\book
\title SAVITRI A LEGEND AND A SYMBOL
\author Sri Aurobindo

\preface
\par
\ht Publisher's Note
\par\nodrop
\PF The writing of {\it Savitri} extended over much of the later part of Sri
Aurobindo's life. The earliest known manuscript is dated 1916. The original
narrative poem was recast several times in the first phase of composition. By
around 1930, Sri Aurobindo had begun to turn it into an epic with a larger
scope and deeper significance.
\par Transformed into “A Legend and a Symbol”, {\it Savitri} became his
major literary work which he continued to expand and perfect until his last
days. In the late 1940s, when his eyesight was failing, he took the help of a
scribe and dictated the extensive final stages of revision.
\par Separate cantos started to appear in print in 1946. Part One of the first
edition was published in 1950. The next year, after Sri Aurobindo's passing,
the rest of the poem was brought out in a second volume.
\par In the second edition (1954), Sri Aurobindo's letters on {\it Savitri} were
added. They are omitted from the present edition and included in {\it Letters
on Poetry and Art}.
\par In 1970 {\it Savitri} was published as volumes 28 and 29 of the Sri
Aurobindo Birth Centenary Library. This edition was reprinted, as a single
volume, a number of times between 1973 and 1990.
\par The fourth (“revised”) edition appeared in 1993. This edition was the
outcome of a systematic comparison of the printed text of {\it Savitri} with
the manuscripts. The 1993 edition has been reprinted several times. In 1997 it
was published as volumes 33 and 34 of the CWSA.
\par The text of the present, electronic, edition (1999) is identical to the text
of the CWSA edition. As the page breaks in the CWSA edition are almost
everywhere identical to the page breaks in the SABCL edition, the SABCL
page numbers have not been given separately for this book.
Page --

\par
\ht Author's Note
\par\nodrop
\PF The tale of Satyavan and Savitri is recited in the Mahabharata as a story
of conjugal love conquering death. But this legend is, as shown by many
features of the human tale, one of the many symbolic myths of the Vedic
cycle. Satyavan is the soul carrying the divine truth of being within itself but
descended into the grip of death and ignorance; Savitri is the Divine Word,
daughter of the Sun, goddess of the supreme Truth who comes down and is
born to save; Aswapati, the Lord of the Horse, her human father, is the Lord
of Tapasya, the concentrated energy of spiritual endeavour that helps us to
rise from the mortal to the immortal planes; Dyumatsena, Lord of the Shining
Hosts, father of Satyavan, is the Divine Mind here fallen blind, losing its
celestial kingdom of vision, and through that loss its kingdom of glory. Still this
is not a mere allegory, the characters are not personified qualities, but
incarnations or emanations of living and conscious Forces with whom we can
enter into concrete touch and they take human bodies in order to help man
and show him the way from his mortal state to a divine consciousness and
immortal life.
\par\bigskip
\rl{Sri Aurobindo}

\sect1

\ht BOOK ONE: The Book of Beginnings
Page --

\sect2
\par
\ht Canto One: The Symbol Dawn
\par
\sbigcap It was the hour before the Gods awake.\nl
Across the path of the divine Event\nl
The huge foreboding mind of Night, alone\nl
In her unlit temple of eternity,\nl
Lay stretched immobile upon Silence' marge.\nl
Almost one felt, opaque, impenetrable,\nl
In the sombre symbol of her eyeless muse\nl
The abysm of the unbodied Infinite;\nl
A fathomless zero occupied the world.\nl
A power of fallen boundless self awake\nl
Between the first and the last Nothingness,\nl
Recalling the tenebrous womb from which it came,\nl
Turned from the insoluble mystery of birth\nl
And the tardy process of mortality\nl
And longed to reach its end in vacant Nought.\nl
As in a dark beginning of all things,\nl
A mute featureless semblance of the Unknown\nl
Repeating for ever the unconscious act,\nl
Prolonging for ever the unseeing will,\nl
Cradled the cosmic drowse of ignorant Force\nl
Whose moved creative slumber kindles the suns\nl
And carries our lives in its somnambulist whirl.\nl
Athwart the vain enormous trance of Space,\nl
Its formless stupor without mind or life,\nl
A shadow spinning through a soulless Void,\nl
Thrown back once more into unthinking dreams,\nl
Earth wheeled abandoned in the hollow gulfs\nl
Forgetful of her spirit and her fate.\nl
The impassive skies were neutral, empty, still.\nl
Then something in the inscrutable darkness stirred;\nl
A nameless movement, an unthought Idea\nl
Page 1

Insistent, dissatisfied, without an aim,\nl
Something that wished but knew not how to be,\nl
Teased the Inconscient to wake Ignorance.\nl
A throe that came and left a quivering trace,\nl
Gave room for an old tired want unfilled,\nl
At peace in its subconscient moonless cave\nl
To raise its head and look for absent light,\nl
Straining closed eyes of vanished memory,\nl
Like one who searches for a bygone self\nl
And only meets the corpse of his desire.\nl
It was as though even in this Nought's profound,\nl
Even in this ultimate dissolution's core,\nl
There lurked an unremembering entity,\nl
Survivor of a slain and buried past\nl
Condemned to resume the effort and the pang,\nl
Reviving in another frustrate world.\nl
An unshaped consciousness desired light\nl
And a blank prescience yearned towards distant change.\nl
As if a childlike finger laid on a cheek\nl
Reminded of the endless need in things\nl
The heedless Mother of the universe,\nl
An infant longing clutched the sombre Vast.\nl
Insensibly somewhere a breach began:\nl
A long lone line of hesitating hue\nl
Like a vague smile tempting a desert heart\nl
Troubled the far rim of life's obscure sleep.\nl
Arrived from the other side of boundlessness\nl
An eye of deity peered through the dumb deeps;\nl
A scout in a reconnaissance from the sun,\nl
It seemed amid a heavy cosmic rest,\nl
The torpor of a sick and weary world,\nl
To seek for a spirit sole and desolate\nl
Too fallen to recollect forgotten bliss.\nl
Intervening in a mindless universe,\nl
Its message crept through the reluctant hush\nl
Calling the adventure of consciousness and joy\nl
Page 2

And, conquering Nature's disillusioned breast,\nl
Compelled renewed consent to see and feel.\nl
A thought was sown in the unsounded Void,\nl
A sense was born within the darkness' depths,\nl
A memory quivered in the heart of Time\nl
As if a soul long dead were moved to live:\nl
But the oblivion that succeeds the fall,\nl
Had blotted the crowded tablets of the past,\nl
And all that was destroyed must be rebuilt\nl
And old experience laboured out once more.\nl
All can be done if the god-touch is there.\nl
A hope stole in that hardly dared to be\nl
Amid the Night's forlorn indifference.\nl
As if solicited in an alien world\nl
With timid and hazardous instinctive grace,\nl
Orphaned and driven out to seek a home,\nl
An errant marvel with no place to live,\nl
Into a far-off nook of heaven there came\nl
A slow miraculous gesture's dim appeal.\nl
The persistent thrill of a transfiguring touch\nl
Persuaded the inert black quietude\nl
And beauty and wonder disturbed the fields of God.\nl
A wandering hand of pale enchanted light\nl
That glowed along a fading moment's brink,\nl
Fixed with gold panel and opalescent hinge\nl
A gate of dreams ajar on mystery's verge.\nl
One lucent corner windowing hidden things\nl
Forced the world's blind immensity to sight.\nl
The darkness failed and slipped like a falling cloak\nl
From the reclining body of a god.\nl
Then through the pallid rift that seemed at first\nl
Hardly enough for a trickle from the suns,\nl
Outpoured the revelation and the flame.\nl
The brief perpetual sign recurred above.\nl
A glamour from unreached transcendences\nl
Iridescent with the glory of the Unseen,\nl
Page 3

A message from the unknown immortal Light\nl
Ablaze upon creation's quivering edge,\nl
Dawn built her aura of magnificent hues\nl
And buried its seed of grandeur in the hours.\nl
An instant's visitor the godhead shone.\nl
On life's thin border awhile the Vision stood\nl
And bent over earth's pondering forehead curve.\nl
Interpreting a recondite beauty and bliss\nl
In colour's hieroglyphs of mystic sense,\nl
It wrote the lines of a significant myth\nl
Telling of a greatness of spiritual dawns,\nl
A brilliant code penned with the sky for page.\nl
Almost that day the epiphany was disclosed\nl
Of which our thoughts and hopes are signal flares;\nl
A lonely splendour from the invisible goal\nl
Almost was flung on the opaque Inane.\nl
Once more a tread perturbed the vacant Vasts;\nl
Infinity's centre, a Face of rapturous calm\nl
Parted the eternal lids that open heaven;\nl
A Form from far beatitudes seemed to near.\nl
Ambassadress twixt eternity and change,\nl
The omniscient Goddess leaned across the breadths\nl
That wrap the fated journeyings of the stars\nl
And saw the spaces ready for her feet.\nl
Once she half looked behind for her veiled sun,\nl
Then, thoughtful, went to her immortal work.\nl
Earth felt the Imperishable's passage close:\nl
The waking ear of Nature heard her steps\nl
And wideness turned to her its limitless eye,\nl
And, scattered on sealed depths, her luminous smile\nl
Kindled to fire the silence of the worlds.\nl
All grew a consecration and a rite.\nl
Air was a vibrant link between earth and heaven;\nl
The wide-winged hymn of a great priestly wind\nl
Arose and failed upon the altar hills;\nl
The high boughs prayed in a revealing sky.\nl
Page 4

Here where our half-lit ignorance skirts the gulfs\nl
On the dumb bosom of the ambiguous earth,\nl
Here where one knows not even the step in front\nl
And Truth has her throne on the shadowy back of doubt,\nl
On this anguished and precarious field of toil\nl
Outspread beneath some large indifferent gaze,\nl
Impartial witness of our joy and bale,\nl
Our prostrate soil bore the awakening ray.\nl
Here too the vision and prophetic gleam\nl
Lit into miracles common meaningless shapes;\nl
Then the divine afflatus, spent, withdrew,\nl
Unwanted, fading from the mortal's range.\nl
A sacred yearning lingered in its trace,\nl
The worship of a Presence and a Power\nl
Too perfect to be held by death-bound hearts,\nl
The prescience of a marvellous birth to come.\nl
Only a little the god-light can stay:\nl
Spiritual beauty illumining human sight\nl
Lines with its passion and mystery Matter's mask\nl
And squanders eternity on a beat of Time.\nl
As when a soul draws near the sill of birth,\nl
Adjoining mortal time to Timelessness,\nl
A spark of deity lost in Matter's crypt\nl
Its lustre vanishes in the inconscient planes,\nl
That transitory glow of magic fire\nl
So now dissolved in bright accustomed air.\nl
The message ceased and waned the messenger.\nl
The single Call, the uncompanioned Power,\nl
Drew back into some far-off secret world\nl
The hue and marvel of the supernal beam:\nl
She looked no more on our mortality.\nl
The excess of beauty natural to god-kind\nl
Could not uphold its claim on time-born eyes;\nl
Too mystic-real for space-tenancy\nl
Her body of glory was expunged from heaven:\nl
The rarity and wonder lived no more.\nl
Page 5

There was the common light of earthly day.\nl
Affranchised from the respite of fatigue\nl
Once more the rumour of the speed of Life\nl
Pursued the cycles of her blinded quest.\nl
All sprang to their unvarying daily acts;\nl
The thousand peoples of the soil and tree\nl
Obeyed the unforeseeing instant's urge,\nl
And, leader here with his uncertain mind,\nl
Alone who stares at the future's covered face,\nl
Man lifted up the burden of his fate.\nl

\spar And Savitri too awoke among these tribes\nl
That hastened to join the brilliant Summoner's chant\nl
And, lured by the beauty of the apparent ways,\nl
Acclaimed their portion of ephemeral joy.\nl
Akin to the eternity whence she came,\nl
No part she took in this small happiness;\nl
A mighty stranger in the human field,\nl
The embodied Guest within made no response.\nl
The call that wakes the leap of human mind,\nl
Its chequered eager motion of pursuit,\nl
Its fluttering-hued illusion of desire,\nl
Visited her heart like a sweet alien note.\nl
Time's message of brief light was not for her.\nl
In her there was the anguish of the gods\nl
Imprisoned in our transient human mould,\nl
The deathless conquered by the death of things.\nl
A vaster Nature's joy had once been hers,\nl
But long could keep not its gold heavenly hue\nl
Or stand upon this brittle earthly base.\nl
A narrow movement on Time's deep abysm,\nl
Life's fragile littleness denied the power,\nl
The proud and conscious wideness and the bliss\nl
She had brought with her into the human form,\nl
The calm delight that weds one soul to all,\nl
The key to the flaming doors of ecstasy.\nl
Page 6

Earth's grain that needs the sap of pleasure and tears\nl
Rejected the undying rapture's boon:\nl
Offered to the daughter of infinity\nl
Her passion-flower of love and doom she gave.\nl
In vain now seemed the splendid sacrifice.\nl
A prodigal of her rich divinity,\nl
Her self and all she was she had lent to men,\nl
Hoping her greater being to implant\nl
And in their body's lives acclimatise\nl
That heaven might native grow on mortal soil.\nl
Hard is it to persuade earth-nature's change;\nl
Mortality bears ill the eternal's touch:\nl
It fears the pure divine intolerance\nl
Of that assault of ether and of fire;\nl
It murmurs at its sorrowless happiness,\nl
Almost with hate repels the light it brings;\nl
It trembles at its naked power of Truth\nl
And the might and sweetness of its absolute Voice.\nl
Inflicting on the heights the abysm's law,\nl
It sullies with its mire heaven's messengers:\nl
Its thorns of fallen nature are the defence\nl
It turns against the saviour hands of Grace;\nl
It meets the sons of God with death and pain.\nl
A glory of lightnings traversing the earth-scene,\nl
Their sun-thoughts fading, darkened by ignorant minds,\nl
Their work betrayed, their good to evil turned,\nl
The cross their payment for the crown they gave,\nl
Only they leave behind a splendid Name.\nl
A fire has come and touched men's hearts and gone;\nl
A few have caught flame and risen to greater life.\nl
Too unlike the world she came to help and save,\nl
Her greatness weighed upon its ignorant breast\nl
And from its dim chasms welled a dire return,\nl
A portion of its sorrow, struggle, fall.\nl
To live with grief, to confront death on her road,—\nl
The mortal's lot became the Immortal's share.\nl
Page 7

Thus trapped in the gin of earthly destinies,\nl
Awaiting her ordeal's hour abode,\nl
Outcast from her inborn felicity,\nl
Accepting life's obscure terrestrial robe,\nl
Hiding herself even from those she loved,\nl
The godhead greater by a human fate.\nl
A dark foreknowledge separated her\nl
From all of whom she was the star and stay;\nl
Too great to impart the peril and the pain,\nl
In her torn depths she kept the grief to come.\nl
As one who watching over men left blind\nl
Takes up the load of an unwitting race,\nl
Harbouring a foe whom with her heart she must feed,\nl
Unknown her act, unknown the doom she faced,\nl
Unhelped she must foresee and dread and dare.\nl
The long-foreknown and fatal morn was here\nl
Bringing a noon that seemed like every noon.\nl
For Nature walks upon her mighty way\nl
Unheeding when she breaks a soul, a life;\nl
Leaving her slain behind she travels on:\nl
Man only marks and God's all-seeing eyes.\nl
Even in this moment of her soul's despair,\nl
In its grim rendezvous with death and fear,\nl
No cry broke from her lips, no call for aid;\nl
She told the secret of her woe to none:\nl
Calm was her face and courage kept her mute.\nl
Yet only her outward self suffered and strove;\nl
Even her humanity was half divine:\nl
Her spirit opened to the Spirit in all,\nl
Her nature felt all Nature as its own.\nl
Apart, living within, all lives she bore;\nl
Aloof, she carried in herself the world:\nl
Her dread was one with the great cosmic dread,\nl
Her strength was founded on the cosmic mights;\nl
The universal Mother's love was hers.\nl
Against the evil at life's afflicted roots,\nl
Page 8

Her own calamity its private sign,\nl
Of her pangs she made a mystic poignant sword.\nl
A solitary mind, a world-wide heart,\nl
To the lone Immortal's unshared work she rose.\nl
At first life grieved not in her burdened breast:\nl
On the lap of earth's original somnolence\nl
Inert, released into forgetfulness,\nl
Prone it reposed, unconscious on mind's verge,\nl
Obtuse and tranquil like the stone and star.\nl
In a deep cleft of silence twixt two realms\nl
She lay remote from grief, unsawn by care,\nl
Nothing recalling of the sorrow here.\nl
Then a slow faint remembrance shadowlike moved,\nl
And sighing she laid her hand upon her bosom\nl
And recognised the close and lingering ache,\nl
Deep, quiet, old, made natural to its place,\nl
But knew not why it was there nor whence it came.\nl
The Power that kindles mind was still withdrawn:\nl
Heavy, unwilling were life's servitors\nl
Like workers with no wages of delight;\nl
Sullen, the torch of sense refused to burn;\nl
The unassisted brain found not its past.\nl
Only a vague earth-nature held the frame.\nl
But now she stirred, her life shared the cosmic load.\nl
At the summons of her body's voiceless call\nl
Her strong far-winging spirit travelled back,\nl
Back to the yoke of ignorance and fate,\nl
Back to the labour and stress of mortal days,\nl
Lighting a pathway through strange symbol dreams\nl
Across the ebbing of the seas of sleep.\nl
Her house of Nature felt an unseen sway,\nl
Illumined swiftly were life's darkened rooms,\nl
And memory's casements opened on the hours\nl
And the tired feet of thought approached her doors.\nl
All came back to her: Earth and Love and Doom,\nl
The ancient disputants, encircled her\nl
Page 9

Like giant figures wrestling in the night:\nl
The godheads from the dim Inconscient born\nl
Awoke to struggle and the pang divine,\nl
And in the shadow of her flaming heart,\nl
At the sombre centre of the dire debate,\nl
A guardian of the unconsoled abyss\nl
Inheriting the long agony of the globe,\nl
A stone-still figure of high and godlike Pain\nl
Stared into Space with fixed regardless eyes\nl
That saw grief's timeless depths but not life's goal.\nl
Afflicted by his harsh divinity,\nl
Bound to his throne, he waited unappeased\nl
The daily oblation of her unwept tears.\nl
All the fierce question of man's hours relived.\nl
The sacrifice of suffering and desire\nl
Earth offers to the immortal Ecstasy\nl
Began again beneath the eternal Hand.\nl
Awake she endured the moments' serried march\nl
And looked on this green smiling dangerous world,\nl
And heard the ignorant cry of living things.\nl
Amid the trivial sounds, the unchanging scene\nl
Her soul arose confronting Time and Fate.\nl
Immobile in herself, she gathered force.\nl
This was the day when Satyavan must die.\nl
\rl{\fsc End of Canto One}
Page 10

\par
\ht Canto Two: The Issue
\par
\sbigcap Awhile, withdrawn in secret fields of thought,\nl
Her mind moved in a many-imaged past\nl
That lived again and saw its end approach:\nl
Dying, it lived imperishably in her;\nl
Transient and vanishing from transient eyes,\nl
Invisible, a fateful ghost of self,\nl
It bore the future on its phantom breast.\nl
Along the fleeting event's far-backward trail\nl
Regressed the stream of the insistent hours,\nl
And on the bank of the mysterious flood\nl
Peopled with well-loved forms now seen no more\nl
And the subtle images of things that were,\nl
Her witness spirit stood reviewing Time.\nl
All that she once had hoped and dreamed and been,\nl
Flew past her eagle-winged through memory's skies.\nl
As in a many-hued flaming inner dawn,\nl
Her life's broad highways and its sweet bypaths\nl
Lay mapped to her sun-clear recording view,\nl
From the bright country of her childhood's days\nl
And the blue mountains of her soaring youth\nl
And the paradise groves and peacock wings of Love\nl
To joy clutched under the silent shadow of doom\nl
In a last turn where heaven raced with hell.\nl
Twelve passionate months led in a day of fate.\nl
An absolute supernatural darkness falls\nl
On man sometimes when he draws near to God:\nl
An hour arrives when fail all Nature's means;\nl
Forced out from the protecting Ignorance\nl
And flung back on his naked primal need,\nl
He at length must cast from him his surface soul\nl
And be the ungarbed entity within:\nl
Page 11

That hour had fallen now on Savitri.\nl
A point she had reached where life must be in vain\nl
Or, in her unborn element awake,\nl
Her will must cancel her body's destiny.\nl
For only the unborn spirit's timeless power\nl
Can lift the yoke imposed by birth in Time.\nl
Only the Self that builds this figure of self\nl
Can rase the fixed interminable line\nl
That joins these changing names, these numberless lives,\nl
These new oblivious personalities\nl
And keeps still lurking in our conscious acts\nl
The trail of old forgotten thoughts and deeds,\nl
Disown the legacy of our buried selves,\nl
The burdensome heirship to our vanished forms\nl
Accepted blindly by the body and soul.\nl
An episode in an unremembered tale,\nl
Its beginning lost, its motive and plot concealed,\nl
A once living story has prepared and made\nl
Our present fate, child of past energies.\nl
The fixity of the cosmic sequences\nl
Fastened with hidden inevitable links\nl
She must disrupt, dislodge by her soul's force\nl
Her past, a block on the Immortal's road,\nl
Make a rased ground and shape anew her fate.\nl
A colloquy of the original Gods\nl
Meeting upon the borders of the unknown,\nl
Her soul's debate with embodied Nothingness\nl
Must be wrestled out on a dangerous dim background:\nl
Her being must confront its formless Cause,\nl
Against the universe weigh its single self.\nl
On the bare peak where Self is alone with Nought\nl
And life has no sense and love no place to stand,\nl
She must plead her case upon extinction's verge,\nl
In the world's death-cave uphold life's helpless claim\nl
And vindicate her right to be and love.\nl
Altered must be Nature's harsh economy;\nl
Page 12

Acquittance she must win from her past's bond,\nl
An old account of suffering exhaust,\nl
Strike out from Time the soul's long compound debt\nl
And the heavy servitudes of the Karmic Gods,\nl
The slow revenge of unforgiving Law\nl
And the deep need of universal pain\nl
And hard sacrifice and tragic consequence.\nl
Out of a timeless barrier she must break,\nl
Penetrate with her thinking depths the Void's monstrous hush,\nl
Look into the lonely eyes of immortal Death\nl
And with her nude spirit measure the Infinite's night.\nl
The great and dolorous moment now was close.\nl
A mailed battalion marching to its doom,\nl
The last long days went by with heavy tramp,\nl
Long but too soon to pass, too near the end.\nl
Alone amid the many faces loved,\nl
Aware among unknowing happy hearts,\nl
Her armoured spirit kept watch upon the hours\nl
Listening for a foreseen tremendous step\nl
In the closed beauty of the inhuman wilds.\nl
A combatant in silent dreadful lists,\nl
The world unknowing, for the world she stood:\nl
No helper had she save the Strength within;\nl
There was no witness of terrestrial eyes;\nl
The Gods above and Nature sole below\nl
Were the spectators of that mighty strife.\nl
Around her were the austere sky-pointing hills,\nl
And the green murmurous broad deep-thoughted woods\nl
Muttered incessantly their muffled spell.\nl
A dense magnificent coloured self-wrapped life\nl
Draped in the leaves' vivid emerald monotone\nl
And set with chequered sunbeams and blithe flowers\nl
Immured her destiny's secluded scene.\nl
There had she grown to the stature of her spirit:\nl
The genius of titanic silences\nl
Steeping her soul in its wide loneliness\nl
Page 13

Had shown to her her self's bare reality\nl
And mated her with her environment.\nl
Its solitude greatened her human hours\nl
With a background of the eternal and unique.\nl
A force of spare direct necessity\nl
Reduced the heavy framework of man's days\nl
And his overburdening mass of outward needs\nl
To a first thin strip of simple animal wants,\nl
And the mighty wildness of the primitive earth\nl
And the brooding multitude of patient trees\nl
And the musing sapphire leisure of the sky\nl
And the solemn weight of the slowly-passing months\nl
Had left in her deep room for thought and God.\nl
There was her drama's radiant prologue lived.\nl
A spot for the eternal's tread on earth\nl
Set in the cloistral yearning of the woods\nl
And watched by the aspiration of the peaks\nl
Appeared through an aureate opening in Time,\nl
Where stillness listening felt the unspoken word\nl
And the hours forgot to pass towards grief and change.\nl
Here with the suddenness divine advents have,\nl
Repeating the marvel of the first descent,\nl
Changing to rapture the dull earthly round,\nl
Love came to her hiding the shadow, Death.\nl
Well might he find in her his perfect shrine.\nl
Since first the earth-being's heavenward growth began,\nl
Through all the long ordeal of the race,\nl
Never a rarer creature bore his shaft,\nl
That burning test of the godhead in our parts,\nl
A lightning from the heights on our abyss.\nl
All in her pointed to a nobler kind.\nl
Near to earth's wideness, intimate with heaven,\nl
Exalted and swift her young large-visioned spirit\nl
Voyaging through worlds of splendour and of calm\nl
Overflew the ways of Thought to unborn things.\nl
Ardent was her self-poised unstumbling will;\nl
Page 14

Her mind, a sea of white sincerity,\nl
Passionate in flow, had not one turbid wave.\nl
As in a mystic and dynamic dance\nl
A priestess of immaculate ecstasies\nl
Inspired and ruled from Truth's revealing vault\nl
Moves in some prophet cavern of the gods,\nl
A heart of silence in the hands of joy\nl
Inhabited with rich creative beats\nl
A body like a parable of dawn\nl
That seemed a niche for veiled divinity\nl
Or golden temple-door to things beyond.\nl
Immortal rhythms swayed in her time-born steps;\nl
Her look, her smile awoke celestial sense\nl
Even in earth-stuff, and their intense delight\nl
Poured a supernal beauty on men's lives.\nl
A wide self-giving was her native act;\nl
A magnanimity as of sea or sky\nl
Enveloped with its greatness all that came\nl
And gave a sense as of a greatened world:\nl
Her kindly care was a sweet temperate sun,\nl
Her high passion a blue heaven's equipoise.\nl
As might a soul fly like a hunted bird,\nl
Escaping with tired wings from a world of storms,\nl
And a quiet reach like a remembered breast,\nl
In a haven of safety and splendid soft repose\nl
One could drink life back in streams of honey-fire,\nl
Recover the lost habit of happiness,\nl
Feel her bright nature's glorious ambience,\nl
And preen joy in her warmth and colour's rule.\nl
A deep of compassion, a hushed sanctuary,\nl
Her inward help unbarred a gate in heaven;\nl
Love in her was wider than the universe,\nl
The whole world could take refuge in her single heart.\nl
The great unsatisfied godhead here could dwell:\nl
Vacant of the dwarf self's imprisoned air,\nl
Her mood could harbour his sublimer breath\nl
Page 15

Spiritual that can make all things divine.\nl
For even her gulfs were secrecies of light.\nl
At once she was the stillness and the word,\nl
A continent of self-diffusing peace,\nl
An ocean of untrembling virgin fire;\nl
The strength, the silence of the gods were hers.\nl
In her he found a vastness like his own,\nl
His high warm subtle ether he refound\nl
And moved in her as in his natural home.\nl
In her he met his own eternity.\nl

\spar Till then no mournful line had barred this ray.\nl
On the frail breast of this precarious earth,\nl
Since her orbed sight in its breath-fastened house,\nl
Opening in sympathy with happier stars\nl
Where life is not exposed to sorrowful change,\nl
Remembered beauty death-claimed lids ignore\nl
And wondered at this world of fragile forms\nl
Carried on canvas-strips of shimmering Time,\nl
The impunity of unborn Mights was hers.\nl
Although she leaned to bear the human load,\nl
Her walk kept still the measures of the gods.\nl
Earth's breath had failed to stain that brilliant glass:\nl
Unsmeared with the dust of our mortal atmosphere\nl
It still reflected heaven's spiritual joy.\nl
Almost they saw who lived within her light\nl
Her playmate in the sempiternal spheres\nl
Descended from its unattainable realms\nl
In her attracting advent's luminous wake,\nl
The white-fire dragon-bird of endless bliss\nl
Drifting with burning wings above her days:\nl
Heaven's tranquil shield guarded the missioned child.\nl
A glowing orbit was her early term,\nl
Years like gold raiment of the gods that pass;\nl
Her youth sat throned in calm felicity.\nl
But joy cannot endure until the end:\nl
Page 16

There is a darkness in terrestrial things\nl
That will not suffer long too glad a note.\nl
On her too closed the inescapable Hand:\nl
The armed Immortal bore the snare of Time.\nl
One dealt with her who meets the burdened great.\nl
Assigner of the ordeal and the path\nl
Who chooses in this holocaust of the soul\nl
Death, fall and sorrow as the spirit's goads,\nl
The dubious godhead with his torch of pain\nl
Lit up the chasm of the unfinished world\nl
And called her to fill with her vast self the abyss.\nl
August and pitiless in his calm outlook,\nl
Heightening the Eternal's dreadful strategy,\nl
He measured the difficulty with the might\nl
And dug more deep the gulf that all must cross.\nl
Assailing her divinest elements,\nl
He made her heart kin to the striving human heart\nl
And forced her strength to its appointed road.\nl
For this she had accepted mortal breath;\nl
To wrestle with the Shadow she had come\nl
And must confront the riddle of man's birth\nl
And life's brief struggle in dumb Matter's night.\nl
Whether to bear with Ignorance and death\nl
Or hew the ways of Immortality,\nl
To win or lose the godlike game for man,\nl
Was her soul's issue thrown with Destiny's dice.\nl
But not to submit and suffer was she born;\nl
To lead, to deliver was her glorious part.\nl
Here was no fabric of terrestrial make\nl
Fit for a day's use by busy careless Powers.\nl
An image fluttering on the screen of Fate,\nl
Half-animated for a passing show,\nl
Or a castaway on the ocean of Desire\nl
Flung to the eddies in a ruthless sport\nl
And tossed along the gulfs of Circumstance,\nl
A creature born to bend beneath the yoke,\nl
Page 17

A chattel and a plaything of Time's lords,\nl
Or one more pawn who comes destined to be pushed\nl
One slow move forward on a measureless board\nl
In the chess-play of the earth-soul with Doom,—\nl
Such is the human figure drawn by Time.\nl
A conscious frame was here, a self-born Force.\nl
In this enigma of the dusk of God,\nl
This slow and strange uneasy compromise\nl
Of limiting Nature with a limitless Soul,\nl
Where all must move between an ordered Chance\nl
And an uncaring blind Necessity,\nl
Too high the fire spiritual dare not blaze.\nl
If once it met the intense original Flame,\nl
An answering touch might shatter all measures made\nl
And earth sink down with the weight of the Infinite.\nl
A gaol is this immense material world:\nl
Across each road stands armed a stone-eyed Law,\nl
At every gate the huge dim sentinels pace.\nl
A grey tribunal of the Ignorance,\nl
An Inquisition of the priests of Night\nl
In judgment sit on the adventurer soul,\nl
And the dual tables and the Karmic norm\nl
Restrain the Titan in us and the God:\nl
Pain with its lash, joy with its silver bribe\nl
Guard the Wheel's circling immobility.\nl
A bond is put on the high-climbing mind,\nl
A seal on the too large wide-open heart;\nl
Death stays the journeying discoverer, Life.\nl
Thus is the throne of the Inconscient safe\nl
While the tardy coilings of the aeons pass\nl
And the Animal browses in the sacred fence\nl
And the gold Hawk can cross the skies no more.\nl
But one stood up and lit the limitless flame.\nl
Arraigned by the dark Power that hates all bliss\nl
In the dire court where life must pay for joy,\nl
Sentenced by the mechanic justicer\nl
Page 18

To the afflicting penalty of man's hopes,\nl
Her head she bowed not to the stark decree\nl
Baring her helpless heart to destiny's stroke.\nl
So bows and must the mind-born will in man\nl
Obedient to the statutes fixed of old,\nl
Admitting without appeal the nether gods.\nl
In her the superhuman cast its seed.\nl
Inapt to fold its mighty wings of dream\nl
Her spirit refused to hug the common soil,\nl
Or, finding all life's golden meanings robbed,\nl
Compound with earth, struck from the starry list,\nl
Or quench with black despair the God-given light.\nl
Accustomed to the eternal and the true,\nl
Her being conscious of its divine founts\nl
Asked not from mortal frailty pain's relief,\nl
Patched not with failure bargain or compromise.\nl
A work she had to do, a word to speak:\nl
Writing the unfinished story of her soul\nl
In thoughts and actions graved in Nature's book,\nl
She accepted not to close the luminous page,\nl
Cancel her commerce with eternity,\nl
Or set a signature of weak assent\nl
To the brute balance of the world's exchange.\nl
A force in her that toiled since earth was made,\nl
Accomplishing in life the great world-plan,\nl
Pursuing after death immortal aims,\nl
Repugned to admit frustration's barren role,\nl
Forfeit the meaning of her birth in Time,\nl
Obey the government of the casual fact\nl
Or yield her high destiny up to passing Chance.\nl
In her own self she found her high recourse;\nl
She matched with the iron law her sovereign right:\nl
Her single will opposed the cosmic rule.\nl
To stay the wheels of Doom this greatness rose.\nl
At the Unseen's knock upon her hidden gates\nl
Her strength made greater by the lightning's touch\nl
Page 19

Awoke from slumber in her heart's recess.\nl
It bore the stroke of That which kills and saves.\nl
Across the awful march no eye can see,\nl
Barring its dreadful route no will can change,\nl
She faced the engines of the universe;\nl
A heart stood in the way of the driving wheels:\nl
Its giant workings paused in front of a mind,\nl
Its stark conventions met the flame of a soul.\nl
A magic leverage suddenly is caught\nl
That moves the veiled Ineffable's timeless will:\nl
A prayer, a master act, a king idea\nl
Can link man's strength to a transcendent Force.\nl
Then miracle is made the common rule,\nl
One mighty deed can change the course of things;\nl
A lonely thought becomes omnipotent.\nl
All now seems Nature's massed machinery;\nl
An endless servitude to material rule\nl
And long determination's rigid chain,\nl
Her firm and changeless habits aping Law,\nl
Her empire of unconscious deft device\nl
Annul the claim of man's free human will.\nl
He too is a machine amid machines;\nl
A piston brain pumps out the shapes of thought,\nl
A beating heart cuts out emotion's modes;\nl
An insentient energy fabricates a soul.\nl
Or the figure of the world reveals the signs\nl
Of a tied Chance repeating her old steps\nl
In circles around Matter's binding-posts.\nl
A random series of inept events\nl
To which reason lends illusive sense, is here,\nl
Or the empiric Life's instinctive search,\nl
Or a vast ignorant mind's colossal work.\nl
But wisdom comes, and vision grows within:\nl
Then Nature's instrument crowns himself her king;\nl
He feels his witnessing self and conscious power;\nl
His soul steps back and sees the Light supreme.\nl
Page 20

A Godhead stands behind the brute machine.\nl
This truth broke in in a triumph of fire;\nl
A victory was won for God in man,\nl
The deity revealed its hidden face.\nl
The great World-Mother now in her arose:\nl
A living choice reversed fate's cold dead turn,\nl
Affirmed the spirit's tread on Circumstance,\nl
Pressed back the senseless dire revolving Wheel\nl
And stopped the mute march of Necessity.\nl
A flaming warrior from the eternal peaks\nl
Empowered to force the door denied and closed\nl
Smote from Death's visage its dumb absolute\nl
And burst the bounds of consciousness and Time.\nl
\rl{\fsc End of Canto Two}
Page 21

\par
\ht Canto Three: The Yoga of the King: The Yoga of the Soul's Release
\par
\sbigcap A world's desire compelled her mortal birth.\nl
One in the front of the immemorial quest,\nl
Protagonist of the mysterious play\nl
In which the Unknown pursues himself through forms\nl
And limits his eternity by the hours\nl
And the blind Void struggles to live and see,\nl
A thinker and toiler in the ideal's air,\nl
Brought down to earth's dumb need her radiant power.\nl
His was a spirit that stooped from larger spheres\nl
Into our province of ephemeral sight,\nl
A colonist from immortality.\nl
A pointing beam on earth's uncertain roads,\nl
His birth held up a symbol and a sign;\nl
His human self like a translucent cloak\nl
Covered the All-Wise who leads the unseeing world.\nl
Affiliated to cosmic Space and Time\nl
And paying here God's debt to earth and man\nl
A greater sonship was his divine right.\nl
Although consenting to mortal ignorance,\nl
His knowledge shared the Light ineffable.\nl
A strength of the original Permanence\nl
Entangled in the moment and its flow,\nl
He kept the vision of the Vasts behind:\nl
A power was in him from the Unknowable.\nl
An archivist of the symbols of the Beyond,\nl
A treasurer of superhuman dreams,\nl
He bore the stamp of mighty memories\nl
And shed their grandiose ray on human life.\nl
His days were a long growth to the Supreme.\nl
A skyward being nourishing its roots\nl
Page 22

On sustenance from occult spiritual founts\nl
Climbed through white rays to meet an unseen Sun.\nl
His soul lived as eternity's delegate,\nl
His mind was like a fire assailing heaven,\nl
His will a hunter in the trails of light.\nl
An ocean impulse lifted every breath;\nl
Each action left the footprints of a god,\nl
Each moment was a beat of puissant wings.\nl
The little plot of our mortality\nl
Touched by this tenant from the heights became\nl
A playground of the living Infinite.\nl
This bodily appearance is not all;\nl
The form deceives, the person is a mask;\nl
Hid deep in man celestial powers can dwell.\nl
His fragile ship conveys through the sea of years\nl
An incognito of the Imperishable.\nl
A spirit that is a flame of God abides,\nl
A fiery portion of the Wonderful,\nl
Artist of his own beauty and delight,\nl
Immortal in our mortal poverty.\nl
This sculptor of the forms of the Infinite,\nl
This screened unrecognised Inhabitant,\nl
Initiate of his own veiled mysteries,\nl
Hides in a small dumb seed his cosmic thought.\nl
In the mute strength of the occult Idea\nl
Determining predestined shape and act,\nl
Passenger from life to life, from scale to scale,\nl
Changing his imaged self from form to form,\nl
He regards the icon growing by his gaze\nl
And in the worm foresees the coming god.\nl
At last the traveller in the paths of Time\nl
Arrives on the frontiers of eternity.\nl
In the transient symbol of humanity draped,\nl
He feels his substance of undying self\nl
And loses his kinship to mortality.\nl
A beam of the Eternal smites his heart,\nl
Page 23

His thought stretches into infinitude;\nl
All in him turns to spirit vastnesses.\nl
His soul breaks out to join the Oversoul,\nl
His life is oceaned by that superlife.\nl
He has drunk from the breasts of the Mother of the worlds;\nl
A topless Supernature fills his frame:\nl
She adopts his spirit's everlasting ground\nl
As the security of her changing world\nl
And shapes the figure of her unborn mights.\nl
Immortally she conceives herself in him,\nl
In the creature the unveiled Creatrix works:\nl
Her face is seen through his face, her eyes through his eyes;\nl
Her being is his through a vast identity.\nl
Then is revealed in man the overt Divine.\nl
A static Oneness and dynamic Power\nl
Descend in him, the integral Godhead's seals;\nl
His soul and body take that splendid stamp.\nl
A long dim preparation is man's life,\nl
A circle of toil and hope and war and peace\nl
Tracked out by Life on Matter's obscure ground.\nl
In his climb to a peak no feet have ever trod,\nl
He seeks through a penumbra shot with flame\nl
A veiled reality half-known, ever missed,\nl
A search for something or someone never found,\nl
Cult of an ideal never made real here,\nl
An endless spiral of ascent and fall\nl
Until at last is reached the giant point\nl
Through which his Glory shines for whom we were made\nl
And we break into the infinity of God.\nl
Across our nature's border line we escape\nl
Into Supernature's arc of living light.\nl
This now was witnessed in that son of Force;\nl
In him that high transition laid its base.\nl
Original and supernal Immanence\nl
Of which all Nature's process is the art,\nl
The cosmic Worker set his secret hand\nl
Page 24

To turn this frail mud-engine to heaven-use.\nl
A Presence wrought behind the ambiguous screen:\nl
It beat his soil to bear a Titan's weight,\nl
Refining half-hewn blocks of natural strength\nl
It built his soul into a statued god.\nl
The Craftsman of the magic stuff of self\nl
Who labours at his high and difficult plan\nl
In the wide workshop of the wonderful world,\nl
Modelled in inward Time his rhythmic parts.\nl
Then came the abrupt transcendent miracle:\nl
The masked immaculate Grandeur could outline,\nl
At travail in the occult womb of life,\nl
His dreamed magnificence of things to be.\nl
A crown of the architecture of the worlds,\nl
A mystery of married Earth and Heaven\nl
Annexed divinity to the mortal scheme.\nl
A Seer was born, a shining Guest of Time.\nl
For him mind's limiting firmament ceased above.\nl
In the griffin forefront of the Night and Day\nl
A gap was rent in the all-concealing vault;\nl
The conscious ends of being went rolling back:\nl
The landmarks of the little person fell,\nl
The island ego joined its continent.\nl
Overpassed was this world of rigid limiting forms:\nl
Life's barriers opened into the Unknown.\nl
Abolished were conception's covenants\nl
And, striking off subjection's rigorous clause,\nl
Annulled the soul's treaty with Nature's nescience.\nl
All the grey inhibitions were torn off\nl
And broken the intellect's hard and lustrous lid;\nl
Truth unpartitioned found immense sky-room;\nl
An empyrean vision saw and knew;\nl
The bounded mind became a boundless light,\nl
The finite self mated with infinity.\nl
His march now soared into an eagle's flight.\nl
Out of apprenticeship to Ignorance\nl
Page 25

Wisdom upraised him to her master craft\nl
And made him an archmason of the soul,\nl
A builder of the Immortal's secret house,\nl
An aspirant to supernal Timelessness:\nl
Freedom and empire called to him from on high;\nl
Above mind's twilight and life's star-led night\nl
There gleamed the dawn of a spiritual day.\nl

\spar As so he grew into his larger self,\nl
Humanity framed his movements less and less;\nl
A greater being saw a greater world.\nl
A fearless will for knowledge dared to erase\nl
The lines of safety Reason draws that bar\nl
Mind's soar, soul's dive into the Infinite.\nl
Even his first steps broke our small earth-bounds\nl
And loitered in a vaster freer air.\nl
In hands sustained by a transfiguring Might\nl
He caught up lightly like a giant's bow\nl
Left slumbering in a sealed and secret cave\nl
The powers that sleep unused in man within.\nl
He made of miracle a normal act\nl
And turned to a common part of divine works,\nl
Magnificently natural at this height,\nl
Efforts that would shatter the strength of mortal hearts,\nl
Pursued in a royalty of mighty ease\nl
Aims too sublime for Nature's daily will:\nl
The gifts of the spirit crowding came to him;\nl
They were his life's pattern and his privilege.\nl
A pure perception lent its lucent joy:\nl
Its intimate vision waited not to think;\nl
It enveloped all Nature in a single glance,\nl
It looked into the very self of things;\nl
Deceived no more by form he saw the soul.\nl
In beings it knew what lurked to them unknown;\nl
It seized the idea in mind, the wish in the heart;\nl
It plucked out from grey folds of secrecy\nl
Page 26

The motives which from their own sight men hide.\nl
He felt the beating life in other men\nl
Invade him with their happiness and their grief;\nl
Their love, their anger, their unspoken hopes\nl
Entered in currents or in pouring waves\nl
Into the immobile ocean of his calm.\nl
He heard the inspired sound of his own thoughts\nl
Re-echoed in the vault of other minds;\nl
The world's thought-streams travelled into his ken;\nl
His inner self grew near to others' selves\nl
And bore a kinship's weight, a common tie,\nl
Yet stood untouched, king of itself, alone.\nl
A magical accord quickened and attuned\nl
To ethereal symphonies the old earthy strings;\nl
It raised the servitors of mind and life\nl
To be happy partners in the soul's response,\nl
Tissue and nerve were turned to sensitive chords,\nl
Records of lustre and ecstasy; it made\nl
The body's means the spirit's acolytes.\nl
A heavenlier function with a finer mode\nl
Lit with its grace man's outward earthliness;\nl
The soul's experience of its deeper sheaths\nl
No more slept drugged by Matter's dominance.\nl
In the dead wall closing us from wider self,\nl
Into a secrecy of apparent sleep,\nl
The mystic tract beyond our waking thoughts,\nl
A door parted, built in by Matter's force,\nl
Releasing things unseized by earthly sense:\nl
A world unseen, unknown by outward mind\nl
Appeared in the silent spaces of the soul.\nl
He sat in secret chambers looking out\nl
Into the luminous countries of the unborn\nl
Where all things dreamed by the mind are seen and true\nl
And all that the life longs for is drawn close.\nl
He saw the Perfect in their starry homes\nl
Wearing the glory of a deathless form,\nl
Page 27

Lain in the arms of the Eternal's peace,\nl
Rapt in the heart-beats of God-ecstasy.\nl
He lived in the mystic space where thought is born\nl
And will is nursed by an ethereal Power\nl
And fed on the white milk of the Eternal's strengths\nl
Till it grows into the likeness of a god.\nl
In the Witness's occult rooms with mind-built walls\nl
On hidden interiors, lurking passages\nl
Opened the windows of the inner sight.\nl
He owned the house of undivided Time.\nl
Lifting the heavy curtain of the flesh\nl
He stood upon a threshold serpent-watched,\nl
And peered into gleaming endless corridors,\nl
Silent and listening in the silent heart\nl
For the coming of the new and the unknown.\nl
He gazed across the empty stillnesses\nl
And heard the footsteps of the undreamed Idea\nl
In the far avenues of the Beyond.\nl
He heard the secret Voice, the Word that knows,\nl
And saw the secret face that is our own.\nl
The inner planes uncovered their crystal doors;\nl
Strange powers and influences touched his life.\nl
A vision came of higher realms than ours,\nl
A consciousness of brighter fields and skies,\nl
Of beings less circumscribed than brief-lived men\nl
And subtler bodies than these passing frames,\nl
Objects too fine for our material grasp,\nl
Acts vibrant with a superhuman light\nl
And movements pushed by a superconscient force,\nl
And joys that never flowed through mortal limbs,\nl
And lovelier scenes than earth's and happier lives.\nl
A consciousness of beauty and of bliss,\nl
A knowledge which became what it perceived,\nl
Replaced the separated sense and heart\nl
And drew all Nature into its embrace.\nl
The mind leaned out to meet the hidden worlds:\nl
Page 28

Air glowed and teemed with marvellous shapes and hues,\nl
In the nostrils quivered celestial fragrances,\nl
On the tongue lingered the honey of paradise.\nl
A channel of universal harmony,\nl
Hearing was a stream of magic audience,\nl
A bed for occult sounds earth cannot hear.\nl
Out of a covert tract of slumber self\nl
The voice came of a truth submerged, unknown\nl
That flows beneath the cosmic surfaces,\nl
Only mid an omniscient silence heard,\nl
Held by intuitive heart and secret sense.\nl
It caught the burden of secrecies sealed and dumb,\nl
It voiced the unfulfilled demand of earth\nl
And the song of promise of unrealised heavens\nl
And all that hides in an omnipotent Sleep.\nl
In the unceasing drama carried by Time\nl
On its long listening flood that bears the world's\nl
Insoluble doubt on a pilgrimage without goal,\nl
A laughter of sleepless pleasure foamed and spumed\nl
And murmurings of desire that cannot die:\nl
A cry came of the world's delight to be,\nl
The grandeur and greatness of its will to live,\nl
Recall of the soul's adventure into space,\nl
A traveller through the magic centuries\nl
And being's labour in Matter's universe,\nl
Its search for the mystic meaning of its birth\nl
And joy of high spiritual response,\nl
Its throb of satisfaction and content\nl
In all the sweetness of the gifts of life,\nl
Its large breath and pulse and thrill of hope and fear,\nl
Its taste of pangs and tears and ecstasy,\nl
Its rapture's poignant beat of sudden bliss,\nl
The sob of its passion and unending pain.\nl
The murmur and whisper of the unheard sounds\nl
Which crowd around our hearts but find no window\nl
To enter, swelled into a canticle\nl
Page 29

Of all that suffers to be still unknown\nl
And all that labours vainly to be born\nl
And all the sweetness none will ever taste\nl
And all the beauty that will never be.\nl
Inaudible to our deaf mortal ears\nl
The wide world-rhythms wove their stupendous chant\nl
To which life strives to fit our rhyme-beats here,\nl
Melting our limits in the illimitable,\nl
Tuning the finite to infinity.\nl
A low muttering rose from the subconscient caves,\nl
The stammer of the primal ignorance;\nl
Answer to that inarticulate questioning,\nl
There stooped with lightning neck and thunder's wings\nl
A radiant hymn to the Inexpressible\nl
And the anthem of the superconscient light.\nl
All was revealed there none can here express;\nl
Vision and dream were fables spoken by truth\nl
Or symbols more veridical than fact,\nl
Or were truths enforced by supernatural seals.\nl
Immortal eyes approached and looked in his,\nl
And beings of many kingdoms neared and spoke:\nl
The ever-living whom we name as dead\nl
Could leave their glory beyond death and birth\nl
To utter the wisdom which exceeds all phrase:\nl
The kings of evil and the kings of good,\nl
Appellants at the reason's judgment seat,\nl
Proclaimed the gospel of their opposites,\nl
And all believed themselves spokesmen of God:\nl
The gods of light and titans of the dark\nl
Battled for his soul as for a costly prize.\nl
In every hour loosed from the quiver of Time\nl
There rose a song of new discovery,\nl
A bow-twang's hum of young experiment.\nl
Each day was a spiritual romance,\nl
As if he was born into a bright new world;\nl
Adventure leaped an unexpected friend,\nl
Page 30

And danger brought a keen sweet tang of joy;\nl
Each happening was a deep experience.\nl
There were high encounters, epic colloquies,\nl
And counsels came couched in celestial speech,\nl
And honeyed pleadings breathed from occult lips\nl
To help the heart to yield to rapture's call,\nl
And sweet temptations stole from beauty's realms\nl
And sudden ecstasies from a world of bliss.\nl
It was a region of wonder and delight.\nl
All now his bright clairaudience could receive;\nl
A contact thrilled of mighty unknown things.\nl
Awakened to new unearthly closenesses,\nl
The touch replied to subtle infinities,\nl
And with a silver cry of opening gates\nl
Sight's lightnings leaped into the invisible.\nl
Ever his consciousness and vision grew;\nl
They took an ampler sweep, a loftier flight;\nl
He passed the border marked for Matter's rule\nl
And passed the zone where thought replaces life.\nl
Out of this world of signs suddenly he came\nl
Into a silent self where world was not\nl
And looked beyond into a nameless vast.\nl
These symbol figures lost their right to live,\nl
All tokens dropped our sense can recognise;\nl
There the heart beat no more at body's touch,\nl
There the eyes gazed no more on beauty's shape.\nl
In rare and lucent intervals of hush\nl
Into a signless region he could soar\nl
Packed with the deep contents of formlessness\nl
Where world was into a single being rapt\nl
And all was known by the light of identity\nl
And Spirit was its own self-evidence.\nl
The Supreme's gaze looked out through human eyes\nl
And saw all things and creatures as itself\nl
And knew all thought and word as its own voice.\nl
There unity is too close for search and clasp\nl
Page 31

And love is a yearning of the One for the One,\nl
And beauty is a sweet difference of the Same\nl
And oneness is the soul of multitude.\nl
There all the truths unite in a single Truth,\nl
And all ideas rejoin Reality.\nl
There knowing herself by her own termless self,\nl
Wisdom supernal, wordless, absolute\nl
Sat uncompanioned in the eternal Calm,\nl
All-seeing, motionless, sovereign and alone.\nl
There knowledge needs not words to embody Idea;\nl
Idea, seeking a house in boundlessness,\nl
Weary of its homeless immortality,\nl
Asks not in thought's carved brilliant cell to rest\nl
Whose single window's clipped outlook on things\nl
Sees only a little arc of God's vast sky.\nl
The boundless with the boundless there consorts;\nl
While there, one can be wider than the world;\nl
While there, one is one's own infinity.\nl
His centre was no more in earthly mind;\nl
A power of seeing silence filled his limbs:\nl
Caught by a voiceless white epiphany\nl
Into a vision that surpasses forms,\nl
Into a living that surpasses life,\nl
He neared the still consciousness sustaining all.\nl
The voice that only by speech can move the mind\nl
Became a silent knowledge in the soul;\nl
The strength that only in action feels its truth\nl
Was lodged now in a mute omnipotent peace.\nl
A leisure in the labour of the worlds,\nl
A pause in the joy and anguish of the search\nl
Restored the stress of Nature to God's calm.\nl
A vast unanimity ended life's debate.\nl
The war of thoughts that fathers the universe,\nl
The clash of forces struggling to prevail\nl
In the tremendous shock that lights a star\nl
As in the building of a grain of dust,\nl
Page 32

The grooves that turn their dumb ellipse in space\nl
Ploughed by the seeking of the world's desire,\nl
The long regurgitations of Time's flood,\nl
The torment edging the dire force of lust\nl
That wakes kinetic in earth's dullard slime\nl
And carves a personality out of mud,\nl
The sorrow by which Nature's hunger is fed,\nl
The oestrus which creates with fire of pain,\nl
The fate that punishes virtue with defeat,\nl
The tragedy that destroys long happiness,\nl
The weeping of Love, the quarrel of the Gods,\nl
Ceased in a truth which lives in its own light.\nl
His soul stood free, a witness and a king.\nl
Absorbed no more in the moment-ridden flux\nl
Where mind incessantly drifts as on a raft\nl
Hurried from phenomenon to phenomenon,\nl
He abode at rest in indivisible Time.\nl
As if a story long written but acted now,\nl
In his present he held his future and his past,\nl
Felt in the seconds the uncounted years\nl
And saw the hours like dots upon a page.\nl
An aspect of the unknown Reality\nl
Altered the meaning of the cosmic scene.\nl
This huge material universe became\nl
A small result of a stupendous force:\nl
Overtaking the moment the eternal Ray\nl
Illumined That which never yet was made.\nl
Thought lay down in a mighty voicelessness;\nl
The toiling Thinker widened and grew still,\nl
Wisdom transcendent touched his quivering heart:\nl
His soul could sail beyond thought's luminous bar;\nl
Mind screened no more the shoreless infinite.\nl
Across a void retreating sky he glimpsed\nl
Through a last glimmer and drift of vanishing stars\nl
The superconscient realms of motionless Peace\nl
Where judgment ceases and the word is mute\nl
Page 33

And the Unconceived lies pathless and alone.\nl
There came not form or any mounting voice;\nl
There only were Silence and the Absolute.\nl
Out of that stillness mind new-born arose\nl
And woke to truths once inexpressible,\nl
And forms appeared, dumbly significant,\nl
A seeing thought, a self-revealing voice.\nl
He knew the source from which his spirit came:\nl
Movement was married to the immobile Vast;\nl
He plunged his roots into the Infinite,\nl
He based his life upon eternity.\nl

\spar Only awhile at first these heavenlier states,\nl
These large wide-poised upliftings could endure.\nl
The high and luminous tension breaks too soon,\nl
The body's stone stillness and the life's hushed trance,\nl
The breathless might and calm of silent mind;\nl
Or slowly they fail as sets a golden day.\nl
The restless nether members tire of peace;\nl
A nostalgia of old little works and joys,\nl
A need to call back small familiar selves,\nl
To tread the accustomed and inferior way,\nl
The need to rest in a natural pose of fall,\nl
As a child who learns to walk can walk not long,\nl
Replace the titan will for ever to climb,\nl
On the heart's altar dim the sacred fire.\nl
An old pull of subconscious cords renews;\nl
It draws the unwilling spirit from the heights,\nl
Or a dull gravitation drags us down\nl
To the blind driven inertia of our base.\nl
This too the supreme Diplomat can use,\nl
He makes our fall a means for greater rise.\nl
For into ignorant Nature's gusty field,\nl
Into the half-ordered chaos of mortal life\nl
The formless Power, the Self of eternal light\nl
Follow in the shadow of the spirit's descent;\nl
Page 34

The twin duality for ever one\nl
Chooses its home mid the tumults of the sense.\nl
He comes unseen into our darker parts\nl
And, curtained by the darkness, does his work,\nl
A subtle and all-knowing guest and guide,\nl
Till they too feel the need and will to change.\nl
All here must learn to obey a higher law,\nl
Our body's cells must hold the Immortal's flame.\nl
Else would the spirit reach alone its source\nl
Leaving a half-saved world to its dubious fate.\nl
Nature would ever labour unredeemed;\nl
Our earth would ever spin unhelped in Space,\nl
And this immense creation's purpose fail\nl
Till at last the frustrate universe sank undone.\nl
Even his godlike strength to rise must fall:\nl
His greater consciousness withdrew behind;\nl
Dim and eclipsed, his human outside strove\nl
To feel again the old sublimities,\nl
Bring the high saving touch, the ethereal flame,\nl
Call back to its dire need the divine Force.\nl
Always the power poured back like sudden rain,\nl
Or slowly in his breast a presence grew;\nl
It clambered back to some remembered height\nl
Or soared above the peak from which it fell.\nl
Each time he rose there was a larger poise,\nl
A dwelling on a higher spirit plane;\nl
The Light remained in him a longer space.\nl
In this oscillation between earth and heaven,\nl
In this ineffable communion's climb\nl
There grew in him as grows a waxing moon\nl
The glory of the integer of his soul.\nl
A union of the Real with the unique,\nl
A gaze of the Alone from every face,\nl
The presence of the Eternal in the hours\nl
Widening the mortal mind's half-look on things,\nl
Bridging the gap between man's force and Fate\nl
Page 35

Made whole the fragment-being we are here.\nl
At last was won a firm spiritual poise,\nl
A constant lodging in the Eternal's realm,\nl
A safety in the Silence and the Ray,\nl
A settlement in the Immutable.\nl
His heights of being lived in the still Self;\nl
His mind could rest on a supernal ground\nl
And look down on the magic and the play\nl
Where the God-child lies on the lap of Night and Dawn\nl
And the Everlasting puts on Time's disguise.\nl
To the still heights and to the troubled depths\nl
His equal spirit gave its vast assent:\nl
A poised serenity of tranquil strength,\nl
A wide unshaken look on Time's unrest\nl
Faced all experience with unaltered peace.\nl
Indifferent to the sorrow and delight,\nl
Untempted by the marvel and the call,\nl
Immobile it beheld the flux of things,\nl
Calm and apart supported all that is:\nl
His spirit's stillness helped the toiling world.\nl
Inspired by silence and the closed eyes' sight\nl
His force could work with a new luminous art\nl
On the crude material from which all is made\nl
And the refusal of Inertia's mass\nl
And the grey front of the world's Ignorance\nl
And nescient Matter and the huge error of life.\nl
As a sculptor chisels a deity out of stone\nl
He slowly chipped off the dark envelope,\nl
Line of defence of Nature's ignorance,\nl
The illusion and mystery of the Inconscient\nl
In whose black pall the Eternal wraps his head\nl
That he may act unknown in cosmic Time.\nl
A splendour of self-creation from the peaks,\nl
A transfiguration in the mystic depths,\nl
A happier cosmic working could begin\nl
And fashion the world-shape in him anew,\nl
Page 36

God found in Nature, Nature fulfilled in God.\nl
Already in him was seen that task of Power:\nl
Life made its home on the high tops of self;\nl
His soul, mind, heart became a single sun;\nl
Only life's lower reaches remained dim.\nl
But there too, in the uncertain shadow of life,\nl
There was a labour and a fiery breath;\nl
The ambiguous cowled celestial puissance worked\nl
Watched by the inner Witness's moveless peace.\nl
Even on the struggling Nature left below\nl
Strong periods of illumination came:\nl
Lightnings of glory after glory burned,\nl
Experience was a tale of blaze and fire,\nl
Air rippled round the argosies of the Gods,\nl
Strange riches sailed to him from the Unseen;\nl
Splendours of insight filled the blank of thought,\nl
Knowledge spoke to the inconscient stillnesses,\nl
Rivers poured down of bliss and luminous force,\nl
Visits of beauty, storm-sweeps of delight\nl
Rained from the all-powerful Mystery above.\nl
Thence stooped the eagles of Omniscience.\nl
A dense veil was rent, a mighty whisper heard;\nl
Repeated in the privacy of his soul,\nl
A wisdom-cry from rapt transcendences\nl
Sang on the mountains of an unseen world;\nl
The voices that an inner listening hears\nl
Conveyed to him their prophet utterances,\nl
And flame-wrapped outbursts of the immortal Word\nl
And flashes of an occult revealing Light\nl
Approached him from the unreachable Secrecy.\nl
An inspired Knowledge sat enthroned within\nl
Whose seconds illumined more than reason's years:\nl
An ictus of revealing lustre fell\nl
As if a pointing accent upon Truth,\nl
And like a sky-flare showing all the ground\nl
A swift intuitive discernment shone.\nl
Page 37

One glance could separate the true and false,\nl
Or raise its rapid torch-fire in the dark\nl
To check the claimants crowding through mind's gates\nl
Covered by the forged signatures of the gods,\nl
Detect the magic bride in her disguise\nl
Or scan the apparent face of thought and life.\nl

\spar Oft inspiration with her lightning feet,\nl
A sudden messenger from the all-seeing tops,\nl
Traversed the soundless corridors of his mind\nl
Bringing her rhythmic sense of hidden things.\nl
A music spoke transcending mortal speech.\nl
As if from a golden phial of the All-Bliss,\nl
A joy of light, a joy of sudden sight,\nl
A rapture of the thrilled undying Word\nl
Poured into his heart as into an empty cup,\nl
A repetition of God's first delight\nl
Creating in a young and virgin Time.\nl
In a brief moment caught, a little space,\nl
All-Knowledge packed into great wordless thoughts\nl
Lodged in the expectant stillness of his depths\nl
A crystal of the ultimate Absolute,\nl
A portion of the inexpressible Truth\nl
Revealed by silence to the silent soul.\nl
The intense creatrix in his stillness wrought;\nl
Her power fallen speechless grew more intimate;\nl
She looked upon the seen and the unforeseen,\nl
Unguessed domains she made her native field.\nl
All-vision gathered into a single ray,\nl
As when the eyes stare at an invisible point\nl
Till through the intensity of one luminous spot\nl
An apocalypse of a world of images\nl
Enters into the kingdom of the seer.\nl
A great nude arm of splendour suddenly rose;\nl
It rent the gauze opaque of Nescience:\nl
Her lifted finger's keen unthinkable tip\nl
Page 38

Bared with a stab of flame the closed Beyond.\nl
An eye awake in voiceless heights of trance,\nl
A mind plucking at the unimaginable,\nl
Overleaping with a sole and perilous bound\nl
The high black wall hiding superconscience,\nl
She broke in with inspired speech for scythe\nl
And plundered the Unknowable's vast estate.\nl
A gleaner of infinitesimal grains of Truth,\nl
A sheaf-binder of infinite experience,\nl
She pierced the guarded mysteries of World-Force\nl
And her magic methods wrapped in a thousand veils;\nl
Or she gathered the lost secrets dropped by Time\nl
In the dust and crannies of his mounting route\nl
Mid old forsaken dreams of hastening Mind\nl
And buried remnants of forgotten space.\nl
A traveller between summit and abyss,\nl
She joined the distant ends, the viewless deeps,\nl
Or streaked along the roads of Heaven and Hell\nl
Pursuing all knowledge like a questing hound.\nl
A reporter and scribe of hidden wisdom talk,\nl
Her shining minutes of celestial speech,\nl
Passed through the masked office of the occult mind,\nl
Transmitting gave to prophet and to seer\nl
The inspired body of the mystic Truth.\nl
A recorder of the inquiry of the gods,\nl
Spokesman of the silent seeings of the Supreme,\nl
She brought immortal words to mortal men.\nl
Above the reason's brilliant slender curve,\nl
Released like radiant air dimming a moon,\nl
Broad spaces of a vision without line\nl
Or limit swam into his spirit's ken.\nl
Oceans of being met his voyaging soul\nl
Calling to infinite discovery;\nl
Timeless domains of joy and absolute power\nl
Stretched out surrounded by the eternal hush;\nl
The ways that lead to endless happiness\nl
Page 39

Ran like dream-smiles through meditating vasts:\nl
Disclosed stood up in a gold moment's blaze\nl
White sun-steppes in the pathless Infinite.\nl
Along a naked curve in bourneless Self\nl
The points that run through the closed heart of things\nl
Shadowed the indeterminable line\nl
That carries the Everlasting through the years.\nl
The magician order of the cosmic Mind\nl
Coercing the freedom of infinity\nl
With the stark array of Nature's symbol facts\nl
And life's incessant signals of event,\nl
Transmuted chance recurrences into laws,\nl
A chaos of signs into a universe.\nl
Out of the rich wonders and the intricate whorls\nl
Of the spirit's dance with Matter as its mask\nl
The balance of the world's design grew clear,\nl
Its symmetry of self-arranged effects\nl
Managed in the deep perspectives of the soul,\nl
And the realism of its illusive art,\nl
Its logic of infinite intelligence,\nl
Its magic of a changing eternity.\nl
A glimpse was caught of things for ever unknown:\nl
The letters stood out of the unmoving Word:\nl
In the immutable nameless Origin\nl
Was seen emerging as from fathomless seas\nl
The trail of the Ideas that made the world,\nl
And, sown in the black earth of Nature's trance,\nl
The seed of the Spirit's blind and huge desire\nl
From which the tree of cosmos was conceived\nl
And spread its magic arms through a dream of space.\nl
Immense realities took on a shape:\nl
There looked out from the shadow of the Unknown\nl
The bodiless Namelessness that saw God born\nl
And tries to gain from the mortal's mind and soul\nl
A deathless body and a divine name.\nl
The immobile lips, the great surreal wings,\nl
Page 40

The visage masked by superconscient Sleep,\nl
The eyes with their closed lids that see all things,\nl
Appeared of the Architect who builds in trance.\nl
The original Desire born in the Void\nl
Peered out; he saw the hope that never sleeps,\nl
The feet that run behind a fleeting fate,\nl
The ineffable meaning of the endless dream.\nl
Hardly for a moment glimpsed viewless to Mind,\nl
As if a torch held by a power of God,\nl
The radiant world of the everlasting Truth\nl
Glimmered like a faint star bordering the night\nl
Above the golden Overmind's shimmering ridge.\nl
Even were caught as through a cunning veil\nl
The smile of love that sanctions the long game,\nl
The calm indulgence and maternal breasts\nl
Of Wisdom suckling the child-laughter of Chance,\nl
Silence, the nurse of the Almighty's power,\nl
The omniscient hush, womb of the immortal Word,\nl
And of the Timeless the still brooding face,\nl
And the creative eye of Eternity.\nl
The inspiring goddess entered a mortal's breast,\nl
Made there her study of divining thought\nl
And sanctuary of prophetic speech\nl
And sat upon the tripod seat of mind:\nl
All was made wide above, all lit below.\nl
In darkness' core she dug out wells of light,\nl
On the undiscovered depths imposed a form,\nl
Lent a vibrant cry to the unuttered vasts,\nl
And through great shoreless, voiceless, starless breadths\nl
Bore earthward fragments of revealing thought\nl
Hewn from the silence of the Ineffable.\nl
A Voice in the heart uttered the unspoken Name,\nl
A dream of seeking Thought wandering through Space\nl
Entered the invisible and forbidden house:\nl
The treasure was found of a supernal Day.\nl
In the deep subconscient glowed her jewel-lamp;\nl
Page 41

Lifted, it showed the riches of the Cave\nl
Where, by the miser traffickers of sense\nl
Unused, guarded beneath Night's dragon paws,\nl
In folds of velvet darkness draped they sleep\nl
Whose priceless value could have saved the world.\nl
A darkness carrying morning in its breast\nl
Looked for the eternal wide returning gleam,\nl
Waiting the advent of a larger ray\nl
And rescue of the lost herds of the Sun.\nl
In a splendid extravagance of the waste of God\nl
Dropped carelessly in creation's spendthrift work,\nl
Left in the chantiers of the bottomless world\nl
And stolen by the robbers of the Deep,\nl
The golden shekels of the Eternal lie,\nl
Hoarded from touch and view and thought's desire,\nl
Locked in blind antres of the ignorant flood,\nl
Lest men should find them and be even as Gods.\nl
A vision lightened on the viewless heights,\nl
A wisdom illumined from the voiceless depths:\nl
A deeper interpretation greatened Truth,\nl
A grand reversal of the Night and Day;\nl
All the world's values changed heightening life's aim;\nl
A wiser word, a larger thought came in\nl
Than what the slow labour of human mind can bring,\nl
A secret sense awoke that could perceive\nl
A Presence and a Greatness everywhere.\nl
The universe was not now this senseless whirl\nl
Borne round inert on an immense machine;\nl
It cast away its grandiose lifeless front,\nl
A mechanism no more or work of Chance,\nl
But a living movement of the body of God.\nl
A spirit hid in forces and in forms\nl
Was the spectator of the mobile scene:\nl
The beauty and the ceaseless miracle\nl
Let in a glow of the Unmanifest:\nl
The formless Everlasting moved in it\nl
Page 42

Seeking its own perfect form in souls and things.\nl
Life kept no more a dull and meaningless shape.\nl
In the struggle and upheaval of the world\nl
He saw the labour of a godhead's birth.\nl
A secret knowledge masked as Ignorance;\nl
Fate covered with an unseen necessity\nl
The game of chance of an omnipotent Will.\nl
A glory and a rapture and a charm,\nl
The All-Blissful sat unknown within the heart;\nl
Earth's pains were the ransom of its prisoned delight.\nl
A glad communion tinged the passing hours;\nl
The days were travellers on a destined road,\nl
The nights companions of his musing spirit.\nl
A heavenly impetus quickened all his breast;\nl
The trudge of Time changed to a splendid march;\nl
The divine Dwarf towered to unconquered worlds,\nl
Earth grew too narrow for his victory.\nl
Once only registering the heavy tread\nl
Of a blind Power on human littleness,\nl
Life now became a sure approach to God,\nl
Existence a divine experiment\nl
And cosmos the soul's opportunity.\nl
The world was a conception and a birth\nl
Of Spirit in Matter into living forms,\nl
And Nature bore the Immortal in her womb,\nl
That she might climb through him to eternal life.\nl
His being lay down in bright immobile peace\nl
And bathed in wells of pure spiritual light;\nl
It wandered in wide fields of wisdom-self\nl
Lit by the rays of an everlasting sun.\nl
Even his body's subtle self within\nl
Could raise the earthly parts towards higher things\nl
And feel on it the breath of heavenlier air.\nl
Already it journeyed towards divinity:\nl
Upbuoyed upon winged winds of rapid joy,\nl
Upheld to a Light it could not always hold,\nl
Page 43

It left mind's distance from the Truth supreme\nl
And lost life's incapacity for bliss.\nl
All now suppressed in us began to emerge.\nl

\spar Thus came his soul's release from Ignorance,\nl
His mind and body's first spiritual change.\nl
A wide God-knowledge poured down from above,\nl
A new world-knowledge broadened from within:\nl
His daily thoughts looked up to the True and One,\nl
His commonest doings welled from an inner Light.\nl
Awakened to the lines that Nature hides,\nl
Attuned to her movements that exceed our ken,\nl
He grew one with a covert universe.\nl
His grasp surprised her mightiest energies' springs;\nl
He spoke with the unknown Guardians of the worlds,\nl
Forms he descried our mortal eyes see not.\nl
His wide eyes bodied viewless entities,\nl
He saw the cosmic forces at their work\nl
And felt the occult impulse behind man's will.\nl
Time's secrets were to him an oft-read book;\nl
The records of the future and the past\nl
Outlined their excerpts on the etheric page.\nl
One and harmonious by the Maker's skill,\nl
The human in him paced with the divine;\nl
His acts betrayed not the interior flame.\nl
This forged the greatness of his front to earth.\nl
A genius heightened in his body's cells\nl
That knew the meaning of his fate-hedged works\nl
Akin to the march of unaccomplished Powers\nl
Beyond life's arc in spirit's immensities.\nl
Apart he lived in his mind's solitude,\nl
A demigod shaping the lives of men:\nl
One soul's ambition lifted up the race;\nl
A Power worked, but none knew whence it came.\nl
The universal strengths were linked with his;\nl
Filling earth's smallness with their boundless breadths,\nl
Page 44

He drew the energies that transmute an age.\nl
Immeasurable by the common look,\nl
He made great dreams a mould for coming things\nl
And cast his deeds like bronze to front the years.\nl
His walk through Time outstripped the human stride.\nl
Lonely his days and splendid like the sun's.\nl
\rl{\fsc End of Canto Three}
Page 45

\par
\ht Canto Four: The Secret Knowledge
\par
\sbigcap On a height he stood that looked towards greater heights.\nl
Our early approaches to the Infinite\nl
Are sunrise splendours on a marvellous verge\nl
While lingers yet unseen the glorious sun.\nl
What now we see is a shadow of what must come.\nl
The earth's uplook to a remote Unknown\nl
Is a preface only of the epic climb\nl
Of human soul from its flat earthly state\nl
To the discovery of a greater self\nl
And the far gleam of an eternal Light.\nl
This world is a beginning and a base\nl
Where Life and Mind erect their structured dreams;\nl
An unborn Power must build reality.\nl
A deathbound littleness is not all we are:\nl
Immortal our forgotten vastnesses\nl
Await discovery in our summit selves;\nl
Unmeasured breadths and depths of being are ours.\nl
Akin to the ineffable Secrecy,\nl
Mystic, eternal in unrealised Time,\nl
Neighbours of Heaven are Nature's altitudes.\nl
To these high-peaked dominions sealed to our search,\nl
Too far from surface Nature's postal routes,\nl
Too lofty for our mortal lives to breathe,\nl
Deep in us a forgotten kinship points\nl
And a faint voice of ecstasy and prayer\nl
Calls to those lucent lost immensities.\nl
Even when we fail to look into our souls\nl
Or lie embedded in earthly consciousness,\nl
Still have we parts that grow towards the light,\nl
Yet are there luminous tracts and heavens serene\nl
And Eldorados of splendour and ecstasy\nl
Page 46

And temples to the godhead none can see.\nl
A shapeless memory lingers in us still\nl
And sometimes, when our sight is turned within,\nl
Earth's ignorant veil is lifted from our eyes;\nl
There is a short miraculous escape.\nl
This narrow fringe of clamped experience\nl
We leave behind meted to us as life,\nl
Our little walks, our insufficient reach.\nl
Our souls can visit in great lonely hours\nl
Still regions of imperishable Light,\nl
All-seeing eagle-peaks of silent Power\nl
And moon-flame oceans of swift fathomless Bliss\nl
And calm immensities of spirit space.\nl
In the unfolding process of the Self\nl
Sometimes the inexpressible Mystery\nl
Elects a human vessel of descent.\nl
A breath comes down from a supernal air,\nl
A Presence is born, a guiding Light awakes,\nl
A stillness falls upon the instruments:\nl
Fixed, motionless like a marble monument,\nl
Stone-calm, the body is a pedestal\nl
Supporting a figure of eternal Peace.\nl
Or a revealing Force sweeps blazing in;\nl
Out of some vast superior continent\nl
Knowledge breaks through trailing its radiant seas,\nl
And Nature trembles with the power, the flame.\nl
A greater Personality sometimes\nl
Possesses us which yet we know is ours:\nl
Or we adore the Master of our souls.\nl
Then the small bodily ego thins and falls;\nl
No more insisting on its separate self,\nl
Losing the punctilio of its separate birth,\nl
It leaves us one with Nature and with God.\nl
In moments when the inner lamps are lit\nl
And the life's cherished guests are left outside,\nl
Our spirit sits alone and speaks to its gulfs.\nl
Page 47

A wider consciousness opens then its doors;\nl
Invading from spiritual silences\nl
A ray of the timeless Glory stoops awhile\nl
To commune with our seized illumined clay\nl
And leaves its huge white stamp upon our lives.\nl
In the oblivious field of mortal mind,\nl
Revealed to the closed prophet eyes of trance\nl
Or in some deep internal solitude\nl
Witnessed by a strange immaterial sense,\nl
The signals of eternity appear.\nl
The truth mind could not know unveils its face,\nl
We hear what mortal ears have never heard,\nl
We feel what earthly sense has never felt,\nl
We love what common hearts repel and dread;\nl
Our minds hush to a bright Omniscient;\nl
A Voice calls from the chambers of the soul;\nl
We meet the ecstasy of the Godhead's touch\nl
In golden privacies of immortal fire.\nl
These signs are native to a larger self\nl
That lives within us by ourselves unseen;\nl
Only sometimes a holier influence comes,\nl
A tide of mightier surgings bears our lives\nl
And a diviner Presence moves the soul;\nl
Or through the earthly coverings something breaks,\nl
A grace and beauty of spiritual light,\nl
The murmuring tongue of a celestial fire.\nl
Ourself and a high stranger whom we feel,\nl
It is and acts unseen as if it were not;\nl
It follows the line of sempiternal birth,\nl
Yet seems to perish with its mortal frame.\nl
Assured of the Apocalypse to be,\nl
It reckons not the moments and the hours;\nl
Great, patient, calm it sees the centuries pass,\nl
Awaiting the slow miracle of our change\nl
In the sure deliberate process of world-force\nl
And the long march of all-revealing Time.\nl
Page 48

It is the origin and the master-clue,\nl
A silence overhead, an inner voice,\nl
A living image seated in the heart,\nl
An unwalled wideness and a fathomless point,\nl
The truth of all these cryptic shows in Space,\nl
The Real towards which our strivings move,\nl
The secret grandiose meaning of our lives.\nl
A treasure of honey in the combs of God,\nl
A Splendour burning in a tenebrous cloak,\nl
It is our glory of the flame of God,\nl
Our golden fountain of the world's delight,\nl
An immortality cowled in the cape of death,\nl
The shape of our unborn divinity.\nl
It guards for us our fate in depths within\nl
Where sleeps the eternal seed of transient things.\nl
Always we bear in us a magic key\nl
Concealed in life's hermetic envelope.\nl
A burning Witness in the sanctuary\nl
Regards through Time and the blind walls of Form;\nl
A timeless Light is in his hidden eyes;\nl
He sees the secret things no words can speak\nl
And knows the goal of the unconscious world\nl
