And the heart of the mystery of the journeying years.\nl

\spar But all is screened, subliminal, mystical;\nl
It needs the intuitive heart, the inward turn,\nl
It needs the power of a spiritual gaze.\nl
Else to our waking mind's small moment look\nl
A goalless voyage seems our dubious course\nl
Some Chance has settled or hazarded some Will,\nl
Or a Necessity without aim or cause\nl
Unwillingly compelled to emerge and be.\nl
In this dense field where nothing is plain or sure,\nl
Our very being seems to us questionable,\nl
Our life a vague experiment, the soul\nl
A flickering light in a strange ignorant world,\nl
Page 49

The earth a brute mechanic accident,\nl
A net of death in which by chance we live.\nl
All we have learned appears a doubtful guess,\nl
The achievement done a passage or a phase\nl
Whose farther end is hidden from our sight,\nl
A chance happening or a fortuitous fate.\nl
Out of the unknown we move to the unknown.\nl
Ever surround our brief existence here\nl
Grey shadows of unanswered questionings;\nl
The dark Inconscient's signless mysteries\nl
Stand up unsolved behind Fate's starting-line.\nl
An aspiration in the Night's profound,\nl
Seed of a perishing body and half-lit mind,\nl
Uplifts its lonely tongue of conscious fire\nl
Towards an undying Light for ever lost;\nl
Only it hears, sole echo of its call,\nl
The dim reply in man's unknowing heart\nl
And meets, not understanding why it came\nl
Or for what reason is the suffering here,\nl
God's sanction to the paradox of life\nl
And the riddle of the Immortal's birth in Time.\nl
Along a path of aeons serpentine\nl
In the coiled blackness of her nescient course\nl
The Earth-Goddess toils across the sands of Time.\nl
A Being is in her whom she hopes to know,\nl
A Word speaks to her heart she cannot hear,\nl
A Fate compels whose form she cannot see.\nl
In her unconscious orbit through the Void\nl
Out of her mindless depths she strives to rise,\nl
A perilous life her gain, a struggling joy;\nl
A Thought that can conceive but hardly knows\nl
Arises slowly in her and creates\nl
The idea, the speech that labels more than it lights;\nl
A trembling gladness that is less than bliss\nl
Invades from all this beauty that must die.\nl
Alarmed by the sorrow dragging at her feet\nl
Page 50

And conscious of the high things not yet won,\nl
Ever she nurses in her sleepless breast\nl
An inward urge that takes from her rest and peace.\nl
Ignorant and weary and invincible,\nl
She seeks through the soul's war and quivering pain\nl
The pure perfection her marred nature needs,\nl
A breath of Godhead on her stone and mire.\nl
A faith she craves that can survive defeat,\nl
The sweetness of a love that knows not death,\nl
The radiance of a truth for ever sure.\nl
A light grows in her, she assumes a voice,\nl
Her state she learns to read and the act she has done,\nl
But the one needed truth eludes her grasp,\nl
Herself and all of which she is the sign.\nl
An inarticulate whisper drives her steps\nl
Of which she feels the force but not the sense;\nl
A few rare intimations come as guides,\nl
Immense divining flashes cleave her brain,\nl
And sometimes in her hours of dream and muse\nl
The truth that she has missed looks out on her\nl
As if far off and yet within her soul.\nl
A change comes near that flees from her surmise\nl
And, ever postponed, compels attempt and hope,\nl
Yet seems too great for mortal hope to dare.\nl
A vision meets her of supernal Powers\nl
That draw her as if mighty kinsmen lost\nl
Approaching with estranged great luminous gaze.\nl
Then is she moved to all that she is not\nl
And stretches arms to what was never hers.\nl
Outstretching arms to the unconscious Void,\nl
Passionate she prays to invisible forms of Gods\nl
Soliciting from dumb Fate and toiling Time\nl
What most she needs, what most exceeds her scope,\nl
A Mind unvisited by illusion's gleams,\nl
A Will expressive of soul's deity,\nl
A Strength not forced to stumble by its speed,\nl
Page 51

A Joy that drags not sorrow as its shade.\nl
For these she yearns and feels them destined hers:\nl
Heaven's privilege she claims as her own right.\nl
Just is her claim the all-witnessing Gods approve,\nl
Clear in a greater light than reason owns:\nl
Our intuitions are its title-deeds;\nl
Our souls accept what our blind thoughts refuse.\nl
Earth's winged chimaeras are Truth's steeds in Heaven,\nl
The impossible God's sign of things to be.\nl
But few can look beyond the present state\nl
Or overleap this matted hedge of sense.\nl
All that transpires on earth and all beyond\nl
Are parts of an illimitable plan\nl
The One keeps in his heart and knows alone.\nl
Our outward happenings have their seed within,\nl
And even this random Fate that imitates Chance,\nl
This mass of unintelligible results,\nl
Are the dumb graph of truths that work unseen:\nl
The laws of the Unknown create the known.\nl
The events that shape the appearance of our lives\nl
Are a cipher of subliminal quiverings\nl
Which rarely we surprise or vaguely feel,\nl
Are an outcome of suppressed realities\nl
That hardly rise into material day:\nl
They are born from the spirit's sun of hidden powers\nl
Digging a tunnel through emergency.\nl
But who shall pierce into the cryptic gulf\nl
And learn what deep necessity of the soul\nl
Determined casual deed and consequence?\nl
Absorbed in a routine of daily acts,\nl
Our eyes are fixed on an external scene;\nl
We hear the crash of the wheels of Circumstance\nl
And wonder at the hidden cause of things.\nl
Yet a foreseeing Knowledge might be ours,\nl
If we could take our spirit's stand within,\nl
If we could hear the muffled daemon voice.\nl
Page 52

Too seldom is the shadow of what must come\nl
Cast in an instant on the secret sense\nl
Which feels the shock of the invisible,\nl
And seldom in the few who answer give\nl
The mighty process of the cosmic Will\nl
Communicates its image to our sight,\nl
Identifying the world's mind with ours.\nl
Our range is fixed within the crowded arc\nl
Of what we observe and touch and thought can guess\nl
And rarely dawns the light of the Unknown\nl
Waking in us the prophet and the seer.\nl
The outward and the immediate are our field,\nl
The dead past is our background and support;\nl
Mind keeps the soul prisoner, we are slaves to our acts;\nl
We cannot free our gaze to reach wisdom's sun.\nl
Inheritor of the brief animal mind,\nl
Man, still a child in Nature's mighty hands,\nl
In the succession of the moments lives;\nl
To a changing present is his narrow right;\nl
His memory stares back at a phantom past,\nl
The future flees before him as he moves;\nl
He sees imagined garments, not a face.\nl
Armed with a limited precarious strength,\nl
He saves his fruits of work from adverse chance.\nl
A struggling ignorance is his wisdom's mate:\nl
He waits to see the consequence of his acts,\nl
He waits to weigh the certitude of his thoughts,\nl
He knows not what he shall achieve or when;\nl
He knows not whether at last he shall survive,\nl
Or end like the mastodon and the sloth\nl
And perish from the earth where he was king.\nl
He is ignorant of the meaning of his life,\nl
He is ignorant of his high and splendid fate.\nl
Only the Immortals on their deathless heights\nl
Dwelling beyond the walls of Time and Space,\nl
Masters of living, free from the bonds of Thought,\nl
Page 53

Who are overseers of Fate and Chance and Will\nl
And experts of the theorem of world-need,\nl
Can see the Idea, the Might that change Time's course,\nl
Come maned with light from undiscovered worlds,\nl
Hear, while the world toils on with its deep blind heart,\nl
The galloping hooves of the unforeseen event,\nl
Bearing the superhuman Rider, near\nl
And, impassive to earth's din and startled cry,\nl
Return to the silence of the hills of God;\nl
As lightning leaps, as thunder sweeps, they pass\nl
And leave their mark on the trampled breast of Life.\nl
Above the world the world-creators stand,\nl
In the phenomenon see its mystic source.\nl
These heed not the deceiving outward play,\nl
They turn not to the moment's busy tramp,\nl
But listen with the still patience of the Unborn\nl
For the slow footsteps of far Destiny\nl
Approaching through huge distances of Time,\nl
Unmarked by the eye that sees effect and cause,\nl
Unheard mid the clamour of the human plane.\nl
Attentive to an unseen Truth they seize\nl
A sound as of invisible augur wings,\nl
Voices of an unplumbed significance,\nl
Mutterings that brood in the core of Matter's sleep.\nl
In the heart's profound audition they can catch\nl
The murmurs lost by Life's uncaring ear,\nl
A prophet-speech in Thought's omniscient trance.\nl
Above the illusion of the hopes that pass,\nl
Behind the appearance and the overt act,\nl
Behind this clock-work Chance and vague surmise,\nl
Amid the wrestle of force, the trampling feet,\nl
Across the cries of anguish and of joy,\nl
Across the triumph, fighting and despair,\nl
They watch the Bliss for which earth's heart has cried\nl
On the long road which cannot see its end\nl
Winding undetected through the sceptic days\nl
Page 54

And to meet it guide the unheedful moving world.\nl
Thus will the masked Transcendent mount his throne.\nl
When darkness deepens strangling the earth's breast\nl
And man's corporeal mind is the only lamp,\nl
As a thief's in the night shall be the covert tread\nl
Of one who steps unseen into his house.\nl
A Voice ill-heard shall speak, the soul obey,\nl
A Power into mind's inner chamber steal,\nl
A charm and sweetness open life's closed doors\nl
And beauty conquer the resisting world,\nl
The Truth-Light capture Nature by surprise,\nl
A stealth of God compel the heart to bliss\nl
And earth grow unexpectedly divine.\nl
In Matter shall be lit the spirit's glow,\nl
In body and body kindled the sacred birth;\nl
Night shall awake to the anthem of the stars,\nl
The days become a happy pilgrim march,\nl
Our will a force of the Eternal's power,\nl
And thought the rays of a spiritual sun.\nl
A few shall see what none yet understands;\nl
God shall grow up while the wise men talk and sleep;\nl
For man shall not know the coming till its hour\nl
And belief shall be not till the work is done.\nl

\spar A Consciousness that knows not its own truth,\nl
A vagrant hunter of misleading dawns,\nl
Between the being's dark and luminous ends\nl
Moves here in a half-light that seems the whole:\nl
An interregnum in Reality\nl
Cuts off the integral Thought, the total Power;\nl
It circles or stands in a vague interspace,\nl
Doubtful of its beginning and its close,\nl
Or runs upon a road that has no end;\nl
Far from the original Dusk, the final Flame\nl
In some huge void Inconscience it lives,\nl
Like a thought persisting in a wide emptiness.\nl
Page 55

As if an unintelligible phrase\nl
Suggested a million renderings to the Mind,\nl
It lends a purport to a random world.\nl
A conjecture leaning upon doubtful proofs,\nl
A message misunderstood, a thought confused\nl
Missing its aim is all that it can speak\nl
Or a fragment of the universal word.\nl
It leaves two giant letters void of sense\nl
While without sanction turns the middle sign\nl
Carrying an enigmatic universe,\nl
As if a present without future or past\nl
Repeating the same revolution's whirl\nl
Turned on its axis in its own Inane.\nl
Thus is the meaning of creation veiled;\nl
For without context reads the cosmic page:\nl
Its signs stare at us like an unknown script,\nl
As if appeared screened by a foreign tongue\nl
Or code of splendour signs without a key\nl
A portion of a parable sublime.\nl
It wears to the perishable creature's eyes\nl
The grandeur of a useless miracle;\nl
Wasting itself that it may last awhile,\nl
A river that can never find its sea,\nl
It runs through life and death on an edge of Time;\nl
A fire in the Night is its mighty action's blaze.\nl
This is our deepest need to join once more\nl
What now is parted, opposite and twain,\nl
Remote in sovereign spheres that never meet\nl
Or fronting like far poles of Night and Day.\nl
We must fill the immense lacuna we have made,\nl
Re-wed the closed finite's lonely consonant\nl
With the open vowels of Infinity,\nl
A hyphen must connect Matter and Mind,\nl
The narrow isthmus of the ascending soul:\nl
We must renew the secret bond in things,\nl
Our hearts recall the lost divine Idea,\nl
Page 56

Reconstitute the perfect word, unite\nl
The Alpha and the Omega in one sound;\nl
Then shall the Spirit and Nature be at one.\nl
Two are the ends of the mysterious plan.\nl
In the wide signless ether of the Self,\nl
In the unchanging Silence white and nude,\nl
Aloof, resplendent like gold dazzling suns\nl
Veiled by the ray no mortal eye can bear,\nl
The Spirit's bare and absolute potencies\nl
Burn in the solitude of the thoughts of God.\nl
A rapture and a radiance and a hush,\nl
Delivered from the approach of wounded hearts,\nl
Denied to the Idea that looks at grief,\nl
Remote from the Force that cries out in its pain,\nl
In his inalienable bliss they live.\nl
Immaculate in self-knowledge and self-power,\nl
Calm they repose on the eternal Will.\nl
Only his law they count and him obey;\nl
They have no goal to reach, no aim to serve.\nl
Implacable in their timeless purity,\nl
All barter or bribe of worship they refuse;\nl
Unmoved by cry of revolt and ignorant prayer\nl
They reckon not our virtue and our sin;\nl
They bend not to the voices that implore,\nl
They hold no traffic with error and its reign;\nl
They are guardians of the silence of the Truth,\nl
They are keepers of the immutable decree.\nl
A deep surrender is their source of might,\nl
A still identity their way to know,\nl
Motionless is their action like a sleep.\nl
At peace, regarding the trouble beneath the stars,\nl
Deathless, watching the works of Death and Chance,\nl
Immobile, seeing the millenniums pass,\nl
Untouched while the long map of Fate unrolls,\nl
They look on our struggle with impartial eyes,\nl
And yet without them cosmos could not be.\nl
Page 57

Impervious to desire and doom and hope,\nl
Their station of inviolable might\nl
Moveless upholds the world's enormous task,\nl
Its ignorance is by their knowledge lit,\nl
Its yearning lasts by their indifference.\nl
As the height draws the low ever to climb,\nl
As the breadths draw the small to adventure vast,\nl
Their aloofness drives man to surpass himself.\nl
Our passion heaves to wed the Eternal's calm,\nl
Our dwarf-search mind to meet the Omniscient's light,\nl
Our helpless hearts to enshrine the Omnipotent's force.\nl
Acquiescing in the wisdom that made hell\nl
And the harsh utility of death and tears,\nl
Acquiescing in the gradual steps of Time,\nl
Careless they seem of the grief that stings the world's heart,\nl
Careless of the pain that rends its body and life;\nl
Above joy and sorrow is that grandeur's walk:\nl
They have no portion in the good that dies,\nl
Mute, pure, they share not in the evil done;\nl
Else might their strength be marred and could not save.\nl
Alive to the truth that dwells in God's extremes,\nl
Awake to a motion of all-seeing Force,\nl
The slow outcome of the long ambiguous years\nl
And the unexpected good from woeful deeds,\nl
The immortal sees not as we vainly see.\nl
He looks on hidden aspects and screened powers,\nl
He knows the law and natural line of things.\nl
Undriven by a brief life's will to act,\nl
Unharassed by the spur of pity and fear,\nl
He makes no haste to untie the cosmic knot\nl
Or the world's torn jarring heart to reconcile.\nl
In Time he waits for the Eternal's hour.\nl
Yet a spiritual secret aid is there;\nl
While a tardy Evolution's coils wind on\nl
And Nature hews her way through adamant\nl
A divine intervention thrones above.\nl
Page 58

Alive in a dead rotating universe\nl
We whirl not here upon a casual globe\nl
Abandoned to a task beyond our force;\nl
Even through the tangled anarchy called Fate\nl
And through the bitterness of death and fall\nl
An outstretched Hand is felt upon our lives.\nl
It is near us in unnumbered bodies and births;\nl
In its unslackening grasp it keeps for us safe\nl
The one inevitable supreme result\nl
No will can take away and no doom change,\nl
The crown of conscious Immortality,\nl
The godhead promised to our struggling souls\nl
When first man's heart dared death and suffered life.\nl
One who has shaped this world is ever its lord:\nl
Our errors are his steps upon the way;\nl
He works through the fierce vicissitudes of our lives,\nl
He works through the hard breath of battle and toil,\nl
He works through our sins and sorrows and our tears,\nl
His knowledge overrules our nescience;\nl
Whatever the appearance we must bear,\nl
Whatever our strong ills and present fate,\nl
When nothing we can see but drift and bale,\nl
A mighty Guidance leads us still through all.\nl
After we have served this great divided world\nl
God's bliss and oneness are our inborn right.\nl
A date is fixed in the calendar of the Unknown,\nl
An anniversary of the Birth sublime:\nl
Our soul shall justify its chequered walk,\nl
All will come near that now is naught or far.\nl
These calm and distant Mights shall act at last.\nl
Immovably ready for their destined task,\nl
The ever-wise compassionate Brilliances\nl
Await the sound of the Incarnate's voice\nl
To leap and bridge the chasms of Ignorance\nl
And heal the hollow yearning gulfs of Life\nl
And fill the abyss that is the universe.\nl
Page 59

Here meanwhile at the Spirit's opposite pole\nl
In the mystery of the deeps that God has built\nl
For his abode below the Thinker's sight,\nl
In this compromise of a stark absolute Truth\nl
With the Light that dwells near the dark end of things,\nl
In this tragi-comedy of divine disguise,\nl
This long far seeking for joy ever near,\nl
In the grandiose dream of which the world is made,\nl
In this gold dome on a black dragon base,\nl
The conscious Force that acts in Nature's breast,\nl
A dark-robed labourer in the cosmic scheme\nl
Carrying clay images of unborn gods,\nl
Executrix of the inevitable Idea\nl
Hampered, enveloped by the hoops of Fate,\nl
Patient trustee of slow eternal Time,\nl
Absolves from hour to hour her secret charge.\nl
All she foresees in masked imperative depths;\nl
The dumb intention of the unconscious gulfs\nl
Answers to a will that sees upon the heights,\nl
And the evolving Word's first syllable\nl
Ponderous, brute-sensed, contains its luminous close,\nl
Privy to a summit victory's vast descent\nl
And the portent of the soul's immense uprise.\nl

\spar All here where each thing seems its lonely self\nl
Are figures of the sole transcendent One:\nl
Only by him they are, his breath is their life;\nl
An unseen Presence moulds the oblivious clay.\nl
A playmate in the mighty Mother's game,\nl
One came upon the dubious whirling globe\nl
To hide from her pursuit in force and form.\nl
A secret spirit in the Inconscient's sleep,\nl
A shapeless Energy, a voiceless Word,\nl
He was here before the elements could emerge,\nl
Before there was light of mind or life could breathe.\nl
Accomplice of her cosmic huge pretence,\nl
Page 60

His semblances he turns to real shapes\nl
And makes the symbol equal with the truth:\nl
He gives to his timeless thoughts a form in Time.\nl
He is the substance, he the self of things;\nl
She has forged from him her works of skill and might:\nl
She wraps him in the magic of her moods\nl
And makes of his myriad truths her countless dreams.\nl
The Master of being has come down to her,\nl
An immortal child born in the fugitive years.\nl
In objects wrought, in the persons she conceives,\nl
Dreaming she chases her idea of him,\nl
And catches here a look and there a gest:\nl
Ever he repeats in them his ceaseless births.\nl
He is the Maker and the world he made,\nl
He is the vision and he is the Seer;\nl
He is himself the actor and the act,\nl
He is himself the knower and the known,\nl
He is himself the dreamer and the dream.\nl
There are Two who are One and play in many worlds;\nl
In Knowledge and Ignorance they have spoken and met\nl
And light and darkness are their eyes' interchange;\nl
Our pleasure and pain are their wrestle and embrace,\nl
Our deeds, our hopes are intimate to their tale;\nl
They are married secretly in our thought and life.\nl
The universe is an endless masquerade:\nl
For nothing here is utterly what it seems;\nl
It is a dream-fact vision of a truth\nl
Which but for the dream would not be wholly true,\nl
A phenomenon stands out significant\nl
Against dim backgrounds of eternity;\nl
We accept its face and pass by all it means;\nl
A part is seen, we take it for the whole.\nl
Thus have they made their play with us for roles:\nl
Author and actor with himself as scene,\nl
He moves there as the Soul, as Nature she.\nl
Here on the earth where we must fill our parts,\nl
Page 61

We know not how shall run the drama's course;\nl
Our uttered sentences veil in their thought.\nl
Her mighty plan she holds back from our sight:\nl
She has concealed her glory and her bliss\nl
And disguised the Love and Wisdom in her heart;\nl
Of all the marvel and beauty that are hers,\nl
Only a darkened little we can feel.\nl
He too wears a diminished godhead here;\nl
He has forsaken his omnipotence,\nl
His calm he has foregone and infinity.\nl
He knows her only, he has forgotten himself;\nl
To her he abandons all to make her great.\nl
He hopes in her to find himself anew,\nl
Incarnate, wedding his infinity's peace\nl
To her creative passion's ecstasy.\nl
Although possessor of the earth and heavens,\nl
He leaves to her the cosmic management\nl
And watches all, the Witness of her scene.\nl
A supernumerary on her stage,\nl
He speaks no words or hides behind the wings.\nl
He takes birth in her world, waits on her will,\nl
Divines her enigmatic gesture's sense,\nl
The fluctuating chance turns of her mood,\nl
Works out her meanings she seems not to know\nl
And serves her secret purpose in long Time.\nl
As one too great for him he worships her;\nl
He adores her as his regent of desire,\nl
He yields to her as the mover of his will,\nl
He burns the incense of his nights and days\nl
Offering his life, a splendour of sacrifice.\nl
A rapt solicitor for her love and grace,\nl
His bliss in her to him is his whole world:\nl
He grows through her in all his being's powers;\nl
He reads by her God's hidden aim in things.\nl
Or, a courtier in her countless retinue,\nl
Content to be with her and feel her near\nl
Page 62

He makes the most of the little that she gives\nl
And all she does drapes with his own delight.\nl
A glance can make his whole day wonderful,\nl
A word from her lips with happiness wings the hours.\nl
He leans on her for all he does and is:\nl
He builds on her largesses his proud fortunate days\nl
And trails his peacock-plumaged joy of life\nl
And suns in the glory of her passing smile.\nl
In a thousand ways he serves her royal needs;\nl
He makes the hours pivot around her will,\nl
Makes all reflect her whims; all is their play:\nl
This whole wide world is only he and she.\nl

\spar This is the knot that ties together the stars:\nl
The Two who are one are the secret of all power,\nl
The Two who are one are the might and right in things.\nl
His soul, silent, supports the world and her,\nl
His acts are her commandment's registers.\nl
Happy, inert, he lies beneath her feet:\nl
His breast he offers for her cosmic dance\nl
Of which our lives are the quivering theatre,\nl
And none could bear but for his strength within,\nl
Yet none would leave because of his delight.\nl
His works, his thoughts have been devised by her,\nl
His being is a mirror vast of hers:\nl
Active, inspired by her he speaks and moves;\nl
His deeds obey her heart's unspoken demands:\nl
Passive, he bears the impacts of the world\nl
As if her touches shaping his soul and life:\nl
His journey through the days is her sun-march;\nl
He runs upon her roads; hers is his course.\nl
A witness and student of her joy and dole,\nl
A partner in her evil and her good,\nl
He has consented to her passionate ways,\nl
He is driven by her sweet and dreadful force.\nl
His sanctioning name initials all her works;\nl
Page 63

His silence is his signature to her deeds;\nl
In the execution of her drama's scheme,\nl
In her fancies of the moment and its mood,\nl
In the march of this obvious ordinary world\nl
Where all is deep and strange to the eyes that see\nl
And Nature's common forms are marvel-wefts,\nl
She through his witness sight and motion of might\nl
Unrolls the material of her cosmic Act,\nl
Her happenings that exalt and smite the soul,\nl
Her force that moves, her powers that save and slay,\nl
Her Word that in the silence speaks to our hearts,\nl
Her silence that transcends the summit Word,\nl
Her heights and depths to which our spirit moves,\nl
Her events that weave the texture of our lives\nl
And all by which we find or lose ourselves,\nl
Things sweet and bitter, magnificent and mean,\nl
Things terrible and beautiful and divine.\nl
Her empire in the cosmos she has built,\nl
He is governed by her subtle and mighty laws.\nl
His consciousness is a babe upon her knees,\nl
His being a field of her vast experiment,\nl
Her endless space is the playground of his thoughts;\nl
She binds to knowledge of the shapes of Time\nl
And the creative error of limiting mind\nl
And chance that wears the rigid face of fate\nl
And her sport of death and pain and Nescience,\nl
His changed and struggling immortality.\nl
His soul is a subtle atom in a mass,\nl
His substance a material for her works.\nl
His spirit survives amid the death of things,\nl
He climbs to eternity through being's gaps,\nl
He is carried by her from Night to deathless Light.\nl
This grand surrender is his free-will's gift,\nl
His pure transcendent force submits to hers.\nl
In the mystery of her cosmic ignorance,\nl
In the insoluble riddle of her play,\nl
Page 64

A creature made of perishable stuff,\nl
In the pattern she has set for him he moves,\nl
He thinks with her thoughts, with her trouble his bosom heaves;\nl
He seems the thing that she would have him seem,\nl
He is whatever her artist will can make.\nl
Although she drives him on her fancy's roads,\nl
At play with him as with her child or slave,\nl
To freedom and the Eternal's mastery\nl
And immortality's stand above the world,\nl
She moves her seeming puppet of an hour.\nl
Even in his mortal session in body's house,\nl
An aimless traveller between birth and death,\nl
Ephemeral dreaming of immortality,\nl
To reign she spurs him. He takes up her powers;\nl
He has harnessed her to the yoke of her own law.\nl
His face of human thought puts on a crown.\nl
Held in her leash, bound to her veiled caprice,\nl
He studies her ways if so he may prevail\nl
Even for an hour and she work out his will;\nl
He makes of her his moment passion's serf:\nl
To obey she feigns, she follows her creature's lead:\nl
For him she was made, lives only for his use.\nl
But conquering her, then is he most her slave;\nl
He is her dependent, all his means are hers;\nl
Nothing without her he can, she rules him still.\nl
At last he wakes to a memory of Self:\nl
He sees within the face of deity,\nl
The Godhead breaks out through the human mould:\nl
Her highest heights she unmasks and is his mate.\nl
Till then he is a plaything in her game;\nl
Her seeming regent, yet her fancy's toy,\nl
A living robot moved by her energy's springs,\nl
He acts as in the movements of a dream,\nl
An automaton stepping in the grooves of Fate,\nl
He stumbles on driven by her whip of Force:\nl
His thought labours, a bullock in Time's fields;\nl
Page 65

His will he thinks his own, is shaped in her forge.\nl
Obedient to World-Nature's dumb control,\nl
Driven by his own formidable Power,\nl
His chosen partner in a titan game,\nl
Her will he has made the master of his fate,\nl
Her whim the dispenser of his pleasure and pain;\nl
He has sold himself into her regal power\nl
For any blow or boon that she may choose:\nl
Even in what is suffering to our sense,\nl
He feels the sweetness of her mastering touch,\nl
In all experience meets her blissful hands;\nl
On his heart he bears the happiness of her tread\nl
And the surprise of her arrival's joy\nl
In each event and every moment's chance.\nl
All she can do is marvellous in his sight:\nl
He revels in her, a swimmer in her sea,\nl
A tireless amateur of her world-delight,\nl
He rejoices in her every thought and act\nl
And gives consent to all that she can wish;\nl
Whatever she desires he wills to be:\nl
The Spirit, the innumerable One,\nl
He has left behind his lone eternity,\nl
He is an endless birth in endless Time,\nl
Her finite's multitude in an infinite Space.\nl

\spar The master of existence lurks in us\nl
And plays at hide-and-seek with his own Force;\nl
In Nature's instrument loiters secret God.\nl
The Immanent lives in man as in his house;\nl
He has made the universe his pastime's field,\nl
A vast gymnasium of his works of might.\nl
All-knowing he accepts our darkened state,\nl
Divine, wears shapes of animal or man;\nl
Eternal, he assents to Fate and Time,\nl
Immortal, dallies with mortality.\nl
The All-Conscious ventured into Ignorance,\nl
Page 66

The All-Blissful bore to be insensible.\nl
Incarnate in a world of strife and pain,\nl
He puts on joy and sorrow like a robe\nl
And drinks experience like a strengthening wine.\nl
He whose transcendence rules the pregnant Vasts,\nl
Prescient now dwells in our subliminal depths,\nl
A luminous individual Power, alone.\nl
\sparn The Absolute, the Perfect, the Alone\nl
Has called out of the Silence his mute Force\nl
Where she lay in the featureless and formless hush\nl
Guarding from Time by her immobile sleep\nl
The ineffable puissance of his solitude.\nl
The Absolute, the Perfect, the Alone\nl
Has entered with his silence into space:\nl
He has fashioned these countless persons of one self;\nl
He has built a million figures of his power;\nl
He lives in all, who lived in his Vast alone;\nl
Space is himself and Time is only he.\nl
The Absolute, the Perfect, the Immune,\nl
One who is in us as our secret self,\nl
Our mask of imperfection has assumed,\nl
He has made this tenement of flesh his own,\nl
His image in the human measure cast\nl
That to his divine measure we might rise;\nl
Then in a figure of divinity\nl
The Maker shall recast us and impose\nl
A plan of godhead on the mortal's mould\nl
Lifting our finite minds to his infinite,\nl
Touching the moment with eternity.\nl
This transfiguration is earth's due to heaven:\nl
A mutual debt binds man to the Supreme:\nl
His nature we must put on as he put ours;\nl
We are sons of God and must be even as he:\nl
His human portion, we must grow divine.\nl
Our life is a paradox with God for key.\nl
Page 67

\spar But meanwhile all is a shadow cast by a dream\nl
And to the musing and immobile spirit\nl
Life and himself don the aspect of a myth,\nl
The burden of a long unmeaning tale.\nl
For the key is hid and by the Inconscient kept;\nl
The secret God beneath the threshold dwells.\nl
In a body obscuring the immortal Spirit\nl
A nameless Resident vesting unseen powers\nl
With Matter's shapes and motives beyond thought\nl
And the hazard of an unguessed consequence,\nl
An omnipotent indiscernible Influence,\nl
He sits, unfelt by the form in which he lives\nl
And veils his knowledge by the groping mind.\nl
A wanderer in a world his thoughts have made,\nl
He turns in a chiaroscuro of error and truth\nl
To find a wisdom that on high is his.\nl
As one forgetting he searches for himself;\nl
As if he had lost an inner light he seeks:\nl
As a sojourner lingering amid alien scenes\nl
He journeys to a home he knows no more.\nl
His own self's truth he seeks who is the Truth;\nl
He is the Player who became the play,\nl
He is the Thinker who became the thought;\nl
He is the many who was the silent One.\nl
In the symbol figures of the cosmic Force\nl
And in her living and inanimate signs\nl
And in her complex tracery of events\nl
He explores the ceaseless miracle of himself,\nl
Till the thousandfold enigma has been solved\nl
In the single light of an all-witnessing Soul.\nl
\sparn This was his compact with his mighty mate,\nl
For love of her and joined to her for ever\nl
To follow the course of Time's eternity,\nl
Amid magic dramas of her sudden moods\nl
And the surprises of her masked Idea\nl
And the vicissitudes of her vast caprice.\nl
Page 68

Two seem his goals, yet ever are they one\nl
And gaze at each other over bourneless Time;\nl
Spirit and Matter are their end and source.\nl
A seeker of hidden meanings in life's forms,\nl
Of the great Mother's wide uncharted will\nl
And the rude enigma of her terrestrial ways\nl
He is the explorer and the mariner\nl
On a secret inner ocean without bourne:\nl
He is the adventurer and cosmologist\nl
Of a magic earth's obscure geography.\nl
In her material order's fixed design\nl
Where all seems sure and, even when changed, the same,\nl
Even though the end is left for ever unknown\nl
And ever unstable is life's shifting flow,\nl
His paths are found for him by silent fate;\nl
As stations in the ages' weltering flood\nl
Firm lands appear that tempt and stay awhile,\nl
Then new horizons lure the mind's advance.\nl
There comes no close to the finite's boundlessness,\nl
There is no last certitude in which thought can pause\nl
And no terminus to the soul's experience.\nl
A limit, a farness never wholly reached,\nl
An unattained perfection calls to him\nl
From distant boundaries in the Unseen:\nl
A long beginning only has been made.\nl

\spar This is the sailor on the flow of Time,\nl
This is World-Matter's slow discoverer,\nl
Who, launched into this small corporeal birth,\nl
Has learned his craft in tiny bays of self,\nl
But dares at last unplumbed infinitudes,\nl
A voyager upon eternity's seas.\nl
In his world-adventure's crude initial start\nl
Behold him ignorant of his godhead's force,\nl
Timid initiate of its vast design.\nl
An expert captain of a fragile craft,\nl
Page 69

A trafficker in small impermanent wares,\nl
At first he hugs the shore and shuns the breadths,\nl
Dares not to affront the far-off perilous main.\nl
He in a petty coastal traffic plies,\nl
His pay doled out from port to neighbour port,\nl
Content with his safe round's unchanging course,\nl
He hazards not the new and the unseen.\nl
But now he hears the sound of larger seas.\nl
A widening world calls him to distant scenes\nl
And journeyings in a larger vision's arc\nl
And peoples unknown and still unvisited shores.\nl
On a commissioned keel his merchant hull\nl
Serves the world's commerce in the riches of Time\nl
Severing the foam of a great land-locked sea\nl
To reach unknown harbour lights in distant climes\nl
And open markets for life's opulent arts,\nl
Rich bales, carved statuettes, hued canvases,\nl
And jewelled toys brought for an infant's play\nl
And perishable products of hard toil\nl
And transient splendours won and lost by the days.\nl
Or passing through a gate of pillar-rocks,\nl
Venturing not yet to cross oceans unnamed\nl
And journey into a dream of distances\nl
He travels close to unfamiliar coasts\nl
And finds new haven in storm-troubled isles,\nl
Or, guided by a sure compass in his thought,\nl
He plunges through a bright haze that hides the stars,\nl
Steering on the trade-routes of Ignorance.\nl
His prow pushes towards undiscovered shores,\nl
He chances on unimagined continents:\nl
A seeker of the islands of the Blest,\nl
He leaves the last lands, crosses the ultimate seas,\nl
He turns to eternal things his symbol quest;\nl
Life changes for him its time-constructed scenes,\nl
Its images veiling infinity.\nl
Earth's borders recede and the terrestrial air\nl
Page 70

Hangs round him no longer its translucent veil.\nl
He has crossed the limit of mortal thought and hope,\nl
He has reached the world's end and stares beyond;\nl
The eyes of mortal body plunge their gaze\nl
Into Eyes that look upon eternity.\nl
A greater world Time's traveller must explore.\nl
At last he hears a chanting on the heights\nl
And the far speaks and the unknown grows near:\nl
He crosses the boundaries of the unseen\nl
And passes over the edge of mortal sight\nl
To a new vision of himself and things.\nl
He is a spirit in an unfinished world\nl
That knows him not and cannot know itself:\nl
The surface symbol of his goalless quest\nl
Takes deeper meanings to his inner view;\nl
His is a search of darkness for the light,\nl
Of mortal life for immortality.\nl
In the vessel of an earthly embodiment\nl
Over the narrow rails of limiting sense\nl
He looks out on the magic waves of Time\nl
Where mind like a moon illumines the world's dark.\nl
There is limned ever retreating from the eyes,\nl
As if in a tenuous misty dream-light drawn,\nl
The outline of a dim mysterious shore.\nl
A sailor on the Inconscient's fathomless sea,\nl
He voyages through a starry world of thought\nl
On Matter's deck to a spiritual sun.\nl
Across the noise and multitudinous cry,\nl
Across the rapt unknowable silences,\nl
Through a strange mid-world under supernal skies,\nl
Beyond earth's longitudes and latitudes,\nl
His goal is fixed outside all present maps.\nl
But none learns whither through the unknown he sails\nl
Or what secret mission the great Mother gave.\nl
In the hidden strength of her omnipotent Will,\nl
Driven by her breath across life's tossing deep,\nl
Page 71

Through the thunder's roar and through the windless hush,\nl
Through fog and mist where nothing more is seen,\nl
He carries her sealed orders in his breast.\nl
Late will he know, opening the mystic script,\nl
Whether to a blank port in the Unseen\nl
He goes or, armed with her fiat, to discover\nl
A new mind and body in the city of God\nl
And enshrine the Immortal in his glory's house\nl
And make the finite one with Infinity.\nl
Across the salt waste of the endless years\nl
Her ocean winds impel his errant boat,\nl
The cosmic waters plashing as he goes,\nl
A rumour around him and danger and a call.\nl
Always he follows in her force's wake.\nl
He sails through life and death and other life,\nl
He travels on through waking and through sleep.\nl
A power is on him from her occult force\nl
That ties him to his own creation's fate,\nl
And never can the mighty Traveller rest\nl
And never can the mystic voyage cease\nl
Till the nescient dusk is lifted from man's soul\nl
And the morns of God have overtaken his night.\nl
As long as Nature lasts, he too is there,\nl
For this is sure that he and she are one;\nl
Even when he sleeps, he keeps her on his breast:\nl
Whoever leaves her, he will not depart\nl
To repose without her in the Unknowable.\nl
There is a truth to know, a work to do;\nl
Her play is real; a Mystery he fulfils:\nl
There is a plan in the Mother's deep world-whim,\nl
A purpose in her vast and random game.\nl
This ever she meant since the first dawn of life,\nl
This constant will she covered with her sport,\nl
To evoke a Person in the impersonal Void,\nl
With the Truth-Light strike earth's massive roots of trance,\nl
Wake a dumb self in the inconscient depths\nl
Page 72

And raise a lost Power from its python sleep\nl
That the eyes of the Timeless might look out from Time\nl
And the world manifest the unveiled Divine.\nl
For this he left his white infinity\nl
And laid on the spirit the burden of the flesh,\nl
That Godhead's seed might flower in mindless Space.\nl
\rl{\fsc End of Canto Four}
Page 73

\ht Canto Five: The Yoga of the King: The Yoga of the Spirit's Freedom and Greatness
\par
\sbigcap This knowledge first he had of time-born men.\nl
Admitted through a curtain of bright mind\nl
That hangs between our thoughts and absolute sight,\nl
He found the occult cave, the mystic door\nl
Near to the well of vision in the soul,\nl
And entered where the Wings of Glory brood\nl
In the silent space where all is for ever known.\nl
Indifferent to doubt and to belief,\nl
Avid of the naked real's single shock\nl
He shore the cord of mind that ties the earth-heart\nl
And cast away the yoke of Matter's law.\nl
The body's rules bound not the spirit's powers:\nl
When life had stopped its beats, death broke not in;\nl
He dared to live when breath and thought were still.\nl
Thus could he step into that magic place\nl
Which few can even glimpse with hurried glance\nl
Lifted for a moment from mind's laboured works\nl
And the poverty of Nature's earthly sight.\nl
All that the Gods have learned is there self-known.\nl
There in a hidden chamber closed and mute\nl
Are kept the record graphs of the cosmic scribe,\nl
And there the tables of the sacred Law,\nl
There is the Book of Being's index page;\nl
The text and glossary of the Vedic truth\nl
Are there; the rhythms and metres of the stars\nl
Significant of the movements of our fate:\nl
The symbol powers of number and of form,\nl
And the secret code of the history of the world\nl
And Nature's correspondence with the soul\nl
Are written in the mystic heart of Life.\nl
Page 74

In the glow of the spirit's room of memories\nl
He could recover the luminous marginal notes\nl
Dotting with light the crabbed ambiguous scroll,\nl
Rescue the preamble and the saving clause\nl
Of the dark Agreement by which all is ruled\nl
That rises from material Nature's sleep\nl
To clothe the Everlasting in new shapes.\nl
He could re-read now and interpret new\nl
Its strange symbol letters, scattered abstruse signs,\nl
Resolve its oracle and its paradox,\nl
Its riddling phrases and its blindfold terms,\nl
The deep oxymoron of its truth's repliques,\nl
And recognise as a just necessity\nl
Its hard conditions for the mighty work,—\nl
Nature's impossible Herculean toil\nl
Only her warlock-wisecraft could enforce,\nl
Its law of the opposition of the gods,\nl
Its list of inseparable contraries.\nl
The dumb great Mother in her cosmic trance\nl
Exploiting for creation's joy and pain\nl
Infinity's sanction to the birth of form,\nl
Accepts indomitably to execute\nl
The will to know in an inconscient world,\nl
The will to live under a reign of death,\nl
The thirst for rapture in a heart of flesh,\nl
And works out through the appearance of a soul\nl
By a miraculous birth in plasm and gas\nl
The mystery of God's covenant with the Night.\nl
Once more was heard in the still cosmic Mind\nl
The Eternal's promise to his labouring Force\nl
Inducing the world-passion to begin,\nl
The cry of birth into mortality\nl
And the opening verse of the tragedy of Time.\nl
Out of the depths the world's buried secret rose;\nl
He read the original ukase kept back\nl
In the locked archives of the spirit's crypt,\nl
Page 75

And saw the signature and fiery seal\nl
Of Wisdom on the dim Power's hooded work\nl
Who builds in Ignorance the steps of Light.\nl
A sleeping deity opened deathless eyes:\nl
He saw the unshaped thought in soulless forms,\nl
Knew Matter pregnant with spiritual sense,\nl
Mind dare the study of the Unknowable,\nl
Life its gestation of the Golden Child.\nl
In the light flooding thought's blank vacancy,\nl
Interpreting the universe by soul signs\nl
He read from within the text of the without:\nl
The riddle grew plain and lost its catch obscure.\nl
A larger lustre lit the mighty page.\nl
A purpose mingled with the whims of Time,\nl
A meaning met the stumbling pace of Chance\nl
And Fate revealed a chain of seeing Will;\nl
A conscious wideness filled the old dumb Space.\nl
In the Void he saw throned the Omniscience supreme.\nl

\spar A Will, a hope immense now seized his heart,\nl
And to discern the superhuman's form\nl
He raised his eyes to unseen spiritual heights,\nl
Aspiring to bring down a greater world.\nl
The glory he had glimpsed must be his home.\nl
A brighter heavenlier sun must soon illume\nl
This dusk room with its dark internal stair,\nl
The infant soul in its small nursery school\nl
Mid objects meant for a lesson hardly learned\nl
Outgrow its early grammar of intellect\nl
And its imitation of Earth-Nature's art,\nl
Its earthly dialect to God-language change,\nl
In living symbols study Reality\nl
And learn the logic of the Infinite.\nl
The Ideal must be Nature's common truth,\nl
The body illumined with the indwelling God,\nl
The heart and mind feel one with all that is,\nl
Page 76

A conscious soul live in a conscious world.\nl
As through a mist a sovereign peak is seen,\nl
The greatness of the eternal Spirit appeared,\nl
Exiled in a fragmented universe\nl
Amid half-semblances of diviner things.\nl
These now could serve no more his regal turn;\nl
The Immortal's pride refused the doom to live\nl
A miser of the scanty bargain made\nl
Between our littleness and bounded hopes\nl
And the compassionate Infinitudes.\nl
His height repelled the lowness of earth's state:\nl
A wideness discontented with its frame\nl
Resiled from poor assent to Nature's terms,\nl
The harsh contract spurned and the diminished lease.\nl
Only beginnings are accomplished here;\nl
Our base's Matter seems alone complete,\nl
An absolute machine without a soul.\nl
Or all seems a misfit of half ideas,\nl
Or we saddle with the vice of earthly form\nl
A hurried imperfect glimpse of heavenly things,\nl
Guesses and travesties of celestial types.\nl
Here chaos sorts itself into a world,\nl
A brief formation drifting in the void:\nl
Apings of knowledge, unfinished arcs of power,\nl
Flamings of beauty into earthly shapes,\nl
Love's broken reflexes of unity\nl
Swim, fragment-mirrorings of a floating sun.\nl
A packed assemblage of crude tentative lives\nl
Are pieced into a tessellated whole.\nl
There is no perfect answer to our hopes;\nl
There are blind voiceless doors that have no key;\nl
Thought climbs in vain and brings a borrowed light,\nl
Cheated by counterfeits sold to us in life's mart,\nl
Our hearts clutch at a forfeited heavenly bliss.\nl
There is provender for the mind's satiety,\nl
There are thrills of the flesh, but not the soul's desire.\nl
Page 77

Here even the highest rapture Time can give\nl
Is a mimicry of ungrasped beatitudes,\nl
A mutilated statue of ecstasy,\nl
A wounded happiness that cannot live,\nl
A brief felicity of mind or sense\nl
Thrown by the World-Power to her body-slave,\nl
Or a simulacrum of enforced delight\nl
In the seraglios of Ignorance.\nl
For all we have acquired soon loses worth,\nl
An old disvalued credit in Time's bank,\nl
Imperfection's cheque drawn on the Inconscient.\nl
An inconsequence dogs every effort made,\nl
And chaos waits on every cosmos formed:\nl
In each success a seed of failure lurks.\nl
He saw the doubtfulness of all things here,\nl
The incertitude of man's proud confident thought,\nl
The transience of the achievements of his force.\nl
A thinking being in an unthinking world,\nl
An island in the sea of the Unknown,\nl
He is a smallness trying to be great,\nl
An animal with some instincts of a god,\nl
His life a story too common to be told,\nl
His deeds a number summing up to nought,\nl
His consciousness a torch lit to be quenched,\nl
His hope a star above a cradle and grave.\nl
And yet a greater destiny may be his,\nl
For the eternal Spirit is his truth.\nl
He can re-create himself and all around\nl
And fashion new the world in which he lives:\nl
He, ignorant, is the Knower beyond Time,\nl
He is the Self above Nature, above Fate.\nl

\spar His soul retired from all that he had done.\nl
Hushed was the futile din of human toil,\nl
Forsaken wheeled the circle of the days;\nl
In distance sank the crowded tramp of life.\nl
Page 78

The Silence was his sole companion left.\nl
Impassive he lived immune from earthly hopes,\nl
A figure in the ineffable Witness' shrine\nl
Pacing the vast cathedral of his thoughts\nl
Under its arches dim with infinity\nl
And heavenward brooding of invisible wings.\nl
A call was on him from intangible heights;\nl
Indifferent to the little outpost Mind,\nl
He dwelt in the wideness of the Eternal's reign.\nl
His being now exceeded thinkable Space,\nl
His boundless thought was neighbour to cosmic sight:\nl
A universal light was in his eyes,\nl
A golden influx flowed through heart and brain;\nl
A Force came down into his mortal limbs,\nl
A current from eternal seas of Bliss;\nl
He felt the invasion and the nameless joy.\nl
Aware of his occult omnipotent Source,\nl
Allured by the omniscient Ecstasy,\nl
A living centre of the Illimitable\nl
Widened to equate with the world's circumference,\nl
He turned to his immense spiritual fate.\nl
Abandoned on a canvas of torn air,\nl
A picture lost in far and fading streaks,\nl
The earth-nature's summits sank below his feet:\nl
He climbed to meet the infinite more above.\nl
The Immobile's ocean-silence saw him pass,\nl
An arrow leaping through eternity\nl
Suddenly shot from the tense bow of Time,\nl
A ray returning to its parent sun.\nl
Opponent of that glory of escape,\nl
The black Inconscient swung its dragon tail\nl
Lashing a slumbrous Infinite by its force\nl
Into the deep obscurities of form:\nl
Death lay beneath him like a gate of sleep.\nl
One-pointed to the immaculate Delight,\nl
Questing for God as for a splendid prey,\nl
Page 79

He mounted burning like a cone of fire.\nl
To a few is given that godlike rare release.\nl
One among many thousands never touched,\nl
Engrossed in the external world's design,\nl
Is chosen by a secret witness Eye\nl
And driven by a pointing hand of Light\nl
Across his soul's unmapped immensitudes.\nl
A pilgrim of the everlasting Truth,\nl
Our measures cannot hold his measureless mind;\nl
He has turned from the voices of the narrow realm\nl
And left the little lane of human Time.\nl
In the hushed precincts of a vaster plan\nl
He treads the vestibules of the Unseen,\nl
Or listens following a bodiless Guide\nl
To a lonely cry in boundless vacancy.\nl
All the deep cosmic murmur falling still,\nl
He lives in the hush before the world was born,\nl
His soul left naked to the timeless One.\nl
Far from compulsion of created things\nl
Thought and its shadowy idols disappear,\nl
The moulds of form and person are undone:\nl
The ineffable Wideness knows him for its own.\nl
A lone forerunner of the Godward earth,\nl
Among the symbols of yet unshaped things\nl
Watched by closed eyes, mute faces of the Unborn,\nl
He journeys to meet the Incommunicable,\nl
Hearing the echo of his single steps\nl
In the eternal courts of Solitude.\nl
A nameless Marvel fills the motionless hours.\nl
His spirit mingles with eternity's heart\nl
And bears the silence of the Infinite.\nl

\spar In a divine retreat from mortal thought,\nl
In a prodigious gesture of soul-sight,\nl
His being towered into pathless heights,\nl
Naked of its vesture of humanity.\nl
Page 80

As thus it rose, to meet him bare and pure\nl
A strong Descent leaped down. A Might, a Flame,\nl
A Beauty half-visible with deathless eyes,\nl
A violent Ecstasy, a Sweetness dire,\nl
Enveloped him with its stupendous limbs\nl
And penetrated nerve and heart and brain\nl
That thrilled and fainted with the epiphany:\nl
His nature shuddered in the Unknown's grasp.\nl
In a moment shorter than death, longer than Time,\nl
By a Power more ruthless than Love, happier than Heaven,\nl
Taken sovereignly into eternal arms,\nl
Haled and coerced by a stark absolute bliss,\nl
In a whirlwind circuit of delight and force\nl
Hurried into unimaginable depths,\nl
Upborne into immeasurable heights,\nl
It was torn out from its mortality\nl
And underwent a new and bourneless change.\nl
An Omniscient knowing without sight or thought,\nl
An indecipherable Omnipotence,\nl
A mystic Form that could contain the worlds,\nl
Yet make one human breast its passionate shrine,\nl
Drew him out of his seeking loneliness\nl
Into the magnitudes of God's embrace.\nl
As when a timeless Eye annuls the hours\nl
Abolishing the agent and the act,\nl
So now his spirit shone out wide, blank, pure:\nl
His wakened mind became an empty slate\nl
On which the Universal and Sole could write.\nl
All that represses our fallen consciousness\nl
Was taken from him like a forgotten load:\nl
A fire that seemed the body of a god\nl
Consumed the limiting figures of the past\nl
And made large room for a new self to live.\nl
Eternity's contact broke the moulds of sense.\nl
A greater Force than the earthly held his limbs,\nl
Huge workings bared his undiscovered sheaths,\nl
Page 81

Strange energies wrought and screened tremendous hands\nl
Unwound the triple cord of mind and freed\nl
The heavenly wideness of a Godhead's gaze.\nl
As through a dress the wearer's shape is seen,\nl
There reached through forms to the hidden absolute\nl
A cosmic feeling and transcendent sight.\nl
Increased and heightened were the instruments.\nl
Illusion lost her aggrandising lens;\nl
As from her failing hand the measures fell,\nl
Atomic looked the things that loomed so large.\nl
The little ego's ring could join no more;\nl
In the enormous spaces of the self\nl
The body now seemed only a wandering shell,\nl
His mind the many-frescoed outer court\nl
Of an imperishable Inhabitant:\nl
His spirit breathed a superhuman air.\nl
The imprisoned deity rent its magic fence.\nl
As with a sound of thunder and of seas,\nl
Vast barriers crashed around the huge escape.\nl
Immutably coeval with the world,\nl
Circle and end of every hope and toil\nl
Inexorably drawn round thought and act,\nl
The fixed immovable peripheries\nl
Effaced themselves beneath the Incarnate's tread.\nl
The dire velamen and the bottomless crypt\nl
Between which life and thought for ever move,\nl
Forbidden still to cross the dim dread bounds,\nl
The guardian darknesses mute and formidable,\nl
Empowered to circumscribe the wingless spirit\nl
In the boundaries of Mind and Ignorance,\nl
Protecting no more a dual eternity\nl
Vanished rescinding their enormous role:\nl
Once figure of creation's vain ellipse,\nl
The expanding zero lost its giant curve.\nl
The old adamantine vetoes stood no more:\nl
Overpowered were earth and Nature's obsolete rule;\nl
Page 82

The python coils of the restricting Law\nl
Could not restrain the swift arisen God:\nl
Abolished were the scripts of destiny.\nl
There was no small death-hunted creature more,\nl
No fragile form of being to preserve\nl
From an all-swallowing Immensity.\nl
The great hammer-beats of a pent-up world-heart\nl
Burst open the narrow dams that keep us safe\nl
Against the forces of the universe.\nl
The soul and cosmos faced as equal powers.\nl
A boundless being in a measureless Time\nl
Invaded Nature with the infinite;\nl
He saw unpathed, unwalled, his titan scope.\nl

\spar All was uncovered to his sealless eye.\nl
A secret Nature stripped of her defence,\nl
Once in a dreaded half-light formidable,\nl
Overtaken in her mighty privacy\nl
Lay bare to the burning splendour of his will.\nl
In shadowy chambers lit by a strange sun\nl
And opening hardly to hid mystic keys\nl
Her perilous arcanes and hooded Powers\nl
Confessed the advent of a mastering Mind\nl
And bore the compulsion of a time-born gaze.\nl
Incalculable in their wizard modes,\nl
Immediate and invincible in the act,\nl
Her secret strengths native to greater worlds\nl
Lifted above our needy limited scope,\nl
The occult privilege of demigods\nl
And the sure power-pattern of her cryptic signs,\nl
Her diagrams of geometric force,\nl
Her potencies of marvel-fraught design\nl
Courted employment by an earth-nursed might.\nl
A conscious Nature's quick machinery\nl
Armed with a latent splendour of miracle\nl
The prophet-passion of a seeing Mind,\nl
Page 83

And the lightning bareness of a free soul-force.\nl
All once impossible deemed could now become\nl
A natural limb of possibility,\nl
A new domain of normalcy supreme.\nl
An almighty occultist erects in Space\nl
This seeming outward world which tricks the sense;\nl
He weaves his hidden threads of consciousness,\nl
He builds bodies for his shapeless energy;\nl
Out of the unformed and vacant Vast he has made\nl
His sorcery of solid images,\nl
His magic of formative number and design,\nl
The fixed irrational links none can annul,\nl
This criss-cross tangle of invisible laws;\nl
His infallible rules, his covered processes,\nl
Achieve unerringly an inexplicable\nl
Creation where our error carves dead frames\nl
Of knowledge for a living ignorance.\nl
In her mystery's moods divorced from the Maker's laws\nl
She too as sovereignly creates her field,\nl
Her will shaping the undetermined vasts,\nl
Making a finite of infinity;\nl
She too can make an order of her caprice,\nl
As if her rash superb wagered to outvie\nl
The veiled Creator's cosmic secrecies.\nl
The rapid footsteps of her fantasy,\nl
Amid whose falls wonders like flowers rise,\nl
Are surer than reason, defter than device\nl
And swifter than Imagination's wings.\nl
All she new-fashions by the thought and word,\nl
Compels all substance by her wand of Mind.\nl
Mind is a mediator divinity:\nl
Its powers can undo all Nature's work:\nl
Mind can suspend or change earth's concrete law.\nl
Affranchised from earth-habit's drowsy seal\nl
The leaden grip of Matter it can break;\nl
Indifferent to the angry stare of Death,\nl
Page 84

It can immortalise a moment's work:\nl
A simple fiat of its thinking force,\nl
The casual pressure of its slight assent\nl
Can liberate the Energy dumb and pent\nl
Within its chambers of mysterious trance:\nl
It makes the body's sleep a puissant arm,\nl
Holds still the breath, the beatings of the heart,\nl
While the unseen is found, the impossible done,\nl
Communicates without means the unspoken thought;\nl
It moves events by its bare silent will,\nl
Acts at a distance without hands or feet.\nl
This giant Ignorance, this dwarfish Life\nl
It can illumine with a prophet sight,\nl
Invoke the bacchic rapture, the Fury's goad,\nl
In our body arouse the demon or the god,\nl
Call in the Omniscient and Omnipotent,\nl
Awake a forgotten Almightiness within.\nl
In its own plane a shining emperor,\nl
Even in this rigid realm, Mind can be king:\nl
The logic of its demigod Idea\nl
In the leap of a transitional moment brings\nl
Surprises of creation never achieved\nl
Even by Matter's strange unconscious skill.\nl
All's miracle here and can by miracle change.\nl
This is that secret Nature's edge of might.\nl
On the margin of great immaterial planes,\nl
In kingdoms of an untrammelled glory of force,\nl
Where Mind is master of the life and form\nl
And soul fulfils its thoughts by its own power,\nl
She meditates upon mighty words and looks\nl
On the unseen links that join the parted spheres.\nl
Thence to the initiate who observes her laws\nl
She brings the light of her mysterious realms:\nl
Here where he stands, his feet on a prostrate world,\nl
His mind no more cast into Matter's mould,\nl
Over their bounds in spurts of splendid strength\nl
Page 85

She carries their magician processes\nl
And the formulas of their stupendous speech,\nl
Till heaven and hell become purveyors to earth\nl
And the universe the slave of mortal will.\nl
A mediatrix with veiled and nameless gods\nl
Whose alien will touches our human life,\nl
Imitating the World-Magician's ways\nl
She invents for her self-bound free-will its grooves\nl
And feigns for magic's freaks a binding cause.\nl
All worlds she makes the partners of her deeds,\nl
Accomplices of her mighty violence,\nl
Her daring leaps into the impossible:\nl
From every source she has taken her cunning means,\nl
She draws from the free-love marriage of the planes\nl
Elements for her creation's tour-de-force:\nl
A wonder-weft of knowledge incalculable,\nl
A compendium of divine invention's feats\nl
She has combined to make the unreal true\nl
Or liberate suppressed reality:\nl
In her unhedged Circean wonderland\nl
Pell-mell she shepherds her occult mightinesses;\nl
Her mnemonics of the craft of the Infinite,\nl
Jets of the screened subliminal's caprice,\nl
Tags of the gramarye of Inconscience,\nl
Freedom of a sovereign Truth without a law,\nl
Thoughts that were born in the immortals' world,\nl
Oracles that break out from behind the shrine,\nl
Warnings from the daemonic inner voice\nl
And peeps and lightning-leaps of prophecy\nl
And intimations to the inner ear,\nl
Abrupt interventions stark and absolute\nl
And the Superconscient's unaccountable acts,\nl
Have woven her balanced web of miracles\nl
And the weird technique of her tremendous art.\nl
This bizarre kingdom passed into his charge.\nl
As one resisting more the more she loves,\nl
Page 86

Her great possessions and her power and lore\nl
She gave, compelled, with a reluctant joy;\nl
Herself she gave for rapture and for use.\nl
Absolved from aberrations in deep ways,\nl
The ends she recovered for which she was made:\nl
She turned against the evil she had helped\nl
Her engined wrath, her invisible means to slay;\nl
Her dangerous moods and arbitrary force\nl
She surrendered to the service of the soul\nl
And the control of a spiritual will.\nl
A greater despot tamed her despotism.\nl
Assailed, surprised in the fortress of her self,\nl
Conquered by her own unexpected king,\nl
Fulfilled and ransomed by her servitude,\nl
She yielded in a vanquished ecstasy,\nl
Her sealed hermetic wisdom forced from her,\nl
Fragments of the mystery of omnipotence.\nl

\spar A border sovereign is the occult Force.\nl
A threshold guardian of the earth-scene's Beyond,\nl
She has canalised the outbreaks of the Gods\nl
And cut through vistas of intuitive sight\nl
A long road of shimmering discoveries.\nl
The worlds of a marvellous Unknown were near,\nl
Behind her an ineffable Presence stood:\nl
Her reign received their mystic influences,\nl
Their lion-forces crouched beneath her feet;\nl
The future sleeps unknown behind their doors.\nl
Abysms infernal gaped round the soul's steps\nl
And called to its mounting vision peaks divine:\nl
An endless climb and adventure of the Idea\nl
There tirelessly tempted the explorer mind\nl
And countless voices visited the charmed ear;\nl
A million figures passed and were seen no more.\nl
This was a forefront of God's thousandfold house,\nl
Beginnings of the half-screened Invisible.\nl
Page 87

A magic porch of entry glimmering\nl
Quivered in a penumbra of screened Light,\nl
A court of the mystical traffic of the worlds,\nl
A balcony and miraculous fa\c{c}ade.\nl
Above her lightened high immensities;\nl
All the unknown looked out from boundlessness:\nl
It lodged upon an edge of hourless Time,\nl
Gazing out of some everlasting Now,\nl
Its shadows gleaming with the birth of gods,\nl
Its bodies signalling the Bodiless,\nl
Its foreheads glowing with the Oversoul,\nl
Its forms projected from the Unknowable,\nl
Its eyes dreaming of the Ineffable,\nl
Its faces staring into eternity.\nl
Life in him learned its huge subconscient rear;\nl
The little fronts unlocked to the unseen Vasts:\nl
Her gulfs stood nude, her far transcendences\nl
Flamed in transparencies of crowded light.\nl

\spar A giant order was discovered here\nl
Of which the tassel and extended fringe\nl
Are the scant stuff of our material lives.\nl
This overt universe whose figures hide\nl
The secrets merged in superconscient light,\nl
Wrote clear the letters of its glowing code:\nl
A map of subtle signs surpassing thought\nl
Was hung upon a wall of inmost mind.\nl
Illumining the world's concrete images\nl
Into significant symbols by its gloss,\nl
It offered to the intuitive exegete\nl
Its reflex of the eternal Mystery.\nl
Ascending and descending twixt life's poles\nl
The seried kingdoms of the graded Law\nl
Plunged from the Everlasting into Time,\nl
Then glad of a glory of multitudinous mind\nl
And rich with life's adventure and delight\nl
Page 88

And packed with the beauty of Matter's shapes and hues\nl
Climbed back from Time into undying Self,\nl
Up a golden ladder carrying the soul,\nl
Tying with diamond threads the Spirit's extremes.\nl
In this drop from consciousness to consciousness\nl
Each leaned on the occult Inconscient's power,\nl
The fountain of its needed Ignorance,\nl
Archmason of the limits by which it lives.\nl
In this soar from consciousness to consciousness\nl
Each lifted tops to That from which it came,\nl
Origin of all that it had ever been\nl
And home of all that it could still become.\nl
An organ scale of the Eternal's acts,\nl
Mounting to their climax in an endless Calm,\nl
Paces of the many-visaged Wonderful,\nl
Predestined stadia of the evolving Way,\nl
Measures of the stature of the growing soul,\nl
They interpreted existence to itself\nl
And, mediating twixt the heights and deeps,\nl
United the veiled married opposites\nl
And linked creation to the Ineffable.\nl
A last high world was seen where all worlds meet;\nl
In its summit gleam where Night is not nor Sleep,\nl
The light began of the Trinity supreme.\nl
All there discovered what it seeks for here.\nl
It freed the finite into boundlessness\nl
And rose into its own eternities.\nl
The Inconscient found its heart of consciousness,\nl
The idea and feeling groping in Ignorance\nl
At last clutched passionately the body of Truth,\nl
The music born in Matter's silences\nl
Plucked nude out of the Ineffable's fathomlessness\nl
The meaning it had held but could not voice;\nl
The perfect rhythm now only sometimes dreamed\nl
An answer brought to the torn earth's hungry need\nl
Rending the night that had concealed the Unknown,\nl
Page 89

Giving to her her lost forgotten soul.\nl
A grand solution closed the long impasse\nl
In which the heights of mortal effort end.\nl
A reconciling Wisdom looked on life;\nl
It took the striving undertones of mind\nl
And took the confused refrain of human hopes\nl
And made of them a sweet and happy call;\nl
It lifted from an underground of pain\nl
The inarticulate murmur of our lives\nl
And found for it a sense illimitable.\nl
A mighty oneness its perpetual theme,\nl
It caught the soul's faint scattered utterances,\nl
Read hardly twixt our lines of rigid thought\nl
Or mid this drowse and coma on Matter's breast\nl
Heard like disjointed mutterings in sleep;\nl
It grouped the golden links that they had lost\nl
And showed to them their divine unity,\nl
Saving from the error of divided self\nl
The deep spiritual cry in all that is.\nl
All the great Words that toiled to express the One\nl
Were lifted into an absoluteness of light,\nl
An ever-burning Revelation's fire\nl
And the immortality of the eternal Voice.\nl
There was no quarrel more of truth with truth;\nl
The endless chapter of their differences\nl
Retold in light by an omniscient Scribe\nl
Travelled through difference towards unity,\nl
Mind's winding search lost every tinge of doubt\nl
Led to its end by an all-seeing speech\nl
That garbed the initial and original thought\nl
With the finality of an ultimate phrase:\nl
United were Time's creative mood and tense\nl
To the style and syntax of Identity.\nl
A paean swelled from the lost musing deeps;\nl
An anthem pealed to the triune ecstasies,\nl
A cry of the moments to the Immortal's bliss.\nl
Page 90

As if the strophes of a cosmic ode,\nl
A hierarchy of climbing harmonies\nl
Peopled with voices and with visages\nl
Aspired in a crescendo of the Gods\nl
From Matter's abysses to the Spirit's peaks.\nl
Above were the Immortal's changeless seats,\nl
White chambers of dalliance with eternity\nl
And the stupendous gates of the Alone.\nl
Across the unfolding of the seas of self\nl
Appeared the deathless countries of the One.\nl
A many-miracled Consciousness unrolled\nl
Vast aim and process and unfettered norms,\nl
A larger Nature's great familiar roads.\nl
Affranchised from the net of earthly sense\nl
Calm continents of potency were glimpsed;\nl
Homelands of beauty shut to human eyes,\nl
Half-seen at first through wonder's gleaming lids,\nl
Surprised the vision with felicity;\nl
Sunbelts of knowledge, moonbelts of delight\nl
Stretched out in an ecstasy of widenesses\nl
Beyond our indigent corporeal range.\nl
There he could enter, there awhile abide.\nl
A voyager upon uncharted routes\nl
Fronting the viewless danger of the Unknown,\nl
Adventuring across enormous realms,\nl
He broke into another Space and Time.\nl
\rl{\fsc End of Canto Five}
\rl{\fsc End of Book One}

\ht BOOK TWO: The Book of the Traveller of the Worlds

\sect2
\par
\ht Canto One: The World-Stair
\par
\sbigcap Alone he moved watched by the infinity\nl
Around him and the Unknowable above.\nl
All could be seen that shuns the mortal eye,\nl
All could be known the mind has never grasped;\nl
All could be done no mortal will can dare.\nl
A limitless movement filled a limitless peace.\nl
In a profound existence beyond earth's\nl
Parent or kin to our ideas and dreams\nl
Where Space is a vast experiment of the soul,\nl
In an immaterial substance linked to ours\nl
In a deep oneness of all things that are,\nl
The universe of the Unknown arose.\nl
A self-creation without end or pause\nl
Revealed the grandeurs of the Infinite:\nl
It flung into the hazards of its play\nl
A million moods, a myriad energies,\nl
The world-shapes that are fancies of its Truth\nl
And the formulas of the freedom of its Force.\nl
It poured into the Ever-stable's flux\nl
A bacchic rapture and revel of Ideas,\nl
A passion and motion of everlastingness.\nl
There rose unborn into the Unchanging's surge\nl
Thoughts that abide in their deathless consequence,\nl
Words that immortal last though fallen mute,\nl
Acts that brought out from Silence its dumb sense,\nl
Lines that convey the inexpressible.\nl
The Eternal's stillness saw in unmoved joy\nl
His universal Power at work display\nl
In plots of pain and dramas of delight\nl
The wonder and beauty of her will to be.\nl
All, even pain, was the soul's pleasure here;\nl
Page 95

Here all experience was a single plan,\nl
The thousandfold expression of the One.\nl
All came at once into his single view;\nl
Nothing escaped his vast intuitive sight,\nl
Nothing drew near he could not feel as kin:\nl
He was one spirit with that immensity.\nl
Images in a supernal consciousness\nl
Embodying the Unborn who never dies,\nl
The structured visions of the cosmic Self\nl
Alive with the touch of being's eternity\nl
Looked at him like form-bound spiritual thoughts\nl
Figuring the movements of the Ineffable.\nl
Aspects of being donned world-outline; forms\nl
That open moving doors on things divine,\nl
Became familiar to his hourly sight;\nl
The symbols of the Spirit's reality,\nl
The living bodies of the Bodiless\nl
Grew near to him, his daily associates.\nl
The exhaustless seeings of the unsleeping Mind,\nl
Letterings of its contact with the invisible,\nl
Surrounded him with countless pointing signs;\nl
The voices of a thousand realms of Life\nl
Missioned to him her mighty messages.\nl
The heaven-hints that invade our earthly lives,\nl
The dire imaginations dreamed by Hell,\nl
Which if enacted and experienced here\nl
Our dulled capacity soon would cease to feel\nl
Or our mortal frailty could not long endure,\nl
Were set in their sublime proportions there.\nl
There lived out in their self-born atmosphere,\nl
They resumed their topless pitch and native power;\nl
Their fortifying stress upon the soul\nl
Bit deep into the ground of consciousness\nl
The passion and purity of their extremes,\nl
The absoluteness of their single cry\nl
And the sovereign sweetness or violent poetry\nl
Page 96

Of their beautiful or terrible delight.\nl
All thought can know or widest sight perceive\nl
And all that thought and sight can never know,\nl
All things occult and rare, remote and strange\nl
Were near to heart's contact, felt by spirit-sense.\nl
Asking for entry at his nature's gates\nl
They crowded the widened spaces of his mind,\nl
His self-discovery's flaming witnesses,\nl
Offering their marvel and their multitude.\nl
These now became new portions of himself,\nl
The figures of his spirit's greater life,\nl
The moving scenery of his large time-walk\nl
Or the embroidered tissue of his sense:\nl
These took the place of intimate human things\nl
And moved as close companions of his thoughts,\nl
Or were his soul's natural environment.\nl
Tireless the heart's adventure of delight,\nl
Endless the kingdoms of the Spirit's bliss,\nl
Unnumbered tones struck from one harmony's strings;\nl
Each to its wide-winged universal poise,\nl
Its fathomless feeling of the All in one,\nl
Brought notes of some perfection yet unseen,\nl
Its single retreat into Truth's secrecies,\nl
Its happy sidelight on the Infinite.\nl
All was found there the Unique has dreamed and made\nl
Tinging with ceaseless rapture and surprise\nl
And an opulent beauty of passionate difference\nl
The recurring beat that moments God in Time.\nl
Only was missing the sole timeless Word\nl
That carries eternity in its lonely sound,\nl
The Idea self-luminous key to all ideas,\nl
The integer of the Spirit's perfect sum\nl
That equates the unequal All to the equal One,\nl
The single sign interpreting every sign,\nl
The absolute index to the Absolute.\nl
Page 97

\spar There walled apart by its own innerness\nl
In a mystical barrage of dynamic light\nl
He saw a lone immense high-curved world-pile\nl
Erect like a mountain-chariot of the Gods\nl
Motionless under an inscrutable sky.\nl
As if from Matter's plinth and viewless base\nl
To a top as viewless, a carved sea of worlds\nl
Climbing with foam-maned waves to the Supreme\nl
Ascended towards breadths immeasurable;\nl
It hoped to soar into the Ineffable's reign:\nl
A hundred levels raised it to the Unknown.\nl
So it towered up to heights intangible\nl
And disappeared in the hushed conscious Vast\nl
As climbs a storeyed temple-tower to heaven\nl
Built by the aspiring soul of man to live\nl
Near to his dream of the Invisible.\nl
Infinity calls to it as it dreams and climbs;\nl
Its spire touches the apex of the world;\nl
Mounting into great voiceless stillnesses\nl
It marries the earth to screened eternities.\nl
Amid the many systems of the One\nl
Made by an interpreting creative joy\nl
Alone it points us to our journey back\nl
Out of our long self-loss in Nature's deeps;\nl
Planted on earth it holds in it all realms:\nl
It is a brief compendium of the Vast.\nl
This was the single stair to being's goal.\nl
A summary of the stages of the spirit,\nl
Its copy of the cosmic hierarchies\nl
Refashioned in our secret air of self\nl
A subtle pattern of the universe.\nl
It is within, below, without, above.\nl
Acting upon this visible Nature's scheme\nl
It wakens our earth-matter's heavy doze\nl
To think and feel and to react to joy;\nl
It models in us our diviner parts,\nl
Page 98

Lifts mortal mind into a greater air,\nl
Makes yearn this life of flesh to intangible aims,\nl
Links the body's death with immortality's call:\nl
Out of the swoon of the Inconscience\nl
It labours towards a superconscient Light.\nl
If earth were all and this were not in her,\nl
Thought could not be nor life-delight's response:\nl
Only material forms could then be her guests\nl
Driven by an inanimate world-force.\nl
Earth by this golden superfluity\nl
Bore thinking man and more than man shall bear;\nl
This higher scheme of being is our cause\nl
And holds the key to our ascending fate;\nl
It calls out of our dense mortality\nl
The conscious spirit nursed in Matter's house.\nl
The living symbol of these conscious planes,\nl
Its influences and godheads of the unseen,\nl
Its unthought logic of Reality's acts\nl
Arisen from the unspoken truth in things,\nl
Have fixed our inner life's slow-scaled degrees.\nl
Its steps are paces of the soul's return\nl
From the deep adventure of material birth,\nl
A ladder of delivering ascent\nl
And rungs that Nature climbs to deity.\nl
Once in the vigil of a deathless gaze\nl
These grades had marked her giant downward plunge,\nl
The wide and prone leap of a godhead's fall.\nl
Our life is a holocaust of the Supreme.\nl
The great World-Mother by her sacrifice\nl
Has made her soul the body of our state;\nl
Accepting sorrow and unconsciousness\nl
Divinity's lapse from its own splendours wove\nl
The many-patterned ground of all we are.\nl
An idol of self is our mortality.\nl
Our earth is a fragment and a residue;\nl
Her power is packed with the stuff of greater worlds\nl
Page 99

And steeped in their colour-lustres dimmed by her drowse;\nl
An atavism of higher births is hers,\nl
Her sleep is stirred by their buried memories\nl
Recalling the lost spheres from which they fell.\nl
Unsatisfied forces in her bosom move;\nl
They are partners of her greater growing fate\nl
And her return to immortality;\nl
They consent to share her doom of birth and death;\nl
They kindle partial gleams of the All and drive\nl
Her blind laborious spirit to compose\nl
A meagre image of the mighty Whole.\nl
The calm and luminous Intimacy within\nl
Approves her work and guides the unseeing Power.\nl
His vast design accepts a puny start.\nl
An attempt, a drawing half-done is the world's life;\nl
Its lines doubt their concealed significance,\nl
Its curves join not their high intended close.\nl
Yet some first image of greatness trembles there,\nl
And when the ambiguous crowded parts have met\nl
The many-toned unity to which they moved,\nl
The Artist's joy shall laugh at reason's rules;\nl
The divine intention suddenly shall be seen,\nl
The end vindicate intuition's sure technique.\nl
A graph shall be of many meeting worlds,\nl
A cube and union-crystal of the gods;\nl
A Mind shall think behind Nature's mindless mask,\nl
A conscious Vast fill the old dumb brute Space.\nl
This faint and fluid sketch of soul called man\nl
Shall stand out on the background of long Time\nl
A glowing epitome of eternity,\nl
A little point reveal the infinitudes.\nl
A Mystery's process is the universe.\nl
At first was laid a strange anomalous base,\nl
A void, a cipher of some secret Whole,\nl
Where zero held infinity in its sum\nl
And All and Nothing were a single term,\nl
Page 100

An eternal negative, a matrix Nought:\nl
Into its forms the Child is ever born\nl
Who lives for ever in the vasts of God.\nl
A slow reversal's movement then took place:\nl
A gas belched out from some invisible Fire,\nl
Of its dense rings were formed these million stars;\nl
Upon earth's new-born soil God's tread was heard.\nl
Across the thick smoke of earth's ignorance\nl
A Mind began to see and look at forms\nl
And groped for knowledge in the nescient Night:\nl
Caught in a blind stone-grip Force worked its plan\nl
And made in sleep this huge mechanical world,\nl
That Matter might grow conscious of its soul\nl
And like a busy midwife the life-power\nl
Deliver the zero carrier of the All.\nl
Because eternal eyes turned on earth's gulfs\nl
The lucent clarity of a pure regard\nl
And saw a shadow of the Unknowable\nl
Mirrored in the Inconscient's boundless sleep,\nl
Creation's search for self began its stir.\nl
A spirit dreamed in the crude cosmic whirl,\nl
Mind flowed unknowing in the sap of life\nl
And Matter's breasts suckled the divine Idea.\nl
A miracle of the Absolute was born;\nl
Infinity put on a finite soul,\nl
All ocean lived within a wandering drop,\nl
A time-made body housed the Illimitable.\nl
To live this Mystery out our souls came here.\nl

\spar A Seer within who knows the ordered plan\nl
Concealed behind our momentary steps,\nl
Inspires our ascent to viewless heights\nl
As once the abysmal leap to earth and life.\nl
His call had reached the Traveller in Time.\nl
Apart in an unfathomed loneliness,\nl
He travelled in his mute and single strength\nl
Page 101

Bearing the burden of the world's desire.\nl
A formless Stillness called, a nameless Light.\nl
Above him was the white immobile Ray,\nl
Around him the eternal Silences.\nl
No term was fixed to the high-pitched attempt;\nl
World after world disclosed its guarded powers,\nl
Heaven after heaven its deep beatitudes,\nl
But still the invisible Magnet drew his soul.\nl
A figure sole on Nature's giant stair,\nl
He mounted towards an indiscernible end\nl
On the bare summit of created things.\nl
\rl{\fsc End of Canto One}
Page 102

\par
\ht Canto Two: The Kingdom of Subtle Matter
\par
\sbigcap In the impalpable field of secret self,\nl
This little outer being's vast support\nl
Parted from vision by earth's solid fence,\nl
He came into a magic crystal air\nl
And found a life that lived not by the flesh,\nl
A light that made visible immaterial things.\nl
