A fine degree in wonder's hierarchy,\nl
The kingdom of subtle Matter's faery craft\nl
Outlined against a sky of vivid hues,\nl
Leaping out of a splendour-trance and haze,\nl
The wizard revelation of its front.\nl
A world of lovelier forms lies near to ours,\nl
Where, undisguised by earth's deforming sight,\nl
All shapes are beautiful and all things true.\nl
In that lucent ambience mystically clear\nl
The eyes were doors to a celestial sense,\nl
Hearing was music and the touch a charm,\nl
And the heart drew a deeper breath of power.\nl
There dwell earth-nature's shining origins:\nl
The perfect plans on which she moulds her works,\nl
The distant outcomes of her travailing force,\nl
Repose in a framework of established fate.\nl
Attempted vainly now or won in vain,\nl
Already were mapped and scheduled there the time\nl
And figure of her future sovereignties\nl
In the sumptuous lineaments traced by desire.\nl
The golden issue of mind's labyrinth plots,\nl
The riches unfound or still uncaught by our lives,\nl
Unsullied by the attaint of mortal thought\nl
Abide in that pellucid atmosphere.\nl
Our vague beginnings are overtaken there,\nl
Page 103

Our middle terms sketched out in prescient lines,\nl
Our finished ends anticipated live.\nl
This brilliant roof of our descending plane,\nl
Intercepting the free boon of heaven's air,\nl
Admits small inrushes of a mighty breath\nl
Or fragrant circuits through gold lattices;\nl
It shields our ceiling of terrestrial mind\nl
From deathless suns and the streaming of God's rain,\nl
Yet canalises a strange irised glow,\nl
And bright dews drip from the Immortal's sky.\nl
A passage for the Powers that move our days,\nl
Occult behind this grosser Nature's walls,\nl
A gossamer marriage-hall of Mind with Form\nl
Is hidden by a tapestry of dreams;\nl
Heaven's meanings steal through it as through a veil,\nl
Its inner sight sustains this outer scene.\nl
A finer consciousness with happier lines,\nl
It has a tact our touch cannot attain,\nl
A purity of sense we never feel;\nl
Its intercession with the eternal Ray\nl
Inspires our transient earth's brief-lived attempts\nl
At beauty and the perfect shape of things.\nl
In rooms of the young divinity of power\nl
And early play of the eternal Child\nl
The embodiments of his outwinging thoughts\nl
Laved in a bright everlasting wonder's tints\nl
And lulled by whispers of that lucid air\nl
Take dream-hued rest like birds on timeless trees\nl
Before they dive to float on earth-time's sea.\nl
All that here seems has lovelier semblance there.\nl
Whatever our hearts conceive, our heads create,\nl
Some high original beauty forfeiting,\nl
Thence exiled here consents to an earthly tinge.\nl
Whatever is here of visible charm and grace\nl
Finds there its faultless and immortal lines;\nl
All that is beautiful here is there divine.\nl
Page 104

Figures are there undreamed by mortal mind:\nl
Bodies that have no earthly counterpart\nl
Traverse the inner eye's illumined trance\nl
And ravish the heart with their celestial tread\nl
Persuading heaven to inhabit that wonder sphere.\nl
The future's marvels wander in its gulfs;\nl
Things old and new are fashioned in those depths:\nl
A carnival of beauty crowds the heights\nl
In that magic kingdom of ideal sight.\nl
In its antechambers of splendid privacy\nl
Matter and soul in conscious union meet\nl
Like lovers in a lonely secret place:\nl
In the clasp of a passion not yet unfortunate\nl
They join their strength and sweetness and delight\nl
And mingling make the high and low worlds one.\nl
Intruder from the formless Infinite\nl
Daring to break into the Inconscient's reign,\nl
The spirit's leap towards body touches ground.\nl
As yet unwrapped in earthly lineaments,\nl
Already it wears outlasting death and birth,\nl
Convincing the abyss by heavenly form,\nl
A covering of its immortality\nl
Alive to the lustre of the wearer's rank,\nl
Fit to endure the rub of Change and Time.\nl
A tissue mixed of the soul's radiant light\nl
And Matter's substance of sign-burdened Force,—\nl
Imagined vainly in our mind's thin air\nl
An abstract phantasm mould of mental make,—\nl
It feels what earthly bodies cannot feel\nl
And is more real than this grosser frame.\nl
After the falling of mortality's cloak\nl
Lightened is its weight to heighten its ascent;\nl
Refined to the touch of finer environments\nl
It drops old patterned palls of denser stuff,\nl
Cancels the grip of earth's descending pull\nl
And bears the soul from world to higher world,\nl
Page 105

Till in the naked ether of the peaks\nl
The spirit's simplicity alone is left,\nl
The eternal being's first transparent robe.\nl
But when it must come back to its mortal load\nl
And the hard ensemble of earth's experience,\nl
Then its return resumes that heavier dress.\nl
For long before earth's solid vest was forged\nl
By the technique of the atomic Void,\nl
A lucent envelope of self-disguise\nl
Was woven round the secret spirit in things.\nl
The subtle realms from those bright sheaths are made.\nl
This wonder-world with all its radiant boon\nl
Of vision and inviolate happiness,\nl
Only for expression cares and perfect form;\nl
Fair on its peaks, it has dangerous nether planes;\nl
Its light draws towards the verge of Nature's lapse;\nl
It lends beauty to the terror of the gulfs\nl
And fascinating eyes to perilous Gods,\nl
Invests with grace the demon and the snake.\nl
Its trance imposes earth's inconscience,\nl
Immortal it weaves for us death's sombre robe\nl
And authorises our mortality.\nl
This medium serves a greater Consciousness:\nl
A vessel of its concealed autocracy,\nl
It is the subtle ground of Matter's worlds,\nl
It is the immutable in their mutable forms,\nl
In the folds of its creative memory\nl
It guards the deathless type of perishing things:\nl
Its lowered potencies found our fallen strengths;\nl
Its thought invents our reasoned ignorance;\nl
Its sense fathers our body's reflexes.\nl
Our secret breath of untried mightier force,\nl
The lurking sun of an instant's inner sight,\nl
Its fine suggestions are a covert fount\nl
For our iridescent rich imaginings\nl
Touching things common with transfiguring hues\nl
Page 106

Till even earth's mud grows rich and warm with the skies\nl
And a glory gleams from the soul's decadence.\nl
Its knowledge is our error's starting-point;\nl
Its beauty dons our mud-mask ugliness,\nl
Its artist good begins our evil's tale.\nl
A heaven of creative truths above,\nl
A cosmos of harmonious dreams between,\nl
A chaos of dissolving forms below,\nl
It plunges lost in our inconscient base.\nl
Out of its fall our denser Matter came.\nl

\spar Thus taken was God's plunge into the Night.\nl
This fallen world became a nurse of souls\nl
Inhabited by concealed divinity.\nl
A Being woke and lived in the meaningless void,\nl
A world-wide Nescience strove towards life and thought,\nl
A Consciousness plucked out from mindless sleep.\nl
All here is driven by an insentient will.\nl
Thus fallen, inconscient, frustrate, dense, inert,\nl
Sunk into inanimate and torpid drowse\nl
Earth lay, a drudge of sleep, forced to create\nl
By a subconscient yearning memory\nl
Left from a happiness dead before she was born,\nl
An alien wonder on her senseless breast.\nl
This mire must harbour the orchid and the rose,\nl
From her blind unwilling substance must emerge\nl
A beauty that belongs to happier spheres.\nl
This is the destiny bequeathed to her,\nl
As if a slain god left a golden trust\nl
To a blind force and an imprisoned soul.\nl
An immortal godhead's perishable parts\nl
She must reconstitute from fragments lost,\nl
Reword from a document complete elsewhere\nl
Her doubtful title to her divine Name.\nl
A residue her sole inheritance,\nl
All things she carries in her shapeless dust.\nl
Page 107

Her giant energy tied to petty forms\nl
In the slow tentative motion of her power\nl
With only frail blunt instruments for use,\nl
She has accepted as her nature's need\nl
And given to man as his stupendous work\nl
A labour to the gods impossible.\nl
A life living hardly in a field of death\nl
Its portion claims of immortality;\nl
A brute half-conscious body serves as means\nl
A mind that must recover a knowledge lost\nl
Held in stone grip by the world's inconscience,\nl
And wearing still these countless knots of Law\nl
A spirit bound stand up as Nature's king.\nl
\sparn A mighty kinship is this daring's cause.\nl
All we attempt in this imperfect world,\nl
Looks forward or looks back beyond Time's gloss\nl
To its pure idea and firm inviolate type\nl
In an absolute creation's flawless skill.\nl
To seize the absolute in shapes that pass,\nl
To fix the eternal's touch in time-made things,\nl
This is the law of all perfection here.\nl
A fragment here is caught of heaven's design;\nl
Else could we never hope for greater life\nl
And ecstasy and glory could not be.\nl
Even in the littleness of our mortal state,\nl
Even in this prison-house of outer form,\nl
A brilliant passage for the infallible Flame\nl
Is driven through gross walls of nerve and brain,\nl
A Splendour presses or a Power breaks through,\nl
Earth's great dull barrier is removed awhile,\nl
The inconscient seal is lifted from our eyes\nl
And we grow vessels of creative might.\nl
The enthusiasm of a divine surprise\nl
Pervades our life, a mystic stir is felt,\nl
A joyful anguish trembles in our limbs;\nl
A dream of beauty dances through the heart,\nl
Page 108

A thought from the eternal Mind draws near,\nl
Intimations cast from the Invisible\nl
Awaking from Infinity's sleep come down,\nl
Symbols of That which never yet was made.\nl
But soon the inert flesh responds no more,\nl
Then sinks the sacred orgy of delight,\nl
The blaze of passion and the tide of power\nl
Are taken from us and, though a glowing form\nl
Abides astonishing earth, imagined supreme,\nl
Too little of what was meant has left a trace.\nl
Earth's eyes half-see, her forces half-create;\nl
Her rarest works are copies of heaven's art.\nl
A radiance of a golden artifice,\nl
A masterpiece of inspired device and rule,\nl
Her forms hide what they house and only mime\nl
The unseized miracle of self-born shapes\nl
That live for ever in the Eternal's gaze.\nl
Here in a difficult half-finished world\nl
Is a slow toiling of unconscious Powers;\nl
Here is man's ignorant divining mind,\nl
His genius born from an inconscient soil.\nl
To copy on earth's copies is his art.\nl
For when he strives for things surpassing earth,\nl
Too rude the workman's tools, too crude his stuff,\nl
And hardly with his heart's blood he achieves\nl
His transient house of the divine Idea,\nl
His figure of a Time-inn for the Unborn.\nl
Our being thrills with high far memories\nl
And would bring down their dateless meanings here,\nl
But, too divine for earthly Nature's scheme,\nl
Beyond our reach the eternal marvels blaze.\nl
Absolute they dwell, unborn, immutable,\nl
Immaculate in the Spirit's deathless air,\nl
Immortal in a world of motionless Time\nl
And an unchanging muse of deep self-space.\nl
Only when we have climbed above ourselves,\nl
Page 109

A line of the Transcendent meets our road\nl
And joins us to the timeless and the true;\nl
It brings to us the inevitable word,\nl
The godlike act, the thoughts that never die.\nl
A ripple of light and glory wraps the brain,\nl
And travelling down the moment's vanishing route\nl
The figures of eternity arrive.\nl
As the mind's visitors or the heart's guests\nl
They espouse our mortal brevity awhile,\nl
Or seldom in some rare delivering glimpse\nl
Are caught by our vision's delicate surmise.\nl
Although beginnings only and first attempts,\nl
These glimmerings point to the secret of our birth\nl
And the hidden miracle of our destiny.\nl
What we are there and here on earth shall be\nl
Is imaged in a contact and a call.\nl
As yet earth's imperfection is our sphere,\nl
Our nature's glass shows not our real self;\nl
That greatness still abides held back within.\nl
Earth's doubting future hides our heritage:\nl
The Light now distant shall grow native here,\nl
The Strength that visits us our comrade power;\nl
The Ineffable shall find a secret voice,\nl
The Imperishable burn through Matter's screen\nl
Making this mortal body godhead's robe.\nl
The Spirit's greatness is our timeless source\nl
And it shall be our crown in endless Time.\nl
A vast Unknown is round us and within;\nl
All things are wrapped in the dynamic One:\nl
A subtle link of union joins all life.\nl
Thus all creation is a single chain:\nl
We are not left alone in a closed scheme\nl
Between a driving of inconscient Force\nl
And an incommunicable Absolute.\nl
Our life is a spur in a sublime soul-range,\nl
Our being looks beyond its walls of mind\nl
Page 110

And it communicates with greater worlds;\nl
There are brighter earths and wider heavens than ours.\nl
There are realms where Being broods in its own depths;\nl
It feels in its immense dynamic core\nl
Its nameless, unformed, unborn potencies\nl
Cry for expression in the unshaped Vast:\nl
Ineffable beyond Ignorance and death,\nl
The images of its everlasting Truth\nl
Look out from a chamber of its self-rapt soul:\nl
As if to its own inner witness gaze\nl
The Spirit holds up its mirrored self and works,\nl
The power and passion of its timeless heart,\nl
The figures of its formless ecstasy,\nl
The grandeurs of its multitudinous might.\nl
Thence comes the mystic substance of our souls\nl
Into the prodigy of our nature's birth,\nl
There is the unfallen height of all we are\nl
And dateless fount of all we hope to be.\nl
On every plane the hieratic Power,\nl
Initiate of unspoken verities,\nl
Dreams to transcribe and make a part of life\nl
In its own native style and living tongue\nl
Some trait of the perfection of the Unborn,\nl
Some vision seen in the omniscient Light,\nl
Some far tone of the immortal rhapsodist Voice,\nl
Some rapture of the all-creating Bliss,\nl
Some form and plan of the Beauty unutterable.\nl
Worlds are there nearer to those absolute realms,\nl
Where the response to Truth is swift and sure\nl
And spirit is not hampered by its frame\nl
And hearts by sharp division seized and rent\nl
And delight and beauty are inhabitants\nl
And love and sweetness are the law of life.\nl
A finer substance in a subtler mould\nl
Embodies the divinity earth but dreams;\nl
Its strength can overtake joy's running feet;\nl
Page 111

Overleaping the fixed hurdles set by Time,\nl
The rapid net of an intuitive clasp\nl
Captures the fugitive happiness we desire.\nl
A Nature lifted by a larger breath,\nl
Plastic and passive to the all-shaping Fire,\nl
Answers the flaming Godhead's casual touch:\nl
Immune from our inertia of response\nl
It hears the word to which our hearts are deaf,\nl
Adopts the seeing of immortal eyes\nl
And, traveller on the roads of line and hue,\nl
Pursues the spirit of beauty to its home.\nl
Thus we draw near to the All-Wonderful\nl
Following his rapture in things as sign and guide;\nl
Beauty is his footprint showing us where he has passed,\nl
Love is his heart-beats' rhythm in mortal breasts,\nl
Happiness the smile on his adorable face.\nl
A communion of spiritual entities,\nl
A genius of creative Immanence,\nl
Makes all creation deeply intimate:\nl
A fourth dimension of aesthetic sense\nl
Where all is in ourselves, ourselves in all,\nl
To the cosmic wideness re-aligns our souls.\nl
A kindling rapture joins the seer and seen;\nl
The craftsman and the craft grown inly one\nl
Achieve perfection by the magic throb\nl
And passion of their close identity.\nl
All that we slowly piece from gathered parts,\nl
Or by long labour stumblingly evolve,\nl
Is there self-born by its eternal right.\nl
In us too the intuitive Fire can burn;\nl
An agent Light, it is coiled in our folded hearts,\nl
On the celestial levels is its home:\nl
Descending, it can bring those heavens here.\nl
But rarely burns the flame nor burns for long;\nl
The joy it calls from those diviner heights\nl
Brings brief magnificent reminiscences\nl
Page 112

And high splendid glimpses of interpreting thought,\nl
But not the utter vision and delight.\nl
A veil is kept, something is still held back,\nl
Lest, captives of the beauty and the joy,\nl
Our souls forget to the Highest to aspire.\nl

\spar In that fair subtle realm behind our own\nl
The form is all, and physical gods are kings.\nl
The inspiring Light plays in fine boundaries;\nl
A faultless beauty comes by Nature's grace;\nl
There liberty is perfection's guarantee:\nl
Although the absolute Image lacks, the Word\nl
Incarnate, the sheer spiritual ecstasy,\nl
All is a miracle of symmetric charm,\nl
A fantasy of perfect line and rule.\nl
There all feel satisfied in themselves and whole,\nl
A rich completeness is by limit made,\nl
Marvel in an utter littleness abounds,\nl
An intricate rapture riots in a small space:\nl
Each rhythm is kin to its environment,\nl
Each line is perfect and inevitable,\nl
Each object faultlessly built for charm and use.\nl
All is enamoured of its own delight.\nl
Intact it lives of its perfection sure\nl
In a heaven-pleased self-glad immunity;\nl
Content to be, it has need of nothing more.\nl
Here was not futile effort's broken heart:\nl
Exempt from the ordeal and the test,\nl
Empty of opposition and of pain,\nl
It was a world that could not fear nor grieve.\nl
It had no grace of error or defeat,\nl
It had no room for fault, no power to fail.\nl
Out of some packed self-bliss it drew at once\nl
Its form-discoveries of the mute Idea\nl
And the miracle of its rhythmic thoughts and acts,\nl
Its clear technique of firm and rounded lives,\nl
Page 113

Its gracious people of inanimate shapes\nl
And glory of breathing bodies like our own.\nl
Amazed, his senses ravished with delight,\nl
He moved in a divine, yet kindred world\nl
Admiring marvellous forms so near to ours\nl
Yet perfect like the playthings of a god,\nl
Deathless in the aspect of mortality.\nl
In their narrow and exclusive absolutes\nl
The finite's ranked supremacies throned abide;\nl
It dreams not ever of what might have been;\nl
Only in boundaries can this absolute live.\nl
In a supremeness bound to its own plan\nl
Where all was finished and no widths were left,\nl
No space for shadows of the immeasurable,\nl
No room for the incalculable's surprise,\nl
A captive of its own beauty and ecstasy,\nl
In a magic circle wrought the enchanted Might.\nl
The spirit stood back effaced behind its frame.\nl
Admired for the bright finality of its lines\nl
A blue horizon limited the soul;\nl
Thought moved in luminous facilities,\nl
The outer ideal's shallows its swim-range:\nl
Life in its boundaries lingered satisfied\nl
With the small happiness of the body's acts.\nl
Assigned as Force to a bound corner-Mind,\nl
Attached to the safe paucity of her room,\nl
She did her little works and played and slept\nl
And thought not of a greater work undone.\nl
Forgetful of her violent vast desires,\nl
Forgetful of the heights to which she rose,\nl
Her walk was fixed within a radiant groove.\nl
The beautiful body of a soul at ease,\nl
Like one who laughs in sweet and sunlit groves,\nl
Childlike she swung in her gold cradle of joy.\nl
The spaces' call reached not her charmed abode,\nl
She had no wings for wide and dangerous flight,\nl
Page 114

She faced no peril of sky or of abyss,\nl
She knew no vistas and no mighty dreams,\nl
No yearning for her lost infinitudes.\nl
A perfect picture in a perfect frame,\nl
This faery artistry could not keep his will:\nl
Only a moment's fine release it gave;\nl
A careless hour was spent in a slight bliss.\nl
Our spirit tires of being's surfaces,\nl
Transcended is the splendour of the form;\nl
It turns to hidden powers and deeper states.\nl
So now he looked beyond for greater light.\nl
His soul's peak-climb abandoning in its rear\nl
This brilliant courtyard of the House of Days,\nl
He left that fine material Paradise.\nl
His destiny lay beyond in larger Space.\nl
\rl{\fsc End of Canto Two}
Page 115

\par
\ht Canto Three: The Glory and the Fall of Life
\par
\sbigcap An uneven broad ascent now lured his feet.\nl
Answering a greater Nature's troubled call\nl
He crossed the limits of embodied Mind\nl
And entered wide obscure disputed fields\nl
Where all was doubt and change and nothing sure,\nl
A world of search and toil without repose.\nl
As one who meets the face of the Unknown,\nl
A questioner with none to give reply,\nl
Attracted to a problem never solved,\nl
Always uncertain of the ground he trod,\nl
Always drawn on to an inconstant goal\nl
He travelled through a land peopled by doubts\nl
In shifting confines on a quaking base.\nl
In front he saw a boundary ever unreached\nl
And thought himself at each step nearer now,—\nl
A far retreating horizon of mirage.\nl
A vagrancy was there that brooked no home,\nl
A journey of countless paths without a close.\nl
Nothing he found to satisfy his heart;\nl
A tireless wandering sought and could not cease.\nl
There life is the manifest Incalculable,\nl
A movement of unquiet seas, a long\nl
And venturous leap of spirit into Space,\nl
A vexed disturbance in the eternal Calm,\nl
An impulse and passion of the Infinite.\nl
Assuming whatever shape her fancy wills,\nl
Escaped from the restraint of settled forms\nl
She has left the safety of the tried and known.\nl
Unshepherded by the fear that walks through Time,\nl
Undaunted by Fate that dogs and Chance that springs,\nl
She accepts disaster as a common risk;\nl
Page 116

Careless of suffering, heedless of sin and fall,\nl
She wrestles with danger and discovery\nl
In the unexplored expanses of the soul.\nl
To be seemed only a long experiment,\nl
The hazard of a seeking ignorant Force\nl
That tries all truths and, finding none supreme,\nl
Moves on unsatisfied, unsure of its end.\nl
As saw some inner mind, so life was shaped:\nl
From thought to thought she passed, from phase to phase,\nl
Tortured by her own powers or proud and blest,\nl
Now master of herself, now toy and slave.\nl
A huge inconsequence was her action's law,\nl
As if all possibility must be drained,\nl
And anguish and bliss were pastimes of the heart.\nl
In a gallop of thunder-hooved vicissitudes\nl
She swept through the race-fields of Circumstance,\nl
Or, swaying, she tossed between her heights and deeps,\nl
Uplifted or broken on Time's inconstant wheel.\nl
Amid a tedious crawl of drab desires\nl
She writhed, a worm mid worms in Nature's mud,\nl
Then, Titan-statured, took all earth for food,\nl
Ambitioned the seas for robe, for crown the stars\nl
And shouting strode from peak to giant peak,\nl
Clamouring for worlds to conquer and to rule.\nl
Then, wantonly enamoured of Sorrow's face,\nl
She plunged into the anguish of the depths\nl
And, wallowing, clung to her own misery.\nl
In dolorous converse with her squandered self\nl
She wrote the account of all that she had lost,\nl
Or sat with grief as with an ancient friend.\nl
A romp of violent raptures soon was spent,\nl
Or she lingered tied to an inadequate joy\nl
Missing the turns of fate, missing life's goal.\nl
A scene was planned for all her numberless moods\nl
Where each could be the law and way of life,\nl
But none could offer a pure felicity;\nl
Page 117

Only a flickering zest they left behind\nl
Or the fierce lust that brings a dead fatigue.\nl
Amid her swift untold variety\nl
Something remained dissatisfied, ever the same\nl
And in the new saw only a face of the old,\nl
For every hour repeated all the rest\nl
And every change prolonged the same unease.\nl
A spirit of her self and aim unsure,\nl
Tired soon of too much joy and happiness,\nl
She needs the spur of pleasure and of pain\nl
And the native taste of suffering and unrest:\nl
She strains for an end that never can she win.\nl
A perverse savour haunts her thirsting lips:\nl
For the grief she weeps which came from her own choice,\nl
For the pleasure yearns that racked with wounds her breast;\nl
Aspiring to heaven she turns her steps towards hell.\nl
Chance she has chosen and danger for playfellows;\nl
Fate's dreadful swing she has taken for cradle and seat.\nl
Yet pure and bright from the Timeless was her birth,\nl
A lost world-rapture lingers in her eyes,\nl
Her moods are faces of the Infinite:\nl
Beauty and happiness are her native right,\nl
And endless Bliss is her eternal home.\nl

\spar This now revealed its antique face of joy,\nl
A sudden disclosure to the heart of grief\nl
Tempting it to endure and long and hope.\nl
Even in changing worlds bereft of peace,\nl
In an air racked with sorrow and with fear\nl
And while his feet trod on a soil unsafe,\nl
He saw the image of a happier state.\nl
In an architecture of hieratic Space\nl
Circling and mounting towards creation's tops,\nl
At a blue height which never was too high\nl
For warm communion between body and soul,\nl
As far as heaven, as near as thought and hope,\nl
Page 118

Glimmered the kingdom of a griefless life.\nl
Above him in a new celestial vault\nl
Other than the heavens beheld by mortal eyes,\nl
As on a fretted ceiling of the gods,\nl
An archipelago of laughter and fire,\nl
Swam stars apart in a rippled sea of sky.\nl
Towered spirals, magic rings of vivid hue\nl
And gleaming spheres of strange felicity\nl
Floated through distance like a symbol world.\nl
On the trouble and the toil they could not share,\nl
On the unhappiness they could not aid,\nl
Impervious to life's suffering, struggle, grief,\nl
Untarnished by its anger, gloom and hate,\nl
Unmoved, untouched, looked down great visioned planes\nl
Blissful for ever in their timeless right.\nl
Absorbed in their own beauty and content,\nl
Of their immortal gladness they live sure.\nl
Apart in their self-glory plunged, remote\nl
Burning they swam in a vague lucent haze,\nl
An everlasting refuge of dream-light,\nl
A nebula of the splendours of the gods\nl
Made from the musings of eternity.\nl
Almost unbelievable by human faith,\nl
Hardly they seemed the stuff of things that are.\nl
As through a magic television's glass\nl
Outlined to some magnifying inner eye\nl
They shone like images thrown from a far scene\nl
Too high and glad for mortal lids to seize.\nl
But near and real to the longing heart\nl
And to the body's passionate thought and sense\nl
Are the hidden kingdoms of beatitude.\nl
In some close unattained realm which yet we feel,\nl
Immune from the harsh clutch of Death and Time,\nl
Escaping the search of sorrow and desire,\nl
In bright enchanted safe peripheries\nl
For ever wallowing in bliss they lie.\nl
Page 119

In dream and trance and muse before our eyes,\nl
Across a subtle vision's inner field,\nl
Wide rapturous landscapes fleeting from the sight,\nl
The figures of the perfect kingdom pass\nl
And behind them leave a shining memory's trail.\nl
Imagined scenes or great eternal worlds,\nl
Dream-caught or sensed, they touch our hearts with their depths;\nl
Unreal-seeming, yet more real than life,\nl
Happier than happiness, truer than things true,\nl
If dreams these were or captured images,\nl
Dream's truth made false earth's vain realities.\nl
In a swift eternal moment fixed there live\nl
Or ever recalled come back to longing eyes\nl
Calm heavens of imperishable Light,\nl
Illumined continents of violet peace,\nl
Oceans and rivers of the mirth of God\nl
And griefless countries under purple suns.\nl

\spar This, once a star of bright remote idea\nl
Or imagination's comet trail of dream,\nl
Took now a close shape of reality.\nl
The gulf between dream-truth, earth-fact was crossed,\nl
The wonder-worlds of life were dreams no more;\nl
His vision made all they unveiled its own:\nl
Their scenes, their happenings met his eyes and heart\nl
And smote them with pure loveliness and bliss.\nl
A breathless summit region drew his gaze\nl
Whose boundaries jutted into a sky of Self\nl
And dipped towards a strange ethereal base.\nl
The quintessence glowed of Life's supreme delight.\nl
On a spiritual and mysterious peak\nl
Only a miracle's high transfiguring line\nl
Divided life from the formless Infinite\nl
And sheltered Time against eternity.\nl
Out of that formless stuff Time mints his shapes;\nl
The Eternal's quiet holds the cosmic act:\nl
Page 120

The protean images of the World-Force\nl
Have drawn the strength to be, the will to last\nl
From a deep ocean of dynamic peace.\nl
Inverting the spirit's apex towards life,\nl
She spends the plastic liberties of the One\nl
To cast in acts the dreams of her caprice,\nl
His wisdom's call steadies her careless feet,\nl
He props her dance upon a rigid base,\nl
His timeless still immutability\nl
Must standardise her creation's miracle.\nl
Out of the Void's unseeing energies\nl
Inventing the scene of a concrete universe,\nl
By his thought she has fixed its paces, in its blind acts\nl
She sees by flashes of his all-knowing Light.\nl
At her will the inscrutable Supermind leans down\nl
To guide her force that feels but cannot know,\nl
Its breath of power controls her restless seas\nl
And life obeys the governing Idea.\nl
At her will, led by a luminous Immanence\nl
The hazardous experimenting Mind\nl
Pushes its way through obscure possibles\nl
Mid chance formations of an unknowing world.\nl
Our human ignorance moves towards the Truth\nl
That Nescience may become omniscient,\nl
Transmuted instincts shape to divine thoughts,\nl
Thoughts house infallible immortal sight\nl
And Nature climb towards God's identity.\nl
The Master of the worlds self-made her slave\nl
Is the executor of her fantasies:\nl
She has canalised the seas of omnipotence;\nl
She has limited by her laws the Illimitable.\nl
The Immortal bound himself to do her works;\nl
He labours at the tasks her Ignorance sets,\nl
Hidden in the cape of our mortality.\nl
The worlds, the forms her goddess fancy makes\nl
Have lost their origin on unseen heights:\nl
Page 121

Even severed, straying from their timeless source,\nl
Even deformed, obscure, accursed and fallen,—\nl
Since even fall has its perverted joy\nl
And nothing she leaves out that serves delight,—\nl
These too can to the peaks revert or here\nl
Cut out the sentence of the spirit's fall,\nl
Recover their forfeited divinity.\nl
At once caught in an eternal vision's sweep\nl
He saw her pride and splendour of highborn zones\nl
And her regions crouching in the nether deeps.\nl
Above was a monarchy of unfallen self,\nl
Beneath was the gloomy trance of the abyss,\nl
An opposite pole or dim antipodes.\nl
There were vasts of the glory of life's absolutes:\nl
All laughed in a safe immortality\nl
And an eternal childhood of the soul\nl
Before darkness came and pain and grief were born\nl
Where all could dare to be themselves and one\nl
And Wisdom played in sinless innocence\nl
With naked Freedom in Truth's happy sun.\nl
There were worlds of her laughter and dreadful irony,\nl
There were fields of her taste of toil and strife and tears;\nl
Her head lay on the breast of amorous Death,\nl
Sleep imitated awhile extinction's peace.\nl
The light of God she has parted from his dark\nl
To test the savour of bare opposites.\nl
Here mingling in man's heart their tones and hues\nl
Have woven his being's mutable design,\nl
His life a forward-rippling stream in Time,\nl
His nature's constant fixed mobility,\nl
His soul a moving picture's changeful film,\nl
His cosmos-chaos of personality.\nl
The grand creatrix with her cryptic touch\nl
Has turned to pathos and power being's self-dream,\nl
Made a passion-play of its fathomless mystery.\nl
Page 122

\spar But here were worlds lifted half-way to heaven.\nl
The Veil was there but not the Shadowy Wall;\nl
In forms not too remote from human grasp\nl
Some passion of the inviolate purity\nl
Broke through, a ray of the original Bliss.\nl
Heaven's joys might have been earth's if earth were pure.\nl
There could have reached our divinised sense and heart\nl
Some natural felicity's bright extreme,\nl
Some thrill of Supernature's absolutes:\nl
All strengths could laugh and sport on earth's hard roads\nl
And never feel her cruel edge of pain,\nl
All love could play and nowhere Nature's shame.\nl
But she has stabled her dreams in Matter's courts\nl
And still her doors are barred to things supreme.\nl
These worlds could feel God's breath visiting their tops;\nl
Some glimmer of the Transcendent's hem was there.\nl
Across the white aeonic silences\nl
Immortal figures of embodied joy\nl
Traversed wide spaces near to eternity's sleep.\nl
Pure mystic voices in beatitude's hush\nl
Appealed to Love's immaculate sweetnesses,\nl
Calling his honeyed touch to thrill the worlds,\nl
His blissful hands to seize on Nature's limbs,\nl
His sweet intolerant might of union\nl
To take all beings into his saviour arms,\nl
Drawing to his pity the rebel and the waif\nl
To force on them the happiness they refuse.\nl
A chant hymeneal to the unseen Divine,\nl
A flaming rhapsody of white desire\nl
Lured an immortal music into the heart\nl
And woke the slumbering ear of ecstasy.\nl
A purer, fierier sense had there its home,\nl
A burning urge no earthly limbs can hold;\nl
One drew a large unburdened spacious breath\nl
And the heart sped from beat to rapturous beat.\nl
The voice of Time sang of the Immortal's joy;\nl
Page 123

An inspiration and a lyric cry,\nl
The moments came with ecstasy on their wings;\nl
Beauty unimaginable moved heaven-bare\nl
Absolved from boundaries in the vasts of dream;\nl
The cry of the Birds of Wonder called from the skies\nl
To the deathless people of the shores of Light.\nl
Creation leaped straight from the hands of God;\nl
Marvel and rapture wandered in the ways.\nl
Only to be was a supreme delight,\nl
Life was a happy laughter of the soul\nl
And Joy was king with Love for minister.\nl
The spirit's luminousness was bodied there.\nl
Life's contraries were lovers or natural friends\nl
And her extremes keen edges of harmony:\nl
Indulgence with a tender purity came\nl
And nursed the god on her maternal breast:\nl
There none was weak, so falsehood could not live;\nl
Ignorance was a thin shade protecting light,\nl
Imagination the free-will of Truth,\nl
Pleasure a candidate for heaven's fire;\nl
The intellect was Beauty's worshipper,\nl
Strength was the slave of calm spiritual law,\nl
Power laid its head upon the breasts of Bliss.\nl
There were summit-glories inconceivable,\nl
Autonomies of Wisdom's still self-rule\nl
And high dependencies of her virgin sun,\nl
Illumined theocracies of the seeing soul\nl
Throned in the power of the Transcendent's ray.\nl
A vision of grandeurs, a dream of magnitudes\nl
In sun-bright kingdoms moved with regal gait:\nl
Assemblies, crowded senates of the gods,\nl
Life's puissances reigned on seats of marble will,\nl
High dominations and autocracies\nl
And laurelled strengths and armed imperative mights.\nl
All objects there were great and beautiful,\nl
All beings wore a royal stamp of power.\nl
Page 124

There sat the oligarchies of natural Law,\nl
Proud violent heads served one calm monarch brow:\nl
All the soul's postures donned divinity.\nl
There met the ardent mutual intimacies\nl
Of mastery's joy and the joy of servitude\nl
Imposed by Love on Love's heart that obeys\nl
And Love's body held beneath a rapturous yoke.\nl
All was a game of meeting kinglinesses.\nl
For worship lifts the worshipper's bowed strength\nl
Close to the god's pride and bliss his soul adores:\nl
The ruler there is one with all he rules;\nl
To him who serves with a free equal heart\nl
Obedience is his princely training's school,\nl
His nobility's coronet and privilege,\nl
His faith is a high nature's idiom,\nl
His service a spiritual sovereignty.\nl
There were realms where Knowledge joined creative Power\nl
In her high home and made her all his own:\nl
The grand Illuminate seized her gleaming limbs\nl
And filled them with the passion of his ray\nl
Till all her body was its transparent house\nl
And all her soul a counterpart of his soul.\nl
Apotheosised, transfigured by wisdom's touch,\nl
Her days became a luminous sacrifice;\nl
An immortal moth in happy and endless fire,\nl
She burned in his sweet intolerable blaze.\nl
A captive Life wedded her conqueror.\nl
In his wide sky she built her world anew;\nl
She gave to mind's calm pace the motor's speed,\nl
To thinking a need to live what the soul saw,\nl
To living an impetus to know and see.\nl
His splendour grasped her, her puissance to him clung;\nl
She crowned the Idea a king in purple robes,\nl
Put her magic serpent sceptre in Thought's grip,\nl
Made forms his inward vision's rhythmic shapes\nl
And her acts the living body of his will.\nl
Page 125

A flaming thunder, a creator flash,\nl
His victor Light rode on her deathless Force;\nl
A centaur's mighty gallop bore the god.\nl
Life throned with mind, a double majesty.\nl
Worlds were there of a happiness great and grave\nl
And action tinged with dream, laughter with thought,\nl
And passion there could wait for its desire\nl
Until it heard the near approach of God.\nl
Worlds were there of a childlike mirth and joy;\nl
A carefree youthfulness of mind and heart\nl
Found in the body a heavenly instrument;\nl
It lit an aureate halo round desire\nl
And freed the deified animal in the limbs\nl
To divine gambols of love and beauty and bliss.\nl
On a radiant soil that gazed at heaven's smile\nl
A swift life-impulse stinted not nor stopped:\nl
It knew not how to tire; happy were its tears.\nl
There work was play and play the only work,\nl
The tasks of heaven a game of godlike might:\nl
A celestial bacchanal for ever pure,\nl
Unstayed by faintness as in mortal frames\nl
Life was an eternity of rapture's moods:\nl
Age never came, care never lined the face.\nl
Imposing on the safety of the stars\nl
A race and laughter of immortal strengths,\nl
The nude god-children in their play-fields ran\nl
Smiting the winds with splendour and with speed;\nl
Of storm and sun they made companions,\nl
Sported with the white mane of tossing seas,\nl
Slew distance trampled to death under their wheels\nl
And wrestled in the arenas of their force.\nl
Imperious in their radiance like the suns\nl
They kindled heaven with the glory of their limbs\nl
Flung like a divine largess to the world.\nl
A spell to force the heart to stark delight,\nl
They carried the pride and mastery of their charm\nl
Page 126

As if Life's banner on the roads of Space.\nl
Ideas were luminous comrades of the soul;\nl
Mind played with speech, cast javelins of thought,\nl
But needed not these instruments' toil to know;\nl
Knowledge was Nature's pastime like the rest.\nl
Investitured with the fresh heart's bright ray,\nl
An early God-instinct's child inheritors,\nl
Tenants of the perpetuity of Time\nl
Still thrilling with the first creation's bliss,\nl
They steeped existence in their youth of soul.\nl
An exquisite and vehement tyranny,\nl
The strong compulsion of their will to joy\nl
Poured smiling streams of happiness through the world.\nl
There reigned a breath of high immune content,\nl
A fortunate gait of days in tranquil air,\nl
A flood of universal love and peace.\nl
A sovereignty of tireless sweetness lived\nl
Like a song of pleasure on the lips of Time.\nl
A large spontaneous order freed the will,\nl
A sun-frank winging of the soul to bliss,\nl
The breadth and greatness of the unfettered act\nl
And the swift fire-heart's golden liberty.\nl
There was no falsehood of soul-severance,\nl
There came no crookedness of thought or word\nl
To rob creation of its native truth;\nl
All was sincerity and natural force.\nl
There freedom was sole rule and highest law.\nl
In a happy series climbed or plunged these worlds:\nl
In realms of curious beauty and surprise,\nl
In fields of grandeur and of titan power,\nl
Life played at ease with her immense desires.\nl
A thousand Edens she could build nor pause;\nl
No bound was set to her greatness and to her grace\nl
And to her heavenly variety.\nl
Awake with a cry and stir of numberless souls,\nl
Arisen from the breast of some deep Infinite,\nl
Page 127

Smiling like a new-born child at love and hope,\nl
In her nature housing the Immortal's power,\nl
In her bosom bearing the eternal Will,\nl
No guide she needed but her luminous heart:\nl
No fall debased the godhead of her steps,\nl
No alien Night had come to blind her eyes.\nl
There was no use for grudging ring or fence;\nl
Each act was a perfection and a joy.\nl
Abandoned to her rapid fancy's moods\nl
And the rich coloured riot of her mind,\nl
Initiate of divine and mighty dreams,\nl
Magician builder of unnumbered forms\nl
Exploring the measures of the rhythms of God,\nl
At will she wove her wizard wonder-dance,\nl
A Dionysian goddess of delight,\nl
A Bacchant of creative ecstasy.\nl

\spar This world of bliss he saw and felt its call,\nl
But found no way to enter into its joy;\nl
Across the conscious gulf there was no bridge.\nl
A darker air encircled still his soul\nl
Tied to an image of unquiet life.\nl
In spite of yearning mind and longing sense,\nl
To a sad Thought by grey experience formed\nl
And a vision dimmed by care and sorrow and sleep\nl
All this seemed only a bright desirable dream\nl
Conceived in a longing distance by the heart\nl
Of one who walks in the shadow of earth-pain.\nl
Although he once had felt the Eternal's clasp,\nl
Too near to suffering worlds his nature lived,\nl
And where he stood were entrances of Night.\nl
Hardly, too close beset by the world's care,\nl
Can the dense mould in which we have been made\nl
Return sheer joy to joy, pure light to light.\nl
For its tormented will to think and live\nl
First to a mingled pain and pleasure woke\nl
Page 128

And still it keeps the habit of its birth:\nl
A dire duality is our way to be.\nl
In the crude beginnings of this mortal world\nl
Life was not nor mind's play nor heart's desire.\nl
When earth was built in the unconscious Void\nl
And nothing was save a material scene,\nl
Identified with sea and sky and stone\nl
Her young gods yearned for the release of souls\nl
Asleep in objects, vague, inanimate.\nl
In that desolate grandeur, in that beauty bare,\nl
In the deaf stillness, mid the unheeded sounds,\nl
Heavy was the uncommunicated load\nl
Of Godhead in a world that had no needs;\nl
For none was there to feel or to receive.\nl
This solid mass which brooked no throb of sense\nl
Could not contain their vast creative urge:\nl
Immersed no more in Matter's harmony,\nl
The Spirit lost its statuesque repose.\nl
In the uncaring trance it groped for sight,\nl
Passioned for the movements of a conscious heart,\nl
Famishing for speech and thought and joy and love,\nl
In the dumb insensitive wheeling day and night\nl
Hungered for the beat of yearning and response.\nl
The poised inconscience shaken with a touch,\nl
The intuitive Silence trembling with a name,\nl
They cried to Life to invade the senseless mould\nl
And in brute forms awake divinity.\nl
A voice was heard on the mute rolling globe,\nl
A murmur moaned in the unlistening Void.\nl
A being seemed to breathe where once was none:\nl
Something pent up in dead insentient depths,\nl
Denied conscious existence, lost to joy,\nl
Turned as if one asleep since dateless time.\nl
Aware of its own buried reality,\nl
Remembering its forgotten self and right,\nl
It yearned to know, to aspire, to enjoy, to live.\nl
Page 129

Life heard the call and left her native light.\nl
Overflowing from her bright magnificent plane\nl
On the rigid coil and sprawl of mortal Space,\nl
Here too the gracious great-winged Angel poured\nl
Her splendour and her swiftness and her bliss,\nl
Hoping to fill a fair new world with joy.\nl
As comes a goddess to a mortal's breast\nl
And fills his days with her celestial clasp,\nl
She stooped to make her home in transient shapes;\nl
In Matter's womb she cast the Immortal's fire,\nl
In the unfeeling Vast woke thought and hope,\nl
Smote with her charm and beauty flesh and nerve\nl
And forced delight on earth's insensible frame.\nl
Alive and clad with trees and herbs and flowers\nl
Earth's great brown body smiled towards the skies,\nl
Azure replied to azure in the sea's laugh;\nl
New sentient creatures filled the unseen depths,\nl
Life's glory and swiftness ran in the beauty of beasts,\nl
Man dared and thought and met with his soul the world.\nl
But while the magic breath was on its way,\nl
Before her gifts could reach our prisoned hearts,\nl
A dark ambiguous Presence questioned all.\nl
The secret Will that robes itself with Night\nl
And offers to spirit the ordeal of the flesh,\nl
Imposed a mystic mask of death and pain.\nl
Interned now in the slow and suffering years\nl
Sojourns the winged and wonderful wayfarer\nl
And can no more recall her happier state,\nl
But must obey the inert Inconscient's law,\nl
Insensible foundation of a world\nl
In which blind limits are on beauty laid\nl
And sorrow and joy as struggling comrades live.\nl
A dim and dreadful muteness fell on her:\nl
Abolished was her subtle mighty spirit\nl
And slain her boon of child-god happiness,\nl
And all her glory into littleness turned\nl
Page 130

And all her sweetness into a maimed desire.\nl
To feed death with her works is here life's doom.\nl
So veiled was her immortality that she seemed,\nl
Inflicting consciousness on unconscious things,\nl
An episode in an eternal death,\nl
A myth of being that must for ever cease.\nl
Such was the evil mystery of her change.\nl
\rl{\fsc End of Canto Three}
Page 131

\par
\ht Canto Four: The Kingdoms of the Little Life
\par
\sbigcap A quivering trepidant uncertain world\nl
Born from that dolorous meeting and eclipse\nl
Appeared in the emptiness where her feet had trod,\nl
A quick obscurity, a seeking stir.\nl
There was a writhing of half-conscious force\nl
Hardly awakened from the Inconscient's sleep,\nl
Tied to an instinct-driven Ignorance,\nl
To find itself and find its hold on things.\nl
Inheritor of poverty and loss,\nl
Assailed by memories that fled when seized,\nl
Haunted by a forgotten uplifting hope,\nl
It strove with a blindness as of groping hands\nl
To fill the aching and disastrous gap\nl
Between earth-pain and the bliss from which Life fell.\nl
A world that ever seeks for something missed,\nl
Hunts for the joy that earth has failed to keep.\nl
Too near to our gates its unappeased unrest\nl
For peace to live on the inert solid globe:\nl
It has joined its hunger to the hunger of earth,\nl
It has given the law of craving to our lives,\nl
It has made our spirit's need a fathomless gulf.\nl
An Influence entered mortal night and day,\nl
A shadow overcast the time-born race;\nl
In the troubled stream where leaps a blind heart-pulse\nl
And the nerve-beat of feeling wakes in sense\nl
Dividing Matter's sleep from conscious Mind,\nl
There strayed a call that knew not why it came.\nl
A Power beyond earth's scope has touched the earth;\nl
The repose that might have been can be no more;\nl
A formless yearning passions in man's heart,\nl
A cry is in his blood for happier things:\nl
Page 132

Else could he roam on a free sunlit soil\nl
With the childlike pain-forgetting mind of beasts\nl
Or live happy, unmoved, like flowers and trees.\nl
The Might that came upon the earth to bless,\nl
Has stayed on earth to suffer and aspire.\nl
The infant laugh that rang through time is hushed:\nl
Man's natural joy of life is overcast\nl
And sorrow is his nurse of destiny.\nl
The animal's thoughtless joy is left behind,\nl
Care and reflection burden his daily walk;\nl
He has risen to greatness and to discontent,\nl
He is awake to the Invisible.\nl
Insatiate seeker, he has all to learn:\nl
He has exhausted now life's surface acts,\nl
His being's hidden realms remain to explore.\nl
He becomes a mind, he becomes a spirit and self;\nl
In his fragile tenement he grows Nature's lord.\nl
In him Matter wakes from its long obscure trance,\nl
In him earth feels the Godhead drawing near.\nl
An eyeless Power that sees no more its aim,\nl
A restless hungry energy of Will,\nl
Life cast her seed in the body's indolent mould;\nl
It woke from happy torpor a blind Force\nl
Compelling it to sense and seek and feel.\nl
In the enormous labour of the Void\nl
Perturbing with her dreams the vast routine\nl
And dead roll of a slumbering universe\nl
The mighty prisoner struggled for release.\nl
Alive with her yearning woke the inert cell,\nl
In the heart she kindled a fire of passion and need,\nl
Amid the deep calm of inanimate things\nl
Arose her great voice of toil and prayer and strife.\nl
A groping consciousness in a voiceless world,\nl
A guideless sense was given her for her road;\nl
Thought was withheld and nothing now she knew,\nl
But all the unknown was hers to feel and clasp.\nl
Page 133

Obeying the push of unborn things towards birth\nl
Out of her seal of insentient life she broke:\nl
In her substance of unthinking mute soul-strength\nl
That cannot utter what its depths divine,\nl
Awoke a blind necessity to know.\nl
The chain that bound her she made her instrument;\nl
Instinct was hers, the chrysalis of Truth,\nl
And effort and growth and striving nescience.\nl
Inflicting on the body desire and hope,\nl
Imposing on inconscience consciousness,\nl
She brought into Matter's dull tenacity\nl
Her anguished claim to her lost sovereign right,\nl
Her tireless search, her vexed uneasy heart,\nl
Her wandering unsure steps, her cry for change.\nl
Adorer of a joy without a name,\nl
In her obscure cathedral of delight\nl
To dim dwarf gods she offers secret rites.\nl
But vain unending is the sacrifice,\nl
The priest an ignorant mage who only makes\nl
Futile mutations in the altar's plan\nl
And casts blind hopes into a powerless flame.\nl
A burden of transient gains weighs down her steps\nl
And hardly under that load can she advance;\nl
But the hours cry to her, she travels on\nl
Passing from thought to thought, from want to want;\nl
Her greatest progress is a deepened need.\nl
Matter dissatisfies, she turns to Mind;\nl
She conquers earth, her field, then claims the heavens.\nl
Insensible, breaking the work she has done\nl
The stumbling ages over her labour pass,\nl
But still no great transforming light came down\nl
And no revealing rapture touched her fall.\nl
Only a glimmer sometimes splits mind's sky\nl
Justifying the ambiguous providence\nl
That makes of night a path to unknown dawns\nl
Or a dark clue to some diviner state.\nl
Page 134

In Nescience began her mighty task,\nl
In Ignorance she pursues the unfinished work,\nl
For knowledge gropes, but meets not Wisdom's face.\nl
Ascending slowly with unconscious steps,\nl
A foundling of the Gods she wanders here\nl
Like a child-soul left near the gates of Hell\nl
Fumbling through fog in search of Paradise.\nl

\spar In this slow ascension he must follow her pace\nl
Even from her faint and dim subconscious start:\nl
So only can earth's last salvation come.\nl
For so only could he know the obscure cause\nl
Of all that holds us back and baffles God\nl
In the jail-delivery of the imprisoned soul.\nl
Along swift paths of fall through dangerous gates\nl
He chanced into a grey obscurity\nl
Teeming with instincts from the mindless gulfs\nl
That pushed to wear a form and win a place.\nl
Life here was intimate with Death and Night\nl
And ate Death's food that she might breathe awhile;\nl
She was their inmate and adopted waif.\nl
Accepting subconscience, in dumb darkness' reign\nl
A sojourner, she hoped not any more.\nl
There far away from Truth and luminous thought\nl
He saw the original seat, the separate birth\nl
Of the dethroned, deformed and suffering Power.\nl
An unhappy face of falsity made true,\nl
A contradiction of our divine birth,\nl
Indifferent to beauty and to light,\nl
Parading she flaunted her animal disgrace\nl
Unhelped by camouflage, brutal and bare,\nl
An authentic image recognised and signed\nl
Of her outcast force exiled from heaven and hope,\nl
Fallen, glorying in the vileness of her state,\nl
The grovel of a strength once half divine,\nl
The graceless squalor of her beast desires,\nl
Page 135

The staring visage of her ignorance,\nl
The naked body of her poverty.\nl
Here first she crawled out from her cabin of mud\nl
Where she had lain inconscient, rigid, mute:\nl
Its narrowness and torpor held her still,\nl
A darkness clung to her uneffaced by Light.\nl
There neared no touch redeeming from above:\nl
The upward look was alien to her sight,\nl
Forgotten the fearless godhead of her walk;\nl
Renounced was the glory and felicity,\nl
The adventure in the dangerous fields of Time:\nl
Hardly she availed, wallowing, to bear and live.\nl

\spar A wide unquiet mist of seeking Space,\nl
A rayless region swallowed in vague swathes,\nl
That seemed, unnamed, unbodied and unhoused,\nl
A swaddled visionless and formless mind,\nl
Asked for a body to translate its soul.\nl
Its prayer denied, it fumbled after thought.\nl
As yet not powered to think, hardly to live,\nl
It opened into a weird and pigmy world\nl
Where this unhappy magic had its source.\nl
On dim confines where Life and Matter meet\nl
He wandered among things half-seen, half-guessed,\nl
Pursued by ungrasped beginnings and lost ends.\nl
There life was born but died before it could live.\nl
There was no solid ground, no constant drift;\nl
Only some flame of mindless Will had power.\nl
Himself was dim to himself, half-felt, obscure,\nl
As if in a struggle of the Void to be.\nl
In strange domains where all was living sense\nl
But mastering thought was not nor cause nor rule,\nl
Only a crude child-heart cried for toys of bliss,\nl
Mind flickered, a disordered infant glow,\nl
And random shapeless energies drove towards form\nl
And took each wisp-fire for a guiding sun.\nl
Page 136

This blindfold force could place no thinking step;\nl
Asking for light she followed darkness' clue.\nl
An inconscient Power groped towards consciousness,\nl
Matter smitten by Matter glimmered to sense,\nl
Blind contacts, slow reactions beat out sparks\nl
Of instinct from a cloaked subliminal bed,\nl
Sensations crowded, dumb substitutes for thought,\nl
Perception answered Nature's wakening blows\nl
But still was a mechanical response,\nl
A jerk, a leap, a start in Nature's dream,\nl
And rude unchastened impulses jostling ran\nl
Heedless of every motion but their own\nl
And, darkling, clashed with darker than themselves,\nl
Free in a world of settled anarchy.\nl
The need to exist, the instinct to survive\nl
Engrossed the tense precarious moment's will\nl
And an unseeing desire felt out for food.\nl
The gusts of Nature were the only law,\nl
Force wrestled with force, but no result remained:\nl
Only were achieved a nescient grasp and drive\nl
And feelings and instincts knowing not their source,\nl
Sense-pleasures and sense-pangs soon caught, soon lost,\nl
And the brute motion of unthinking lives.\nl
It was a vain unnecessary world\nl
Whose will to be brought poor and sad results\nl
And meaningless suffering and a grey unease.\nl
Nothing seemed worth the labour to become.\nl

\spar But judged not so his spirit's wakened eye.\nl
As shines a solitary witness star\nl
That burns apart, Light's lonely sentinel,\nl
In the drift and teeming of a mindless Night,\nl
A single thinker in an aimless world\nl
Awaiting some tremendous dawn of God,\nl
He saw the purpose in the works of Time.\nl
Even in that aimlessness a work was done\nl
Page 137

Pregnant with magic will and change divine.\nl
The first writhings of the cosmic serpent Force\nl
Uncoiled from the mystic ring of Matter's trance;\nl
It raised its head in the warm air of life.\nl
It could not cast off yet Night's stiffening sleep\nl
Or wear as yet mind's wonder-flecks and streaks,\nl
Put on its jewelled hood the crown of soul\nl
Or stand erect in the blaze of spirit's sun.\nl
As yet were only seen foulness and force,\nl
The secret crawl of consciousness to light\nl
Through a fertile slime of lust and battening sense,\nl
Beneath the body's crust of thickened self\nl
A tardy fervent working in the dark,\nl
The turbid yeast of Nature's passionate change,\nl
Ferment of the soul's creation out of mire.\nl
A heavenly process donned this grey disguise,\nl
A fallen ignorance in its covert night\nl
Laboured to achieve its dumb unseemly work,\nl
A camouflage of the Inconscient's need\nl
To release the glory of God in Nature's mud.\nl
His sight, spiritual in embodying orbs,\nl
Could pierce through the grey phosphorescent haze\nl
And scan the secrets of the shifting flux\nl
That animates these mute and solid cells\nl
And leads the thought and longing of the flesh\nl
And the keen lust and hunger of its will.\nl
This too he tracked along its hidden stream\nl
And traced its acts to a miraculous fount.\nl
A mystic Presence none can probe nor rule,\nl
Creator of this game of ray and shade\nl
In this sweet and bitter paradoxical life,\nl
Asks from the body the soul's intimacies\nl
And by the swift vibration of a nerve\nl
Links its mechanic throbs to light and love.\nl
It summons the spirit's sleeping memories\nl
Up from subconscient depths beneath Time's foam;\nl
Page 138

Oblivious of their flame of happy truth,\nl
Arriving with heavy eyes that hardly see,\nl
They come disguised as feelings and desires,\nl
Like weeds upon the surface float awhile\nl
And rise and sink on a somnambulist tide.\nl
Impure, degraded though her motions are,\nl
Always a heaven-truth broods in life's deeps;\nl
In her obscurest members burns that fire.\nl
A touch of God's rapture in creation's acts,\nl
A lost remembrance of felicity\nl
Lurks still in the dumb roots of death and birth,\nl
The world's senseless beauty mirrors God's delight.\nl
That rapture's smile is secret everywhere;\nl
It flows in the wind's breath, in the tree's sap,\nl
Its hued magnificence blooms in leaves and flowers.\nl
When life broke through its half-drowse in the plant\nl
That feels and suffers but cannot move or cry,\nl
In beast and in winged bird and thinking man\nl
It made of the heart's rhythm its music's beat;\nl
It forced the unconscious tissues to awake\nl
And ask for happiness and earn the pang\nl
And thrill with pleasure and laughter of brief delight,\nl
And quiver with pain and crave for ecstasy.\nl
Imperative, voiceless, ill-understood,\nl
Too far from light, too close to being's core,\nl
Born strangely in Time from the eternal Bliss,\nl
It presses on heart's core and vibrant nerve;\nl
Its sharp self-seeking tears our consciousness;\nl
Our pain and pleasure have that sting for cause:\nl
Instinct with it, but blind to its true joy\nl
The soul's desire leaps out towards passing things.\nl
All Nature's longing drive none can resist,\nl
Comes surging through the blood and quickened sense;\nl
An ecstasy of the infinite is her cause.\nl
It turns in us to finite loves and lusts,\nl
The will to conquer and have, to seize and keep,\nl
Page 139

To enlarge life's room and scope and pleasure's range,\nl
To battle and overcome and make one's own,\nl
The hope to mix one's joy with others' joy,\nl
A yearning to possess and be possessed,\nl
To enjoy and be enjoyed, to feel, to live.\nl
Here was its early brief attempt to be,\nl
Its rapid end of momentary delight\nl
Whose stamp of failure haunts all ignorant life.\nl
Inflicting still its habit on the cells\nl
The phantom of a dark and evil start\nl
Ghostlike pursues all that we dream and do.\nl
Although on earth are firm established lives,\nl
A working of habit or a sense of law,\nl
A steady repetition in the flux,\nl
Yet are its roots of will ever the same;\nl
These passions are the stuff of which we are made.\nl
This was the first cry of the awaking world.\nl
It clings around us still and clamps the god.\nl
Even when reason is born and soul takes form,\nl
In beast and reptile and in thinking man\nl
It lasts and is the fount of all their life.\nl
This too was needed that breath and living might be.\nl
The spirit in a finite ignorant world\nl
Must rescue so its prisoned consciousness\nl
Forced out in little jets at quivering points\nl
From the Inconscient's sealed infinitude.\nl
Then slowly it gathers mass, looks up at Light.\nl
This Nature lives tied to her origin,\nl
A clutch of nether force is on her still;\nl
Out of unconscious depths her instincts leap;\nl
A neighbour is her life to insentient Nought.\nl
Under this law an ignorant world was made.\nl
\sparn In the enigma of the darkened Vasts,\nl
In the passion and self-loss of the Infinite\nl
When all was plunged in the negating Void,\nl
Non-Being's night could never have been saved\nl
Page 140

If Being had not plunged into the dark\nl
Carrying with it its triple mystic cross.\nl
Invoking in world-time the timeless truth,\nl
Bliss changed to sorrow, knowledge made ignorant,\nl
God's force turned into a child's helplessness\nl
Can bring down heaven by their sacrifice.\nl
A contradiction founds the base of life:\nl
The eternal, the divine Reality\nl
Has faced itself with its own contraries;\nl
Being became the Void and Conscious-Force\nl
Nescience and walk of a blind Energy\nl
And Ecstasy took the figure of world-pain.\nl
In a mysterious dispensation's law\nl
A Wisdom that prepares its far-off ends\nl
Planned so to start her slow aeonic game.\nl
A blindfold search and wrestle and fumbling clasp\nl
Of a half-seen Nature and a hidden Soul,\nl
A game of hide-and-seek in twilit rooms,\nl
A play of love and hate and fear and hope\nl
Continues in the nursery of mind\nl
Its hard and heavy romp of self-born twins.\nl
At last the struggling Energy can emerge\nl
And meet the voiceless Being in wider fields;\nl
Then can they see and speak and, breast to breast,\nl
In a larger consciousness, a clearer light,\nl
The Two embrace and strive and each know each\nl
Regarding closer now the playmate's face.\nl
Even in these formless coilings he could feel\nl
Matter's response to an infant stir of soul.\nl
In Nature he saw the mighty Spirit concealed,\nl
Watched the weak birth of a tremendous Force,\nl
Pursued the riddle of Godhead's tentative pace,\nl
Heard the faint rhythms of a great unborn Muse.\nl

\spar Then came a fierier breath of waking Life,\nl
And there arose from the dim gulf of things\nl
Page 141

The strange creations of a thinking sense,\nl
Existences half-real and half-dream.\nl
A life was there that hoped not to survive:\nl
Beings were born who perished without trace,\nl
Events that were a formless drama's limbs\nl
And actions driven by a blind creature will.\nl
A seeking Power found out its road to form,\nl
Patterns were built of love and joy and pain\nl
And symbol figures for the moods of Life.\nl
An insect hedonism fluttered and crawled\nl
And basked in a sunlit Nature's surface thrills,\nl
And dragon raptures, python agonies\nl
Crawled in the marsh and mire and licked the sun.\nl
Huge armoured strengths shook a frail quaking ground,\nl
Great puissant creatures with a dwarfish brain,\nl
And pigmy tribes imposed their small life-drift.\nl
In a dwarf model of humanity\nl
Nature now launched the extreme experience\nl
And master-point of her design's caprice,\nl
Luminous result of her half-conscious climb\nl
On rungs twixt her sublimities and grotesques\nl
To massive from infinitesimal shapes,\nl
To a subtle balancing of body and soul,\nl
To an order of intelligent littleness.\nl
Around him in the moment-beats of Time\nl
The kingdom of the animal self arose,\nl
Where deed is all and mind is still half-born\nl
And the heart obeys a dumb unseen control.\nl
The Force that works by the light of Ignorance,\nl
Her animal experiment began,\nl
Crowding with conscious creatures her world-scheme;\nl
But to the outward only were they alive,\nl
Only they replied to touches and surfaces\nl
And to the prick of need that drove their lives.\nl
A body that knew not its own soul within,\nl
There lived and longed, had wrath and joy and grief;\nl
Page 142

A mind was there that met the objective world\nl
As if a stranger or enemy at its door:\nl
Its thoughts were kneaded by the shocks of sense;\nl
It captured not the spirit in the form,\nl
It entered not the heart of what it saw;\nl
It looked not for the power behind the act,\nl
It studied not the hidden motive in things\nl
Nor strove to find the meaning of it all.\nl
Beings were there who wore a human form;\nl
Absorbed they lived in the passion of the scene,\nl
But knew not who they were or why they lived:\nl
Content to breathe, to feel, to sense, to act,\nl
Life had for them no aim save Nature's joy\nl
And the stimulus and delight of outer things;\nl
Identified with the spirit's outward shell,\nl
They worked for the body's wants, they craved no more.\nl
The veiled spectator watching from their depths\nl
Fixed not his inward eye upon himself\nl
Nor turned to find the author of the plot,\nl
He saw the drama only and the stage.\nl
There was no brooding stress of deeper sense,\nl
The burden of reflection was not borne:\nl
Mind looked on Nature with unknowing eyes,\nl
Adored her boons and feared her monstrous strokes.\nl
It pondered not on the magic of her laws,\nl
It thirsted not for the secret wells of Truth,\nl
But made a register of crowding facts\nl
And strung sensations on a vivid thread:\nl
It hunted and it fled and sniffed the winds,\nl
Or slothed inert in sunshine and soft air:\nl
It sought the engrossing contacts of the world,\nl
But only to feed the surface sense with bliss.\nl
These felt life's quiver in the outward touch,\nl
They could not feel behind the touch the soul.\nl
To guard their form of self from Nature's harm,\nl
To enjoy and to survive was all their care.\nl
Page 143

The narrow horizon of their days was filled\nl
With things and creatures that could help and hurt:\nl
The world's values hung upon their little self.\nl
Isolated, cramped in the vast unknown,\nl
To save their small lives from surrounding Death\nl
They made a tiny circle of defence\nl
Against the siege of the huge universe:\nl
They preyed upon the world and were its prey,\nl
But never dreamed to conquer and be free.\nl
Obeying the World-Power's hints and firm taboos\nl
A scanty part they drew from her rich store;\nl
There was no conscious code and no life-plan:\nl
The patterns of thinking of a little group\nl
Fixed a traditional behaviour's law.\nl
Ignorant of soul save as a wraith within,\nl
Tied to a mechanism of unchanging lives\nl
And to a dull usual sense and feeling's beat,\nl
They turned in grooves of animal desire.\nl
In walls of stone fenced round they worked and warred,\nl
Did by a banded selfishness a small good\nl
Or wrought a dreadful wrong and cruel pain\nl
On sentient lives and thought they did no ill.\nl
Ardent from the sack of happy peaceful homes\nl
And gorged with slaughter, plunder, rape and fire,\nl
They made of human selves their helpless prey,\nl
A drove of captives led to lifelong woe,\nl
Or torture a spectacle made and holiday,\nl
Mocking or thrilled by their torn victims' pangs;\nl
Admiring themselves as titans and as gods\nl
Proudly they sang their high and glorious deeds\nl
And praised their victory and their splendid force.\nl
An animal in the instinctive herd\nl
Pushed by life impulses, forced by common needs,\nl
Each in his own kind saw his ego's glass;\nl
All served the aim and action of the pack.\nl
Those like himself, by blood or custom kin,\nl
Page 144

To him were parts of his life, his adjunct selves,\nl
His personal nebula's constituent stars,\nl
Satellite companions of his solar I.\nl
A master of his life's environment,\nl
A leader of a huddled human mass\nl
Herding for safety on a dangerous earth,\nl
He gathered them round him as if minor Powers\nl
To make a common front against the world,\nl
Or, weak and sole on an indifferent earth,\nl
As a fortress for his undefended heart,\nl
Or else to heal his body's loneliness.\nl
In others than his kind he sensed a foe,\nl
An alien unlike force to shun and fear,\nl
A stranger and adversary to hate and slay.\nl
Or he lived as lives the solitary brute;\nl
At war with all he bore his single fate.\nl
Absorbed in the present act, the fleeting days,\nl
None thought to look beyond the hour's gains,\nl
Or dreamed to make this earth a fairer world,\nl
Or felt some touch divine surprise his heart.\nl
The gladness that the fugitive moment gave,\nl
The desire grasped, the bliss, the experience won,\nl
Movement and speed and strength were joy enough\nl
And bodily longings shared and quarrel and play,\nl
And tears and laughter and the need called love.\nl
In war and clasp these life-wants joined the All-Life,\nl
Wrestlings of a divided unity\nl
Inflicting mutual grief and happiness\nl
In ignorance of the Self for ever one.\nl
Arming its creatures with delight and hope\nl
A half-awakened Nescience struggled there\nl
To know by sight and touch the outside of things.\nl
Instinct was formed; in memory's crowded sleep\nl
The past lived on as in a bottomless sea:\nl
Inverting into half-thought the quickened sense\nl
She felt around for truth with fumbling hands,\nl
Page 145

Clutched to her the little she could reach and seize\nl
And put aside in her subconscient cave.\nl
So must the dim being grow in light and force\nl
And rise to his higher destiny at last,\nl
Look up to God and round at the universe,\nl
And learn by failure and progress by fall\nl
And battle with environment and doom,\nl
By suffering discover his deep soul\nl
And by possession grow to his own vasts.\nl
Half-way she stopped and found her path no more.\nl
Still nothing was achieved but to begin,\nl
Yet finished seemed the circle of her force.\nl
Only she had beaten out sparks of ignorance;\nl
Only the life could think and not the mind,\nl
Only the sense could feel and not the soul.\nl
Only was lit some heat of the flame of Life,\nl
Some joy to be, some rapturous leaps of sense.\nl
All was an impetus of half-conscious Force,\nl
A spirit sprawling drowned in dense life-foam,\nl
A vague self grasping at the shape of things.\nl
Behind all moved seeking for vessels to hold\nl
A first raw vintage of the grapes of God,\nl
On earth's mud a spilth of the supernal Bliss,\nl
Intoxicating the stupefied soul and mind\nl
A heady wine of rapture dark and crude,\nl
Dim, uncast yet into spiritual form,\nl
Obscure inhabitant of the world's blind core,\nl
An unborn godhead's will, a mute Desire.\nl

\spar A third creation now revealed its face.\nl
A mould of body's early mind was made.\nl
A glint of light kindled the obscure World-Force;\nl
It dowered a driven world with the seeing Idea\nl
And armed the act with thought's dynamic point:\nl
A small thinking being watched the works of Time.\nl
A difficult evolution from below\nl
Page 146

Called a masked intervention from above;\nl
Else this great, blind inconscient universe\nl
Could never have disclosed its hidden mind,\nl
Or even in blinkers worked in beast and man\nl
The Intelligence that devised the cosmic scheme.\nl
At first he saw a dim obscure mind-power\nl
Moving concealed by Matter and dumb life.\nl
A current thin, it streamed in life's vast flow\nl
Tossing and drifting under a drifting sky\nl
Amid the surge and glimmering tremulous wash,\nl
Released in splash of sense and feeling's waves.\nl
In the deep midst of an insentient world\nl
Its huddled waves and foam of consciousness ran\nl
Pressing and eddying through a narrow strait,\nl
Carrying experience in its crowded pace.\nl
It flowed emerging into upper light\nl
From the deep pool of its subliminal birth\nl
To reach some high existence still unknown.\nl
There was no thinking self, aim there was none:\nl
All was unorganised stress and seekings vague.\nl
Only to the unstable surface rose\nl
Sensations, stabs and edges of desire\nl
And passion's leaps and brief emotion's cries,\nl
A casual colloquy of flesh with flesh,\nl
A murmur of heart to longing wordless heart,\nl
Glimmerings of knowledge with no shape of thought\nl
And jets of subconscious will or hunger's pulls.\nl
All was dim sparkle on a foaming top:\nl
It whirled around a drifting shadow-self\nl
On an inconscient flood of Force in Time.\nl
Then came the pressure of a seeing Power\nl
That drew all into a dancing turbid mass\nl
Circling around a single luminous point,\nl
Centre of reference in a conscious field,\nl
Figure of a unitary Light within.\nl
It lit the impulse of the half-sentient flood,\nl
Page 147

Even an illusion gave of fixity\nl
As if a sea could serve as a firm soil.\nl
That strange observing Power imposed its sight.\nl
It forced on flux a limit and a shape,\nl
It gave its stream a lower narrow bank,\nl
Drew lines to snare the spirit's formlessness.\nl
It fashioned the life-mind of bird and beast,\nl
The answer of the reptile and the fish,\nl
The primitive pattern of the thoughts of man.\nl
A finite movement of the Infinite\nl
Came winging its way through a wide air of Time;\nl
A march of knowledge moved in Nescience\nl
And guarded in the form a separate soul.\nl
Its right to be immortal it reserved,\nl
But built a wall against the siege of death\nl
And threw a hook to clutch eternity.\nl
A thinking entity appeared in Space.\nl
A little ordered world broke into view\nl
Where being had prison-room for act and sight,\nl
A floor to walk, a clear but scanty range.\nl
An instrument-personality was born,\nl
And a restricted clamped intelligence\nl
Consented to confine in narrow bounds\nl
Its seeking; it tied the thought to visible things,\nl
Prohibiting the adventure of the Unseen\nl
And the soul's tread through unknown infinities.\nl
A reflex reason, Nature-habit's glass\nl
Illumined life to know and fix its field,\nl
Accept a dangerous ignorant brevity\nl
And the inconclusive purpose of its walk\nl
And profit by the hour's precarious chance\nl
In the allotted boundaries of its fate.\nl
A little joy and knowledge satisfied\nl
This little being tied into a knot\nl
And hung on a bulge of its environment,\nl
A little curve cut off in measureless Space,\nl
Page 148

A little span of life in all vast Time.\nl
A thought was there that planned, a will that strove,\nl
But for small aims within a narrow scope,\nl
Wasting unmeasured toil on transient things.\nl
It knew itself a creature of the mud;\nl
It asked no larger law, no loftier aim;\nl
It had no inward look, no upward gaze.\nl
A backward scholar on logic's rickety bench\nl
Indoctrinated by the erring sense,\nl
It took appearance for the face of God,\nl
For casual lights the marching of the suns,\nl
For heaven a starry strip of doubtful blue;\nl
Aspects of being feigned to be the whole.\nl
There was a voice of busy interchange,\nl
A market-place of trivial thoughts and acts:\nl
A life soon spent, a mind the body's slave\nl
Here seemed the brilliant crown of Nature's work,\nl
And tiny egos took the world as means\nl
To sate awhile dwarf lusts and brief desires,\nl
In a death-closed passage saw life's start and end\nl
As though a blind alley were creation's sign,\nl
As if for this the soul had coveted birth\nl
In the wonderland of a self-creating world\nl
And the opportunities of cosmic Space.\nl
This creature passionate only to survive,\nl
Fettered to puny thoughts with no wide range\nl
And to the body's needs and pangs and joys,\nl
This fire growing by its fuel's death,\nl
Increased by what it seized and made its own:\nl
It gathered and grew and gave itself to none.\nl
Only it hoped for greatness in its den\nl
And pleasure and victory in small fields of power\nl
And conquest of life-room for self and kin,\nl
An animal limited by its feeding-space.\nl
It knew not the Immortal in its house;\nl
It had no greater deeper cause to live.\nl
Page 149

In limits only it was powerful;\nl
Acute to capture truth for outward use,\nl
Its knowledge was the body's instrument;\nl
Absorbed in the little works of its prison-house\nl
It turned around the same unchanging points\nl
In the same circle of interest and desire,\nl
But thought itself the master of its jail.\nl
Although for action, not for wisdom made,\nl
Thought was its apex—or its gutter's rim:\nl
It saw an image of the external world\nl
And saw its surface self, but knew no more.\nl
Out of a slow confused embroiled self-search\nl
Mind grew to a clarity cut out, precise,\nl
A gleam enclosed in a stone ignorance.\nl
In this bound thinking's narrow leadership\nl
Tied to the soil, inspired by common things,\nl
Attached to a confined familiar world,\nl
Amid the multitude of her motived plots,\nl
Her changing actors and her million masks,\nl
Life was a play monotonously the same.\nl
There were no vast perspectives of the spirit,\nl
No swift invasions of unknown delight,\nl
No golden distances of wide release.\nl
This petty state resembled our human days\nl
But fixed to eternity of changeless type,\nl
A moment's movement doomed to last through Time.\nl
Existence bridge-like spanned the inconscient gulfs,\nl
A half-illumined building in a mist,\nl
Which from a void of Form arose to sight\nl
And jutted out into a void of Soul.\nl
A little light in a great darkness born,\nl
Life knew not where it went nor whence it came.\nl
Around all floated still the nescient haze.\nl
\rl{\fsc End of Canto Four}
Page 150

\par
\ht Canto Five: The Godheads of the Little Life
\par
\sbigcap A fixed and narrow power with rigid forms,\nl
He saw the empire of the little life,\nl
An unhappy corner in eternity.\nl
It lived upon the margin of the Idea\nl
Protected by Ignorance as in a shell.\nl
Then, hoping to learn the secret of this world\nl
He peered across its scanty fringe of sight,\nl
To disengage from its surface-clear obscurity\nl
The Force that moved it and the Idea that made,\nl
Imposing smallness on the Infinite,\nl
The ruling spirit of its littleness,\nl
The divine law that gave it right to be,\nl
Its claim on Nature and its need in Time.\nl
He plunged his gaze into the siege of mist\nl
That held this ill-lit straitened continent\nl
Ringed with the skies and seas of ignorance\nl
And kept it safe from Truth and Self and Light.\nl
As when a searchlight stabs the Night's blind breast\nl
And dwellings and trees and figures of men appear\nl
As if revealed to an eye in Nothingness,\nl
All lurking things were torn out of their veils\nl
And held up in his vision's sun-white blaze.\nl
A busy restless uncouth populace\nl
Teemed in their dusky unnoted thousands there.\nl
In a mist of secrecy wrapping the world-scene\nl
The little deities of Time's nether act\nl
Who work remote from Heaven's controlling eye,\nl
Plotted, unknown to the creatures whom they move,\nl
The small conspiracies of this petty reign\nl
Amused with the small contrivings, the brief hopes\nl
And little eager steps and little ways\nl
Page 151

And reptile wallowings in the dark and dust,\nl
And the crouch and ignominy of creeping life.\nl
A trepidant and motley multitude,\nl
A strange pell-mell of magic artisans,\nl
Was seen moulding the plastic clay of life,\nl
An elfin brood, an elemental kind.\nl
Astonished by the unaccustomed glow,\nl
As if immanent in the shadows started up\nl
Imps with wry limbs and carved beast visages,\nl
Sprite-prompters goblin-wizened or faery-small,\nl
And genii fairer but unsouled and poor\nl
And fallen beings, their heavenly portion lost,\nl
And errant divinities trapped in Time's dust.\nl
Ignorant and dangerous wills but armed with power,\nl
Half-animal, half-god their mood, their shape.\nl
Out of the greyness of a dim background\nl
Their whispers come, an inarticulate force,\nl
Awake in mind an echoing thought or word,\nl
To their sting of impulse the heart's sanction draw,\nl
And in that little Nature do their work\nl
And fill its powers and creatures with unease.\nl
Its seed of joy they curse with sorrow's fruit,\nl
Put out with error's breath its scanty lights\nl
And turn its surface truths to falsehood's ends,\nl
Its small emotions spur, its passions drive\nl
To the abyss or through the bog and mire:\nl
Or else with a goad of hard dry lusts they prick,\nl
While jogs on devious ways that nowhere lead\nl
Life's cart finding no issue from ignorance.\nl
To sport with good and evil is their law;\nl
Luring to failure and meaningless success,\nl
All models they corrupt, all measures cheat,\nl
Make knowledge a poison, virtue a pattern dull\nl
And lead the endless cycles of desire\nl
Through semblances of sad or happy chance\nl
