To an inescapable fatality.\nl
Page 152

All by their influence is enacted there.\nl
Nor there alone is their empire or their role:\nl
Wherever are soulless minds and guideless lives\nl
And in a small body self is all that counts,\nl
Wherever love and light and largeness lack,\nl
These crooked fashioners take up their task.\nl
To all half-conscious worlds they extend their reign.\nl
Here too these godlings drive our human hearts,\nl
Our nature's twilight is their lurking-place:\nl
Here too the darkened primitive heart obeys\nl
The veiled suggestions of a hidden Mind\nl
That dogs our knowledge with misleading light\nl
And stands between us and the Truth that saves.\nl
It speaks to us with the voices of the Night:\nl
Our darkened lives to greater darkness move;\nl
Our seekings listen to calamitous hopes.\nl
A structure of unseeing thoughts is built\nl
And reason used by an irrational Force.\nl
This earth is not alone our teacher and nurse;\nl
The powers of all the worlds have entrance here.\nl
In their own fields they follow the wheel of law\nl
And cherish the safety of a settled type;\nl
On earth out of their changeless orbit thrown\nl
Their law is kept, lost their fixed form of things.\nl
Into a creative chaos they are cast\nl
Where all asks order but is driven by Chance;\nl
Strangers to earth-nature, they must learn earth's ways,\nl
Aliens or opposites, they must unite:\nl
They work and battle and with pain agree:\nl
These join, those part, all parts and joins anew,\nl
But never can we know and truly live\nl
Till all have found their divine harmony.\nl
Our life's uncertain way winds circling on,\nl
Our mind's unquiet search asks always light,\nl
Till they have learned their secret in their source,\nl
In the light of the Timeless and its spaceless home,\nl
Page 153

In the joy of the Eternal sole and one.\nl
But now the Light supreme is far away:\nl
Our conscious life obeys the Inconscient's laws;\nl
To ignorant purposes and blind desires\nl
Our hearts are moved by an ambiguous force;\nl
Even our mind's conquests wear a battered crown.\nl
A slowly changing order binds our will.\nl
This is our doom until our souls are free.\nl
A mighty Hand then rolls mind's firmaments back,\nl
Infinity takes up the finite's acts\nl
And Nature steps into the eternal Light.\nl
Then only ends this dream of nether life.\nl

\spar At the outset of this enigmatic world\nl
Which seems at once an enormous brute machine\nl
And a slow unmasking of the spirit in things,\nl
In this revolving chamber without walls\nl
In which God sits impassive everywhere\nl
As if unknown to himself and by us unseen\nl
In a miracle of inconscient secrecy,\nl
Yet is all here his action and his will.\nl
In this whirl and sprawl through infinite vacancy\nl
The Spirit became Matter and lay in the whirl,\nl
A body sleeping without sense or soul.\nl
A mass phenomenon of visible shapes\nl
Supported by the silence of the Void\nl
Appeared in the eternal Consciousness\nl
And seemed an outward and insensible world.\nl
There was none there to see and none to feel;\nl
Only the miraculous Inconscient,\nl
A subtle wizard skilled, was at its task.\nl
Inventing ways for magical results,\nl
Managing creation's marvellous device,\nl
Marking mechanically dumb wisdom's points,\nl
Using the unthought inevitable Idea,\nl
It did the works of God's intelligence\nl
Page 154

Or wrought the will of some supreme Unknown.\nl
Still consciousness was hidden in Nature's womb,\nl
Unfelt was the Bliss whose rapture dreamed the worlds.\nl
Being was an inert substance driven by Force.\nl
At first was only an etheric Space:\nl
Its huge vibrations circled round and round\nl
Housing some unconceived initiative:\nl
Upheld by a supreme original Breath\nl
Expansion and contraction's mystic act\nl
Created touch and friction in the void,\nl
Into abstract emptiness brought clash and clasp:\nl
Parent of an expanding universe\nl
In a matrix of disintegrating force,\nl
By spending it conserved an endless sum.\nl
On the hearth of Space it kindled a viewless Fire\nl
That, scattering worlds as one might scatter seeds,\nl
Whirled out the luminous order of the stars.\nl
An ocean of electric Energy\nl
Formlessly formed its strange wave-particles\nl
Constructing by their dance this solid scheme,\nl
Its mightiness in the atom shut to rest;\nl
Masses were forged or feigned and visible shapes;\nl
Light flung the photon's swift revealing spark\nl
And showed, in the minuteness of its flash\nl
Imaged, this cosmos of apparent things.\nl
Thus has been made this real impossible world,\nl
An obvious miracle or convincing show.\nl
Or so it seems to man's audacious mind\nl
Who seats his thought as the arbiter of truth,\nl
His personal vision as impersonal fact,\nl
As witnesses of an objective world\nl
His erring sense and his instruments' artifice.\nl
Thus must he work life's tangible riddle out\nl
In a doubtful light, by error seize on Truth\nl
And slowly part the visage and the veil.\nl
Or else, forlorn of faith in mind and sense,\nl
Page 155

His knowledge a bright body of ignorance,\nl
He sees in all things strangely fashioned here\nl
The unwelcome jest of a deceiving Force,\nl
A parable of Maya and her might.\nl
This vast perpetual motion caught and held\nl
In the mysterious and unchanging change\nl
Of the persistent movement we call Time\nl
And ever renewing its recurrent beat,\nl
These mobile rounds that stereotype a flux,\nl
These static objects in the cosmic dance\nl
That are but Energy's self-repeating whorls\nl
Prolonged by the spirit of the brooding Void,\nl
Awaited life and sense and waking Mind.\nl
A little the Dreamer changed his pose of stone.\nl
But when the Inconscient's scrupulous work was done\nl
And Chance coerced by fixed immutable laws,\nl
A scene was set for Nature's conscious play.\nl
Then stirred the Spirit's mute immobile sleep;\nl
The Force concealed broke dumbly, slowly out.\nl
A dream of living woke in Matter's heart,\nl
A will to live moved the Inconscient's dust,\nl
A freak of living startled vacant Time,\nl
Ephemeral in a blank eternity,\nl
Infinitesimal in a dead Infinite.\nl
A subtler breath quickened dead Matter's forms;\nl
The world's set rhythm changed to a conscious cry;\nl
A serpent Power twinned the insensible Force.\nl
Islands of living dotted lifeless Space\nl
And germs of living formed in formless air.\nl
A Life was born that followed Matter's law,\nl
Ignorant of the motives of its steps;\nl
Ever inconstant, yet for ever the same,\nl
It repeated the paradox that gave it birth:\nl
Its restless and unstable stabilities\nl
Recurred incessantly in the flow of Time\nl
And purposeful movements in unthinking forms\nl
Page 156

Betrayed the heavings of an imprisoned Will.\nl
Waking and sleep lay locked in mutual arms;\nl
Helpless and indistinct came pleasure and pain\nl
Trembling with the first faint thrills of a World-Soul.\nl
A strength of life that could not cry or move,\nl
Yet broke into beauty signing some deep delight:\nl
An inarticulate sensibility,\nl
Throbs of the heart of an unknowing world,\nl
Ran through its somnolent torpor and there stirred\nl
A vague uncertain thrill, a wandering beat,\nl
A dim unclosing as of secret eyes.\nl
Infant self-feeling grew and birth was born.\nl
A godhead woke but lay with dreaming limbs;\nl
Her house refused to open its sealed doors.\nl
Insentient to our eyes that only see\nl
The form, the act and not the imprisoned God,\nl
Life hid in her pulse occult of growth and power\nl
A consciousness with mute stifled beats of sense,\nl
A mind suppressed that knew not yet of thought,\nl
An inert spirit that could only be.\nl
At first she raised no voice, no motion dared:\nl
Charged with world-power, instinct with living force,\nl
Only she clung with her roots to the safe earth,\nl
Thrilled dumbly to the shocks of ray and breeze\nl
And put out tendril fingers of desire;\nl
The strength in her yearning for sun and light\nl
Felt not the embrace that made her breathe and live;\nl
Absorbed she dreamed content with beauty and hue.\nl
At last the charmed Immensity looked forth:\nl
Astir, vibrant, hungering, she groped for mind;\nl
Then slowly sense quivered and thought peered out;\nl
She forced the reluctant mould to grow aware.\nl
The magic was chiselled of a conscious form;\nl
Its tranced vibrations rhythmed a quick response,\nl
And luminous stirrings prompted brain and nerve,\nl
Awoke in Matter spirit's identity\nl
Page 157

And in a body lit the miracle\nl
Of the heart's love and the soul's witness gaze.\nl
Impelled by an unseen Will there could break out\nl
Fragments of some vast impulse to become\nl
And vivid glimpses of a secret self,\nl
And the doubtful seeds and force of shapes to be\nl
Awoke from the inconscient swoon of things.\nl
An animal creation crept and ran\nl
And flew and called between the earth and sky,\nl
Hunted by death but hoping still to live\nl
And glad to breathe if only for a while.\nl
Then man was moulded from the original brute.\nl
A thinking mind had come to lift life's moods,\nl
The keen-edged tool of a Nature mixed and vague,\nl
An intelligence half-witness, half-machine.\nl
This seeming driver of her wheel of works\nl
Missioned to motive and record her drift\nl
And fix its law on her inconstant powers,\nl
This master-spring of a delicate enginery,\nl
Aspired to enlighten its user and refine\nl
Lifting to a vision of the indwelling Power\nl
The absorbed mechanic's crude initiative:\nl
He raised his eyes; Heaven-light mirrored a Face.\nl
Amazed at the works wrought in her mystic sleep,\nl
She looked upon the world that she had made:\nl
Wondering now seized the great automaton;\nl
She paused to understand her self and aim,\nl
Pondering she learned to act by conscious rule,\nl
A visioned measure guided her rhythmic steps;\nl
Thought bordered her instincts with a frame of will\nl
And lit with the idea her blinded urge.\nl
On her mass of impulses, her reflex acts,\nl
On the Inconscient's pushed or guided drift\nl
And mystery of unthinking accurate steps\nl
She stuck the specious image of a self,\nl
A living idol of disfigured spirit;\nl
Page 158

On Matter's acts she imposed a patterned law;\nl
She made a thinking body from chemic cells\nl
And moulded a being out of a driven force.\nl
To be what she was not inflamed her hope:\nl
She turned her dream towards some high Unknown;\nl
A breath was felt below of One supreme.\nl
An opening looked up to spheres above\nl
And coloured shadows limned on mortal ground\nl
The passing figures of immortal things;\nl
A quick celestial flash could sometimes come:\nl
The illumined soul-ray fell on heart and flesh\nl
And touched with semblances of ideal light\nl
The stuff of which our earthly dreams are made.\nl
A fragile human love that could not last,\nl
Ego's moth-wings to lift the seraph soul,\nl
Appeared, a surface glamour of brief date\nl
Extinguished by a scanty breath of Time;\nl
Joy that forgot mortality for a while\nl
Came, a rare visitor who left betimes,\nl
And made all things seem beautiful for an hour,\nl
Hopes that soon fade to drab realities\nl
And passions that crumble to ashes while they blaze\nl
Kindled the common earth with their brief flame.\nl
A creature insignificant and small\nl
Visited, uplifted by an unknown Power,\nl
Man laboured on his little patch of earth\nl
For means to last, to enjoy, to suffer and die.\nl
A spirit that perished not with the body and breath\nl
Was there like a shadow of the Unmanifest\nl
And stood behind the little personal form\nl
But claimed not yet this earthly embodiment.\nl
Assenting to Nature's long slow-moving toil,\nl
Watching the works of his own Ignorance,\nl
Unknown, unfelt the mighty Witness lives\nl
And nothing shows the Glory that is here.\nl
A Wisdom governing the mystic world,\nl
Page 159

A Silence listening to the cry of Life,\nl
It sees the hurrying crowd of moments stream\nl
Towards the still greatness of a distant hour.\nl

\spar This huge world unintelligibly turns\nl
In the shadow of a mused Inconscience;\nl
It hides a key to inner meanings missed,\nl
It locks in our hearts a voice we cannot hear.\nl
An enigmatic labour of the spirit,\nl
An exact machine of which none knows the use,\nl
An art and ingenuity without sense,\nl
This minute elaborate orchestrated life\nl
For ever plays its motiveless symphonies.\nl
The mind learns and knows not, turning its back to truth;\nl
It studies surface laws by surface thought,\nl
Life's steps surveys and Nature's process sees,\nl
Not seeing for what she acts or why we live;\nl
It marks her tireless care of just device,\nl
Her patient intricacy of fine detail,\nl
The ingenious spirit's brave inventive plan\nl
In her great futile mass of endless works,\nl
Adds purposeful figures to her purposeless sum,\nl
Its gabled storeys piles, its climbing roofs\nl
On the close-carved foundations she has laid,\nl
Imagined citadels reared in mythic air\nl
Or mounts a stair of dream to a mystic moon:\nl
Transient creations point and hit the sky:\nl
A world-conjecture's scheme is laboured out\nl
On the dim floor of mind's incertitude,\nl
Or painfully built a fragmentary whole.\nl
Impenetrable, a mystery recondite\nl
Is the vast plan of which we are a part;\nl
Its harmonies are discords to our view\nl
Because we know not the great theme they serve.\nl
Inscrutable work the cosmic agencies.\nl
Only the fringe of a wide surge we see;\nl
Page 160

Our instruments have not that greater light,\nl
Our will tunes not with the eternal Will,\nl
Our heart's sight is too blind and passionate.\nl
Impotent to share in Nature's mystic tact,\nl
Inapt to feel the pulse and core of things,\nl
Our reason cannot sound life's mighty sea\nl
And only counts its waves and scans its foam;\nl
It knows not whence these motions touch and pass,\nl
It sees not whither sweeps the hurrying flood:\nl
Only it strives to canalise its powers\nl
And hopes to turn its course to human ends:\nl
But all its means come from the Inconscient's store.\nl
Unseen here act dim huge world-energies\nl
And only trickles and currents are our share.\nl
Our mind lives far off from the authentic Light\nl
Catching at little fragments of the Truth\nl
In a small corner of infinity,\nl
Our lives are inlets of an ocean's force.\nl
Our conscious movements have sealed origins\nl
But with those shadowy seats no converse hold;\nl
No understanding binds our comrade parts;\nl
Our acts emerge from a crypt our minds ignore.\nl
Our deepest depths are ignorant of themselves;\nl
Even our body is a mystery shop;\nl
As our earth's roots lurk screened below our earth,\nl
So lie unseen our roots of mind and life.\nl
Our springs are kept close hid beneath, within;\nl
Our souls are moved by powers behind the wall.\nl
In the subterranean reaches of the spirit\nl
A puissance acts and recks not what it means;\nl
Using unthinking monitors and scribes,\nl
It is the cause of what we think and feel.\nl
The troglodytes of the subconscious Mind,\nl
Ill-trained slow stammering interpreters\nl
Only of their small task's routine aware\nl
And busy with the record in our cells,\nl
Page 161

Concealed in the subliminal secrecies\nl
Mid an obscure occult machinery,\nl
Capture the mystic Morse whose measured lilt\nl
Transmits the messages of the cosmic Force.\nl
A whisper falls into life's inner ear\nl
And echoes from the dun subconscient caves,\nl
Speech leaps, thought quivers, the heart vibrates, the will\nl
Answers and tissue and nerve obey the call.\nl
Our lives translate these subtle intimacies;\nl
All is the commerce of a secret Power.\nl
\sparn A thinking puppet is the mind of life:\nl
Its choice is the work of elemental strengths\nl
That know not their own birth and end and cause\nl
And glimpse not the immense intent they serve.\nl
In this nether life of man drab-hued and dull,\nl
Yet filled with poignant small ignoble things,\nl
The conscious Doll is pushed a hundred ways\nl
And feels the push but not the hands that drive.\nl
For none can see the masked ironic troupe\nl
To whom our figure-selves are marionettes,\nl
Our deeds unwitting movements in their grasp,\nl
Our passionate strife an entertainment's scene.\nl
Ignorant themselves of their own fount of strength\nl
They play their part in the enormous whole.\nl
Agents of darkness imitating light,\nl
Spirits obscure and moving things obscure,\nl
Unwillingly they serve a mightier Power.\nl
Ananke's engines organising Chance,\nl
Channels perverse of a stupendous Will,\nl
Tools of the Unknown who use us as their tools,\nl
Invested with power in Nature's nether state,\nl
Into the actions mortals think their own\nl
They bring the incoherencies of Fate,\nl
Or make a doom of Time's slipshod caprice\nl
And toss the lives of men from hand to hand\nl
In an inconsequent and devious game.\nl
Page 162

Against all higher truth their stuff rebels;\nl
Only to Titan force their will lies prone.\nl
Inordinate their hold on human hearts,\nl
In all our nature's turns they intervene.\nl
Insignificant architects of low-built lives\nl
And engineers of interest and desire,\nl
Out of crude earthiness and muddy thrills\nl
And coarse reactions of material nerve\nl
They build our huddled structures of self-will\nl
And the ill-lighted mansions of our thought,\nl
Or with the ego's factories and marts\nl
Surround the beautiful temple of the soul.\nl
Artists minute of the hues of littleness,\nl
They set the mosaic of our comedy\nl
Or plan the trivial tragedy of our days,\nl
Arrange the deed, combine the circumstance\nl
And the fantasia of the moods costume.\nl
These unwise prompters of man's ignorant heart\nl
And tutors of his stumbling speech and will,\nl
Movers of petty wraths and lusts and hates\nl
And changeful thoughts and shallow emotion's starts,\nl
These slight illusion-makers with their masks,\nl
Painters of the decor of a dull-hued stage\nl
And nimble scene-shifters of the human play,\nl
Ever are busy with this ill-lit scene.\nl
Ourselves incapable to build our fate\nl
Only as actors speak and strut our parts\nl
Until the piece is done and we pass off\nl
Into a brighter Time and subtler Space.\nl
Thus they inflict their little pigmy law\nl
And curb the mounting slow uprise of man,\nl
Then his too scanty walk with death they close.\nl

\spar This is the ephemeral creature's daily life.\nl
As long as the human animal is lord\nl
And a dense nether nature screens the soul,\nl
Page 163

As long as intellect's outward-gazing sight\nl
Serves earthy interest and creature joys,\nl
An incurable littleness pursues his days.\nl
Ever since consciousness was born on earth,\nl
Life is the same in insect, ape and man,\nl
Its stuff unchanged, its way the common route.\nl
If new designs, if richer details grow\nl
And thought is added and more tangled cares,\nl
If little by little it wears a brighter face,\nl
Still even in man the plot is mean and poor.\nl
A gross content prolongs his fallen state;\nl
His small successes are failures of the soul,\nl
His little pleasures punctuate frequent griefs:\nl
Hardship and toil are the heavy price he pays\nl
For the right to live and his last wages death.\nl
An inertia sunk towards inconscience,\nl
A sleep that imitates death is his repose.\nl
A puny splendour of creative force\nl
Is made his spur to fragile human works\nl
Which yet outlast their brief creator's breath.\nl
He dreams sometimes of the revels of the gods\nl
And sees the Dionysian gesture pass,—\nl
A leonine greatness that would tear his soul\nl
If through his failing limbs and fainting heart\nl
The sweet and joyful mighty madness swept:\nl
Trivial amusements stimulate and waste\nl
The energy given to him to grow and be.\nl
His little hour is spent in little things.\nl
A brief companionship with many jars,\nl
A little love and jealousy and hate,\nl
A touch of friendship mid indifferent crowds\nl
Draw his heart-plan on life's diminutive map.\nl
If something great awakes, too frail his pitch\nl
To reveal its zenith tension of delight,\nl
His thought to eternise its ephemeral soar,\nl
Art's brilliant gleam is a pastime for his eyes,\nl
Page 164

A thrill that smites the nerves is music's spell.\nl
Amidst his harassed toil and welter of cares,\nl
Pressed by the labour of his crowding thoughts,\nl
He draws sometimes around his aching brow\nl
Nature's calm mighty hands to heal his life-pain.\nl
He is saved by her silence from his rack of self;\nl
In her tranquil beauty is his purest bliss.\nl
A new life dawns, he looks out from vistas wide;\nl
The Spirit's breath moves him but soon retires:\nl
His strength was not made to hold that puissant guest.\nl
All dulls down to convention and routine\nl
Or a fierce excitement brings him vivid joys:\nl
His days are tinged with the red hue of strife\nl
And lust's hot glare and passion's crimson stain;\nl
Battle and murder are his tribal game.\nl
Time has he none to turn his eyes within\nl
And look for his lost self and his dead soul.\nl
His motion on too short an axis wheels;\nl
He cannot soar but creeps on his long road\nl
Or if, impatient of the trudge of Time,\nl
He would make a splendid haste on Fate's slow road,\nl
His heart that runs soon pants and tires and sinks;\nl
Or he walks ever on and finds no end.\nl
Hardly a few can climb to greater life.\nl
All tunes to a low scale and conscious pitch.\nl
His knowledge dwells in the house of Ignorance;\nl
His force nears not even once the Omnipotent,\nl
Rare are his visits of heavenly ecstasy.\nl
The bliss which sleeps in things and tries to wake,\nl
Breaks out in him in a small joy of life:\nl
This scanty grace is his persistent stay;\nl
It lightens the burden of his many ills\nl
And reconciles him to his little world.\nl
He is satisfied with his common average kind;\nl
Tomorrow's hopes and his old rounds of thought,\nl
His old familiar interests and desires\nl
Page 165

He has made into a thick and narrowing hedge\nl
Defending his small life from the Invisible;\nl
His being's kinship to infinity\nl
He has shut away from him into inmost self,\nl
Fenced off the greatnesses of hidden God.\nl
His being was formed to play a trivial part\nl
In a little drama on a petty stage;\nl
In a narrow plot he has pitched his tent of life\nl
Beneath the wide gaze of the starry Vast.\nl
He is the crown of all that has been done:\nl
Thus is creation's labour justified;\nl
This is the world's result, Nature's last poise!\nl
And if this were all and nothing more were meant,\nl
If what now seems were the whole of what must be,\nl
If this were not a stade through which we pass\nl
On our road from Matter to eternal Self,\nl
To the Light that made the worlds, the Cause of things,\nl
Well might interpret our mind's limited view\nl
Existence as an accident in Time,\nl
Illusion or phenomenon or freak,\nl
The paradox of a creative Thought\nl
Which moves between unreal opposites,\nl
Inanimate Force struggling to feel and know,\nl
Matter that chanced to read itself by Mind,\nl
Inconscience monstrously engendering soul.\nl
At times all looks unreal and remote:\nl
We seem to live in a fiction of our thoughts\nl
Pieced from sensation's fanciful traveller's tale,\nl
Or caught on the film of the recording brain,\nl
A figment or circumstance in cosmic sleep.\nl
A somnambulist walking under the moon,\nl
An image of ego treads through an ignorant dream\nl
Counting the moments of a spectral Time.\nl
In a false perspective of effect and cause,\nl
Trusting to a specious prospect of world-space,\nl
It drifts incessantly from scene to scene,\nl
Page 166

Whither it knows not, to what fabulous verge.\nl
All here is dreamed or doubtfully exists,\nl
But who the dreamer is and whence he looks\nl
Is still unknown or only a shadowy guess.\nl
Or the world is real but ourselves too small,\nl
Insufficient for the mightiness of our stage.\nl
A thin life-curve crosses the titan whirl\nl
Of the orbit of a soulless universe,\nl
And in the belly of the sparse rolling mass\nl
A mind looks out from a small casual globe\nl
And wonders what itself and all things are.\nl
And yet to some interned subjective sight\nl
That strangely has formed in Matter's sightless stuff,\nl
A pointillage minute of little self\nl
Takes figure as world-being's conscious base.\nl
Such is our scene in the half-light below.\nl
This is the sign of Matter's infinite,\nl
This the weird purport of the picture shown\nl
To Science the giantess, measurer of her field,\nl
As she pores on the record of her close survey\nl
And mathematises her huge external world,\nl
To Reason bound within the circle of sense,\nl
Or in Thought's broad impalpable Exchange\nl
A speculator in tenuous vast ideas,\nl
Abstractions in the void her currency\nl
We know not with what firm values for its base.\nl
Only religion in this bankruptcy\nl
Presents its dubious riches to our hearts\nl
Or signs unprovisioned cheques on the Beyond:\nl
Our poverty shall there have its revenge.\nl
Our spirits depart discarding a futile life\nl
Into the blank unknown or with them take\nl
Death's passport into immortality.\nl

\spar Yet was this only a provisional scheme,\nl
A false appearance sketched by limiting sense,\nl
Page 167

Mind's insufficient self-discovery,\nl
An early attempt, a first experiment.\nl
This was a toy to amuse the infant earth;\nl
But knowledge ends not in these surface powers\nl
That live upon a ledge in the Ignorance\nl
And dare not look into the dangerous depths\nl
Or to stare upward measuring the Unknown.\nl
There is a deeper seeing from within\nl
And, when we have left these small purlieus of mind,\nl
A greater vision meets us on the heights\nl
In the luminous wideness of the spirit's gaze.\nl
At last there wakes in us a witness Soul\nl
That looks at truths unseen and scans the Unknown;\nl
Then all assumes a new and marvellous face:\nl
The world quivers with a God-light at its core,\nl
In Time's deep heart high purposes move and live,\nl
Life's borders crumble and join infinity.\nl
This broad, confused, yet rigid scheme becomes\nl
A magnificent imbroglio of the Gods,\nl
A game, a work ambiguously divine.\nl
Our seekings are short-lived experiments\nl
Made by a wordless and inscrutable Power\nl
Testing its issues from inconscient Night\nl
To meet its luminous self of Truth and Bliss.\nl
It peers at the Real through the apparent form;\nl
It labours in our mortal mind and sense;\nl
Amid the figures of the Ignorance,\nl
In the symbol pictures drawn by word and thought,\nl
It seeks the truth to which all figures point;\nl
It looks for the source of Light with vision's lamp;\nl
It works to find the Doer of all works,\nl
The unfelt Self within who is the guide,\nl
The unknown Self above who is the goal.\nl
All is not here a blinded Nature's task:\nl
A Word, a Wisdom watches us from on high,\nl
A Witness sanctioning her will and works,\nl
Page 168

An Eye unseen in the unseeing vast;\nl
There is an Influence from a Light above,\nl
There are thoughts remote and sealed eternities;\nl
A mystic motive drives the stars and suns.\nl
In this passage from a deaf unknowing Force\nl
To struggling consciousness and transient breath\nl
A mighty Supernature waits on Time.\nl
The world is other than we now think and see,\nl
Our lives a deeper mystery than we have dreamed;\nl
Our minds are starters in the race to God,\nl
Our souls deputed selves of the Supreme.\nl
Across the cosmic field through narrow lanes\nl
Asking a scanty dole from Fortune's hands\nl
And garbed in beggar's robes there walks the One.\nl
Even in the theatre of these small lives\nl
Behind the act a secret sweetness breathes,\nl
An urge of miniature divinity.\nl
A mystic passion from the wells of God\nl
Flows through the guarded spaces of the soul;\nl
A force that helps supports the suffering earth,\nl
An unseen nearness and a hidden joy.\nl
There are muffled throbs of laughter's undertones,\nl
The murmur of an occult happiness,\nl
An exultation in the depths of sleep,\nl
A heart of bliss within a world of pain.\nl
An Infant nursed on Nature's covert breast,\nl
An Infant playing in the magic woods,\nl
Fluting to rapture by the spirit's streams,\nl
Awaits the hour when we shall turn to his call.\nl
In this investiture of fleshly life\nl
A soul that is a spark of God survives\nl
And sometimes it breaks through the sordid screen\nl
And kindles a fire that makes us half-divine.\nl
In our body's cells there sits a hidden Power\nl
That sees the unseen and plans eternity,\nl
Our smallest parts have room for deepest needs;\nl
Page 169

There too the golden Messengers can come:\nl
A door is cut in the mud wall of self;\nl
Across the lowly threshold with bowed heads\nl
Angels of ecstasy and self-giving pass,\nl
And lodged in an inner sanctuary of dream\nl
The makers of the image of deity live.\nl
Pity is there and fire-winged sacrifice,\nl
And flashes of sympathy and tenderness\nl
Cast heaven-lights from the heart's secluded shrine.\nl
A work is done in the deep silences;\nl
A glory and wonder of spiritual sense,\nl
A laughter in beauty's everlasting space\nl
Transforming world-experience into joy,\nl
Inhabit the mystery of the untouched gulfs;\nl
Lulled by Time's beats eternity sleeps in us.\nl
In the sealed hermetic heart, the happy core,\nl
Unmoved behind this outer shape of death\nl
The eternal Entity prepares within\nl
Its matter of divine felicity,\nl
Its reign of heavenly phenomenon.\nl
Even in our sceptic mind of ignorance\nl
A foresight comes of some immense release,\nl
Our will lifts towards it slow and shaping hands.\nl
Each part in us desires its absolute.\nl
Our thoughts covet the everlasting Light,\nl
Our strength derives from an omnipotent Force,\nl
And since from a veiled God-joy the worlds were made\nl
And since eternal Beauty asks for form\nl
Even here where all is made of being's dust,\nl
Our hearts are captured by ensnaring shapes,\nl
Our very senses blindly seek for bliss.\nl
Our error crucifies Reality\nl
To force its birth and divine body here,\nl
Compelling, incarnate in a human form\nl
And breathing in limbs that one can touch and clasp,\nl
Its Knowledge to rescue an ancient Ignorance,\nl
Page 170

Its saviour light the inconscient universe.\nl
And when that greater Self comes sea-like down\nl
To fill this image of our transience,\nl
All shall be captured by delight, transformed:\nl
In waves of undreamed ecstasy shall roll\nl
Our mind and life and sense and laugh in a light\nl
Other than this hard limited human day,\nl
The body's tissues thrill apotheosised,\nl
Its cells sustain bright metamorphosis.\nl
This little being of Time, this shadow soul,\nl
This living dwarf-figurehead of darkened spirit\nl
Out of its traffic in petty dreams shall rise.\nl
Its shape of person and its ego-face\nl
Divested of this mortal travesty,\nl
Like a clay troll kneaded into a god\nl
New-made in the image of the eternal Guest,\nl
It shall be caught to the breast of a white Force\nl
And, flaming with the paradisal touch\nl
In a rose-fire of sweet spiritual grace,\nl
In the red passion of its infinite change,\nl
Quiver, awake, and shudder with ecstasy.\nl
As if reversing a deformation's spell,\nl
Released from the black magic of the Night,\nl
Renouncing servitude to the dim Abyss,\nl
It shall learn at last who lived within unseen,\nl
And seized with marvel in the adoring heart\nl
To the enthroned Child-Godhead kneel aware,\nl
Trembling with beauty and delight and love.\nl
But first the spirit's ascent we must achieve\nl
Out of the chasm from which our nature rose.\nl
The soul must soar sovereign above the form\nl
And climb to summits beyond mind's half-sleep;\nl
Our hearts we must inform with heavenly strength,\nl
Surprise the animal with the occult god.\nl
Then kindling the gold tongue of sacrifice,\nl
Calling the powers of a bright hemisphere,\nl
Page 171

We shall shed the discredit of our mortal state,\nl
Make the abysm a road for Heaven's descent,\nl
Acquaint our depths with the supernal Ray\nl
And cleave the darkness with the mystic Fire.\nl

\spar Adventuring once more in the natal mist\nl
Across the dangerous haze, the pregnant stir,\nl
He through the astral chaos shore a way\nl
Mid the grey faces of its demon gods,\nl
Questioned by whispers of its flickering ghosts,\nl
Besieged by sorceries of its fluent force.\nl
As one who walks unguided through strange fields\nl
Tending he knows not where nor with what hope,\nl
He trod a soil that failed beneath his feet\nl
And journeyed in stone strength to a fugitive end.\nl
His trail behind him was a vanishing line\nl
Of glimmering points in a vague immensity;\nl
A bodiless murmur travelled at his side\nl
In the wounded gloom complaining against light.\nl
A huge obstruction its immobile heart,\nl
The watching opacity multiplied as he moved\nl
Its hostile mass of dead and staring eyes;\nl
The darkness glimmered like a dying torch.\nl
Around him an extinguished phantom glow\nl
Peopled with shadowy and misleading shapes\nl
The vague Inconscient's dark and measureless cave.\nl
His only sunlight was his spirit's flame.\nl
\rl{\fsc End of Canto Five}
Page 172

\par

\par
\ht Canto Six: The Kingdoms and Godheads of the Greater Life
\par
\sbigcap As one who between dim receding walls\nl
Towards the far gleam of a tunnel's mouth,\nl
Hoping for light, walks now with freer pace\nl
And feels approach a breath of wider air,\nl
So he escaped from that grey anarchy.\nl
Into an ineffectual world he came,\nl
A purposeless region of arrested birth\nl
Where being from non-being fled and dared\nl
To live but had no strength long to abide.\nl
Above there gleamed a pondering brow of sky\nl
Tormented, crossed by wings of doubtful haze\nl
Adventuring with a voice of roaming winds\nl
And crying for a direction in the void\nl
Like blind souls looking for the selves they lost\nl
And wandering through unfamiliar worlds;\nl
Wings of vague questioning met the query of Space.\nl
After denial dawned a dubious hope,\nl
A hope of self and form and leave to live\nl
And the birth of that which never yet could be,\nl
And joy of the mind's hazard, the heart's choice,\nl
Grace of the unknown and hands of sudden surprise\nl
And a touch of sure delight in unsure things:\nl
To a strange uncertain tract his journey came\nl
Where consciousness played with unconscious self\nl
And birth was an attempt or episode.\nl
A charm drew near that could not keep its spell,\nl
An eager Power that could not find its way,\nl
A Chance that chose a strange arithmetic\nl
But could not bind with it the forms it made,\nl
A multitude that could not guard its sum\nl
Which less than zero grew and more than one.\nl
Page 173

Arriving at a large and shadowy sense\nl
That cared not to define its fleeting drift,\nl
Life laboured in a strange and mythic air\nl
Denuded of her sweet magnificent suns.\nl
In worlds imagined, never yet made true,\nl
A lingering glimmer on creation's verge,\nl
One strayed and dreamed and never stopped to achieve:\nl
To achieve would have destroyed that magic Space.\nl
The marvels of a twilight wonderland\nl
Full of a beauty strangely, vainly made,\nl
A surge of fanciful realities,\nl
Dim tokens of a Splendour sealed above,\nl
Awoke the passion of the eyes' desire,\nl
Compelled belief on the enamoured thought\nl
And drew the heart but led it to no goal.\nl
A magic flowed as if of moving scenes\nl
That kept awhile their fugitive delicacy\nl
Of sparing lines limned by an abstract art\nl
In a rare scanted light with faint dream-brush\nl
On a silver background of incertitude.\nl
An infant glow of heavens near to morn,\nl
A fire intense conceived but never lit,\nl
Caressed the air with ardent hints of day.\nl
The perfect longing for imperfection's charm,\nl
The illumined caught by the snare of Ignorance,\nl
Ethereal creatures drawn by body's lure\nl
To that region of promise, beating invisible wings,\nl
Came hungry for the joy of finite life\nl
But too divine to tread created soil\nl
And share the fate of perishable things.\nl
The Children of the unembodied Gleam\nl
Arisen from a formless thought in the soul\nl
And chased by an imperishable desire,\nl
Traversed the field of the pursuing gaze.\nl
A Will that unpersisting failed, worked there:\nl
Life was a search but finding never came.\nl
Page 174

There nothing satisfied, but all allured,\nl
Things seemed to be that never wholly are,\nl
Images were seen that looked like living acts\nl
And symbols hid the sense they claimed to show,\nl
Pale dreams grew real to the dreamer's eyes.\nl
The souls came there that vainly strive for birth,\nl
And spirits entrapped might wander through all time,\nl
Yet never find the truth by which they live.\nl
All ran like hopes that hunt a lurking chance;\nl
Nothing was solid, nothing felt complete:\nl
All was unsafe, miraculous and half-true.\nl
It seemed a realm of lives that had no base.\nl

\spar Then dawned a greater seeking, broadened sky,\nl
A journey under wings of brooding Force.\nl
First came the kingdom of the morning star:\nl
A twilight beauty trembled under its spear\nl
And the throb of promise of a wider Life.\nl
Then slowly rose a great and doubting sun\nl
And in its light she made of self a world.\nl
A spirit was there that sought for its own deep self,\nl
Yet was content with fragments pushed in front\nl
And parts of living that belied the whole\nl
But, pieced together, might one day be true.\nl
Yet something seemed to be achieved at last.\nl
A growing volume of the will-to-be,\nl
A text of living and a graph of force,\nl
A script of acts, a song of conscious forms\nl
Burdened with meanings fugitive from thought's grasp\nl
And crowded with undertones of life's rhythmic cry,\nl
Could write itself on the hearts of living things.\nl
In an outbreak of the might of secret Spirit,\nl
In Life and Matter's answer of delight,\nl
Some face of deathless beauty could be caught\nl
That gave immortality to a moment's joy,\nl
Some word that could incarnate highest Truth\nl
Page 175

Leaped out from a chance tension of the soul,\nl
Some hue of the Absolute could fall on life,\nl
Some glory of knowledge and intuitive sight,\nl
Some passion of the rapturous heart of Love.\nl
A hierophant of the bodiless Secrecy\nl
Interned in an unseen spiritual sheath,\nl
The Will that pushes sense beyond its scope\nl
To feel the light and joy intangible,\nl
Half found its way into the Ineffable's peace,\nl
Half captured a sealed sweetness of desire\nl
That yearned from a bosom of mysterious Bliss,\nl
Half manifested veiled Reality.\nl
A soul not wrapped into its cloak of mind\nl
Could glimpse the true sense of a world of forms;\nl
Illumined by a vision in the thought,\nl
Upbuoyed by the heart's understanding flame,\nl
It could hold in the conscious ether of the spirit\nl
The divinity of a symbol universe.\nl
\sparn This realm inspires us with our vaster hopes;\nl
Its forces have made landings on our globe,\nl
Its signs have traced their pattern in our lives:\nl
It lends a sovereign movement to our fate,\nl
Its errant waves motive our life's high surge.\nl
All that we seek for is prefigured there\nl
And all we have not known nor ever sought\nl
Which yet one day must be born in human hearts\nl
That the Timeless may fulfil itself in things.\nl
Incarnate in the mystery of the days,\nl
Eternal in an unclosed Infinite,\nl
A mounting endless possibility\nl
Climbs high upon a topless ladder of dream\nl
For ever in the Being's conscious trance.\nl
All on that ladder mounts to an unseen end.\nl
An Energy of perpetual transience makes\nl
The journey from which no return is sure,\nl
The pilgrimage of Nature to the Unknown.\nl
Page 176

As if in her ascent to her lost source\nl
She hoped to unroll all that could ever be,\nl
Her high procession moves from stage to stage,\nl
A progress leap from sight to greater sight,\nl
A process march from form to ampler form,\nl
A caravan of the inexhaustible\nl
Formations of a boundless Thought and Force.\nl
Her timeless Power that lay once on the lap\nl
Of a beginningless and endless Calm,\nl
Now severed from the Spirit's immortal bliss,\nl
Erects the type of all the joys she has lost;\nl
Compelling transient substance into shape,\nl
She hopes by the creative act's release\nl
To o'erleap sometimes the gulf she cannot fill,\nl
To heal awhile the wound of severance,\nl
Escape from the moment's prison of littleness\nl
And meet the Eternal's wide sublimities\nl
In the uncertain time-field portioned here.\nl
Almost she nears what never can be attained;\nl
She shuts eternity into an hour\nl
And fills a little soul with the Infinite;\nl
The Immobile leans to the magic of her call;\nl
She stands on a shore in the Illimitable,\nl
Perceives the formless Dweller in all forms\nl
And feels around her infinity's embrace.\nl
Her task no ending knows; she serves no aim\nl
But labours driven by a nameless Will\nl
That came from some unknowable formless Vast.\nl
This is her secret and impossible task\nl
To catch the boundless in a net of birth,\nl
To cast the spirit into physical form,\nl
To lend speech and thought to the Ineffable;\nl
She is pushed to reveal the ever Unmanifest.\nl
Yet by her skill the impossible has been done:\nl
She follows her sublime irrational plan,\nl
Invents devices of her magic art\nl
Page 177

To find new bodies for the Infinite\nl
And images of the Unimaginable;\nl
She has lured the Eternal into the arms of Time.\nl
Even now herself she knows not what she has done.\nl
For all is wrought beneath a baffling mask:\nl
A semblance other than its hidden truth\nl
The aspect wears of an illusion's trick,\nl
A feigned time-driven unreality,\nl
The unfinished creation of a changing soul\nl
In a body changing with the inhabitant.\nl
Insignificant her means, infinite her work;\nl
On a great field of shapeless consciousness\nl
In little finite strokes of mind and sense\nl
An endless Truth she endlessly unfolds;\nl
A timeless mystery works out in Time.\nl
The greatness she has dreamed her acts have missed,\nl
Her labour is a passion and a pain,\nl
A rapture and pang, her glory and her curse;\nl
And yet she cannot choose but labours on;\nl
Her mighty heart forbids her to desist.\nl
As long as the world lasts her failure lives\nl
Astonishing and foiling Reason's gaze,\nl
A folly and a beauty unspeakable,\nl
A superb madness of the will to live,\nl
A daring, a delirium of delight.\nl
This is her being's law, its sole resource;\nl
She sates, though satisfaction never comes,\nl
Her hungry will to lavish everywhere\nl
Her many-imaged fictions of the Self\nl
And thousand fashions of one Reality.\nl
A world she made touched by truth's fleeing hem,\nl
A world cast into a dream of what it seeks,\nl
An icon of truth, a conscious mystery's shape.\nl
It lingered not like the earth-mind hemmed in\nl
In solid barriers of apparent fact;\nl
It dared to trust the dream-mind and the soul.\nl
Page 178

A hunter of spiritual verities\nl
Still only thought or guessed or held by faith,\nl
It seized in imagination and confined\nl
A painted bird of paradise in a cage.\nl
This greater life is enamoured of the Unseen;\nl
It calls to some highest Light beyond its reach,\nl
It can feel the Silence that absolves the soul;\nl
It feels a saviour touch, a ray divine:\nl
Beauty and good and truth its godheads are.\nl
It is near to heavenlier heavens than earth's eyes see,\nl
A direr darkness than man's life can bear:\nl
It has kinship with the demon and the god.\nl
A strange enthusiasm has moved its heart;\nl
It hungers for heights, it passions for the supreme.\nl
It hunts for the perfect word, the perfect shape,\nl
It leaps to the summit thought, the summit light.\nl
For by the form the Formless is brought close\nl
And all perfection fringes the Absolute.\nl
A child of heaven who never saw his home,\nl
Its impetus meets the eternal at a point:\nl
It can only near and touch, it cannot hold;\nl
It can only strain towards some bright extreme:\nl
Its greatness is to seek and to create.\nl
\sparn On every plane, this Greatness must create.\nl
On earth, in heaven, in hell she is the same;\nl
Of every fate she takes her mighty part.\nl
A guardian of the fire that lights the suns,\nl
She triumphs in her glory and her might:\nl
Opposed, oppressed she bears God's urge to be born:\nl
The spirit survives upon non-being's ground,\nl
World-force outlasts world-disillusion's shock:\nl
Dumb, she is still the Word, inert the Power.\nl
Here fallen, a slave of death and ignorance,\nl
To things deathless she is driven to aspire\nl
And moved to know even the Unknowable.\nl
Even nescient, null, her sleep creates a world.\nl
Page 179

When most unseen, most mightily she works;\nl
Housed in the atom, buried in the clod,\nl
Her quick creative passion cannot cease.\nl
Inconscience is her long gigantic pause,\nl
Her cosmic swoon is a stupendous phase:\nl
Time-born, she hides her immortality;\nl
In death, her bed, she waits the hour to rise.\nl
Even with the Light denied that sent her forth\nl
And the hope dead she needed for her task,\nl
Even when her brightest stars are quenched in Night,\nl
Nourished by hardship and calamity\nl
And with pain for her body's handmaid, masseuse, nurse,\nl
Her tortured invisible spirit continues still\nl
To toil though in darkness, to create though with pangs;\nl
She carries crucified God upon her breast.\nl
In chill insentient depths where joy is none,\nl
Immured, oppressed by the resisting Void\nl
Where nothing moves and nothing can become,\nl
Still she remembers, still invokes the skill\nl
The Wonder-worker gave her at her birth,\nl
Imparts to drowsy formlessness a shape,\nl
Reveals a world where nothing was before.\nl
In realms confined to a prone circle of death,\nl
To a dark eternity of Ignorance,\nl
A quiver in an inert inconscient mass,\nl
Or imprisoned in immobilised whorls of Force,\nl
By Matter's blind compulsion deaf and mute\nl
She refuses motionless in the dust to sleep.\nl
Then, for her rebel waking's punishment\nl
Given only hard mechanic Circumstance\nl
As the enginery of her magic craft,\nl
She fashions godlike marvels out of mud;\nl
In the plasm she sets her dumb immortal urge,\nl
Helps the live tissue to think, the closed sense to feel,\nl
Flashes through the frail nerves poignant messages,\nl
In a heart of flesh miraculously loves,\nl
Page 180

To brute bodies gives a soul, a will, a voice.\nl
Ever she summons as by a sorcerer's wand\nl
Beings and shapes and scenes innumerable,\nl
Torch-bearers of her pomps through Time and Space.\nl
This world is her long journey through the night,\nl
The suns and planets lamps to light her road,\nl
Our reason is the confidante of her thoughts,\nl
Our senses are her vibrant witnesses.\nl
There drawing her signs from things half true, half false,\nl
She labours to replace by realised dreams\nl
The memory of her lost eternity.\nl
\sparn These are her deeds in this huge world-ignorance:\nl
Till the veil is lifted, till the night is dead,\nl
In light or dark she keeps her tireless search;\nl
Time is her road of endless pilgrimage.\nl
One mighty passion motives all her works.\nl
Her eternal Lover is her action's cause;\nl
For him she leaped forth from the unseen Vasts\nl
To move here in a stark unconscious world.\nl
Its acts are her commerce with her hidden Guest,\nl
His moods she takes for her heart's passionate moulds;\nl
In beauty she treasures the sunlight of his smile.\nl
Ashamed of her rich cosmic poverty,\nl
She cajoles with her small gifts his mightiness,\nl
Holds with her scenes his look's fidelity\nl
And woos his large-eyed wandering thoughts to dwell\nl
In figures of her million-impulsed Force.\nl
Only to attract her veiled companion\nl
And keep him close to her breast in her world-cloak\nl
Lest from her arms he turn to his formless peace,\nl
Is her heart's business and her clinging care.\nl
Yet when he is most near, she feels him far.\nl
For contradiction is her nature's law.\nl
Although she is ever in him and he in her,\nl
As if unaware of the eternal tie,\nl
Her will is to shut God into her works\nl
Page 181

And keep him as her cherished prisoner\nl
That never they may part again in Time.\nl
A sumptuous chamber of the spirit's sleep\nl
At first she made, a deep interior room,\nl
Where he slumbers as if a forgotten guest.\nl
But now she turns to break the oblivious spell,\nl
Awakes the sleeper on the sculptured couch;\nl
She finds again the Presence in the form\nl
And in the light that wakes with him recovers\nl
A meaning in the hurry and trudge of Time,\nl
And through this mind that once obscured the soul\nl
Passes a glint of unseen deity.\nl
Across a luminous dream of spirit-space\nl
She builds creation like a rainbow bridge\nl
Between the original Silence and the Void.\nl
A net is made of the mobile universe;\nl
She weaves a snare for the conscious Infinite.\nl
A knowledge is with her that conceals its steps\nl
And seems a mute omnipotent Ignorance.\nl
A might is with her that makes wonders true;\nl
The incredible is her stuff of common fact.\nl
Her purposes, her workings riddles prove;\nl
Examined, they grow other than they were,\nl
Explained, they seem yet more inexplicable.\nl
Even in our world a mystery has reigned\nl
Earth's cunning screen of trivial plainness hides;\nl
Her larger levels are of sorceries made.\nl
There the enigma shows its splendid prism,\nl
There is no deep disguise of commonness;\nl
Occult, profound comes all experience,\nl
Marvel is ever new, miracle divine.\nl
There is a screened burden, a mysterious touch,\nl
There is a secrecy of hidden sense.\nl
Although no earthen mask weighs on her face,\nl
Into herself she flees from her own sight.\nl
All forms are tokens of some veiled idea\nl
Page 182

Whose covert purpose lurks from mind's pursuit,\nl
Yet is a womb of sovereign consequence.\nl
There every thought and feeling is an act,\nl
And every act a symbol and a sign,\nl
And every symbol hides a living power.\nl
A universe she builds from truths and myths,\nl
But what she needed most she cannot build;\nl
All shown is a figure or copy of the Truth,\nl
But the Real veils from her its mystic face.\nl
All else she finds, there lacks eternity;\nl
All is sought out, but missed the Infinite.\nl

\spar A consciousness lit by a Truth above\nl
Was felt; it saw the light but not the Truth:\nl
It caught the Idea and built from it a world;\nl
It made an Image there and called it God.\nl
Yet something true and inward harboured there.\nl
The beings of that world of greater life,\nl
Tenants of a larger air and freer space,\nl
Live not by the body or in outward things:\nl
A deeper living was their seat of self.\nl
In that intense domain of intimacy\nl
Objects dwell as companions of the soul;\nl
The body's actions are a minor script,\nl
The surface rendering of a life within.\nl
All forces are Life's retinue in that world\nl
And thought and body as her handmaids move.\nl
The universal widenesses give her room:\nl
All feel the cosmic movement in their acts\nl
And are the instruments of her cosmic might.\nl
Or their own self they make their universe.\nl
In all who have risen to a greater Life,\nl
A voice of unborn things whispers to the ear,\nl
To their eyes visited by some high sunlight\nl
Aspiration shows the image of a crown:\nl
To work out a seed that she has thrown within,\nl
Page 183

To achieve her power in them her creatures live.\nl
Each is a greatness growing towards the heights\nl
Or from his inner centre oceans out;\nl
In circling ripples of concentric power\nl
They swallow, glutted, their environment.\nl
Even of that largeness many a cabin make;\nl
In narrower breadths and briefer vistas pent\nl
They live content with some small greatness won.\nl
To rule the little empire of themselves,\nl
To be a figure in their private world\nl
And make the milieu's joys and griefs their own\nl
And satisfy their life-motives and life-wants\nl
Is charge enough and office for this strength,\nl
A steward of the Person and his fate.\nl
This was transition-line and starting-point,\nl
A first immigration into heavenliness,\nl
For all who cross into that brilliant sphere:\nl
These are the kinsmen of our earthly race;\nl
This region borders on our mortal state.\nl
\sparn This wider world our greater movements gives,\nl
Its strong formations build our growing selves;\nl
Its creatures are our brighter replicas,\nl
Complete the types we only initiate\nl
And are securely what we strive to be.\nl
As if thought-out eternal characters,\nl
Entire, not pulled as we by contrary tides,\nl
They follow the unseen leader in the heart,\nl
Their lives obey the inner nature's law.\nl
There is kept grandeur's store, the hero's mould;\nl
The soul is the watchful builder of its fate;\nl
None is a spirit indifferent and inert;\nl
They choose their side, they see the god they adore.\nl
A battle is joined between the true and false,\nl
A pilgrimage sets out to the divine Light.\nl
For even Ignorance there aspires to know\nl
And shines with the lustre of a distant star;\nl
Page 184

There is a knowledge in the heart of sleep\nl
And Nature comes to them as a conscious force.\nl
An ideal is their leader and their king:\nl
Aspiring to the monarchy of the sun\nl
They call in Truth for their high government,\nl
Hold her incarnate in their daily acts\nl
And fill their thoughts with her inspired voice\nl
And shape their lives into her breathing form,\nl
Till in her sun-gold godhead they too share.\nl
Or to the truth of Darkness they subscribe;\nl
Whether for Heaven or Hell they must wage war:\nl
Warriors of Good, they serve a shining cause\nl
Or are Evil's soldiers in the pay of Sin.\nl
For evil and good an equal tenure keep\nl
Wherever Knowledge is Ignorance's twin.\nl
All powers of Life towards their godhead tend\nl
In the wideness and the daring of that air,\nl
Each builds its temple and expands its cult,\nl
And Sin too there is a divinity.\nl
Affirming the beauty and splendour of her law\nl
She claims life as her natural domain,\nl
Assumes the world's throne or dons the papal robe:\nl
Her worshippers proclaim her sacred right.\nl
A red-tiaraed Falsehood they revere,\nl
Worship the shadow of a crooked God,\nl
Admit the black Idea that twists the brain\nl
Or lie with the harlot Power that slays the soul.\nl
A mastering virtue statuesques the pose,\nl
Or a Titan passion goads to a proud unrest:\nl
At Wisdom's altar they are kings and priests\nl
Or their life a sacrifice to an idol of Power.\nl
Or Beauty shines on them like a wandering star;\nl
Too far to reach, passionate they follow her light;\nl
In Art and life they catch the All-Beautiful's ray\nl
And make the world their radiant treasure house:\nl
Even common figures are with marvel robed;\nl
Page 185

A charm and greatness locked in every hour\nl
Awakes the joy which sleeps in all things made.\nl
A mighty victory or a mighty fall,\nl
A throne in heaven or a pit in hell,\nl
The dual Energy they have justified\nl
And marked their souls with her tremendous seal:\nl
Whatever Fate may do to them they have earned;\nl
Something they have done, something they have been, they live.\nl
There Matter is soul's result and not its cause.\nl
In a contrary balance to earth's truth of things\nl
The gross weighs less, the subtle counts for more;\nl
On inner values hangs the outer plan.\nl
As quivers with the thought the expressive word,\nl
As yearns the act with the passion of the soul\nl
This world's apparent sensible design\nl
Looks vibrant back to some interior might.\nl
A Mind not limited by external sense\nl
Gave figures to the spirit's imponderables,\nl
The world's impacts without channels registered\nl
And turned into the body's concrete thrill\nl
The vivid workings of a bodiless Force;\nl
Powers here subliminal that act unseen\nl
Or in ambush crouch waiting behind the wall\nl
Came out in front uncovering their face.\nl
The occult grew there overt, the obvious kept\nl
A covert turn and shouldered the unknown;\nl
The unseen was felt and jostled visible shapes.\nl
In the communion of two meeting minds\nl
Thought looked at thought and had no need of speech;\nl
Emotion clasped emotion in two hearts,\nl
They felt each other's thrill in the flesh and nerves\nl
Or melted each in each and grew immense\nl
As when two houses burn and fire joins fire:\nl
Hate grappled hate and love broke in on love,\nl
Will wrestled with will on mind's invisible ground;\nl
Others' sensations passing through like waves\nl
Page 186

Left quivering the subtle body's frame,\nl
Their anger rushed galloping in brute attack,\nl
A charge of trampling hooves on shaken soil;\nl
One felt another's grief invade the breast,\nl
Another's joy exulting ran through the blood:\nl
Hearts could draw close through distance, voices near\nl
That spoke upon the shore of alien seas.\nl
There beat a throb of living interchange:\nl
Being felt being even when afar\nl
And consciousness replied to consciousness.\nl
And yet the ultimate oneness was not there.\nl
There was a separateness of soul from soul:\nl
An inner wall of silence could be built,\nl
An armour of conscious might protect and shield;\nl
The being could be closed in and solitary;\nl
One could remain apart in self, alone.\nl
Identity was not yet nor union's peace.\nl
All was imperfect still, half-known, half-done:\nl
The miracle of Inconscience overpassed,\nl
The miracle of the Superconscient still,\nl
Unknown, self-wrapped, unfelt, unknowable,\nl
Looked down on them, origin of all they were.\nl
As forms they came of the formless Infinite,\nl
As names lived of a nameless Eternity.\nl
The beginning and the end were there occult;\nl
A middle term worked unexplained, abrupt:\nl
They were words that spoke to a vast wordless Truth,\nl
They were figures crowding an unfinished sum.\nl
None truly knew himself or knew the world\nl
Or the Reality living there enshrined:\nl
Only they knew what Mind could take and build\nl
Out of the secret Supermind's huge store.\nl
A darkness under them, a bright Void above,\nl
Uncertain they lived in a great climbing Space;\nl
By mysteries they explained a Mystery,\nl
A riddling answer met the riddle of things.\nl
Page 187

As he moved in this ether of ambiguous life,\nl
Himself was soon a riddle to himself;\nl
As symbols he saw all and sought their sense.\nl

\spar Across the leaping springs of death and birth\nl
And over shifting borders of soul-change,\nl
A hunter on the spirit's creative track,\nl
He followed in life's fine and mighty trails\nl
Pursuing her sealed formidable delight\nl
In a perilous adventure without close.\nl
At first no aim appeared in those large steps:\nl
Only the wide source he saw of all things here\nl
Looking towards a wider source beyond.\nl
For as she drew away from earthly lines,\nl
A tenser drag was felt from the Unknown,\nl
A higher context of delivering thought\nl
Drove her towards marvel and discovery;\nl
There came a high release from pettier cares,\nl
A mightier image of desire and hope,\nl
A vaster formula, a greater scene.\nl
Ever she circled towards some far-off Light:\nl
Her signs still covered more than they revealed;\nl
But tied to some immediate sight and will\nl
They lost their purport in the joy of use,\nl
Till stripped of their infinite meaning they became\nl
A cipher gleaming with unreal sense.\nl
Armed with a magical and haunted bow\nl
She aimed at a target kept invisible\nl
And ever deemed remote though always near.\nl
As one who spells illumined characters,\nl
The key-book of a crabbed magician text,\nl
He scanned her subtle tangled weird designs\nl
And the screened difficult theorem of her clues,\nl
Traced in the monstrous sands of desert Time\nl
The thread beginnings of her titan works,\nl
Watched her charade of action for some hint,\nl

Read the N\=o-gestures of her silhouettes,\nl

And the byways of her intimate desires,\nl
In the complex corners crowded with her dreams\nl
And rounds crossed by an intrigue of irrelevant rounds,\nl
A wanderer straying amid fugitive scenes,\nl
He lost its signs and chased each failing guess.\nl
Ever he met key-words, ignorant of their key.\nl
A sun that dazzled its own eye of sight,\nl
A luminous enigma's brilliant hood\nl

Chapters of her metaphysical romance\nl
Of the soul's search for lost Reality\nl
And her fictions drawn from spirit's authentic fact,\nl
Her caprices and conceits and meanings locked,\nl

The magnificent wrappings of her secrecy\nl

Her meaningful outlines of the souls of things\nl

A thousand baffling faces of the Truth\nl

Page 189

In sudden scintillations of the Unknown,\nl
Inexpressive sounds became veridical,\nl

Sealed some precise unreadable harmony,\nl

In her green wildernesses and lurking depths,\nl

In the sleepy splendour of her noons he saw,\nl
A perpetual repetition through the hours,\nl
Thought's dance of dragonflies on mystery's stream\nl
That skim but never test its murmurs' race,\nl
And heard the laughter of her rose desires\nl
Running as if to escape from longed-for hands,\nl
Jingling sweet anklet-bells of fantasy.\nl
Amidst live symbols of her occult power\nl
He moved and felt them as close real forms:\nl
In that life more concrete than the lives of men\nl
Throbbed heart-beats of the hidden reality:\nl
Embodied was there what we but think and feel,\nl
Self-framed what here takes outward borrowed shapes.\nl
A comrade of Silence on her austere heights\nl
Page 190

Accepted by her mighty loneliness,\nl
He stood with her on meditating peaks\nl
Where life and being are a sacrament\nl
Offered to the Reality beyond,\nl
And saw her loose into infinity\nl
Her hooded eagles of significance,\nl
Messengers of Thought to the Unknowable.\nl
Identified in soul-vision and soul-sense,\nl
Entering into her depths as into a house,\nl
All he became that she was or longed to be,\nl
He thought with her thoughts and journeyed with her steps,\nl
Lived with her breath and scanned all with her eyes\nl
That so he might learn the secret of her soul.\nl
A witness overmastered by his scene,\nl
He admired her splendid front of pomp and play\nl
And the marvels of her rich and delicate craft,\nl
And thrilled to the insistence of her cry;\nl
Impassioned he bore the sorceries of her might,\nl
Felt laid on him her abrupt mysterious will,\nl
Her hands that knead fate in their violent grasp,\nl
Her touch that moves, her powers that seize and drive.\nl
But this too he saw, her soul that wept within,\nl
Her seekings vain that clutch at fleeing truth,\nl
Her hopes whose sombre gaze mates with despair,\nl
The passion that possessed her longing limbs,\nl
The trouble and rapture of her yearning breasts,\nl
Her mind that toils unsatisfied with its fruits,\nl
Her heart that captures not the one Beloved.\nl
Always he met a veiled and seeking Force,\nl
An exiled goddess building mimic heavens,\nl
A Sphinx whose eyes look up to a hidden Sun.\nl

\spar Ever he felt near a spirit in her forms:\nl
Its passive presence was her nature's strength;\nl
This sole is real in apparent things,\nl

But her solid outsides nowhere bear its trace.\nl

Life stared at him with vague confused outlines\nl
Offering a picture the eyes could not keep,\nl

The thought that gives it sense lives far beyond;\nl

\spar Here is the gap, here stops or sinks life's force;\nl
This deficit paupers the magician's skill:\nl

A half-sight draws the horizon of her acts:\nl
Her depths remember what she came to do,\nl

In knowledge to sum up omniscience,\nl

Our life's repose is in the Infinite;\nl

All was contrivance and unceasing stir.\nl
A hundred ways to live were tried in vain:\nl
A sameness that assumed a thousand forms\nl
Strove to escape from its long monotone\nl
And made new things that soon were like the old.\nl
A curious decoration lured the eye\nl
And novel values furbished ancient themes\nl
To cheat the mind with the idea of change.\nl
A different picture that was still the same\nl
Appeared upon the cosmic vague background.\nl
Only another labyrinthine house\nl
Of creatures and their doings and events,\nl
A city of the traffic of bound souls,\nl
Page 197

A market of creation and her wares,\nl
Was offered to the labouring mind and heart.\nl
A circuit ending where it first began\nl
Is dubbed the forward and eternal march\nl
Of progress on perfection's unknown road.\nl
Each final scheme leads to a sequel plan.\nl
Yet every new departure seems the last,\nl
Inspired evangel, theory's ultimate peak,\nl
Proclaiming a panacea for all Time's ills\nl
Or carrying thought in its ultimate zenith flight\nl
And trumpeting supreme discovery;\nl
Each brief idea, a structure perishable,\nl
Publishes the immortality of its rule,\nl
Its claim to be the perfect form of things,\nl
Truth's last epitome, Time's golden best.\nl
But nothing has been achieved of infinite worth:\nl
A world made ever anew, never complete,\nl
Piled always half-attempts on lost attempts\nl
And saw a fragment as the eternal Whole.\nl
In the aimless mounting total of things done\nl
Existence seemed a vain necessity's act,\nl
A wrestle of eternal opposites\nl
In a clasped antagonism's close-locked embrace,\nl
A play without denouement or idea,\nl
A hunger march of lives without a goal,\nl
Or, written on a bare blackboard of Space,\nl
A futile and recurring sum of souls,\nl
A hope that failed, a light that never shone,\nl
The labour of an unaccomplished Force\nl
Tied to its acts in a dim eternity.\nl
There is no end or none can yet be seen:\nl
Although defeated, life must struggle on;\nl
Always she sees a crown she cannot grasp;\nl
Her eyes are fixed beyond her fallen state.\nl
There quivers still within her breast and ours\nl
A glory that was once and is no more,\nl
Page 198

Or there calls to us from some unfulfilled beyond\nl
A greatness yet unreached by the halting world.\nl
In a memory behind our mortal sense\nl
A dream persists of larger happier air\nl
Breathing around free hearts of joy and love,\nl
Forgotten by us, immortal in lost Time.\nl
A ghost of bliss pursues her haunted depths;\nl
For she remembers still, though now so far,\nl
Her realm of golden ease and glad desire\nl
And the beauty and strength and happiness that were hers\nl
In the sweetness of her glowing paradise,\nl
In her kingdom of immortal ecstasy\nl
Half-way between God's silence and the Abyss.\nl
This knowledge in our hidden parts we keep;\nl
Awake to a vague mystery's appeal,\nl
We meet a deep unseen Reality\nl
Far truer than the world's face of present truth:\nl
We are chased by a self we cannot now recall\nl
And moved by a Spirit we must still become.\nl
As one who has lost the kingdom of his soul,\nl
We look back to some god-phase of our birth\nl
Other than this imperfect creature here\nl
And hope in this or a diviner world\nl
To recover yet from Heaven's patient guard\nl
What by our mind's forgetfulness we miss,\nl
Our being's natural felicity,\nl
Our heart's delight we have exchanged for grief,\nl
The body's thrill we bartered for mere pain,\nl
The bliss for which our mortal nature yearns\nl
As yearns an obscure moth to blazing Light.\nl
Our life is a march to a victory never won.\nl
This wave of being longing for delight,\nl
This eager turmoil of unsatisfied strengths,\nl
These long far files of forward-striving hopes\nl
Lift worshipping eyes to the blue Void called heaven\nl
Looking for the golden Hand that never came,\nl
Page 199

The advent for which all creation waits,\nl
The beautiful visage of Eternity\nl
That shall appear upon the roads of Time.\nl
Yet still to ourselves we say rekindling faith,\nl
“Oh, surely one day he shall come to our cry,\nl
One day he shall create our life anew\nl
And utter the magic formula of peace\nl
And bring perfection to the scheme of things.\nl
One day he shall descend to life and earth,\nl
Leaving the secrecy of the eternal doors,\nl
Into a world that cries to him for help,\nl
And bring the truth that sets the spirit free,\nl
The joy that is the baptism of the soul,\nl
The strength that is the outstretched arm of Love.\nl
One day he shall lift his beauty's dreadful veil,\nl
Impose delight on the world's beating heart\nl
And bare his secret body of light and bliss.”\nl
But now we strain to reach an unknown goal:\nl
There is no end of seeking and of birth,\nl
There is no end of dying and return;\nl
The life that wins its aim asks greater aims,\nl
The life that fails and dies must live again;\nl
Till it has found itself it cannot cease.\nl
All must be done for which life and death were made.\nl
But who shall say that even then is rest?\nl
Or there repose and action are the same\nl
In the deep breast of God's supreme delight.\nl
In a high state where ignorance is no more,\nl
Each movement is a wave of peace and bliss,\nl
Repose God's motionless creative force,\nl
Action a ripple in the Infinite\nl
And birth a gesture of Eternity.\nl
A sun of transfiguration still can shine\nl
And Night can bare its core of mystic light;\nl
The self-cancelling, self-afflicting paradox\nl
Into a self-luminous mystery might change,\nl
Page 200

The imbroglio into a joyful miracle.\nl
Then God could be visible here, here take a shape;\nl
Disclosed would be the spirit's identity;\nl
Life would reveal her true immortal face.\nl
But now a termless labour is her fate:\nl
In its recurrent decimal of events\nl
Birth, death are a ceaseless iteration's points;\nl
The old question-mark margins each finished page,\nl
Each volume of her effort's history.\nl
A limping Yes through the aeons journeys still\nl
Accompanied by an eternal No.\nl
All seems in vain, yet endless is the game.\nl
Impassive turns the ever-circling Wheel,\nl
Life has no issue, death brings no release.\nl
A prisoner of itself the being lives\nl
And keeps its futile immortality;\nl
Extinction is denied, its sole escape.\nl
An error of the gods has made the world.\nl
Or indifferent the Eternal watches Time.\nl
\rl{\fsc End of Canto Six}
Page 201

\par
\ht Canto Seven: The Descent into Night
\par
\sbigcap A mind absolved from life, made calm to know,\nl
A heart divorced from the blindness and the pang,\nl
The seal of tears, the bond of ignorance,\nl
He turned to find that wide world-failure's cause.\nl
Away he looked from Nature's visible face\nl
And sent his gaze into the viewless Vast,\nl
The formidable unknown Infinity,\nl
Asleep behind the endless coil of things,\nl
That carries the universe in its timeless breadths\nl
And the ripples of its being are our lives.\nl
The worlds are built by its unconscious Breath\nl
And Matter and Mind are its figures or its powers,\nl
Our waking thoughts the output of its dreams.\nl
The veil was rent that covers Nature's depths:\nl
He saw the fount of the world's lasting pain\nl
And the mouth of the black pit of Ignorance;\nl
The evil guarded at the roots of life\nl
Raised up its head and looked into his eyes.\nl
On a dim bank where dies subjective Space,\nl
From a stark ridge overlooking all that is,\nl
A tenebrous awakened Nescience,\nl
Her wide blank eyes wondering at Time and Form,\nl
Stared at the inventions of the living Void\nl
And the Abyss whence our beginnings rose.\nl
Behind appeared a grey carved mask of Night\nl
Watching the birth of all created things.\nl
A hidden Puissance conscious of its force,\nl
A vague and lurking Presence everywhere,\nl
A contrary Doom that threatens all things made,\nl
A Death figuring as the dark seed of life,\nl
Seemed to engender and to slay the world.\nl
Page 202

Then from the sombre mystery of the gulfs\nl
And from the hollow bosom of the Mask\nl
Something crept forth that seemed a shapeless Thought.\nl
A fatal Influence upon creatures stole\nl
Whose lethal touch pursued the immortal spirit,\nl
On life was laid the haunting finger of death\nl
And overcast with error, grief and pain\nl
The soul's native will for truth and joy and light.\nl
A deformation coiled that claimed to be\nl
The being's very turn, Nature's true drive.\nl
A hostile and perverting Mind at work\nl
In every corner ensconced of conscious life\nl
Corrupted Truth with her own formulas;\nl
Interceptor of the listening of the soul,\nl
Afflicting knowledge with the hue of doubt\nl
It captured the oracles of the occult gods,\nl
Effaced the signposts of Life's pilgrimage,\nl
Cancelled the firm rock-edicts graved by Time,\nl
And on the foundations of the cosmic Law\nl
Erected its bronze pylons of misrule.\nl
Even Light and Love by that cloaked danger's spell\nl
Turned from the brilliant nature of the gods\nl
To fallen angels and misleading suns,\nl
Became themselves a danger and a charm,\nl
A perverse sweetness, heaven-born malefice:\nl
Its power could deform divinest things.\nl
A wind of sorrow breathed upon the world;\nl
All thought with falsehood was besieged, all act\nl
Stamped with defect or with frustration's sign,\nl
All high attempt with failure or vain success,\nl
But none could know the reason of his fall.\nl
The grey Mask whispered and, though no sound was heard,\nl
Yet in the ignorant heart a seed was sown\nl
That bore black fruit of suffering, death and bale.\nl
Out of the chill steppes of a bleak Unseen\nl
Invisible, wearing the Night's grey mask,\nl
Page 203

Arrived the shadowy dreadful messengers,\nl
Invaders from a dangerous world of power,\nl
Ambassadors of evil's absolute.\nl
In silence the inaudible voices spoke,\nl
Hands that none saw planted the fatal grain,\nl
No form was seen, yet a dire work was done,\nl
An iron decree in crooked uncials written\nl
Imposed a law of sin and adverse fate.\nl
Life looked at him with changed and sombre eyes:\nl
Her beauty he saw and the yearning heart in things\nl
That with a little happiness is content,\nl
Answering to a small ray of truth or love;\nl
He saw her gold sunlight and her far blue sky,\nl
Her green of leaves and hue and scent of flowers\nl
And the charm of children and the love of friends\nl
And the beauty of women and kindly hearts of men,\nl
But saw too the dreadful Powers that drive her moods\nl
And the anguish she has strewn upon her ways,\nl
Fate waiting on the unseen steps of men\nl
And her evil and sorrow and last gift of death.\nl
A breath of disillusion and decadence\nl
Corrupting watched for Life's maturity\nl
And made to rot the full grain of the soul:\nl
Progress became a purveyor of Death.\nl
A world that clung to the law of a slain Light\nl
Cherished the putrid corpses of dead truths,\nl
Hailed twisted forms as things free, new and true,\nl
Beauty from ugliness and evil drank\nl
Feeling themselves guests at a banquet of the gods\nl
And tasted corruption like a high-spiced food.\nl
A darkness settled on the heavy air;\nl
It hunted the bright smile from Nature's lips\nl
And slew the native confidence in her heart\nl
And put fear's crooked look into her eyes.\nl
The lust that warps the spirit's natural good\nl
Replaced by a manufactured virtue and vice\nl
Page 204

The frank spontaneous impulse of the soul:\nl
Afflicting Nature with the dual's lie,\nl
Their twin values whetted a forbidden zest,\nl
Made evil a relief from spurious good,\nl
The ego battened on righteousness and sin\nl
And each became an instrument of Hell.\nl
In rejected heaps by a monotonous road\nl
The old simple delights were left to lie\nl
On the wasteland of life's descent to Night.\nl
All glory of life was dimmed, tarnished with doubt;\nl
All beauty ended in an aging face;\nl
All power was dubbed a tyranny cursed by God\nl
And Truth a fiction needed by the mind:\nl
The chase of joy was now a tired hunt;\nl
All knowledge was left a questioning Ignorance.\nl

\spar As from a womb obscure he saw emerge\nl
The body and visage of a dark Unseen\nl
Hidden behind the fair outsides of life.\nl
Its dangerous commerce is our suffering's cause.\nl
Its breath is a subtle poison in men's hearts;\nl
All evil starts from that ambiguous face.\nl
A peril haunted now the common air;\nl
The world grew full of menacing Energies,\nl
And wherever turned for help or hope his eyes,\nl
In field and house, in street and camp and mart\nl
He met the prowl and stealthy come and go\nl
Of armed disquieting bodied Influences.\nl
A march of goddess figures dark and nude\nl
Alarmed the air with grandiose unease;\nl
Appalling footsteps drew invisibly near,\nl
Shapes that were threats invaded the dream-light,\nl
And ominous beings passed him on the road\nl
Whose very gaze was a calamity:\nl
A charm and sweetness sudden and formidable,\nl
Faces that raised alluring lips and eyes\nl
Page 205

Approached him armed with beauty like a snare,\nl
But hid a fatal meaning in each line\nl
And could in a moment dangerously change.\nl
But he alone discerned that screened attack.\nl
A veil upon the inner vision lay,\nl
A force was there that hid its dreadful steps;\nl
All was belied, yet thought itself the truth;\nl
All were beset but knew not of the siege:\nl
For none could see the authors of their fall.\nl
\sparn Aware of some dark wisdom still withheld\nl
That was the seal and warrant of this strength,\nl
He followed the track of dim tremendous steps\nl
Returning to the night from which they came.\nl
A tract he reached unbuilt and owned by none:\nl
There all could enter but none stay for long.\nl
It was a no man's land of evil air,\nl
A crowded neighbourhood without one home,\nl
A borderland between the world and hell.\nl
There unreality was Nature's lord:\nl
It was a space where nothing could be true,\nl
For nothing was what it had claimed to be:\nl
A high appearance wrapped a specious void.\nl
Yet nothing would confess its own pretence\nl
Even to itself in the ambiguous heart:\nl
A vast deception was the law of things;\nl
Only by that deception they could live.\nl
An unsubstantial Nihil guaranteed\nl
The falsehood of the forms this Nature took\nl
And made them seem awhile to be and live.\nl
A borrowed magic drew them from the Void;\nl
They took a shape and stuff that was not theirs\nl
And showed a colour that they could not keep,\nl
Mirrors to a phantasm of reality.\nl
Each rainbow brilliance was a splendid lie;\nl
A beauty unreal graced a glamour face.\nl
Nothing could be relied on to remain:\nl
Page 206

Joy nurtured tears and good an evil proved,\nl
But never out of evil one plucked good:\nl
Love ended early in hate, delight killed with pain,\nl
Truth into falsity grew and death ruled life.\nl
A Power that laughed at the mischiefs of the world,\nl
An irony that joined the world's contraries\nl
And flung them into each other's arms to strive,\nl
Put a sardonic rictus on God's face.\nl
Aloof, its influence entered everywhere\nl
And left a cloven hoof-mark on the breast;\nl
A twisted heart and a strange sombre smile\nl
Mocked at the sinister comedy of life.\nl
Announcing the advent of a perilous Form\nl
An ominous tread softened its dire footfall\nl
That none might understand or be on guard;\nl
None heard until a dreadful grasp was close.\nl
Or else all augured a divine approach,\nl
An air of prophecy felt, a heavenly hope,\nl
Listened for a gospel, watched for a new star.\nl
The Fiend was visible but cloaked in light;\nl
He seemed a helping angel from the skies:\nl
He armed untruth with Scripture and the Law;\nl
He deceived with wisdom, with virtue slew the soul\nl
And led to perdition by the heavenward path.\nl
A lavish sense he gave of power and joy,\nl
And, when arose the warning from within,\nl
He reassured the ear with dulcet tones\nl
Or took the mind captive in its own net;\nl
His rigorous logic made the false seem true.\nl
Amazing the elect with holy lore\nl
He spoke as with the very voice of God.\nl
The air was full of treachery and ruse;\nl
Truth-speaking was a stratagem in that place;\nl
Ambush lurked in a smile and peril made\nl
Safety its cover, trust its entry's gate:\nl
Falsehood came laughing with the eyes of truth;\nl
Page 207

Each friend might turn an enemy or spy,\nl
The hand one clasped ensleeved a dagger's stab\nl
And an embrace could be Doom's iron cage.\nl
Agony and danger stalked their trembling prey\nl
And softly spoke as to a timid friend:\nl
Attack sprang suddenly vehement and unseen;\nl
Fear leaped upon the heart at every turn\nl
And cried out with an anguished dreadful voice;\nl
It called for one to save but none came near.\nl
All warily walked, for death was ever close;\nl
Yet caution seemed a vain expense of care,\nl
