For all that guarded proved a deadly net,\nl
And when after long suspense salvation came\nl
And brought a glad relief disarming strength,\nl
It served as a smiling passage to worse fate.\nl
There was no truce and no safe place to rest;\nl
One dared not slumber or put off one's arms:\nl
It was a world of battle and surprise.\nl
All who were there lived for themselves alone;\nl
All warred against all, but with a common hate\nl
Turned on the mind that sought some higher good;\nl
Truth was exiled lest she should dare to speak\nl
And hurt the heart of darkness with her light\nl
Or bring her pride of knowledge to blaspheme\nl
The settled anarchy of established things.\nl

\spar Then the scene changed, but kept its dreadful core:\nl
Altering its form the life remained the same.\nl
A capital was there without a State:\nl
It had no ruler, only groups that strove.\nl
He saw a city of ancient Ignorance\nl
Founded upon a soil that knew not Light.\nl
There each in his own darkness walked alone:\nl
Only they agreed to differ in Evil's paths,\nl
To live in their own way for their own selves\nl
Or to enforce a common lie and wrong;\nl
Page 208

There Ego was lord upon his peacock seat\nl
And Falsehood sat by him, his mate and queen:\nl
The world turned to them as Heaven to Truth and God.\nl
Injustice justified by firm decrees\nl
The sovereign weights of Error's legalised trade,\nl
But all the weights were false and none the same;\nl
Ever she watched with her balance and a sword,\nl
Lest any sacrilegious word expose\nl
The sanctified formulas of her old misrule.\nl
In high professions wrapped self-will walked wide\nl
And licence stalked prating of order and right:\nl
There was no altar raised to Liberty;\nl
True freedom was abhorred and hunted down:\nl
Harmony and tolerance nowhere could be seen;\nl
Each group proclaimed its dire and naked Law.\nl
A frame of ethics knobbed with scriptural rules\nl
Or a theory passionately believed and praised\nl
A table seemed of high Heaven's sacred code.\nl
A formal practice mailed and iron-shod\nl
Gave to a rude and ruthless warrior kind\nl
Drawn from the savage bowels of the earth\nl
A proud stern poise of harsh nobility,\nl
A civic posture rigid and formidable.\nl
But all their private acts belied the pose:\nl
Power and utility were their Truth and Right,\nl
An eagle rapacity clawed its coveted good,\nl
Beaks pecked and talons tore all weaker prey.\nl
In their sweet secrecy of pleasant sins\nl
Nature they obeyed and not a moralist God.\nl
Inconscient traders in bundles of contraries,\nl
They did what in others they would persecute;\nl
When their eyes looked upon their fellow's vice,\nl
An indignation flamed, a virtuous wrath;\nl
Oblivious of their own deep-hid offence,\nl
Moblike they stoned a neighbour caught in sin.\nl
A pragmatist judge within passed false decrees,\nl
Page 209

Posed worst iniquities on equity's base,\nl
Reasoned ill actions just, sanctioned the scale\nl
Of the merchant ego's interest and desire.\nl
Thus was a balance kept, the world could live.\nl
A zealot fervour pushed their ruthless cults,\nl
All faith not theirs bled scourged as heresy;\nl
They questioned, captived, tortured, burned or smote\nl
And forced the soul to abandon right or die.\nl
Amid her clashing creeds and warring sects\nl
Religion sat upon a blood-stained throne.\nl
A hundred tyrannies oppressed and slew\nl
And founded unity upon fraud and force.\nl
Only what seemed was prized as real there:\nl
The ideal was a cynic ridicule's butt;\nl
Hooted by the crowd, mocked by enlightened wits,\nl
Spiritual seeking wandered outcasted,—\nl
A dreamer's self-deceiving web of thought\nl
Or mad chimaera deemed or hypocrite's fake,\nl
Its passionate instinct trailed through minds obscure\nl
Lost in the circuits of the Ignorance.\nl
A lie was there the truth and truth a lie.\nl
Here must the traveller of the upward Way—\nl
For daring Hell's kingdoms winds the heavenly route—\nl
Pause or pass slowly through that perilous space,\nl
A prayer upon his lips and the great Name.\nl
If probed not all discernment's keen spear-point,\nl
He might stumble into falsity's endless net.\nl
Over his shoulder often he must look back\nl
Like one who feels on his neck an enemy's breath;\nl
Else stealing up behind a treasonous blow\nl
Might prostrate cast and pin to unholy soil,\nl
Pierced through his back by Evil's poignant stake.\nl
So might one fall on the Eternal's road\nl
Forfeiting the spirit's lonely chance in Time\nl
And no news of him reach the waiting gods,\nl
Marked “missing” in the register of souls,\nl
Page 210

His name the index of a failing hope,\nl
The position of a dead remembered star.\nl
Only were safe who kept God in their hearts:\nl
Courage their armour, faith their sword, they must walk,\nl
The hand ready to smite, the eye to scout,\nl
Casting a javelin regard in front,\nl
Heroes and soldiers of the army of Light.\nl
Hardly even so, the grisly danger past,\nl
Released into a calmer purer air,\nl
They dared at length to breathe and smile once more.\nl
Once more they moved beneath a real sun.\nl
Though Hell claimed rule, the spirit still had power.\nl
This No-man's-land he passed without debate;\nl
Him the heights missioned, him the Abyss desired:\nl
None stood across his way, no voice forbade.\nl
For swift and easy is the downward path,\nl
And now towards the Night was turned his face.\nl

\spar A greater darkness waited, a worse reign,\nl
If worse can be where all is evil's extreme;\nl
Yet to the cloaked the uncloaked is naked worst.\nl
There God and Truth and the supernal Light\nl
Had never been or else had power no more.\nl
As when one slips in a deep moment's trance\nl
Over mind's border into another world,\nl
He crossed a boundary whose stealthy trace\nl
Eye could not see but only the soul feel.\nl
Into an armoured fierce domain he came\nl
And saw himself wandering like a lost soul\nl
Amid grimed walls and savage slums of Night.\nl
Around him crowded grey and squalid huts\nl
Neighbouring proud palaces of perverted Power,\nl
Inhuman quarters and demoniac wards.\nl
A pride in evil hugged its wretchedness;\nl
A misery haunting splendour pressed those fell\nl
Dun suburbs of the cities of dream-life.\nl
Page 211

There Life displayed to the spectator soul\nl
The shadow depths of her strange miracle.\nl
A strong and fallen goddess without hope,\nl
Obscured, deformed by some dire Gorgon spell,\nl
As might a harlot empress in a bouge,\nl
Nude, unashamed, exulting she upraised\nl
Her evil face of perilous beauty and charm\nl
And, drawing panic to a shuddering kiss\nl
Twixt the magnificence of her fatal breasts,\nl
Allured to their abyss the spirit's fall.\nl
Across his field of sight she multiplied\nl
As on a scenic film or moving plate\nl
The implacable splendour of her nightmare pomps.\nl
On the dark background of a soulless world\nl
She staged between a lurid light and shade\nl
Her dramas of the sorrow of the depths\nl
Written on the agonised nerves of living things:\nl
Epics of horror and grim majesty,\nl
Wry statues spat and stiffened in life's mud,\nl
A glut of hideous forms and hideous deeds\nl
Paralysed pity in the hardened breast.\nl
In booths of sin and night-repairs of vice\nl
Styled infamies of the body's concupiscence\nl
And sordid imaginations etched in flesh,\nl
Turned lust into a decorative art:\nl
Abusing Nature's gift her pervert skill\nl
Immortalised the sown grain of living death,\nl
In a mud goblet poured the bacchic wine,\nl
To a satyr gave the thyrsus of a god.\nl
Impure, sadistic, with grimacing mouths,\nl
Grey foul inventions gruesome and macabre\nl
Came televisioned from the gulfs of Night.\nl
Her craft ingenious in monstrosity,\nl
Impatient of all natural shape and poise,\nl
A gape of nude exaggerated lines,\nl
Gave caricature a stark reality,\nl
Page 212

And art-parades of weird distorted forms,\nl
And gargoyle masques obscene and terrible\nl
Trampled to tormented postures the torn sense.\nl
An inexorable evil's worshipper,\nl
She made vileness great and sublimated filth;\nl
A dragon power of reptile energies\nl
And strange epiphanies of grovelling Force\nl
And serpent grandeurs couching in the mire\nl
Drew adoration to a gleam of slime.\nl
All Nature pulled out of her frame and base\nl
Was twisted into an unnatural pose:\nl
Repulsion stimulated inert desire;\nl
Agony was made a red-spiced food for bliss,\nl
Hatred was trusted with the work of lust\nl
And torture took the form of an embrace;\nl
A ritual anguish consecrated death;\nl
Worship was offered to the Undivine.\nl
A new aesthesis of Inferno's art\nl
That trained the mind to love what the soul hates,\nl
Imposed allegiance on the quivering nerves\nl
And forced the unwilling body to vibrate.\nl
Too sweet and too harmonious to excite\nl
In this regime that soiled the being's core,\nl
Beauty was banned, the heart's feeling dulled to sleep\nl
And cherished in their place sensation's thrills;\nl
The world was probed for jets of sense-appeal.\nl
Here cold material intellect was the judge\nl
And needed sensual prick and jog and lash\nl
That its hard dryness and dead nerves might feel\nl
Some passion and power and acrid point of life.\nl
A new philosophy theorised evil's rights,\nl
Gloried in the shimmering rot of decadence,\nl
Or gave to a python Force persuasive speech\nl
And armed with knowledge the primaeval brute.\nl
Over life and Matter only brooding bowed,\nl
Mind changed to the image of a rampant beast;\nl
Page 213

It scrambled into the pit to dig for truth\nl
And lighted its search with the subconscient's flares.\nl
Thence bubbling rose sullying the upper air,\nl
The filth and festering secrets of the Abyss:\nl
This it called positive fact and real life.\nl
This now composed the fetid atmosphere.\nl
A wild-beast passion crept from secret Night\nl
To watch its prey with fascinating eyes:\nl
Around him like a fire with sputtering tongues\nl
There lolled and laughed a bestial ecstasy;\nl
The air was packed with longings brute and fierce;\nl
Crowding and stinging in a monstrous swarm\nl
Pressed with a noxious hum into his mind\nl
Thoughts that could poison Nature's heavenliest breath,\nl
Forcing reluctant lids assailed the sight\nl
Acts that revealed the mystery of Hell.\nl
All that was there was on this pattern made.\nl

\spar A race possessed inhabited those parts.\nl
A force demoniac lurking in man's depths\nl
That heaves suppressed by the heart's human law,\nl
Awed by the calm and sovereign eyes of Thought,\nl
Can in a fire and earthquake of the soul\nl
Arise and, calling to its native night,\nl
Overthrow the reason, occupy the life\nl
And stamp its hoof on Nature's shaking ground:\nl
This was for them their being's flaming core.\nl
A mighty energy, a monster god,\nl
Hard to the strong, implacable to the weak,\nl
It stared at the harsh unpitying world it made\nl
With the stony eyelids of its fixed idea.\nl
Its heart was drunk with a dire hunger's wine,\nl
In others' suffering felt a thrilled delight\nl
And of death and ruin the grandiose music heard.\nl
To have power, to be master, was sole virtue and good:\nl
It claimed the whole world for Evil's living room,\nl
Page 214

Its party's grim totalitarian reign\nl
The cruel destiny of breathing things.\nl
All on one plan was shaped and standardised\nl
Under a dark dictatorship's breathless weight.\nl
In street and house, in councils and in courts\nl
Beings he met who looked like living men\nl
And climbed in speech upon high wings of thought\nl
But harboured all that is subhuman, vile\nl
And lower than the lowest reptile's crawl.\nl
The reason meant for nearness to the gods\nl
And uplift to heavenly scale by the touch of mind\nl
Only enhanced by its enlightening ray\nl
Their inborn nature's wry monstrosity.\nl
Often, a familiar visage studying\nl
Joyfully encountered at some dangerous turn,\nl
Hoping to recognise a look of light,\nl
His vision warned by the spirit's inward eye\nl
Discovered suddenly Hell's trademark there,\nl
Or saw with the inner sense that cannot err,\nl
In the semblance of a fair or virile form\nl
The demon and the goblin and the ghoul.\nl
An insolence reigned of cold stone-hearted strength\nl
Mighty, obeyed, approved by the Titan's law,\nl
The huge laughter of a giant cruelty\nl
And fierce glad deeds of ogre violence.\nl
In that wide cynic den of thinking beasts\nl
One looked in vain for a trace of pity or love;\nl
There was no touch of sweetness anywhere,\nl
But only Force and its acolytes, greed and hate:\nl
There was no help for suffering, none to save,\nl
None dared resist or speak a noble word.\nl
Armed with the aegis of tyrannic Power,\nl
Signing the edicts of her dreadful rule\nl
And using blood and torture as a seal,\nl
Darkness proclaimed her slogans to the world.\nl
A servile blinkered silence hushed the mind\nl
Page 215

Or only it repeated lessons taught,\nl
While mitred, holding the good shepherd's staff,\nl
Falsehood enthroned on awed and prostrate hearts\nl
The cults and creeds that organise living death\nl
And slay the soul on the altar of a lie.\nl
All were deceived or served their own deceit;\nl
Truth in that stifling atmosphere could not live.\nl
There wretchedness believed in its own joy\nl
And fear and weakness hugged their abject depths;\nl
All that is low and sordid-thoughted, base,\nl
All that is drab and poor and miserable,\nl
Breathed in a lax content its natural air\nl
And felt no yearning of divine release:\nl
Arrogant, gibing at more luminous states\nl
The people of the gulfs despised the sun.\nl
A barriered autarchy excluded light;\nl
Fixed in its will to be its own grey self,\nl
It vaunted its norm unique and splendid type:\nl
It soothed its hunger with a plunderer's dream;\nl
Flaunting its cross of servitude like a crown,\nl
It clung to its dismal harsh autonomy.\nl
A bull-throat bellowed with its brazen tongue;\nl
Its hard and shameless clamour filling Space\nl
And threatening all who dared to listen to truth\nl
Claimed the monopoly of the battered ear;\nl
A deafened acquiescence gave its vote,\nl
And braggart dogmas shouted in the night\nl
Kept for the fallen soul once deemed a god\nl
The pride of its abysmal absolute.\nl

\spar A lone discoverer in these menacing realms\nl
Guarded like termite cities from the sun,\nl
Oppressed mid crowd and tramp and noise and flare,\nl
Passing from dusk to deeper dangerous dusk,\nl
He wrestled with powers that snatched from mind its light\nl
And smote from him their clinging influences.\nl
Page 216

Soon he emerged in a dim wall-less space.\nl
For now the peopled tracts were left behind;\nl
He walked between wide banks of failing eve.\nl
Around him grew a gaunt spiritual blank,\nl
A threatening waste, a sinister loneliness\nl
That left mind bare to an unseen assault,\nl
An empty page on which all that willed could write\nl
Stark monstrous messages without control.\nl
A travelling dot on downward roads of Dusk\nl
Mid barren fields and barns and straggling huts\nl
And a few crooked and phantasmal trees,\nl
He faced a sense of death and conscious void.\nl
But still a hostile Life unseen was there\nl
Whose deathlike poise resisting light and truth\nl
Made living a bleak gap in nullity.\nl
He heard the grisly voices that deny;\nl
Assailed by thoughts that swarmed like spectral hordes,\nl
A prey to the staring phantoms of the gloom\nl
And terror approaching with its lethal mouth,\nl
Driven by a strange will down ever down,\nl
The sky above a communiqu\'e of Doom,\nl
He strove to shield his spirit from despair,\nl
But felt the horror of the growing Night\nl
And the Abyss rising to claim his soul.\nl
Then ceased the abodes of creatures and their forms\nl
And solitude wrapped him in its voiceless folds.\nl
All vanished suddenly like a thought expunged;\nl
His spirit became an empty listening gulf\nl
Void of the dead illusion of a world:\nl
Nothing was left, not even an evil face.\nl
He was alone with the grey python Night.\nl
A dense and nameless Nothing conscious, mute,\nl
Which seemed alive but without body or mind,\nl
Lusted all beings to annihilate\nl
That it might be for ever nude and sole.\nl
As in a shapeless beast's intangible jaws,\nl
Page 217

Gripped, strangled by that lusting viscous blot,\nl
Attracted to some black and giant mouth\nl
And swallowing throat and a huge belly of doom,\nl
His being from its own vision disappeared\nl
Drawn towards depths that hungered for its fall.\nl
A formless void oppressed his struggling brain,\nl
A darkness grim and cold benumbed his flesh,\nl
A whispered grey suggestion chilled his heart;\nl
Haled by a serpent-force from its warm home\nl
And dragged to extinction in bleak vacancy\nl
Life clung to its seat with cords of gasping breath;\nl
Lapped was his body by a tenebrous tongue.\nl
Existence smothered travailed to survive;\nl
Hope strangled perished in his empty soul,\nl
Belief and memory abolished died\nl
And all that helps the spirit in its course.\nl
There crawled through every tense and aching nerve\nl
Leaving behind its poignant quaking trail\nl
A nameless and unutterable fear.\nl
As a sea nears a victim bound and still,\nl
The approach alarmed his mind for ever dumb\nl
Of an implacable eternity\nl
Of pain inhuman and intolerable.\nl
This he must bear, his hope of heaven estranged;\nl
He must ever exist without extinction's peace\nl
In a slow suffering Time and tortured Space,\nl
An anguished nothingness his endless state.\nl
A lifeless vacancy was now his breast,\nl
And in the place where once was luminous thought,\nl
Only remained like a pale motionless ghost\nl
An incapacity for faith and hope\nl
And the dread conviction of a vanquished soul\nl
Immortal still but with its godhead lost,\nl
Self lost and God and touch of happier worlds.\nl
But he endured, stilled the vain terror, bore\nl
The smothering coils of agony and affright;\nl
Page 218

Then peace returned and the soul's sovereign gaze.\nl
To the blank horror a calm Light replied:\nl
Immutable, undying and unborn,\nl
Mighty and mute the Godhead in him woke\nl
And faced the pain and danger of the world.\nl
He mastered the tides of Nature with a look:\nl
He met with his bare spirit naked Hell.\nl
\rl{\fsc End of Canto Seven}
Page 219

\par
\ht Canto Eight: The World of Falsehood, the Mother of Evil and the Sons of Darkness
\par
\sbigcap Then could he see the hidden heart of Night:\nl
The labour of its stark unconsciousness\nl
Revealed the endless terrible Inane.\nl
A spiritless blank Infinity was there;\nl
A Nature that denied the eternal Truth\nl
In the vain braggart freedom of its thought\nl
Hoped to abolish God and reign alone.\nl
There was no sovereign Guest, no witness Light;\nl
Unhelped it would create its own bleak world.\nl
Its large blind eyes looked out on demon acts,\nl
Its deaf ears heard the untruth its dumb lips spoke;\nl
Its huge misguided fancy took vast shapes,\nl
Its mindless sentience quivered with fierce conceits;\nl
Engendering a brute principle of life\nl
Evil and pain begot a monstrous soul.\nl
The Anarchs of the formless depths arose,\nl
Great Titan beings and demoniac powers,\nl
World-egos racked with lust and thought and will,\nl
Vast minds and lives without a spirit within:\nl
Impatient architects of error's house,\nl
Leaders of the cosmic ignorance and unrest\nl
And sponsors of sorrow and mortality\nl
Embodied the dark Ideas of the Abyss.\nl
A shadow substance into emptiness came,\nl
Dim forms were born in the unthinking Void\nl
And eddies met and made an adverse Space\nl
In whose black folds Being imagined Hell.\nl
His eyes piercing the triple-plated gloom\nl
Identified their sight with its blind stare:\nl
Accustomed to the unnatural dark, they saw\nl
Page 220

Unreality made real and conscious Night.\nl
A violent, fierce and formidable world,\nl
An ancient womb of huge calamitous dreams,\nl
Coiled like a larva in the obscurity\nl
That keeps it from the spear-points of Heaven's stars.\nl
It was the gate of a false Infinite,\nl
An eternity of disastrous absolutes,\nl
An immense negation of spiritual things.\nl
All once self-luminous in the spirit's sphere\nl
Turned now into their own dark contraries:\nl
Being collapsed into a pointless void\nl
That yet was a zero parent of the worlds;\nl
Inconscience swallowing up the cosmic Mind\nl
Produced a universe from its lethal sleep;\nl
Bliss into black coma fallen, insensible,\nl
Coiled back to itself and God's eternal joy\nl
Through a false poignant figure of grief and pain\nl
Still dolorously nailed upon a cross\nl
Fixed in the soil of a dumb insentient world\nl
Where birth was a pang and death an agony,\nl
Lest all too soon should change again to bliss.\nl
Thought sat, a priestess of Perversity,\nl
On her black tripod of the triune Snake\nl
Reading by opposite signs the eternal script,\nl
A sorceress reversing life's God-frame.\nl
In darkling aisles with evil eyes for lamps\nl
And fatal voices chanting from the apse,\nl
In strange infernal dim basilicas\nl
Intoning the magic of the unholy Word,\nl
The ominous profound Initiate\nl
Performed the ritual of her Mysteries.\nl
There suffering was Nature's daily food\nl
Alluring to the anguished heart and flesh,\nl
And torture was the formula of delight,\nl
Pain mimicked the celestial ecstasy.\nl
There Good, a faithless gardener of God,\nl
Page 221

Watered with virtue the world's upas-tree\nl
And, careful of the outward word and act,\nl
Engrafted his hypocrite blooms on native ill.\nl
All high things served their nether opposite:\nl
The forms of Gods sustained a demon cult;\nl
Heaven's face became a mask and snare of Hell.\nl
There in the heart of vain phenomenon,\nl
In an enormous action's writhen core\nl
He saw a Shape illimitable and vague\nl
Sitting on Death who swallows all things born.\nl
A chill fixed face with dire and motionless eyes,\nl
Her dreadful trident in her shadowy hand\nl
Outstretched, she pierced all creatures with one fate.\nl

\spar When nothing was save Matter without soul\nl
And a spiritless hollow was the heart of Time,\nl
Then Life first touched the insensible Abyss;\nl
Awaking the stark Void to hope and grief\nl
Her pallid beam smote the unfathomed Night\nl
In which God hid himself from his own view.\nl
In all things she sought their slumbering mystic truth,\nl
The unspoken Word that inspires unconscious forms;\nl
She groped in his deeps for an invisible Law,\nl
Fumbled in the dim subconscient for his mind\nl
And strove to find a way for spirit to be.\nl
But from the Night another answer came.\nl
A seed was in that nether matrix cast,\nl
A dumb unprobed husk of perverted truth,\nl
A cell of an insentient infinite.\nl
A monstrous birth prepared its cosmic form\nl
In Nature's titan embryo, Ignorance.\nl
Then in a fatal and stupendous hour\nl
Something that sprang from the stark Inconscient's sleep\nl
Unwillingly begotten by the mute Void,\nl
Lifted its ominous head against the stars;\nl
Overshadowing earth with its huge body of Doom\nl
Page 222

It chilled the heavens with the menace of a face.\nl
A nameless Power, a shadowy Will arose\nl
Immense and alien to our universe.\nl
In the inconceivable Purpose none can gauge\nl
A vast Non-Being robed itself with shape,\nl
The boundless Nescience of the unconscious depths\nl
Covered eternity with nothingness.\nl
A seeking Mind replaced the seeing Soul:\nl
Life grew into a huge and hungry death,\nl
The Spirit's bliss was changed to cosmic pain.\nl
Assuring God's self-cowled neutrality\nl
A mighty opposition conquered Space.\nl
A sovereign ruling falsehood, death and grief,\nl
It pressed its fierce hegemony on the earth;\nl
Disharmonising the original style\nl
Of the architecture of her fate's design,\nl
It falsified the primal cosmic Will\nl
And bound to struggle and dread vicissitudes\nl
The long slow process of the patient Power.\nl
Implanting error in the stuff of things\nl
It made an Ignorance of the all-wise Law;\nl
It baffled the sure touch of life's hid sense,\nl
Kept dumb the intuitive guide in Matter's sleep,\nl
Deformed the insect's instinct and the brute's,\nl
Disfigured man's thought-born humanity.\nl
A shadow fell across the simple Ray:\nl
Obscured was the Truth-light in the cavern heart\nl
That burns unwitnessed in the altar crypt\nl
Behind the still velamen's secrecy\nl
Companioning the Godhead of the shrine.\nl
Thus was the dire antagonist Energy born\nl
Who mimes the eternal Mother's mighty shape\nl
And mocks her luminous infinity\nl
With a grey distorted silhouette in the Night.\nl
Arresting the passion of the climbing soul,\nl
She forced on life a slow and faltering pace;\nl
Page 223

Her hand's deflecting and retarding weight\nl
Is laid on the mystic evolution's curve:\nl
The tortuous line of her deceiving mind\nl
The Gods see not and man is impotent;\nl
Oppressing the God-spark within the soul\nl
She forces back to the beast the human fall.\nl
Yet in her formidable instinctive mind\nl
She feels the One grow in the heart of Time\nl
And sees the Immortal shine through the human mould.\nl
Alarmed for her rule and full of fear and rage\nl
She prowls around each light that gleams through the dark\nl
Casting its ray from the spirit's lonely tent,\nl
Hoping to enter with fierce stealthy tread\nl
And in the cradle slay the divine Child.\nl
Incalculable are her strength and ruse;\nl
Her touch is a fascination and a death;\nl
She kills her victim with his own delight;\nl
Even Good she makes a hook to drag to Hell.\nl
For her the world runs to its agony.\nl
Often the pilgrim on the Eternal's road\nl
Ill-lit from clouds by the pale moon of Mind,\nl
Or in devious byways wandering alone,\nl
Or lost in deserts where no path is seen,\nl
Falls overpowered by her lion leap,\nl
A conquered captive under her dreadful paws.\nl
Intoxicated by a burning breath\nl
And amorous grown of a destroying mouth,\nl
Once a companion of the sacred Fire,\nl
The mortal perishes to God and Light,\nl
An Adversary governs heart and brain,\nl
A Nature hostile to the Mother-Force.\nl
The self of life yields up its instruments\nl
To Titan and demoniac agencies\nl
That aggrandise earth-nature and disframe:\nl
A cowled fifth-columnist is now thought's guide;\nl
His subtle defeatist murmur slays the faith\nl
Page 224

And, lodged in the breast or whispering from outside,\nl
A lying inspiration fell and dark\nl
A new order substitutes for the divine.\nl
A silence falls upon the spirit's heights,\nl
From the veiled sanctuary the God retires,\nl
Empty and cold is the chamber of the Bride;\nl
The golden Nimbus now is seen no more,\nl
No longer burns the white spiritual ray\nl
And hushed for ever is the secret Voice.\nl
Then by the Angel of the Vigil Tower\nl
A name is struck from the recording book;\nl
A flame that sang in Heaven sinks quenched and mute;\nl
In ruin ends the epic of a soul.\nl
This is the tragedy of the inner death\nl
When forfeited is the divine element\nl
And only a mind and body live to die.\nl

\spar For terrible agencies the Spirit allows\nl
And there are subtle and enormous Powers\nl
That shield themselves with the covering Ignorance.\nl
Offspring of the gulfs, agents of the shadowy Force,\nl
Haters of light, intolerant of peace,\nl
Aping to the thought the shining Friend and Guide,\nl
Opposing in the heart the eternal Will,\nl
They veil the occult uplifting Harmonist.\nl
His wisdom's oracles are made our bonds;\nl
The doors of God they have locked with keys of creed\nl
And shut out by the Law his tireless Grace.\nl
Along all Nature's lines they have set their posts\nl
And intercept the caravans of Light;\nl
Wherever the Gods act, they intervene.\nl
A yoke is laid upon the world's dim heart;\nl
Masked are its beats from the supernal Bliss,\nl
And the closed peripheries of brilliant Mind\nl
Block the fine entries of celestial Fire.\nl
Always the dark Adventurers seem to win;\nl
Page 225

Nature they fill with evil's institutes,\nl
Turn into defeats the victories of Truth,\nl
Proclaim as falsehoods the eternal laws,\nl
And load the dice of Doom with wizard lies;\nl
The world's shrines they have occupied, usurped its thrones.\nl
In scorn of the dwindling chances of the Gods\nl
They claim creation as their conquered fief\nl
And crown themselves the iron Lords of Time.\nl
Adepts of the illusion and the mask,\nl
The artificers of Nature's fall and pain\nl
Have built their altars of triumphant Night\nl
In the clay temple of terrestrial life.\nl
In the vacant precincts of the sacred Fire,\nl
In front of the reredos in the mystic rite\nl
Facing the dim velamen none can pierce,\nl
Intones his solemn hymn the mitred priest\nl
Invoking their dreadful presence in his breast:\nl
Attributing to them the awful Name\nl
He chants the syllables of the magic text\nl
And summons the unseen communion's act,\nl
While twixt the incense and the muttered prayer\nl
All the fierce bale with which the world is racked\nl
Is mixed in the foaming chalice of man's heart\nl
And poured to them like sacramental wine.\nl
Assuming names divine they guide and rule.\nl
Opponents of the Highest they have come\nl
Out of their world of soulless thought and power\nl
To serve by enmity the cosmic scheme.\nl
Night is their refuge and strategic base.\nl
Against the sword of Flame, the luminous Eye,\nl
Bastioned they live in massive forts of gloom,\nl
Calm and secure in sunless privacy:\nl
No wandering ray of Heaven can enter there.\nl
Armoured, protected by their lethal masks,\nl
As in a studio of creative Death\nl
The giant sons of Darkness sit and plan\nl
Page 226

The drama of the earth, their tragic stage.\nl
All who would raise the fallen world must come\nl
Under the dangerous arches of their power;\nl
For even the radiant children of the gods\nl
To darken their privilege is and dreadful right.\nl
None can reach heaven who has not passed through hell.\nl

\spar This too the traveller of the worlds must dare.\nl
A warrior in the dateless duel's strife,\nl
He entered into dumb despairing Night\nl
Challenging the darkness with his luminous soul.\nl
Alarming with his steps the threshold gloom\nl
He came into a fierce and dolorous realm\nl
Peopled by souls who never had tasted bliss;\nl
Ignorant like men born blind who know not light,\nl
They could equate worst ill with highest good,\nl
Virtue was to their eyes a face of sin\nl
And evil and misery were their natural state.\nl
A dire administration's penal code\nl
Making of grief and pain the common law,\nl
Decreeing universal joylessness\nl
Had changed life into a stoic sacrament\nl
And torture into a daily festival.\nl
An act was passed to chastise happiness;\nl
Laughter and pleasure were banned as deadly sins:\nl
A questionless mind was ranked as wise content,\nl
A dull heart's silent apathy as peace:\nl
Sleep was not there, torpor was the sole rest,\nl
Death came but neither respite gave nor end;\nl
Always the soul lived on and suffered more.\nl
Ever he deeper probed that kingdom of pain;\nl
Around him grew the terror of a world\nl
Of agony followed by worse agony,\nl
And in the terror a great wicked joy\nl
Glad of one's own and others' calamity.\nl
There thought and life were a long punishment,\nl
Page 227

The breath a burden and all hope a scourge,\nl
The body a field of torment, a massed unease;\nl
Repose was a waiting between pang and pang.\nl
This was the law of things none dreamed to change:\nl
A hard sombre heart, a harsh unsmiling mind\nl
Rejected happiness like a cloying sweet;\nl
Tranquillity was a tedium and ennui:\nl
Only by suffering life grew colourful;\nl
It needed the spice of pain, the salt of tears.\nl
If one could cease to be, all would be well;\nl
Else only fierce sensations gave some zest:\nl
A fury of jealousy burning the gnawed heart,\nl
The sting of murderous spite and hate and lust,\nl
The whisper that lures to the pit and treachery's stroke\nl
Threw vivid spots on the dull aching hours.\nl
To watch the drama of infelicity,\nl
The writhing of creatures under the harrow of doom\nl
And sorrow's tragic gaze into the night\nl
And horror and the hammering heart of fear\nl
Were the ingredients in Time's heavy cup\nl
That pleased and helped to enjoy its bitter taste.\nl
Of such fierce stuff was made up life's long hell:\nl
These were the threads of the dark spider's-web\nl
In which the soul was caught, quivering and rapt;\nl
This was religion, this was Nature's rule.\nl
In a fell chapel of iniquity\nl
To worship a black pitiless image of Power\nl
Kneeling one must cross hard-hearted stony courts,\nl
A pavement like a floor of evil fate.\nl
Each stone was a keen edge of ruthless force\nl
And glued with the chilled blood from tortured breasts;\nl
The dry gnarled trees stood up like dying men\nl
Stiffened into a pose of agony,\nl
And from each window peered an ominous priest\nl
Chanting Te Deums for slaughter's crowning grace,\nl
Uprooted cities, blasted human homes,\nl
Burned writhen bodies, the bombshell's massacre.\nl
Page 228

“Our enemies are fallen, are fallen,” they sang,\nl
“All who once stayed our will are smitten and dead;\nl
How great we are, how merciful art Thou.”\nl
Thus thought they to reach God's impassive throne\nl
And Him command whom all their acts opposed,\nl
Magnifying their deeds to touch his skies,\nl
And make him an accomplice of their crimes.\nl
There no relenting pity could have place,\nl
But ruthless strength and iron moods had sway,\nl
A dateless sovereignty of terror and gloom:\nl
This took the figure of a darkened God\nl
Revered by the racked wretchedness he had made,\nl
Who held in thrall a miserable world,\nl
And helpless hearts nailed to unceasing woe\nl
Adored the feet that trampled them into mire.\nl
It was a world of sorrow and of hate,\nl
Sorrow with hatred for its lonely joy,\nl
Hatred with others' sorrow as its feast;\nl
A bitter rictus curled the suffering mouth;\nl
A tragic cruelty saw its ominous chance.\nl
Hate was the black archangel of that realm;\nl
It glowed, a sombre jewel in the heart\nl
Burning the soul with its malignant rays,\nl
And wallowed in its fell abysm of might.\nl
These passions even objects seemed to exude,—\nl
For mind overflowed into the inanimate\nl
That answered with the wickedness it received,—\nl
Against their users used malignant powers,\nl
Hurt without hands and strangely, suddenly slew,\nl
Appointed as instruments of an unseen doom.\nl
Or they made themselves a fateful prison wall\nl
Where men condemned wake through the creeping hours\nl
Counted by the tollings of an ominous bell.\nl
An evil environment worsened evil souls:\nl
All things were conscious there and all perverse.\nl
In this infernal realm he dared to press\nl
Even into its deepest pit and darkest core,\nl
Page 229

Perturbed its tenebrous base, dared to contest\nl
Its ancient privileged right and absolute force:\nl
In Night he plunged to know her dreadful heart,\nl
In Hell he sought the root and cause of Hell.\nl
Its anguished gulfs opened in his own breast;\nl
He listened to clamours of its crowded pain,\nl
The heart-beats of its fatal loneliness.\nl
Above was a chill deaf eternity.\nl
In vague tremendous passages of Doom\nl
He heard the goblin Voice that guides to slay,\nl
And faced the enchantments of the demon Sign,\nl
And traversed the ambush of the opponent Snake.\nl
In menacing tracts, in tortured solitudes\nl
Companionless he roamed through desolate ways\nl
Where the red Wolf waits by the fordless stream\nl
And Death's black eagles scream to the precipice,\nl
And met the hounds of bale who hunt men's hearts\nl
Baying across the veldts of Destiny,\nl
In footless battlefields of the Abyss\nl
Fought shadowy combats in mute eyeless depths,\nl
Assaults of Hell endured and Titan strokes\nl
And bore the fierce inner wounds that are slow to heal.\nl
A prisoner of a hooded magic Force,\nl
Captured and trailed in Falsehood's lethal net\nl
And often strangled in the noose of grief,\nl
Or cast in the grim morass of swallowing doubt,\nl
Or shut into pits of error and despair,\nl
He drank her poison draughts till none was left.\nl
In a world where neither hope nor joy could come\nl
The ordeal he suffered of evil's absolute reign,\nl
Yet kept intact his spirit's radiant truth.\nl
Incapable of motion or of force,\nl
In Matter's blank denial gaoled and blind,\nl
Pinned to the black inertia of our base\nl
He treasured between his hands his flickering soul.\nl
His being ventured into mindless Void,\nl
Intolerant gulfs that knew not thought nor sense;\nl
Page 230

Thought ceased, sense failed, his soul still saw and knew.\nl
In atomic parcellings of the Infinite\nl
Near to the dumb beginnings of lost Self,\nl
He felt the curious small futility\nl
Of the creation of material things.\nl
Or, stifled in the Inconscient's hollow dusk,\nl
He sounded the mystery dark and bottomless\nl
Of the enormous and unmeaning deeps\nl
Whence struggling life in a dead universe rose.\nl
There in the stark identity lost by mind\nl
He felt the sealed sense of the insensible world\nl
And a mute wisdom in the unknowing Night.\nl
Into the abysmal secrecy he came\nl
Where darkness peers from her mattress, grey and nude,\nl
And stood on the last locked subconscient's floor\nl
Where Being slept unconscious of its thoughts\nl
And built the world not knowing what it built.\nl
There waiting its hour the future lay unknown,\nl
There is the record of the vanished stars.\nl
There in the slumber of the cosmic Will\nl
He saw the secret key of Nature's change.\nl
A light was with him, an invisible hand\nl
Was laid upon the error and the pain\nl
Till it became a quivering ecstasy,\nl
The shock of sweetness of an arm's embrace.\nl
He saw in Night the Eternal's shadowy veil,\nl
Knew death for a cellar of the house of life,\nl
In destruction felt creation's hasty pace,\nl
Knew loss as the price of a celestial gain\nl
And hell as a short cut to heaven's gates.\nl
Then in Illusion's occult factory\nl
And in the Inconscient's magic printing-house\nl
Torn were the formats of the primal Night\nl
And shattered the stereotypes of Ignorance.\nl
Alive, breathing a deep spiritual breath,\nl
Nature expunged her stiff mechanical code\nl
And the articles of the bound soul's contract,\nl
Page 231

Falsehood gave back to Truth her tortured shape.\nl
Annulled were the tables of the law of Pain,\nl
And in their place grew luminous characters.\nl
The skilful Penman's unseen finger wrote\nl
His swift intuitive calligraphy;\nl
Earth's forms were made his divine documents,\nl
The wisdom embodied mind could not reveal,\nl
Inconscience chased from the world's voiceless breast;\nl
Transfigured were the fixed schemes of reasoning Thought.\nl
Arousing consciousness in things inert,\nl
He imposed upon dark atom and dumb mass\nl
The diamond script of the Imperishable,\nl
Inscribed on the dim heart of fallen things\nl
A paean-song of the free Infinite\nl
And the Name, foundation of eternity,\nl
And traced on the awake exultant cells\nl
In the ideographs of the Ineffable\nl
The lyric of the love that waits through Time\nl
And the mystic volume of the Book of Bliss\nl
And the message of the superconscient Fire.\nl
Then life beat pure in the corporeal frame;\nl
The infernal Gleam died and could slay no more.\nl
Hell split across its huge abrupt fa\c{c}ade\nl
As if a magic building were undone,\nl
Night opened and vanished like a gulf of dream.\nl
Into being's gap scooped out as empty Space\nl
In which she had filled the place of absent God,\nl
There poured a wide intimate and blissful Dawn;\nl
Healed were all things that Time's torn heart had made\nl
And sorrow could live no more in Nature's breast:\nl
Division ceased to be, for God was there.\nl
The soul lit the conscious body with its ray,\nl
Matter and spirit mingled and were one.\nl
\rl{\fsc End of Canto Eight}
Page 232

\par
\ht Canto Nine: The Paradise of the Life-Gods
\par
\sbigcap Around him shone a great felicitous Day.\nl
A lustre of some rapturous Infinite,\nl
It held in the splendour of its golden laugh\nl
Regions of the heart's happiness set free,\nl
Intoxicated with the wine of God,\nl
Immersed in light, perpetually divine.\nl
A favourite and intimate of the Gods\nl
Obeying the divine command to joy,\nl
It was the sovereign of its own delight\nl
And master of the kingdoms of its force.\nl
Assured of the bliss for which all forms were made,\nl
Unmoved by fear and grief and the shocks of Fate\nl
And unalarmed by the breath of fleeting Time\nl
And unbesieged by adverse circumstance,\nl
It breathed in a sweet secure unguarded ease\nl
Free from our body's frailty inviting death,\nl
Far from our danger-zone of stumbling Will.\nl
It needed not to curb its passionate beats;\nl
Thrilled by the clasp of the warm satisfied sense\nl
And the swift wonder-rush and flame and cry\nl
Of the life-impulses' red magnificent race,\nl
It lived in a jewel-rhythm of the laughter of God\nl
And lay on the breast of universal love.\nl
Immune the unfettered Spirit of Delight\nl
Pastured his gleaming sun-herds and moon-flocks\nl
Along the lyric speed of griefless streams\nl
In fragrance of the unearthly asphodel.\nl
A silence of felicity wrapped the heavens,\nl
A careless radiance smiled upon the heights;\nl
A murmur of inarticulate ravishment\nl
Trembled in the winds and touched the enchanted soil;\nl
Page 233

Incessant in the arms of ecstasy\nl
Repeating its sweet involuntary note\nl
A sob of rapture flowed along the hours.\nl
Advancing under an arch of glory and peace,\nl
Traveller on plateau and on musing ridge,\nl
As one who sees in the World-Magician's glass\nl
A miracled imagery of soul-scapes flee\nl
He traversed scenes of an immortal joy\nl
And gazed into abysms of beauty and bliss.\nl
Around him was a light of conscious suns\nl
And a brooding gladness of great symbol things;\nl
To meet him crowded plains of brilliant calm,\nl
Mountains and violet valleys of the Blest,\nl
Deep glens of joy and crooning waterfalls\nl
And woods of quivering purple solitude;\nl
Below him lay like gleaming jewelled thoughts\nl
Rapt dreaming cities of Gandharva kings.\nl
Across the vibrant secrecies of Space\nl
A dim and happy music sweetly stole,\nl
Smitten by unseen hands he heard heart-close\nl
The harps' cry of the heavenly minstrels pass,\nl
And voices of unearthly melody\nl
Chanted the glory of eternal love\nl
In the white-blue-moonbeam air of Paradise.\nl
A summit and core of all that marvellous world,\nl
Apart stood high Elysian nameless hills,\nl
Burning like sunsets in a trance of eve.\nl
As if to some new unsearched profundity,\nl
Into a joyful stillness plunged their base;\nl
Their slopes through a hurry of laughter and voices sank,\nl
Crossed by a throng of singing rivulets,\nl
Adoring blue heaven with their happy hymn,\nl
Down into woods of shadowy secrecy:\nl
Lifted into wide voiceless mystery\nl
Their peaks climbed towards a greatness beyond life.\nl
The shining Edens of the vital gods\nl
Page 234

Received him in their deathless harmonies.\nl
All things were perfect there that flower in Time;\nl
Beauty was there creation's native mould,\nl
Peace was a thrilled voluptuous purity.\nl
There Love fulfilled her gold and roseate dreams\nl
And Strength her crowned and mighty reveries;\nl
Desire climbed up, a swift omnipotent flame,\nl
And Pleasure had the stature of the gods;\nl
Dream walked along the highways of the stars;\nl
Sweet common things turned into miracles:\nl
Overtaken by the spirit's sudden spell,\nl
Smitten by a divine passion's alchemy,\nl
Pain's self compelled transformed to potent joy\nl
Curing the antithesis twixt heaven and hell.\nl
All life's high visions are embodied there,\nl
Her wandering hopes achieved, her aureate combs\nl
Caught by the honey-eater's darting tongue,\nl
Her burning guesses changed to ecstasied truths,\nl
Her mighty pantings stilled in deathless calm\nl
And liberated her immense desires.\nl
In that paradise of perfect heart and sense\nl
No lower note could break the endless charm\nl
Of her sweetness ardent and immaculate;\nl
Her steps are sure of their intuitive fall.\nl
After the anguish of the soul's long strife\nl
At length were found calm and celestial rest\nl
And, lapped in a magic flood of sorrowless hours,\nl
Healed were his warrior nature's wounded limbs\nl
In the encircling arms of Energies\nl
That brooked no stain and feared not their own bliss.\nl
In scenes forbidden to our pallid sense\nl
Amid miraculous scents and wonder-hues\nl
He met the forms that divinise the sight,\nl
To music that can immortalise the mind\nl
And make the heart wide as infinity\nl
Listened, and captured the inaudible\nl
Page 235

Cadences that awake the occult ear:\nl
Out of the ineffable hush it hears them come\nl
Trembling with the beauty of a wordless speech,\nl
And thoughts too great and deep to find a voice,\nl
Thoughts whose desire new-makes the universe.\nl
A scale of sense that climbed with fiery feet\nl
To heights of unimagined happiness,\nl
Recast his being's aura in joy-glow,\nl
His body glimmered like a skiey shell;\nl
His gates to the world were swept with seas of light.\nl
His earth, dowered with celestial competence,\nl
Harboured a power that needed now no more\nl
To cross the closed customs-line of mind and flesh\nl
And smuggle godhead into humanity.\nl
It shrank no more from the supreme demand\nl
Of an untired capacity for bliss,\nl
A might that could explore its own infinite\nl
And beauty and passion and the depths' reply\nl
Nor feared the swoon of glad identity\nl
Where spirit and flesh in inner ecstasy join\nl
Annulling the quarrel between self and shape.\nl
It drew from sight and sound spiritual power,\nl
Made sense a road to reach the intangible:\nl
It thrilled with the supernal influences\nl
That build the substance of life's deeper soul.\nl
Earth-nature stood reborn, comrade of heaven.\nl
A fit companion of the timeless Kings,\nl
Equalled with the godheads of the living Suns,\nl
He mixed in the radiant pastimes of the Unborn,\nl
Heard whispers of the Player never seen\nl
And listened to his voice that steals the heart\nl
And draws it to the breast of God's desire,\nl
And felt its honey of felicity\nl
Flow through his veins like the rivers of Paradise,\nl
Made body a nectar-cup of the Absolute.\nl
In sudden moments of revealing flame,\nl
Page 236

In passionate responses half-unveiled\nl
He reached the rim of ecstasies unknown;\nl
A touch supreme surprised his hurrying heart,\nl
The clasp was remembered of the Wonderful,\nl
And hints leaped down of white beatitudes.\nl
Eternity drew close disguised as Love\nl
And laid its hand upon the body of Time.\nl
A little gift comes from the Immensitudes,\nl
But measureless to life its gain of joy;\nl
All the untold Beyond is mirrored there.\nl
A giant drop of the Bliss unknowable\nl
Overwhelmed his limbs and round his soul became\nl
A fiery ocean of felicity;\nl
He foundered drowned in sweet and burning vasts:\nl
The dire delight that could shatter mortal flesh,\nl
The rapture that the gods sustain he bore.\nl
Immortal pleasure cleansed him in its waves\nl
And turned his strength into undying power.\nl
Immortality captured Time and carried Life.\nl
\rl{\fsc End of Canto Nine}
Page 237

\par
\ht Canto Ten: The Kingdoms and Godheads of the Little Mind
\par
\sbigcap This too must now be overpassed and left,\nl
As all must be until the Highest is gained\nl
In whom the world and self grow true and one:\nl
Till That is reached our journeying cannot cease.\nl
Always a nameless goal beckons beyond,\nl
Always ascends the zigzag of the gods\nl
And upward points the spirit's climbing Fire.\nl
This breath of hundred-hued felicity\nl
And its pure heightened figure of Time's joy,\nl
Tossed upon waves of flawless happiness,\nl
Hammered into single beats of ecstasy,\nl
This fraction of the spirit's integer\nl
Caught into a passionate greatness of extremes,\nl
This limited being lifted to zenith bliss,\nl
Happy to enjoy one touch of things supreme,\nl
Packed into its sealed small infinity,\nl
Its endless time-made world outfacing Time,\nl
A little output of God's vast delight.\nl
The moments stretched towards the eternal Now,\nl
The hours discovered immortality,\nl
But, satisfied with their sublime contents,\nl
On peaks they ceased whose tops half-way to Heaven\nl
Pointed to an apex they could never mount,\nl
To a grandeur in whose air they could not live.\nl
Inviting to their high and exquisite sphere,\nl
To their secure and fine extremities\nl
This creature who hugs his limits to feel safe,\nl
These heights declined a greater adventure's call.\nl
A glory and sweetness of satisfied desire\nl
Tied up the spirit to golden posts of bliss.\nl
It could not house the wideness of a soul\nl
Page 238

Which needed all infinity for its home.\nl
A memory soft as grass and faint as sleep,\nl
The beauty and call receding sank behind\nl
Like a sweet song heard fading far away\nl
Upon the long high road to Timelessness.\nl
Above was an ardent white tranquillity.\nl
A musing spirit looked out on the worlds\nl
And like a brilliant clambering of skies\nl
Passing through clarity to an unseen Light\nl
Large lucent realms of Mind from stillness shone.\nl
But first he met a silver-grey expanse\nl
Where Day and Night had wedded and were one:\nl
It was a tract of dim and shifting rays\nl
Parting Life's sentient flow from Thought's self-poise.\nl
A coalition of uncertainties\nl
There exercised uneasy government\nl
On a ground reserved for doubt and reasoned guess,\nl
A rendezvous of Knowledge with Ignorance.\nl
At its low extremity held difficult sway\nl
A mind that hardly saw and slowly found;\nl
Its nature to our earthly nature close\nl
And kin to our precarious mortal thought\nl
That looks from soil to sky and sky to soil\nl
But knows not the below nor the beyond,\nl
It only sensed itself and outward things.\nl
This was the first means of our slow ascent\nl
From the half-conscience of the animal soul\nl
Living in a crowded press of shape-events\nl
In a realm it cannot understand nor change;\nl
Only it sees and acts in a given scene\nl
And feels and joys and sorrows for a while.\nl
The ideas that drive the obscure embodied spirit\nl
Along the roads of suffering and desire\nl
In a world that struggles to discover Truth,\nl
Found here their power to be and Nature-force.\nl
Here are devised the forms of an ignorant life\nl
Page 239

That sees the empiric fact as settled law,\nl
Labours for the hour and not for eternity\nl
And trades its gains to meet the moment's call:\nl
The slow process of a material mind\nl
Which serves the body it should rule and use\nl
And needs to lean upon an erring sense,\nl
Was born in that luminous obscurity.\nl
Advancing tardily from a limping start,\nl
Crutching hypothesis on argument,\nl
Throning its theories as certitudes,\nl
It reasons from the half-known to the unknown,\nl
Ever constructing its frail house of thought,\nl
Ever undoing the web that it has spun.\nl
A twilight sage whose shadow seems to him self,\nl
Moving from minute to brief minute lives;\nl
A king dependent on his satellites\nl
Signs the decrees of ignorant ministers,\nl
A judge in half-possession of his proofs,\nl
A voice clamant of uncertainty's postulates,\nl
An architect of knowledge, not its source.\nl
This powerful bondslave of his instruments\nl
Thinks his low station Nature's highest top,\nl
Oblivious of his share in all things made\nl
And haughtily humble in his own conceit\nl
Believes himself a spawn of Matter's mud\nl
And takes his own creations for his cause.\nl
To eternal light and knowledge meant to rise,\nl
Up from man's bare beginning is our climb;\nl
Out of earth's heavy smallness we must break,\nl
We must search our nature with spiritual fire:\nl
An insect crawl preludes our glorious flight;\nl
Our human state cradles the future god,\nl
Our mortal frailty an immortal force.\nl
\sparn At the glow-worm top of these pale glimmer-realms\nl
Where dawn-sheen gambolled with the native dusk\nl
And helped the Day to grow and Night to fail,\nl
Page 240

Escaping over a wide and shimmering bridge,\nl
He came into a realm of early Light\nl
And the regency of a half-risen sun.\nl
Out of its rays our mind's full orb was born.\nl
Appointed by the Spirit of the Worlds\nl
To mediate with the unknowing depths,\nl
A prototypal deft Intelligence\nl
Half-poised on equal wings of thought and doubt\nl
Toiled ceaselessly twixt being's hidden ends.\nl
A Secrecy breathed in life's moving act;\nl
A covert nurse of Nature's miracles,\nl
It shaped life's wonders out of Matter's mud:\nl
It cut the pattern of the shapes of things,\nl
It pitched mind's tent in the vague ignorant Vast.\nl
A master Magician of measure and device\nl
Has made an eternity from recurring forms\nl
And to the wandering spectator thought\nl
Assigned a seat on the inconscient stage.\nl
On earth by the will of this Arch-Intelligence\nl
A bodiless energy put on Matter's robe;\nl
Proton and photon served the imager Eye\nl
To change things subtle into a physical world\nl
And the invisible appeared as shape\nl
And the impalpable was felt as mass:\nl
Magic of percept joined with concept's art\nl
And lent to each object an interpreting name:\nl
Idea was disguised in a body's artistry,\nl
And by a strange atomic law's mystique\nl
A frame was made in which the sense could put\nl
Its symbol picture of the universe.\nl
Even a greater miracle was done.\nl
The mediating light linked body's power,\nl
The sleep and dreaming of the tree and plant,\nl
The animal's vibrant sense, the thought in man,\nl
To the effulgence of a Ray above.\nl
Its skill endorsing Matter's right to think\nl
Page 241

Cut sentient passages for the mind of flesh\nl
And found a means for Nescience to know.\nl
Offering its little squares and cubes of word\nl
As figured substitutes for reality,\nl
A mummified mnemonic alphabet,\nl
It helped the unseeing Force to read her works.\nl
A buried consciousness arose in her\nl
And now she dreams herself human and awake.\nl
But all was still a mobile Ignorance;\nl
Still Knowledge could not come and firmly grasp\nl
This huge invention seen as a universe.\nl
A specialist of logic's hard machine\nl
Imposed its rigid artifice on the soul;\nl
An aide of the inventor intellect,\nl
It cut Truth into manageable bits\nl
That each might have his ration of thought-food,\nl
Then new-built Truth's slain body by its art:\nl
A robot exact and serviceable and false\nl
Displaced the spirit's finer view of things:\nl
A polished engine did the work of a god.\nl
None the true body found, its soul seemed dead:\nl
None had the inner look which sees Truth's whole;\nl
All glorified the glittering substitute.\nl
Then from the secret heights a wave swept down,\nl
A brilliant chaos of rebel light arose;\nl
It looked above and saw the dazzling peaks,\nl
It looked within and woke the sleeping god.\nl
Imagination called her shining squads\nl
That venture into undiscovered scenes\nl
Where all the marvels lurk none yet has known:\nl
Lifting her beautiful and miraculous head,\nl
She conspired with inspiration's sister brood\nl
To fill thought's skies with glimmering nebulae.\nl
A bright Error fringed the mystery-altar's frieze;\nl
Darkness grew nurse to wisdom's occult sun,\nl
Myth suckled knowledge with her lustrous milk;\nl
Page 242

The infant passed from dim to radiant breasts.\nl
Thus worked the Power upon the growing world;\nl
Its subtle craft withheld the full-orbed blaze,\nl
Cherished the soul's childhood and on fictions fed\nl
Far richer in their sweet and nectarous sap\nl
Nourishing its immature divinity\nl
Than the staple or dry straw of Reason's tilth,\nl
Its heaped fodder of innumerable facts,\nl
Plebeian fare on which today we thrive.\nl
Thus streamed down from the realm of early Light\nl
Ethereal thinkings into Matter's world;\nl
Its gold-horned herds trooped into earth's cave-heart.\nl
Its morning rays illume our twilight's eyes,\nl
Its young formations move the mind of earth\nl
To labour and to dream and new-create,\nl
To feel beauty's touch and know the world and self:\nl
The Golden Child began to think and see.\nl

\spar In those bright realms are Mind's first forward steps.\nl
Ignorant of all but eager to know all,\nl
Its curious slow enquiry there begins;\nl
Ever its searching grasps at shapes around,\nl
Ever it hopes to find out greater things.\nl
Ardent and golden-gleamed with sunrise fires,\nl
Alert it lives upon invention's verge.\nl
Yet all it does is on an infant's scale,\nl
As if the cosmos were a nursery game,\nl
Mind, life the playthings of a Titan's babe.\nl
As one it works who builds a mimic fort\nl
Miraculously stable for a while,\nl
Made of the sands upon a bank of Time\nl
Mid an occult eternity's shoreless sea.\nl
A small keen instrument the great Puissance chose,\nl
An arduous pastime passionately pursues;\nl
To teach the Ignorance is her difficult charge,\nl
Her thought starts from an original nescient Void\nl
Page 243

And what she teaches she herself must learn\nl
Arousing knowledge from its sleepy lair.\nl
For knowledge comes not to us as a guest\nl
Called into our chamber from the outer world;\nl
A friend and inmate of our secret self,\nl
It hid behind our minds and fell asleep\nl
And slowly wakes beneath the blows of life;\nl
The mighty daemon lies unshaped within,\nl
To evoke, to give it form is Nature's task.\nl
All was a chaos of the true and false,\nl
Mind sought amid deep mists of Nescience;\nl
It looked within itself but saw not God.\nl
A material interim diplomacy\nl
Denied the Truth that transient truths might live\nl
And hid the Deity in creed and guess\nl
That the World-Ignorance might grow slowly wise.\nl
This was the imbroglio made by sovereign Mind\nl
Looking from a gleam-ridge into the Night\nl
In her first tamperings with Inconscience:\nl
Its alien dusk baffles her luminous eyes;\nl
Her rapid hands must learn a cautious zeal;\nl
Only a slow advance the earth can bear.\nl
Yet was her strength unlike the unseeing earth's\nl
Compelled to handle makeshift instruments\nl
Invented by the life-force and the flesh.\nl
Earth all perceives through doubtful images,\nl
All she conceives in hazardous jets of sight,\nl
Small lights kindled by touches of groping thought.\nl
Incapable of the soul's direct inlook\nl
She sees by spasms and solders knowledge-scrap,\nl
Makes Truth the slave-girl of her indigence,\nl
Expelling Nature's mystic unity\nl
Cuts into quantum and mass the moving All;\nl
She takes for measuring-rod her ignorance.\nl
In her own domain a pontiff and a seer,\nl
That greater Power with her half-risen sun\nl
Page 244

Wrought within limits but possessed her field;\nl
She knew by a privilege of thinking force\nl
And claimed an infant sovereignty of sight.\nl
In her eyes however darkly fringed was lit\nl
The Archangel's gaze who knows inspired his acts\nl
And shapes a world in its far-seeing flame.\nl
In her own realm she stumbles not nor fails,\nl
But moves in boundaries of subtle power\nl
Across which mind can step towards the sun.\nl
A candidate for a higher suzerainty,\nl
A passage she cut through from Night to Light,\nl
And searched for an ungrasped Omniscience.\nl

\spar A dwarf three-bodied trinity was her serf.\nl
First, smallest of the three, but strong of limb,\nl
A low-brow with a square and heavy jowl,\nl
A pigmy Thought needing to live in bounds\nl
For ever stooped to hammer fact and form.\nl
Absorbed and cabined in external sight,\nl
It takes its stand on Nature's solid base.\nl
A technician admirable, a thinker crude,\nl
A riveter of Life to habit's grooves,\nl
Obedient to gross Matter's tyranny,\nl
A prisoner of the moulds in which it works,\nl
It binds itself by what itself creates.\nl
A slave of a fixed mass of absolute rules,\nl
It sees as Law the habits of the world,\nl
It sees as Truth the habits of the mind.\nl
In its realm of concrete images and events\nl
Turning in a worn circle of ideas\nl
And ever repeating old familiar acts,\nl
It lives content with the common and the known.\nl
It loves the old ground that was its dwelling-place:\nl
Abhorring change as an audacious sin,\nl
Distrustful of each new discovery\nl
Only it advances step by careful step\nl
Page 245

And fears as if a deadly abyss the unknown.\nl
A prudent treasurer of its ignorance,\nl
It shrinks from adventure, blinks at glorious hope,\nl
Preferring a safe foothold upon things\nl
To the dangerous joy of wideness and of height.\nl
The world's slow impressions on its labouring mind,\nl
Tardy imprints almost indelible,\nl
Increase their value by their poverty;\nl
The old sure memories are its capital stock:\nl
Only what sense can grasp seems absolute:\nl
External fact it figures as sole truth,\nl
Wisdom identifies with the earthward look,\nl
And things long known and actions always done\nl
Are to its clinging hold a balustrade\nl
Of safety on the perilous stair of Time.\nl
Heaven's trust to it are the established ancient ways,\nl
Immutable laws man has no right to change,\nl
A sacred legacy from the great dead past\nl
Or the one road that God has made for life,\nl
A firm shape of Nature never to be changed,\nl
Part of the huge routine of the universe.\nl
A smile from the Preserver of the Worlds\nl
Sent down of old this guardian Mind to earth\nl
That all might stand in their fixed changeless type\nl
And from their secular posture never move.\nl
One sees it circling faithful to its task,\nl
Tireless in an assigned tradition's round;\nl
In decayed and crumbling offices of Time\nl
It keeps close guard in front of custom's wall,\nl
Or in an ancient Night's dim environs\nl
It dozes on a little courtyard's stones\nl
And barks at every unfamiliar light\nl
As at a foe who would break up its home,\nl
A watch-dog of the spirit's sense-railed house\nl
Against intruders from the Invisible,\nl
Nourished on scraps of life and Matter's bones\nl
Page 246

In its kennel of objective certitude.\nl
And yet behind it stands a cosmic might:\nl
A measured Greatness keeps its vaster plan,\nl
A fathomless sameness rhythms the tread of life;\nl
The stars' changeless orbits furrow inert Space,\nl
A million species follow one mute Law.\nl
A huge inertness is the world's defence,\nl
Even in change is treasured changelessness;\nl
Into inertia revolution sinks,\nl
In a new dress the old resumes its role;\nl
The Energy acts, the stable is its seal:\nl
On Shiva's breast is stayed the enormous dance.\nl
\sparn A fiery spirit came, next of the three.\nl
A hunchback rider of the red Wild-Ass,\nl
A rash Intelligence leaped down lion-maned\nl
From the great mystic Flame that rings the worlds\nl
And with its dire edge eats at being's heart.\nl
Thence sprang the burning vision of Desire.\nl
A thousand shapes it wore, took numberless names:\nl
A need of multitude and uncertainty\nl
Pricks it for ever to pursue the One\nl
On countless roads across the vasts of Time\nl
Through circuits of unending difference.\nl
It burns all breasts with an ambiguous fire.\nl
A radiance gleaming on a murky stream,\nl
It flamed towards heaven, then sank, engulfed, towards hell;\nl
It climbed to drag down Truth into the mire\nl
And used for muddy ends its brilliant Force;\nl
A huge chameleon gold and blue and red\nl
Turning to black and grey and lurid brown,\nl
Hungry it stared from a mottled bough of life\nl
To snap up insect joys, its favourite food,\nl
The dingy sustenance of a sumptuous frame\nl
Nursing the splendid passion of its hues.\nl
A snake of flame with a dull cloud for tail,\nl
Followed by a dream-brood of glittering thoughts,\nl
Page 247

A lifted head with many-tinged flickering crests,\nl
It licked at knowledge with a smoky tongue.\nl
A whirlpool sucking in an empty air,\nl
It based on vacancy stupendous claims,\nl
In Nothingness born to Nothingness returned,\nl
Yet all the time unwittingly it drove\nl
Towards the hidden Something that is All.\nl
Ardent to find, incapable to retain,\nl
A brilliant instability was its mark,\nl
To err its inborn trend, its native cue.\nl
At once to an unreflecting credence prone,\nl
It thought all true that flattered its own hopes;\nl
It cherished golden nothings born of wish,\nl
It snatched at the unreal for provender.\nl
In darkness it discovered luminous shapes;\nl
Peering into a shadow-hung half-light\nl
It saw hued images scrawled on Fancy's cave;\nl
Or it swept in circles through conjecture's night\nl
And caught in imagination's camera\nl
Bright scenes of promise held by transient flares,\nl
Fixed in life's air the feet of hurrying dreams,\nl
Kept prints of passing Forms and hooded Powers\nl
And flash-images of half-seen verities.\nl
An eager spring to seize and to possess\nl
Unguided by reason or the seeing soul\nl
Was its first natural motion and its last,\nl
It squandered life's force to achieve the impossible:\nl
It scorned the straight road and ran on wandering curves\nl
And left what it had won for untried things;\nl
It saw unrealised aims as instant fate\nl
And chose the precipice for its leap to heaven.\nl
Adventure its system in the gamble of life,\nl
It took fortuitous gains as safe results;\nl
Error discouraged not its confident view\nl
Ignorant of the deep law of being's ways\nl
And failure could not slow its fiery clutch;\nl
Page 248

One chance made true warranted all the rest.\nl
Attempt, not victory, was the charm of life.\nl
An uncertain winner of uncertain stakes,\nl
Instinct its dam and the life-mind its sire,\nl
It ran its race and came in first or last.\nl
Yet were its works nor small and vain nor null;\nl
It nursed a portion of infinity's strength\nl
And could create the high things its fancy willed;\nl
Its passion caught what calm intelligence missed.\nl
Insight of impulse laid its leaping grasp\nl
On heavens high Thought had hidden in dazzling mist,\nl
Caught glimmers that revealed a lurking sun:\nl
It probed the void and found a treasure there.\nl
A half-intuition purpled in its sense;\nl
It threw the lightning's fork and hit the unseen.\nl
It saw in the dark and vaguely blinked in the light,\nl
Ignorance was its field, the unknown its prize.\nl
\sparn Of all these Powers the greatest was the last.\nl
Arriving late from a far plane of thought\nl
Into a packed irrational world of Chance\nl
Where all was grossly felt and blindly done,\nl
Yet the haphazard seemed the inevitable,\nl
Came Reason, the squat godhead artisan,\nl
To her narrow house upon a ridge in Time.\nl
Adept of clear contrivance and design,\nl
A pensive face and close and peering eyes,\nl
She took her firm and irremovable seat,\nl
The strongest, wisest of the troll-like Three.\nl
Armed with her lens and measuring-rod and probe,\nl
She looked upon an object universe\nl
And the multitudes that in it live and die\nl
And the body of Space and the fleeing soul of Time,\nl
And took the earth and stars into her hands\nl
To try what she could make of these strange things.\nl
In her strong purposeful laborious mind,\nl
Inventing her scheme-lines of reality\nl
Page 249

And the geometric curves of her time-plan,\nl
She multiplied her slow half-cuts at Truth:\nl
Impatient of enigma and the unknown,\nl
Intolerant of the lawless and the unique,\nl
Imposing reflection on the march of Force,\nl
Imposing clarity on the unfathomable,\nl
She strove to reduce to rules the mystic world.\nl
Nothing she knew but all things hoped to know.\nl
In dark inconscient realms once void of thought,\nl
Missioned by a supreme Intelligence\nl
To throw its ray upon the obscure Vast,\nl
An imperfect light leading an erring mass\nl
By the power of sense and the idea and word,\nl
She ferrets out Nature's process, substance, cause.\nl
All life to harmonise by thought's control,\nl
She with the huge imbroglio struggles still;\nl
Ignorant of all but her own seeking mind\nl
To save the world from Ignorance she came.\nl
A sovereign worker through the centuries\nl
Observing and remoulding all that is,\nl
Confident she took up her stupendous charge.\nl
There the low bent and mighty figure sits\nl
Bowed under the arc-lamps of her factory home\nl
Amid the clatter and ringing of her tools.\nl
A rigorous stare in her creative eyes\nl
Coercing the plastic stuff of cosmic Mind,\nl
She sets the hard inventions of her brain\nl
In a pattern of eternal fixity:\nl
Indifferent to the cosmic dumb demand,\nl
Unconscious of too close realities,\nl
Of the unspoken thought, the voiceless heart,\nl
She leans to forge her credos and iron codes\nl
And metal structures to imprison life\nl
And mechanic models of all things that are.\nl
For the world seen she weaves a world conceived:\nl
She spins in stiff but unsubstantial lines\nl
Page 250

Her gossamer word-webs of abstract thought,\nl
Her segment systems of the Infinite,\nl
Her theodicies and cosmogonic charts\nl
And myths by which she explains the inexplicable.\nl
At will she spaces in thin air of mind\nl
Like maps in the school-house of intellect hung,\nl
Forcing wide Truth into a narrow scheme,\nl
Her numberless warring strict philosophies;\nl
Out of Nature's body of phenomenon\nl
She carves with Thought's keen edge in rigid lines,\nl
Like rails for the World-Magician's power to run,\nl
Her sciences precise and absolute.\nl
On the huge bare walls of human nescience\nl
Written round Nature's deep dumb hieroglyphs\nl
She pens in clear demotic characters\nl
The vast encyclopaedia of her thoughts;\nl
An algebra of her mathematics' signs,\nl
Her numbers and unerring formulas\nl
She builds to clinch her summary of things.\nl
On all sides runs as if in a cosmic mosque\nl
Tracing the scriptural verses of her laws\nl
The daedal of her patterned arabesques,\nl
Art of her wisdom, artifice of her lore.\nl
This art, this artifice are her only stock.\nl
In her high works of pure intelligence,\nl
In her withdrawal from the senses' trap,\nl
There comes no breaking of the walls of mind,\nl
There leaps no rending flash of absolute power,\nl
There dawns no light of heavenly certitude.\nl
A million faces wears her knowledge here\nl
And every face is turbaned with a doubt.\nl
All now is questioned, all reduced to nought.\nl
Once monumental in their massive craft\nl
Her old great mythic writings disappear\nl
And into their place start strict ephemeral signs;\nl
This constant change spells progress to her eyes:\nl
Page 251

Her thought is an endless march without a goal.\nl
There is no summit on which she can stand\nl
And see in a single glance the Infinite's whole.\nl
\sparn An inconclusive play is Reason's toil.\nl
Each strong idea can use her as its tool;\nl
Accepting every brief she pleads her case.\nl
Open to every thought, she cannot know.\nl
The eternal Advocate seated as judge\nl
Armours in logic's invulnerable mail\nl
A thousand combatants for Truth's veiled throne\nl
And sets on a high horse-back of argument\nl
To tilt for ever with a wordy lance\nl
In a mock tournament where none can win.\nl
Assaying thought's values with her rigid tests\nl
Balanced she sits on wide and empty air,\nl
Aloof and pure in her impartial poise.\nl
Absolute her judgments seem but none is sure;\nl
Time cancels all her verdicts in appeal.\nl
Although like sunbeams to our glow-worm mind\nl
Her knowledge feigns to fall from a clear heaven,\nl
Its rays are a lantern's lustres in the Night;\nl
She throws a glittering robe on Ignorance.\nl
But now is lost her ancient sovereign claim\nl
To rule mind's high realm in her absolute right,\nl
Bind thought with logic's forged infallible chain\nl
Or see truth nude in a bright abstract haze.\nl
A master and slave of stark phenomenon,\nl
She travels on the roads of erring sight\nl
Or looks upon a set mechanical world\nl
Constructed for her by her instruments.\nl
A bullock yoked in the cart of proven fact,\nl
She drags huge knowledge-bales through Matter's dust\nl
To reach utility's immense bazaar.\nl
Apprentice she has grown to her old drudge;\nl
An aided sense is her seeking's arbiter.\nl
This now she uses as the assayer's stone.\nl
Page 252

As if she knew not facts are husks of truth,\nl
The husks she keeps, the kernel throws aside.\nl
An ancient wisdom fades into the past,\nl
The ages' faith becomes an idle tale,\nl
God passes out of the awakened thought,\nl
An old discarded dream needed no more:\nl
Only she seeks mechanic Nature's keys.\nl
Interpreting stone-laws inevitable\nl
She digs into Matter's hard concealing soil,\nl
To unearth the processes of all things done.\nl
A loaded huge self-worked machine appears\nl
To her eye's eager and admiring stare,\nl
An intricate and meaningless enginery\nl
Of ordered fateful and unfailing Chance:\nl
Ingenious and meticulous and minute,\nl
Its brute unconscious accurate device\nl
Unrolls an unerring march, maps a sure road;\nl
It plans without thinking, acts without a will,\nl
A million purposes serves with purpose none\nl
And builds a rational world without a mind.\nl
It has no mover, no maker, no idea:\nl
Its vast self-action toils without a cause;\nl
A lifeless Energy irresistibly driven,\nl
Death's head on the body of Necessity,\nl
Engenders life and fathers consciousness,\nl
Then wonders why all was and whence it came.\nl
Our thoughts are parts of the immense machine,\nl
Our ponderings but a freak of Matter's law,\nl
The mystic's lore was a fancy or a blind;\nl
Of soul or spirit we have now no need:\nl
Matter is the admirable Reality,\nl
The patent unescapable miracle,\nl
The hard truth of things, simple, eternal, sole.\nl
A suicidal rash expenditure\nl
Creating the world by a mystery of self-loss\nl
Has poured its scattered works on empty Space;\nl
Page 253

Late shall the self-disintegrating Force\nl
Contract the immense expansion it has made:\nl
Then ends this mighty and unmeaning toil,\nl
The Void is left bare, vacant as before.\nl
Thus vindicated, crowned, the grand new Thought\nl
Explained the world and mastered all its laws,\nl
Touched the dumb roots, woke veiled tremendous powers;\nl
It bound to service the unconscious djinns\nl
That sleep unused in Matter's ignorant trance.\nl
All was precise, rigid, indubitable.\nl
But when on Matter's rock of ages based\nl
A whole stood up firm and clear-cut and safe,\nl
All staggered back into a sea of doubt;\nl
This solid scheme melted in endless flux:\nl
She had met the formless Power inventor of forms;\nl
Suddenly she stumbled upon things unseen:\nl
A lightning from the undiscovered Truth\nl
Startled her eyes with its perplexing glare\nl
And dug a gulf between the Real and Known\nl
Till all her knowledge seemed an ignorance.\nl
Once more the world was made a wonder-web,\nl
A magic's process in a magical space,\nl
An unintelligible miracle's depths\nl
Whose source is lost in the Ineffable.\nl
Once more we face the blank Unknowable.\nl
In a crash of values, in a huge doom-crack,\nl
In the sputter and scatter of her breaking work\nl
She lost her clear conserved constructed world.\nl
A quantum dance remained, a sprawl of chance\nl
In Energy's stupendous tripping whirl:\nl
A ceaseless motion in the unbounded Void\nl
Invented forms without a thought or aim:\nl
Necessity and Cause were shapeless ghosts;\nl
Matter was an incident in being's flow,\nl
Law but a clock-work habit of blind force.\nl
Ideals, ethics, systems had no base\nl
Page 254

And soon collapsed or without sanction lived;\nl
All grew a chaos, a heave and clash and strife.\nl
Ideas warring and fierce leaped upon life;\nl
A hard compression held down anarchy\nl
And liberty was only a phantom's name:\nl
Creation and destruction waltzed inarmed\nl
On the bosom of a torn and quaking earth;\nl
All reeled into a world of Kali's dance.\nl
Thus tumbled, sinking, sprawling in the Void,\nl
Clutching for props, a soil on which to stand,\nl
She only saw a thin atomic Vast,\nl
The rare-point sparse substratum universe\nl
On which floats a solid world's phenomenal face.\nl
Alone a process of events was there\nl
And Nature's plastic and protean change\nl
And, strong by death to slay or to create,\nl
The riven invisible atom's omnipotent force.\nl
One chance remained that here might be a power\nl
To liberate man from the old inadequate means\nl
And leave him sovereign of the earthly scene.\nl
For Reason then might grasp the original Force\nl
To drive her car upon the roads of Time.\nl
All then might serve the need of the thinking race,\nl
An absolute State found order's absolute,\nl
To a standardised perfection cut all things,\nl
In society build a just exact machine.\nl
Then science and reason careless of the soul\nl
Could iron out a tranquil uniform world,\nl
Aeonic seekings glut with outward truths\nl
And a single-patterned thinking force on mind,\nl
Inflicting Matter's logic on Spirit's dreams\nl
A reasonable animal make of man\nl
And a symmetrical fabric of his life.\nl
This would be Nature's peak on an obscure globe,\nl
The grand result of the long ages' toil,\nl
Earth's evolution crowned, her mission done.\nl
Page 255

So might it be if the spirit fell asleep;\nl
Man then might rest content and live in peace,\nl
Master of Nature who once her bondslave worked,\nl
The world's disorder hardening into Law,—\nl
If Life's dire heart arose not in revolt,\nl
If God within could find no greater plan.\nl
But many-visaged is the cosmic Soul;\nl
A touch can alter the fixed front of Fate.\nl
A sudden turn can come, a road appear.\nl
A greater Mind may see a greater Truth,\nl
Or we may find when all the rest has failed\nl
Hid in ourselves the key of perfect change.\nl
Ascending from the soil where creep our days,\nl
Earth's consciousness may marry with the Sun,\nl
Our mortal life ride on the spirit's wings,\nl
Our finite thoughts commune with the Infinite.\nl
\sparn In the bright kingdoms of the rising Sun\nl
All is a birth into a power of light:\nl
All here deformed guards there its happy shape,\nl
Here all is mixed and marred, there pure and whole;\nl
Yet each is a passing step, a moment's phase.\nl
Awake to a greater Truth beyond her acts,\nl
The mediatrix sat and saw her works\nl
And felt the marvel in them and the force\nl
But knew the power behind the face of Time:\nl
She did the task, obeyed the knowledge given,\nl
Her deep heart yearned towards great ideal things\nl
And from the light looked out to wider light:\nl
A brilliant hedge drawn round her narrowed her power;\nl
Faithful to her limited sphere she toiled, but knew\nl
Its highest, widest seeing was a half-search,\nl
Its mightiest acts a passage or a stage.\nl
For not by Reason was creation made\nl
And not by Reason can the Truth be seen\nl
Which through the veils of thought, the screens of sense\nl
Hardly the spirit's vision can descry\nl
Page 256

Dimmed by the imperfection of its means:\nl
The little Mind is tied to little things:\nl
Its sense is but the spirit's outward touch,\nl
Half-waked in a world of dark Inconscience;\nl
It feels out for its beings and its forms\nl
Like one left fumbling in the ignorant Night.\nl
In this small mould of infant mind and sense\nl
Desire is a child-heart's cry crying for bliss,\nl
Our reason only a toys' artificer,\nl
A rule-maker in a strange stumbling game.\nl
But she her dwarf aides knew whose confident sight\nl
A bounded prospect took for the far goal.\nl
The world she has made is an interim report\nl
Of a traveller towards the half-found truth in things\nl
Moving twixt nescience and nescience.\nl
For nothing is known while aught remains concealed;\nl
The Truth is known only when all is seen.\nl
Attracted by the All that is the One,\nl
She yearns towards a higher light than hers;\nl
Hid by her cults and creeds she has glimpsed God's face:\nl
She knows she has but found a form, a robe,\nl
But ever she hopes to see him in her heart\nl
And feel the body of his reality.\nl
As yet a mask is there and not a brow,\nl
Although sometimes two hidden eyes appear:\nl
Reason cannot tear off that glimmering mask,\nl
Her efforts only make it glimmer more;\nl
In packets she ties up the Indivisible;\nl
Finding her hands too small to hold vast Truth\nl
She breaks up knowledge into alien parts\nl
Or peers through cloud-rack for a vanished sun:\nl
She sees, not understanding what she has seen,\nl
Through the locked visages of finite things\nl
