The myriad aspects of infinity.\nl
One day the Face must burn out through the mask.\nl
Our ignorance is Wisdom's chrysalis,\nl
Page 257

Our error weds new knowledge on its way,\nl
Its darkness is a blackened knot of light;\nl
Thought dances hand in hand with Nescience\nl
On the grey road that winds towards the Sun.\nl
Even while her fingers fumble at the knots\nl
Which bind them to their strange companionship,\nl
Into the moments of their married strife\nl
Sometimes break flashes of the enlightening Fire.\nl
Even now great thoughts are here that walk alone:\nl
Armed they have come with the infallible word\nl
In an investiture of intuitive light\nl
That is a sanction from the eyes of God;\nl
Announcers of a distant Truth they flame\nl
Arriving from the rim of eternity.\nl
A fire shall come out of the infinitudes,\nl
A greater Gnosis shall regard the world\nl
Crossing out of some far omniscience\nl
On lustrous seas from the still rapt Alone\nl
To illumine the deep heart of self and things.\nl
A timeless knowledge it shall bring to Mind,\nl
Its aim to life, to Ignorance its close.\nl

\spar Above in a high breathless stratosphere,\nl
Overshadowing the dwarfish trinity,\nl
Lived, aspirants to a limitless Beyond,\nl
Captives of Space, walled by the limiting heavens,\nl
In the unceasing circuit of the hours\nl
Yearning for the straight paths of eternity,\nl
And from their high station looked down on this world\nl
Two sun-gaze Daemons witnessing all that is.\nl
A power to uplift the laggard world,\nl
Imperious rode a huge high-winged Life-Thought\nl
Unwont to tread the firm unchanging soil:\nl
Accustomed to a blue infinity,\nl
It planed in sunlit sky and starlit air;\nl
It saw afar the unreached Immortal's home\nl
Page 258

And heard afar the voices of the Gods.\nl
Iconoclast and shatterer of Time's forts,\nl
Overleaping limit and exceeding norm,\nl
It lit the thoughts that glow through the centuries\nl
And moved to acts of superhuman force.\nl
As far as its self-winged air-planes could fly,\nl
Visiting the future in great brilliant raids\nl
It reconnoitred vistas of dream-fate.\nl
Apt to conceive, unable to attain,\nl
It drew its concept-maps and vision-plans\nl
Too large for the architecture of mortal Space.\nl
Beyond in wideness where no footing is,\nl
An imagist of bodiless Ideas,\nl
Impassive to the cry of life and sense,\nl
A pure Thought-Mind surveyed the cosmic act.\nl
Archangel of a white transcending realm,\nl
It saw the world from solitary heights\nl
Luminous in a remote and empty air.\nl
\rl{\fsc End of Canto Ten}
Page 259

\par
\ht Canto Eleven: The Kingdoms and Godheads of the Greater Mind
\par
\sbigcap There ceased the limits of the labouring Power.\nl
But being and creation cease not there.\nl
For Thought transcends the circles of mortal mind,\nl
It is greater than its earthly instrument:\nl
The godhead crammed into mind's narrow space\nl
Escapes on every side into some vast\nl
That is a passage to infinity.\nl
It moves eternal in the spirit's field,\nl
A runner towards the far spiritual light,\nl
A child and servant of the spirit's force.\nl
But mind too falls back from a nameless peak.\nl
His being stretched beyond the sight of Thought.\nl
For the spirit is eternal and unmade\nl
And not by thinking was its greatness born,\nl
And not by thinking can its knowledge come.\nl
It knows itself and in itself it lives,\nl
It moves where no thought is nor any form.\nl
Its feet are steadied upon finite things,\nl
Its wings can dare to cross the Infinite.\nl
Arriving into his ken a wonder space\nl
Of great and marvellous meetings called his steps,\nl
Where Thought leaned on a Vision beyond thought\nl
And shaped a world from the Unthinkable.\nl
On peaks imagination cannot tread,\nl
In the horizons of a tireless sight,\nl
Under a blue veil of eternity\nl
The splendours of ideal Mind were seen\nl
Outstretched across the boundaries of things known.\nl
Origin of the little that we are,\nl
Instinct with the endless more that we must be,\nl
A prop of all that human strength enacts,\nl
Page 260

Creator of hopes by earth unrealised,\nl
It spreads beyond the expanding universe;\nl
It wings beyond the boundaries of Dream,\nl
It overtops the ceiling of life's soar.\nl
Awake in a luminous sphere unbound by Thought,\nl
Exposed to omniscient immensities,\nl
It casts on our world its great crowned influences,\nl
Its speed that outstrips the ambling of the hours,\nl
Its force that strides invincibly through Time,\nl
Its mights that bridge the gulf twixt man and God,\nl
Its lights that combat Ignorance and Death.\nl
In its vast ambit of ideal Space\nl
Where beauty and mightiness walk hand in hand,\nl
The Spirit's truths take form as living Gods\nl
And each can build a world in its own right.\nl
In an air which doubt and error cannot mark\nl
With the stigmata of their deformity,\nl
In communion with the musing privacy\nl
Of a truth that sees in an unerring light\nl
Where the sight falters not nor wanders thought,\nl
Exempt from our world's exorbitant tax of tears,\nl
Dreaming its luminous creations gaze\nl
On the Ideas that people eternity.\nl
In a sun-blaze of joy and absolute power\nl
Above the Masters of the Ideal throne\nl
In sessions of secure felicity,\nl
In regions of illumined certitude.\nl
Far are those realms from our labour and yearning and call,\nl
Perfection's reign and hallowed sanctuary\nl
Closed to the uncertain thoughts of human mind,\nl
Remote from the turbid tread of mortal life.\nl
But since our secret selves are next of kin,\nl
A breath of unattained divinity\nl
Visits the imperfect earth on which we toil;\nl
Across a gleaming ether's golden laugh\nl
A light falls on our vexed unsatisfied lives,\nl
Page 261

A thought comes down from the ideal worlds\nl
And moves us to new-model even here\nl
Some image of their greatness and appeal\nl
And wonder beyond the ken of mortal hope.\nl
Amid the heavy sameness of the days\nl
And contradicted by the human law,\nl
A faith in things that are not and must be\nl
Lives comrade of this world's delight and pain,\nl
The child of the secret soul's forbidden desire\nl
Born of its amour with eternity.\nl
Our spirits break free from their environment;\nl
The future brings its face of miracle near,\nl
Its godhead looks at us with present eyes;\nl
Acts deemed impossible grow natural;\nl
We feel the hero's immortality;\nl
The courage and the strength death cannot touch\nl
Awake in limbs that are mortal, hearts that fail;\nl
We move by the rapid impulse of a will\nl
That scorns the tardy trudge of mortal time.\nl
These promptings come not from an alien sphere:\nl
Ourselves are citizens of that mother State,\nl
Adventurers, we have colonised Matter's night.\nl
But now our rights are barred, our passports void;\nl
We live self-exiled from our heavenlier home.\nl
An errant ray from the immortal Mind\nl
Accepted the earth's blindness and became\nl
Our human thought, servant of Ignorance.\nl
An exile, labourer on this unsure globe\nl
Captured and driven in Life's nescient grasp,\nl
Hampered by obscure cell and treacherous nerve,\nl
It dreams of happier states and nobler powers,\nl
The natural privilege of unfallen gods,\nl
Recalling still its old lost sovereignty.\nl
Amidst earth's mist and fog and mud and stone\nl
It still remembers its exalted sphere\nl
And the high city of its splendid birth.\nl
Page 262

A memory steals in from lost heavens of Truth,\nl
A wide release comes near, a Glory calls,\nl
A might looks out, an estranged felicity.\nl
In glamorous passages of half-veiled light\nl
Wandering, a brilliant shadow of itself,\nl
This quick uncertain leader of blind gods,\nl
This tender of small lamps, this minister serf\nl
Hired by a mind and body for earth-use\nl
Forgets its work mid crude realities;\nl
It recovers its renounced imperial right,\nl
It wears once more a purple robe of thought\nl
And knows itself the Ideal's seer and king,\nl
Communicant and prophet of the Unborn,\nl
Heir to delight and immortality.\nl
All things are real that here are only dreams,\nl
In our unknown depths sleeps their reserve of truth,\nl
On our unreached heights they reign and come to us\nl
In thought and muse trailing their robes of light.\nl
But our dwarf will and cold pragmatic sense\nl
Admit not the celestial visitants:\nl
Awaiting us on the Ideal's peaks\nl
Or guarded in our secret self unseen\nl
Yet flashed sometimes across the awakened soul,\nl
Hide from our lives their greatness, beauty, power.\nl
Our present feels sometimes their regal touch,\nl
Our future strives towards their luminous thrones:\nl
Out of spiritual secrecy they gaze,\nl
Immortal footfalls in mind's corridors sound:\nl
Our souls can climb into the shining planes,\nl
The breadths from which they came can be our home.\nl
His privilege regained of shadowless sight\nl
The Thinker entered the immortals' air\nl
And drank again his pure and mighty source.\nl
Immutable in rhythmic calm and joy\nl
He saw, sovereignly free in limitless light,\nl
The unfallen planes, the thought-created worlds\nl
Page 263

Where Knowledge is the leader of the act\nl
And Matter is of thinking substance made,\nl
Feeling, a heaven-bird poised on dreaming wings,\nl
Answers Truth's call as to a parent's voice,\nl
Form luminous leaps from the all-shaping beam\nl
And Will is a conscious chariot of the Gods,\nl
And Life, a splendour stream of musing Force,\nl
Carries the voices of the mystic Suns.\nl
A happiness it brings of whispered truth;\nl
There runs in its flow honeying the bosom of Space\nl
A laughter from the immortal heart of Bliss,\nl
And the unfathomed Joy of timelessness,\nl
The sound of Wisdom's murmur in the Unknown\nl
And the breath of an unseen Infinity.\nl
In gleaming clarities of amethyst air\nl
The chainless and omnipotent Spirit of Mind\nl
Brooded on the blue lotus of the Idea.\nl
A gold supernal sun of timeless Truth\nl
Poured down the mystery of the eternal Ray\nl
Through a silence quivering with the word of Light\nl
On an endless ocean of discovery.\nl
Far-off he saw the joining hemispheres.\nl
On meditation's mounting edge of trance\nl
Great stairs of thought climbed up to unborn heights\nl
Where Time's last ridges touch eternity's skies\nl
And Nature speaks to the spirit's absolute.\nl

\spar A triple realm of ordered thought came first,\nl
A small beginning of immense ascent:\nl
Above were bright ethereal skies of mind,\nl
A packed and endless soar as if sky pressed sky\nl
Buttressed against the Void on bastioned light;\nl
The highest strove to neighbour eternity,\nl
The largest widened into the infinite.\nl
But though immortal, mighty and divine,\nl
The first realms were close and kin to human mind;\nl
Page 264

Their deities shape our greater thinking's roads,\nl
A fragment of their puissance can be ours:\nl
These breadths were not too broad for our souls to range,\nl
These heights were not too high for human hope.\nl
A triple flight led to this triple world.\nl
Although abrupt for common strengths to tread,\nl
Its upward slope looks down on our earth-poise:\nl
On a slant not too precipitously steep\nl
One could turn back travelling deep descending lines\nl
To commune with the mortal's universe.\nl
The mighty wardens of the ascending stair\nl
Who intercede with the all-creating Word,\nl
There waited for the pilgrim heaven-bound soul;\nl
Holding the thousand keys of the Beyond\nl
They proffered their knowledge to the climbing mind\nl
And filled the life with Thought's immensities.\nl
The prophet hierophants of the occult Law,\nl
The flame-bright hierarchs of the divine Truth,\nl
Interpreters between man's mind and God's,\nl
They bring the immortal fire to mortal men.\nl
Iridescent, bodying the invisible,\nl
The guardians of the Eternal's bright degrees\nl
Fronted the Sun in radiant phalanxes.\nl
Afar they seemed a symbol imagery,\nl
Illumined originals of the shadowy script\nl
In which our sight transcribes the ideal Ray,\nl
Or icons figuring a mystic Truth,\nl
But, nearer, Gods and living Presences.\nl
A march of friezes marked the lowest steps;\nl
Fantastically ornate and richly small,\nl
They had room for the whole meaning of a world,\nl
Symbols minute of its perfection's joy,\nl
Strange beasts that were Nature's forces made alive\nl
And, wakened to the wonder of his role,\nl
Man grown an image undefaced of God\nl
And objects the fine coin of Beauty's reign;\nl
Page 265

But wide the terrains were those levels serve.\nl
In front of the ascending epiphany\nl
World-Time's enjoyers, favourites of World-Bliss,\nl
The Masters of things actual, lords of the hours,\nl
Playmates of youthful Nature and child God,\nl
Creators of Matter by hid stress of Mind\nl
Whose subtle thoughts support unconscious Life\nl
And guide the fantasy of brute events,\nl
Stood there, a race of young keen-visioned gods,\nl
King-children born on Wisdom's early plane,\nl
Taught in her school world-making's mystic play.\nl
Archmasons of the eternal Thaumaturge,\nl
Moulders and measurers of fragmented Space,\nl
They have made their plan of the concealed and known\nl
A dwelling-house for the invisible king.\nl
Obeying the Eternal's deep command\nl
They have built in the material front of things\nl
This wide world-kindergarten of young souls\nl
Where the infant spirit learns through mind and sense\nl
To read the letters of the cosmic script\nl
And study the body of the cosmic self\nl
And search for the secret meaning of the whole.\nl
To all that Spirit conceives they give a mould;\nl
Persuading Nature into visible moods\nl
They lend a finite shape to infinite things.\nl
Each power that leaps from the Unmanifest\nl
Leaving the largeness of the Eternal's peace\nl
They seized and held by their precisian eye\nl
And made a figurante in the cosmic dance.\nl
Its free caprice they bound by rhythmic laws\nl
And compelled to accept its posture and its line\nl
In the wizardry of an ordered universe.\nl
The All-containing was contained in form,\nl
Oneness was carved into units measurable,\nl
The limitless built into a cosmic sum:\nl
Unending Space was beaten into a curve,\nl
Page 266

Indivisible Time into small minutes cut,\nl
The infinitesimal massed to keep secure\nl
The mystery of the Formless cast into form.\nl
Invincibly their craft devised for use\nl
The magic of sequent number and sign's spell,\nl
Design's miraculous potency was caught\nl
Laden with beauty and significance\nl
And by the determining mandate of their gaze\nl
Figure and quality equating joined\nl
In an inextricable identity.\nl
On each event they stamped its curves of law\nl
And its trust and charge of burdened circumstance;\nl
A free and divine incident no more\nl
At each moment willed or adventure of the soul,\nl
It lengthened a fate-bound mysterious chain,\nl
A line foreseen of an immutable plan,\nl
One step more in Necessity's long march.\nl
A term was set for every eager Power\nl
Restraining its will to monopolise the world,\nl
A groove of bronze prescribed for force and act\nl
And shown to each moment its appointed place\nl
Forewilled inalterably in the spiral\nl
Huge Time-loop fugitive from eternity.\nl
Inevitable their thoughts like links of Fate\nl
Imposed on the leap and lightning race of mind\nl
And on the frail fortuitous flux of life\nl
And on the liberty of atomic things\nl
Immutable cause and adamant consequence.\nl
Idea gave up the plastic infinity\nl
To which it was born and now traced out instead\nl
Small separate steps of chain-work in a plot:\nl
Immortal once, now tied to birth and end,\nl
Torn from its immediacy of errorless sight,\nl
Knowledge was rebuilt from cells of inference\nl
Into a fixed body flasque and perishable;\nl
Thus bound it grew, but could not last and broke\nl
Page 267

And to a new thinking's body left its place.\nl
A cage for the Infinite's great-eyed seraphim Thoughts\nl
Was closed with a criss-cross of world-laws for bars\nl
And hedged into a curt horizon's arc\nl
The irised vision of the Ineffable.\nl
A timeless Spirit was made the slave of the hours;\nl
The Unbound was cast into a prison of birth\nl
To make a world that Mind could grasp and rule.\nl
On an earth which looked towards a thousand suns,\nl
That the created might grow Nature's lord\nl
And Matter's depths be illumined with a soul\nl
They tied to date and norm and finite scope\nl
The million-mysteried movement of the One.\nl
\sparn Above stood ranked a subtle archangel race\nl
With larger lids and looks that searched the unseen.\nl
A light of liberating knowledge shone\nl
Across the gulfs of silence in their eyes;\nl
They lived in the mind and knew truth from within;\nl
A sight withdrawn in the concentrated heart\nl
Could pierce behind the screen of Time's results\nl
And the rigid cast and shape of visible things.\nl
All that escaped conception's narrow noose\nl
Vision descried and gripped; their seeing thoughts\nl
Filled in the blanks left by the seeking sense.\nl
High architects of possibility\nl
And engineers of the impossible,\nl
Mathematicians of the infinitudes\nl
And theoricians of unknowable truths,\nl
They formulate enigma's postulates\nl
And join the unknown to the apparent worlds.\nl
Acolytes they wait upon the timeless Power,\nl
The cycle of her works investigate;\nl
Passing her fence of wordless privacy\nl
Their mind could penetrate her occult mind\nl
And draw the diagram of her secret thoughts;\nl
They read the codes and ciphers she had sealed,\nl
Page 268

Copies they made of all her guarded plans,\nl
For every turn of her mysterious course\nl
Assigned a reason and unchanging rule.\nl
The unseen grew visible to student eyes,\nl
Explained was the immense Inconscient's scheme,\nl
Audacious lines were traced upon the Void;\nl
The Infinite was reduced to square and cube.\nl
Arranging symbol and significance,\nl
Tracing the curve of a transcendent Power,\nl
They framed the cabbala of the cosmic Law,\nl
The balancing line discovered of Life's technique\nl
And structured her magic and her mystery.\nl
Imposing schemes of knowledge on the Vast\nl
They clamped to syllogisms of finite thought\nl
The free logic of an infinite Consciousness,\nl
Grammared the hidden rhythms of Nature's dance,\nl
Critiqued the plot of the drama of the worlds,\nl
Made figure and number a key to all that is:\nl
The psycho-analysis of cosmic Self\nl
Was traced, its secrets hunted down, and read\nl
The unknown pathology of the Unique.\nl
Assessed was the system of the probable,\nl
The hazard of fleeing possibilities,\nl
To account for the Actual's unaccountable sum,\nl
Necessity's logarithmic tables drawn,\nl
Cast into a scheme the triple act of the One.\nl
Unveiled, the abrupt invisible multitude\nl
Of forces whirling from the hands of Chance\nl
Seemed to obey some vast imperative:\nl
Their tangled motives worked out unity.\nl
A wisdom read their mind to themselves unknown,\nl
Their anarchy rammed into a formula\nl
And from their giant randomness of Force,\nl
Following the habit of their million paths,\nl
Distinguishing each faintest line and stroke\nl
Of a concealed unalterable design,\nl
Page 269

Out of the chaos of the Invisible's moods\nl
Derived the calculus of Destiny.\nl
In its bright pride of universal lore\nl
Mind's knowledge overtopped the Omniscient's power:\nl
The Eternal's winging eagle puissances\nl
Surprised in their untracked empyrean\nl
Stooped from their gyres to obey the beck of Thought:\nl
Each mysteried God forced to revealing form,\nl
Assigned his settled moves in Nature's game,\nl
Zigzagged at the gesture of a chess-player Will\nl
Across the chequerboard of cosmic Fate.\nl
In the wide sequence of Necessity's steps\nl
Predicted, every act and thought of God,\nl
Its values weighed by the accountant Mind,\nl
Checked in his mathematised omnipotence,\nl
Lost its divine aspect of miracle\nl
And was a figure in a cosmic sum.\nl
The mighty Mother's whims and lightning moods\nl
Arisen from her all-wise unruled delight\nl
In the freedom of her sweet and passionate breast,\nl
Robbed of their wonder were chained to a cause and aim;\nl
An idol of bronze replaced her mystic shape\nl
That captures the movements of the cosmic vasts,\nl
In the sketch precise of an ideal face\nl
Forgotten was her eyelashes' dream-print\nl
Carrying on their curve infinity's dreams,\nl
Lost the alluring marvel of her eyes;\nl
The surging wave-throbs of her vast sea-heart\nl
They bound to a theorem of ordered beats:\nl
Her deep designs which from herself she had veiled\nl
Bowed self-revealed in their confessional.\nl
For the birth and death of the worlds they fixed a date,\nl
The diameter of infinity was drawn,\nl
Measured the distant arc of the unseen heights\nl
And visualised the plumbless viewless depths,\nl
Till all seemed known that in all time could be.\nl
Page 270

All was coerced by number, name and form;\nl
Nothing was left untold, incalculable.\nl
Yet was their wisdom circled with a nought:\nl
Truths they could find and hold but not the one Truth:\nl
The Highest was to them unknowable.\nl
By knowing too much they missed the whole to be known:\nl
The fathomless heart of the world was left unguessed\nl
And the Transcendent kept its secrecy.\nl
\sparn In a sublimer and more daring soar\nl
To the wide summit of the triple stairs\nl
Bare steps climbed up like flaming rocks of gold\nl
Burning their way to a pure absolute sky.\nl
August and few the sovereign Kings of Thought\nl
Have made of Space their wide all-seeing gaze\nl
Surveying the enormous work of Time:\nl
A breadth of all-containing Consciousness\nl
Supported Being in a still embrace.\nl
Intercessors with a luminous Unseen,\nl
They capt in the long passage to the world\nl
The imperatives of the creator Self\nl
Obeyed by unknowing earth, by conscious heaven;\nl
Their thoughts are partners in its vast control.\nl
A great all-ruling Consciousness is there\nl
And Mind unwitting serves a higher Power;\nl
It is a channel, not the source of all.\nl
The cosmos is no accident in Time;\nl
There is a meaning in each play of Chance,\nl
There is a freedom in each face of Fate.\nl
A Wisdom knows and guides the mysteried world;\nl
A Truth-gaze shapes its beings and events;\nl
A Word self-born upon creation's heights,\nl
Voice of the Eternal in the temporal spheres,\nl
Prophet of the seeings of the Absolute,\nl
Sows the Idea's significance in Form\nl
And from that seed the growths of Time arise.\nl
On peaks beyond our ken the All-Wisdom sits:\nl
Page 271

A single and infallible look comes down,\nl
A silent touch from the supernal's air\nl
Awakes to ignorant knowledge in its acts\nl
The secret power in the inconscient depths,\nl
Compelling the blinded Godhead to emerge,\nl
Determining Necessity's nude dance\nl
As she passes through the circuit of the hours\nl
And vanishes from the chase of finite eyes\nl
Down circling vistas of aeonic Time.\nl
The unseizable forces of the cosmic whirl\nl
Bear in their bacchant limbs the fixity\nl
Of an original foresight that is Fate.\nl
Even Nature's ignorance is Truth's instrument;\nl
Our struggling ego cannot change her course:\nl
Yet is it a conscious power that moves in us,\nl
A seed-idea is parent of our acts\nl
And destiny the unrecognised child of Will.\nl
Infallibly by Truth's directing gaze\nl
All creatures here their secret self disclose,\nl
Forced to become what in themselves they hide.\nl
For He who Is grows manifest in the years\nl
And the slow Godhead shut within the cell\nl
Climbs from the plasm to immortality.\nl
But hidden, but denied to mortal grasp,\nl
Mystic, ineffable is the spirit's truth,\nl
Unspoken, caught only by the spirit's eye.\nl
When naked of ego and mind it hears the Voice;\nl
It looks through light to ever greater light\nl
And sees Eternity ensphering Life.\nl
This greater Truth is foreign to our thoughts;\nl
Where a free Wisdom works, they seek for a rule;\nl
Or we only see a tripping game of Chance\nl
Or a labour in chains forced by bound Nature's law,\nl
An absolutism of dumb unthinking Power.\nl
Audacious in their sense of God-born strength\nl
These dared to grasp with their thought Truth's absolute;\nl
Page 272

By an abstract purity of godless sight,\nl
By a percept nude, intolerant of forms,\nl
They brought to Mind what Mind could never reach\nl
And hoped to conquer Truth's supernal base.\nl
A stripped imperative of conceptual phrase\nl
Architectonic and inevitable\nl
Translated the unthinkable into thought:\nl
A silver-winged fire of naked subtle sense,\nl
An ear of mind withdrawn from the outward's rhymes\nl
Discovered the seed-sounds of the eternal Word,\nl
The rhythm and music heard that built the worlds,\nl
And seized in things the bodiless Will to be.\nl
The Illimitable they measured with number's rods\nl
And traced the last formula of limited things,\nl
In transparent systems bodied termless truths,\nl
The Timeless made accountable to Time\nl
And valued the incommensurable Supreme.\nl
To park and hedge the ungrasped infinitudes\nl
They erected absolute walls of thought and speech\nl
And made a vacuum to hold the One.\nl
In their sight they drove towards an empty peak,\nl
A mighty space of cold and sunlit air.\nl
To unify their task, excluding life\nl
Which cannot bear the nakedness of the Vast,\nl
They made a cipher of a multitude,\nl
In negation found the meaning of the All\nl
And in nothingness the absolute positive.\nl
A single law simplessed the cosmic theme,\nl
Compressing Nature into a formula;\nl
Their titan labour made all knowledge one,\nl
A mental algebra of the Spirit's ways,\nl
An abstract of the living Divinity.\nl
Here the mind's wisdom stopped; it felt complete;\nl
For nothing more was left to think or know:\nl
In a spiritual zero it sat throned\nl
And took its vast silence for the Ineffable.\nl
Page 273

\spar This was the play of the bright gods of Thought.\nl
Attracting into time the timeless Light,\nl
Imprisoning eternity in the hours,\nl
This they have planned, to snare the feet of Truth\nl
In an aureate net of concept and of phrase\nl
And keep her captive for the thinker's joy\nl
In his little world built of immortal dreams:\nl
There must she dwell mured in the human mind,\nl
An empress prisoner in her subject's house,\nl
Adored and pure and still on his heart's throne,\nl
His splendid property cherished and apart\nl
In the wall of silence of his secret muse,\nl
Immaculate in white virginity,\nl
The same for ever and for ever one,\nl
His worshipped changeless Goddess through all time.\nl
Or else, a faithful consort of his mind\nl
Assenting to his nature and his will,\nl
She sanctions and inspires his words and acts\nl
Prolonging their resonance through the listening years,\nl
Companion and recorder of his march\nl
Crossing a brilliant tract of thought and life\nl
Carved out of the eternity of Time.\nl
A witness to his high triumphant star,\nl
Her godhead servitor to a crowned Idea,\nl
He shall dominate by her a prostrate world;\nl
A warrant for his deeds and his beliefs,\nl
She attests his right divine to lead and rule.\nl
Or as a lover clasps his one beloved,\nl
Godhead of his life's worship and desire,\nl
Icon of his heart's sole idolatry,\nl
She now is his and must live for him alone:\nl
She has invaded him with her sudden bliss,\nl
An exhaustless marvel in his happy grasp,\nl
An allurement, a caught ravishing miracle.\nl
Her now he claims after long rapt pursuit,\nl
The one joy of his body and his soul:\nl
Page 274

Inescapable is her divine appeal,\nl
Her immense possession an undying thrill,\nl
An intoxication and an ecstasy:\nl
The passion of her self-revealing moods,\nl
A heavenly glory and variety,\nl
Makes ever new her body to his eyes,\nl
Or else repeats the first enchantment's touch,\nl
The luminous rapture of her mystic breasts\nl
And beautiful vibrant limbs a living field\nl
Of throbbing new discovery without end.\nl
A new beginning flowers in word and laugh,\nl
A new charm brings back the old extreme delight:\nl
He is lost in her, she is his heaven here.\nl
Truth smiled upon the gracious golden game.\nl
Out of her hushed eternal spaces leaned\nl
The great and boundless Goddess feigned to yield\nl
The sunlit sweetness of her secrecies.\nl
Incarnating her beauty in his clasp\nl
She gave for a brief kiss her immortal lips\nl
And drew to her bosom one glorified mortal head:\nl
She made earth her home, for whom heaven was too small.\nl
In a human breast her occult presence lived;\nl
He carved from his own self his figure of her:\nl
She shaped her body to a mind's embrace.\nl
Into thought's narrow limits she has come;\nl
Her greatness she has suffered to be pressed\nl
Into the little cabin of the Idea,\nl
The closed room of a lonely thinker's grasp:\nl
She has lowered her heights to the stature of our souls\nl
And dazzled our lids with her celestial gaze.\nl
Thus each is satisfied with his high gain\nl
And thinks himself beyond mortality blest,\nl
A king of truth upon his separate throne.\nl
To her possessor in the field of Time\nl
A single splendour caught from her glory seems\nl
The one true light, her beauty's glowing whole.\nl
Page 275

But thought nor word can seize eternal Truth:\nl
The whole world lives in a lonely ray of her sun.\nl
In our thinking's close and narrow lamp-lit house\nl
The vanity of our shut mortal mind\nl
Dreams that the chains of thought have made her ours;\nl
But only we play with our own brilliant bonds;\nl
Tying her down, it is ourselves we tie.\nl
In our hypnosis by one luminous point\nl
We see not what small figure of her we hold;\nl
We feel not her inspiring boundlessness,\nl
We share not her immortal liberty.\nl
Thus is it even with the seer and sage;\nl
For still the human limits the divine:\nl
Out of our thoughts we must leap up to sight,\nl
Breathe her divine illimitable air,\nl
Her simple vast supremacy confess,\nl
Dare to surrender to her absolute.\nl
Then the Unmanifest reflects his form\nl
In the still mind as in a living glass;\nl
The timeless Ray descends into our hearts\nl
And we are rapt into eternity.\nl
For Truth is wider, greater than her forms.\nl
A thousand icons they have made of her\nl
And find her in the idols they adore;\nl
But she remains herself and infinite.\nl
\rl{\fsc End of Canto Eleven}
Page 276

\par
\ht Canto Twelve: The Heavens of the Ideal
\par
\sbigcap Always the Ideal beckoned from afar.\nl
Awakened by the touch of the Unseen,\nl
Deserting the boundary of things achieved,\nl
Aspired the strong discoverer, tireless Thought,\nl
Revealing at each step a luminous world.\nl
It left known summits for the unknown peaks:\nl
Impassioned, it sought the lone unrealised Truth,\nl
It longed for the Light that knows not death and birth.\nl
Each stage of the soul's remote ascent was built\nl
Into a constant heaven felt always here.\nl
At each pace of the journey marvellous\nl
A new degree of wonder and of bliss,\nl
A new rung formed in Being's mighty stair,\nl
A great wide step trembling with jewelled fire\nl
As if a burning spirit quivered there\nl
Upholding with his flame the immortal hope,\nl
As if a radiant God had given his soul\nl
That he might feel the tread of pilgrim feet\nl
Mounting in haste to the Eternal's house.\nl
At either end of each effulgent stair\nl
The heavens of the ideal Mind were seen\nl
In a blue lucency of dreaming Space\nl
Like strips of brilliant sky clinging to the moon.\nl
On one side glimmered hue on floating hue,\nl
A glory of sunrise breaking on the soul,\nl
In a tremulous rapture of the heart's insight\nl
And the spontaneous bliss that beauty gives,\nl
The lovely kingdoms of the deathless Rose.\nl
Above the spirit cased in mortal sense\nl
Are superconscious realms of heavenly peace,\nl
Below, the Inconscient's sullen dim abyss,\nl
Page 277

Between, behind our life, the deathless Rose.\nl
Across the covert air the spirit breathes,\nl
A body of the cosmic beauty and joy\nl
Unseen, unguessed by the blind suffering world,\nl
Climbing from Nature's deep surrendered heart\nl
It blooms for ever at the feet of God,\nl
Fed by life's sacrificial mysteries.\nl
Here too its bud is born in human breasts;\nl
Then by a touch, a presence or a voice\nl
The world is turned into a temple ground\nl
And all discloses the unknown Beloved.\nl
In an outburst of heavenly joy and ease\nl
Life yields to the divinity within\nl
And gives the rapture-offering of its all,\nl
And the soul opens to felicity.\nl
A bliss is felt that never can wholly cease,\nl
A sudden mystery of secret Grace\nl
Flowers goldening our earth of red desire.\nl
All the high gods who hid their visages\nl
From the soiled passionate ritual of our hopes,\nl
Reveal their names and their undying powers.\nl
A fiery stillness wakes the slumbering cells,\nl
A passion of the flesh becoming spirit,\nl
And marvellously is fulfilled at last\nl
The miracle for which our life was made.\nl
A flame in a white voiceless cupola\nl
Is seen and faces of immortal light,\nl
The radiant limbs that know not birth and death,\nl
The breasts that suckle the first-born of the Sun,\nl
The wings that crowd thought's ardent silences,\nl
The eyes that look into spiritual Space.\nl
Our hidden centres of celestial force\nl
Open like flowers to a heavenly atmosphere;\nl
Mind pauses thrilled with the supernal Ray,\nl
And even this transient body then can feel\nl
Ideal love and flawless happiness\nl
Page 278

And laughter of the heart's sweetness and delight\nl
Freed from the rude and tragic hold of Time,\nl
And beauty and the rhythmic feet of the hours.\nl
This in high realms touches immortal kind;\nl
What here is in the bud has blossomed there.\nl
There is the secrecy of the House of Flame,\nl
The blaze of godlike thought and golden bliss,\nl
The rapt idealism of heavenly sense;\nl
There are the wonderful voices, the sun-laugh,\nl
A gurgling eddy in rivers of God's joy,\nl
And the mysteried vineyards of the gold moon-wine,\nl
All the fire and sweetness of which hardly here\nl
A brilliant shadow visits mortal life.\nl
Although are witnessed there the joys of Time,\nl
Pressed on the bosom the Immortal's touch is felt,\nl
Heard are the flutings of the Infinite.\nl
Here upon earth are early awakenings,\nl
Moments that tremble in an air divine,\nl
And grown upon the yearning of her soil\nl
Time's sun-flowers' gaze at gold Eternity:\nl
There are the imperishable beatitudes.\nl
A million lotuses swaying on one stem,\nl
World after coloured and ecstatic world\nl
Climbs towards some far unseen epiphany.\nl
\sparn On the other side of the eternal stairs\nl
The mighty kingdoms of the deathless Flame\nl
Aspired to reach the Being's absolutes.\nl
Out of the sorrow and darkness of the world,\nl
Out of the depths where life and thought are tombed,\nl
Lonely mounts up to heaven the deathless Flame.\nl
In a veiled Nature's hallowed secrecies\nl
It burns for ever on the altar Mind,\nl
Its priests the souls of dedicated gods,\nl
Humanity its house of sacrifice.\nl
Once kindled, never can its flamings cease.\nl
A fire along the mystic paths of earth,\nl
Page 279

It rises through the mortal's hemisphere,\nl
Till borne by runners of the Day and Dusk\nl
It enters the occult eternal Light\nl
And clambers whitening to the invisible Throne.\nl
Its worlds are steps of an ascending Force:\nl
A dream of giant contours, titan lines,\nl
Homes of unfallen and illumined Might,\nl
Heavens of unchanging Good pure and unborn,\nl
Heights of the grandeur of Truth's ageless ray,\nl
As in a symbol sky they start to view\nl
And call our souls into a vaster air.\nl
On their summits they bear up the sleepless Flame;\nl
Dreaming of a mysterious Beyond,\nl
Transcendent of the paths of Fate and Time,\nl
They point above themselves with index peaks\nl
Through a pale-sapphire ether of god-mind\nl
Towards some gold Infinite's apocalypse.\nl
A thunder rolling mid the hills of God,\nl
Tireless, severe is their tremendous Voice:\nl
Exceeding us, to exceed ourselves they call\nl
And bid us rise incessantly above.\nl
Far from our eager reach those summits live,\nl
Too lofty for our mortal strength and height,\nl
Hardly in a dire ecstasy of toil\nl
Climbed by the spirit's naked athlete will.\nl
Austere, intolerant they claim from us\nl
Efforts too lasting for our mortal nerve\nl
Our hearts cannot cleave to nor our flesh support;\nl
Only the Eternal's strength in us can dare\nl
To attempt the immense adventure of that climb\nl
And the sacrifice of all we cherish here.\nl
Our human knowledge is a candle burnt\nl
On a dim altar to a sun-vast Truth;\nl
Man's virtue, a coarse-spun ill-fitting dress,\nl
Apparels wooden images of Good;\nl
Passionate and blinded, bleeding, stained with mire\nl
Page 280

His energy stumbles towards a deathless Force.\nl
An imperfection dogs our highest strength;\nl
Portions and pale reflections are our share.\nl
Happy the worlds that have not felt our fall,\nl
Where Will is one with Truth and Good with Power;\nl
Impoverished not by earth-mind's indigence,\nl
They keep God's natural breath of mightiness,\nl
His bare spontaneous swift intensities;\nl
There is his great transparent mirror, Self,\nl
And there his sovereign autarchy of bliss\nl
In which immortal natures have their part,\nl
Heirs and cosharers of divinity.\nl
\sparn He through the Ideal's kingdoms moved at will,\nl
Accepted their beauty and their greatness bore,\nl
Partook of the glories of their wonder fields,\nl
But passed nor stayed beneath their splendour's rule.\nl
All there was an intense but partial light.\nl
In each a seraph-winged high-browed Idea\nl
United all knowledge by one master thought,\nl
Persuaded all action to one golden sense,\nl
All powers subjected to a single power\nl
And made a world where it could reign alone,\nl
An absolute ideal's perfect home.\nl
Insignia of their victory and their faith,\nl
They offered to the Traveller at their gates\nl
A quenchless flame or an unfading flower,\nl
Emblem of a high kingdom's privilege.\nl
A glorious shining Angel of the Way\nl
Presented to the seeking of the soul\nl
The sweetness and the might of an idea,\nl
Each deemed Truth's intimate fount and summit force,\nl
The heart of the meaning of the universe,\nl
Perfection's key, passport to Paradise.\nl
Yet were there regions where these absolutes met\nl
And made a circle of bliss with married hands;\nl
Light stood embraced by light, fire wedded fire,\nl
Page 281

But none in the other would his body lose\nl
To find his soul in the world's single Soul,\nl
A multiplied rapture of infinity.\nl
Onward he passed to a diviner sphere:\nl
There, joined in a common greatness, light and bliss,\nl
All high and beautiful and desirable powers\nl
Forgetting their difference and their separate reign\nl
Become a single multitudinous whole.\nl
Above the parting of the roads of Time,\nl
Above the Silence and its thousandfold Word,\nl
In the immutable and inviolate Truth\nl
For ever united and inseparable,\nl
The radiant children of Eternity dwell\nl
On the wide spirit height where all are one.\nl
\rl{\fsc End of Canto Twelve}
Page 282

\par
\ht Canto Thirteen: In the Self of Mind
\par
\sbigcap At last there came a bare indifferent sky\nl
Where Silence listened to the cosmic Voice,\nl
But answered nothing to a million calls;\nl
The soul's endless question met with no response.\nl
An abrupt conclusion ended eager hopes,\nl
A deep cessation in a mighty calm,\nl
A finis-line on the last page of thought\nl
And a margin and a blank of wordless peace.\nl
There paused the climbing hierarchy of worlds.\nl
He stood on a wide arc of summit Space\nl
Alone with an enormous Self of Mind\nl
Which held all life in a corner of its vasts.\nl
Omnipotent, immobile and aloof,\nl
In the world which sprang from it, it took no part:\nl
It gave no heed to the paeans of victory,\nl
It was indifferent to its own defeats,\nl
It heard the cry of grief and made no sign;\nl
Impartial fell its gaze on evil and good,\nl
It saw destruction come and did not move.\nl
An equal Cause of things, a lonely Seer\nl
And Master of its multitude of forms,\nl
It acted not but bore all thoughts and deeds,\nl
The witness Lord of Nature's myriad acts\nl
Consenting to the movements of her Force.\nl
His mind reflected this vast quietism.\nl
This witness hush is the Thinker's secret base:\nl
Hidden in silent depths the word is formed,\nl
From hidden silences the act is born\nl
Into the voiceful mind, the labouring world;\nl
In secrecy wraps the seed the Eternal sows\nl
Silence, the mystic birthplace of the soul.\nl
Page 283

In God's supreme withdrawn and timeless hush\nl
A seeing Self and potent Energy met;\nl
The Silence knew itself and thought took form:\nl
Self-made from the dual power creation rose.\nl
In the still self he lived and it in him;\nl
Its mute immemorable listening depths,\nl
Its vastness and its stillness were his own;\nl
One being with it he grew wide, powerful, free.\nl
Apart, unbound, he looked on all things done.\nl
As one who builds his own imagined scenes\nl
And loses not himself in what he sees,\nl
Spectator of a drama self-conceived,\nl
He looked on the world and watched its motive thoughts\nl
With the burden of luminous prophecy in their eyes,\nl
Its forces with their feet of wind and fire\nl
Arisen from the dumbness in his soul.\nl
All now he seemed to understand and know;\nl
Desire came not nor any gust of will,\nl
The great perturbed inquirer lost his task;\nl
Nothing was asked nor wanted any more.\nl
There he could stay, the Self, the Silence won:\nl
His soul had peace, it knew the cosmic Whole.\nl
Then suddenly a luminous finger fell\nl
On all things seen or touched or heard or felt\nl
And showed his mind that nothing could be known;\nl
That must be reached from which all knowledge comes.\nl
The sceptic Ray disrupted all that seems\nl
And smote at the very roots of thought and sense.\nl
In a universe of Nescience they have grown,\nl
Aspiring towards a superconscient Sun,\nl
Playing in shine and rain from heavenlier skies\nl
They never can win however high their reach\nl
Or overpass however keen their probe.\nl
A doubt corroded even the means to think,\nl
Distrust was thrown upon Mind's instruments;\nl
All that it takes for reality's shining coin,\nl
Page 284

Proved fact, fixed inference, deduction clear,\nl
Firm theory, assured significance,\nl
Appeared as frauds upon Time's credit bank\nl
Or assets valueless in Truth's treasury.\nl
An Ignorance on an uneasy throne\nl
Travestied with a fortuitous sovereignty\nl
A figure of knowledge garbed in dubious words\nl
And tinsel thought-forms brightly inadequate.\nl
A labourer in the dark dazzled by half-light,\nl
What it knew was an image in a broken glass,\nl
What it saw was real but its sight untrue.\nl
All the ideas in its vast repertory\nl
Were like the mutterings of a transient cloud\nl
That spent itself in sound and left no trace.\nl
A frail house hanging in uncertain air,\nl
The thin ingenious web round which it moves,\nl
Put out awhile on the tree of the universe,\nl
And gathered up into itself again,\nl
Was only a trap to catch life's insect food,\nl
Winged thoughts that flutter fragile in brief light\nl
But dead, once captured in fixed forms of mind,\nl
Aims puny but looming large in man's small scale,\nl
Flickers of imagination's brilliant gauze\nl
And cobweb-wrapped beliefs alive no more.\nl
The magic hut of built-up certitudes\nl
Made out of glittering dust and bright moonshine\nl
In which it shrines its image of the Real,\nl
Collapsed into the Nescience whence it rose.\nl
Only a gleam was there of symbol facts\nl
That shroud the mystery lurking in their glow,\nl
And falsehoods based on hidden realities\nl
By which they live until they fall from Time.\nl
Our mind is a house haunted by the slain past,\nl
Ideas soon mummified, ghosts of old truths,\nl
God's spontaneities tied with formal strings\nl
And packed into drawers of reason's trim bureau,\nl
Page 285

A grave of great lost opportunities,\nl
Or an office for misuse of soul and life\nl
And all the waste man makes of heaven's gifts\nl
And all his squanderings of Nature's store,\nl
A stage for the comedy of Ignorance.\nl
The world seemed a long aeonic failure's scene:\nl
All sterile grew, no base was left secure.\nl
Assailed by the edge of the convicting beam\nl
The builder Reason lost her confidence\nl
In the successful sleight and turn of thought\nl
That makes the soul the prisoner of a phrase.\nl
Its highest wisdom was a brilliant guess,\nl
Its mighty structured science of the worlds\nl
A passing light on being's surfaces.\nl
There was nothing there but a schema drawn by sense,\nl
A substitute for eternal mysteries,\nl
A scrawl figure of reality, a plan\nl
And elevation by the architect Word\nl
Imposed upon the semblances of Time.\nl
Existence' self was shadowed by a doubt;\nl
Almost it seemed a lotus-leaf afloat\nl
On a nude pool of cosmic Nothingness.\nl
This great spectator and creator Mind\nl
Was only some half-seeing's delegate,\nl
A veil that hung between the soul and Light,\nl
An idol, not the living body of God.\nl
Even the still spirit that looks upon its works\nl
Was some pale front of the Unknowable;\nl
A shadow seemed the wide and witness Self,\nl
Its liberation and immobile calm\nl
A void recoil of being from Time-made things,\nl
Not the self-vision of Eternity.\nl
Deep peace was there, but not the nameless Force:\nl
Our sweet and mighty Mother was not there\nl
Who gathers to her bosom her children's lives,\nl
Her clasp that takes the world into her arms\nl
Page 286

In the fathomless rapture of the Infinite,\nl
The Bliss that is creation's splendid grain\nl
Or the white passion of God-ecstasy\nl
That laughs in the blaze of the boundless heart of Love.\nl
A greater Spirit than the Self of Mind\nl
Must answer to the questioning of his soul.\nl
For here was no firm clue and no sure road;\nl
High-climbing pathways ceased in the unknown;\nl
An artist Sight constructed the Beyond\nl
In contrary patterns and conflicting hues;\nl
A part-experience fragmented the Whole.\nl
He looked above, but all was blank and still:\nl
A sapphire firmament of abstract Thought\nl
Escaped into a formless Vacancy.\nl
He looked below, but all was dark and mute.\nl
A noise was heard, between, of thought and prayer,\nl
A strife, a labour without end or pause;\nl
A vain and ignorant seeking raised its voice.\nl
A rumour and a movement and a call,\nl
A foaming mass, a cry innumerable\nl
Rolled ever upon the ocean surge of Life\nl
Along the coasts of mortal Ignorance.\nl
On its unstable and enormous breast\nl
Beings and forces, forms, ideas like waves\nl
Jostled for figure and supremacy,\nl
And rose and sank and rose again in Time;\nl
And at the bottom of the sleepless stir,\nl
A Nothingness parent of the struggling worlds,\nl
A huge creator Death, a mystic Void,\nl
For ever sustaining the irrational cry,\nl
For ever excluding the supernal Word,\nl
Motionless, refusing question and response,\nl
Reposed beneath the voices and the march\nl
The dim Inconscient's dumb incertitude.\nl
Two firmaments of darkness and of light\nl
Opposed their limits to the spirit's walk;\nl
Page 287

It moved veiled in from Self's infinity\nl
In a world of beings and momentary events\nl
Where all must die to live and live to die.\nl
Immortal by renewed mortality,\nl
It wandered in the spiral of its acts\nl
Or ran around the cycles of its thought,\nl
Yet was no more than its original self\nl
And knew no more than when it first began.\nl
To be was a prison, extinction the escape.\nl
\rl{\fsc End of Canto Thirteen}
Page 288

\par
\ht Canto Fourteen: The World-Soul
\par
\sbigcap A covert answer to his seeking came.\nl
In a far shimmering background of Mind-Space\nl
A glowing mouth was seen, a luminous shaft;\nl
A recluse gate it seemed, musing on joy,\nl
A veiled retreat and escape to mystery.\nl
Away from the unsatisfied surface world\nl
It fled into the bosom of the unknown,\nl
A well, a tunnel of the depths of God.\nl
It plunged as if a mystic groove of hope\nl
Through many layers of formless voiceless self\nl
To reach the last profound of the world's heart,\nl
And from that heart there surged a wordless call\nl
Pleading with some still impenetrable Mind,\nl
Voicing some passionate unseen desire.\nl
As if a beckoning finger of secrecy\nl
Outstretched into a crystal mood of air,\nl
Pointing at him from some near hidden depth,\nl
As if a message from the world's deep soul,\nl
An intimation of a lurking joy\nl
That flowed out from a cup of brooding bliss,\nl
There shimmered stealing out into the Mind\nl
A mute and quivering ecstasy of light,\nl
A passion and delicacy of roseate fire.\nl
As one drawn to his lost spiritual home\nl
Feels now the closeness of a waiting love,\nl
Into a passage dim and tremulous\nl
That clasped him in from day and night's pursuit,\nl
He travelled led by a mysterious sound.\nl
A murmur multitudinous and lone,\nl
All sounds it was in turn, yet still the same.\nl
A hidden call to unforeseen delight\nl
Page 289

In the summoning voice of one long-known, well-loved,\nl
But nameless to the unremembering mind,\nl
It led to rapture back the truant heart.\nl
The immortal cry ravished the captive ear.\nl
Then, lowering its imperious mystery,\nl
It sank to a whisper circling round the soul.\nl
It seemed the yearning of a lonely flute\nl
That roamed along the shores of memory\nl
And filled the eyes with tears of longing joy.\nl
A cricket's rash and fiery single note,\nl
It marked with shrill melody night's moonless hush\nl
And beat upon a nerve of mystic sleep\nl
Its high insistent magical reveille.\nl
A jingling silver laugh of anklet bells\nl
Travelled the roads of a solitary heart;\nl
Its dance solaced an eternal loneliness:\nl
An old forgotten sweetness sobbing came.\nl
Or from a far harmonious distance heard\nl
The tinkling pace of a long caravan\nl
It seemed at times, or a vast forest's hymn,\nl
The solemn reminder of a temple gong,\nl
A bee-croon honey-drunk in summer isles\nl
Ardent with ecstasy in a slumbrous noon,\nl
Or the far anthem of a pilgrim sea.\nl
An incense floated in the quivering air,\nl
A mystic happiness trembled in the breast\nl
As if the invisible Beloved had come\nl
Assuming the sudden loveliness of a face\nl
And close glad hands could seize his fugitive feet\nl
And the world change with the beauty of a smile.\nl
Into a wonderful bodiless realm he came,\nl
The home of a passion without name or voice,\nl
A depth he felt answering to every height,\nl
A nook was found that could embrace all worlds,\nl
A point that was the conscious knot of Space,\nl
An hour eternal in the heart of Time.\nl
Page 290

The silent Soul of all the world was there:\nl
A Being lived, a Presence and a Power,\nl
A single Person who was himself and all\nl
And cherished Nature's sweet and dangerous throbs\nl
Transfigured into beats divine and pure.\nl
One who could love without return for love,\nl
Meeting and turning to the best the worst,\nl
It healed the bitter cruelties of earth,\nl
Transforming all experience to delight;\nl
Intervening in the sorrowful paths of birth\nl
It rocked the cradle of the cosmic Child\nl
And stilled all weeping with its hand of joy;\nl
It led things evil towards their secret good,\nl
It turned racked falsehood into happy truth;\nl
Its power was to reveal divinity.\nl
Infinite, coeval with the mind of God,\nl
It bore within itself a seed, a flame,\nl
A seed from which the Eternal is new-born,\nl
A flame that cancels death in mortal things.\nl
All grew to all kindred and self and near;\nl
The intimacy of God was everywhere,\nl
No veil was felt, no brute barrier inert,\nl
Distance could not divide, Time could not change.\nl
A fire of passion burned in spirit-depths,\nl
A constant touch of sweetness linked all hearts,\nl
The throb of one adoration's single bliss\nl
In a rapt ether of undying love.\nl
An inner happiness abode in all,\nl
A sense of universal harmonies,\nl
A measureless secure eternity\nl
Of truth and beauty and good and joy made one.\nl
Here was the welling core of finite life;\nl
A formless spirit became the soul of form.\nl

\spar All there was soul or made of sheer soul-stuff;\nl
A sky of soul covered a deep soul-ground.\nl
Page 291

All here was known by a spiritual sense:\nl
Thought was not there but a knowledge near and one\nl
Seized on all things by a moved identity,\nl
A sympathy of self with other selves,\nl
The touch of consciousness on consciousness\nl
And being's look on being with inmost gaze\nl
And heart laid bare to heart without walls of speech\nl
And the unanimity of seeing minds\nl
In myriad forms luminous with the one God.\nl
Life was not there, but an impassioned force,\nl
Finer than fineness, deeper than the deeps,\nl
Felt as a subtle and spiritual power,\nl
A quivering out from soul to answering soul,\nl
A mystic movement, a close influence,\nl
A free and happy and intense approach\nl
Of being to being with no screen or check,\nl
Without which life and love could never have been.\nl
Body was not there, for bodies were needed not,\nl
The soul itself was its own deathless form\nl
And met at once the touch of other souls\nl
Close, blissful, concrete, wonderfully true.\nl
As when one walks in sleep through luminous dreams\nl
And, conscious, knows the truth their figures mean,\nl
Here where reality was its own dream,\nl
He knew things by their soul and not their shape:\nl
As those who have lived long made one in love\nl
Need word nor sign for heart's reply to heart,\nl
He met and communed without bar of speech\nl
With beings unveiled by a material frame.\nl
There was a strange spiritual scenery,\nl
A loveliness of lakes and streams and hills,\nl
A flow, a fixity in a soul-space,\nl
And plains and valleys, stretches of soul-joy,\nl
And gardens that were flower-tracts of the spirit,\nl
Its meditations of tinged reverie.\nl
Air was the breath of a pure infinite.\nl
Page 292

A fragrance wandered in a coloured haze\nl
As if the scent and hue of all sweet flowers\nl
Had mingled to copy heaven's atmosphere.\nl
Appealing to the soul and not the eye\nl
Beauty lived there at home in her own house,\nl
There all was beautiful by its own right\nl
And needed not the splendour of a robe.\nl
All objects were like bodies of the Gods,\nl
A spirit symbol environing a soul,\nl
For world and self were one reality.\nl

\spar Immersed in voiceless internatal trance\nl
The beings that once wore forms on earth sat there\nl
In shining chambers of spiritual sleep.\nl
Passed were the pillar-posts of birth and death,\nl
Passed was their little scene of symbol deeds,\nl
Passed were the heavens and hells of their long road;\nl
They had returned into the world's deep soul.\nl
All now was gathered into pregnant rest:\nl
Person and nature suffered a slumber change.\nl
In trance they gathered back their bygone selves,\nl
In a background memory's foreseeing muse\nl
Prophetic of new personality\nl
Arranged the map of their coming destiny's course:\nl
Heirs of their past, their future's discoverers,\nl
Electors of their own self-chosen lot,\nl
They waited for the adventure of new life.\nl
A Person persistent through the lapse of worlds,\nl
Although the same for ever in many shapes\nl
By the outward mind unrecognisable,\nl
Assuming names unknown in unknown climes\nl
Imprints through Time upon the earth's worn page\nl
A growing figure of its secret self,\nl
And learns by experience what the spirit knew,\nl
Till it can see its truth alive and God.\nl
Once more they must face the problem-game of birth,\nl
Page 293

The soul's experiment of joy and grief\nl
And thought and impulse lighting the blind act,\nl
And venture on the roads of circumstance,\nl
Through inner movements and external scenes\nl
Travelling to self across the forms of things.\nl
Into creation's centre he had come.\nl
The spirit wandering from state to state\nl
Finds here the silence of its starting-point\nl
In the formless force and the still fixity\nl
And brooding passion of the world of Soul.\nl
All that is made and once again unmade,\nl
The calm persistent vision of the One\nl
Inevitably re-makes, it lives anew:\nl
Forces and lives and beings and ideas\nl
Are taken into the stillness for a while;\nl
There they remould their purpose and their drift,\nl
Recast their nature and re-form their shape.\nl
Ever they change and changing ever grow,\nl
And passing through a fruitful stage of death\nl
And after long reconstituting sleep\nl
Resume their place in the process of the Gods\nl
Until their work in cosmic Time is done.\nl
\sparn Here was the fashioning chamber of the worlds.\nl
An interval was left twixt act and act,\nl
Twixt birth and birth, twixt dream and waking dream,\nl
A pause that gave new strength to do and be.\nl
Beyond were regions of delight and peace,\nl
Mute birthplaces of light and hope and love,\nl
And cradles of heavenly rapture and repose.\nl
In a slumber of the voices of the world\nl
He of the eternal moment grew aware;\nl
His knowledge stripped bare of the garbs of sense\nl
Knew by identity without thought or word;\nl
His being saw itself without its veils,\nl
Life's line fell from the spirit's infinity.\nl
Along a road of pure interior light,\nl
Page 294

Alone between tremendous Presences,\nl
Under the watching eyes of nameless Gods,\nl
His soul passed on, a single conscious power,\nl
Towards the end which ever begins again,\nl
Approaching through a stillness dumb and calm\nl
To the source of all things human and divine.\nl
There he beheld in their mighty union's poise\nl
The figure of the deathless Two-in-One,\nl
A single being in two bodies clasped,\nl
A diarchy of two united souls,\nl
Seated absorbed in deep creative joy;\nl
Their trance of bliss sustained the mobile world.\nl
Behind them in a morning dusk One stood\nl
Who brought them forth from the Unknowable.\nl
Ever disguised she awaits the seeking spirit;\nl
Watcher on the supreme unreachable peaks,\nl
Guide of the traveller of the unseen paths,\nl
She guards the austere approach to the Alone.\nl
At the beginning of each far-spread plane\nl
Pervading with her power the cosmic suns\nl
She reigns, inspirer of its multiple works\nl
And thinker of the symbol of its scene.\nl
Above them all she stands supporting all,\nl
The sole omnipotent Goddess ever-veiled\nl
Of whom the world is the inscrutable mask;\nl
The ages are the footfalls of her tread,\nl
Their happenings the figure of her thoughts,\nl
And all creation is her endless act.\nl
His spirit was made a vessel of her force;\nl
Mute in the fathomless passion of his will\nl
He outstretched to her his folded hands of prayer.\nl
Then in a sovereign answer to his heart\nl
A gesture came as of worlds thrown away,\nl
And from her raiment's lustrous mystery raised\nl
One arm half-parted the eternal veil.\nl
A light appeared still and imperishable.\nl
Page 295

Attracted to the large and luminous depths\nl
Of the ravishing enigma of her eyes,\nl
He saw the mystic outline of a face.\nl
Overwhelmed by her implacable light and bliss,\nl
An atom of her illimitable self\nl
Mastered by the honey and lightning of her power,\nl
Tossed towards the shores of her ocean-ecstasy,\nl
Drunk with a deep golden spiritual wine,\nl
He cast from the rent stillness of his soul\nl
A cry of adoration and desire\nl
And the surrender of his boundless mind\nl
And the self-giving of his silent heart.\nl
He fell down at her feet unconscious, prone.\nl
\rl{\fsc End of Canto Fourteen}
Page 296

\par
\ht Canto Fifteen: The Kingdoms of the Greater Knowledge
\par
\sbigcap After a measureless moment of the soul\nl
Again returning to these surface fields\nl
Out of the timeless depths where he had sunk,\nl
He heard once more the slow tread of the hours.\nl
All once perceived and lived was far away;\nl
Himself was to himself his only scene.\nl
Above the Witness and his universe\nl
He stood in a realm of boundless silences\nl
Awaiting the Voice that spoke and built the worlds.\nl
A light was round him wide and absolute,\nl
A diamond purity of eternal sight;\nl
A consciousness lay still, devoid of forms,\nl
Free, wordless, uncoerced by sign or rule,\nl
For ever content with only being and bliss;\nl
A sheer existence lived in its own peace\nl
On the single spirit's bare and infinite ground.\nl
Out of the sphere of Mind he had arisen,\nl
He had left the reign of Nature's hues and shades;\nl
He dwelt in his self's colourless purity.\nl
It was a plane of undetermined spirit\nl
That could be a zero or round sum of things,\nl
A state in which all ceased and all began.\nl
All it became that figures the absolute,\nl
A high vast peak whence Spirit could see the worlds,\nl
Calm's wide epiphany, wisdom's mute home,\nl
A lonely station of Omniscience,\nl
A diving-board of the Eternal's power,\nl
A white floor in the house of All-Delight.\nl
Here came the thought that passes beyond Thought,\nl
Here the still Voice which our listening cannot hear,\nl
The Knowledge by which the knower is the known,\nl
Page 297

The Love in which beloved and lover are one.\nl
All stood in an original plenitude,\nl
Hushed and fulfilled before they could create\nl
The glorious dream of their universal acts;\nl
Here was engendered the spiritual birth,\nl
Here closed the finite's crawl to the Infinite.\nl
A thousand roads leaped into Eternity\nl
Or singing ran to meet God's veilless face.\nl
The Known released him from its limiting chain;\nl
He knocked at the doors of the Unknowable.\nl
Thence gazing with an immeasurable outlook\nl
One with self's inlook into its own pure vasts,\nl
He saw the splendour of the spirit's realms,\nl
The greatness and wonder of its boundless works,\nl
The power and passion leaping from its calm,\nl
The rapture of its movement and its rest,\nl
And its fire-sweet miracle of transcendent life,\nl
The million-pointing undivided grasp\nl
Of its vision of one same stupendous All,\nl
Its inexhaustible acts in a timeless Time,\nl
A space that is its own infinity.\nl
A glorious multiple of one radiant Self,\nl
Answering to joy with joy, to love with love,\nl
All there were moving mansions of God-bliss;\nl
Eternal and unique they lived the One.\nl
There forces are great outbursts of God's truth\nl
And objects are its pure spiritual shapes;\nl
Spirit no more is hid from its own view,\nl
All sentience is a sea of happiness\nl
And all creation is an act of light.\nl
Out of the neutral silence of his soul\nl
He passed to its fields of puissance and of calm\nl
And saw the Powers that stand above the world,\nl
Traversed the realms of the supreme Idea\nl
And sought the summit of created things\nl
And the almighty source of cosmic change.\nl
Page 298

There Knowledge called him to her mystic peaks\nl
Where thought is held in a vast internal sense\nl
And feeling swims across a sea of peace\nl
And vision climbs beyond the reach of Time.\nl
An equal of the first creator seers,\nl
Accompanied by an all-revealing light\nl
He moved through regions of transcendent Truth\nl
Inward, immense, innumerably one.\nl
There distance was his own huge spirit's extent;\nl
Delivered from the fictions of the mind\nl
Time's triple dividing step baffled no more;\nl
Its inevitable and continuous stream,\nl
The long flow of its manifesting course,\nl
Was held in spirit's single wide regard.\nl
A universal beauty showed its face:\nl
The invisible deep-fraught significances,\nl
Here sheltered behind form's insensible screen,\nl
Uncovered to him their deathless harmony\nl
And the key to the wonder-book of common things.\nl
In their uniting law stood up revealed\nl
The multiple measures of the upbuilding force,\nl
The lines of the World-Geometer's technique,\nl
The enchantments that uphold the cosmic web\nl
And the magic underlying simple shapes.\nl
On peaks where Silence listens with still heart\nl
To the rhythmic metres of the rolling worlds,\nl
He served the sessions of the triple Fire.\nl
On the rim of two continents of slumber and trance\nl
He heard the ever unspoken Reality's voice\nl
Awaken revelation's mystic cry,\nl
The birthplace found of the sudden infallible Word\nl
And lived in the rays of an intuitive Sun.\nl
Absolved from the ligaments of death and sleep\nl
He rode the lightning seas of cosmic Mind\nl
And crossed the ocean of original sound;\nl
On the last step to the supernal birth\nl
Page 299

He trod along extinction's narrow edge\nl
Near the high verges of eternity,\nl
And mounted the gold ridge of the world-dream\nl
Between the slayer and the saviour fires;\nl
The belt he reached of the unchanging Truth,\nl
Met borders of the inexpressible Light\nl
And thrilled with the presence of the Ineffable.\nl
Above him he saw the flaming Hierarchies,\nl
The wings that fold around created Space,\nl
The sun-eyed Guardians and the golden Sphinx\nl
And the tiered planes and the immutable Lords.\nl
A wisdom waiting on Omniscience\nl
Sat voiceless in a vast passivity;\nl
It judged not, measured not, nor strove to know,\nl
But listened for the veiled all-seeing Thought\nl
And the burden of a calm transcendent Voice.\nl
He had reached the top of all that can be known:\nl
His sight surpassed creation's head and base;\nl
Ablaze the triple heavens revealed their suns,\nl
The obscure Abyss exposed its monstrous rule.\nl
All but the ultimate Mystery was his field,\nl
Almost the Unknowable disclosed its rim.\nl
His self's infinities began to emerge,\nl
The hidden universes cried to him;\nl
Eternities called to eternities\nl
Sending their speechless message still remote.\nl
Arisen from the marvel of the depths\nl
And burning from the superconscious heights\nl
And sweeping in great horizontal gyres\nl
A million energies joined and were the One.\nl
All flowed immeasurably to one sea:\nl
All living forms became its atom homes.\nl
A Panergy that harmonised all life\nl
Held now existence in its vast control;\nl
A portion of that majesty he was made.\nl
At will he lived in the unoblivious Ray.\nl
Page 300

\sparn In that high realm where no untruth can come,\nl
Where all are different and all is one,\nl
In the Impersonal's ocean without shore\nl
The Person in the World-Spirit anchored rode;\nl
It thrilled with the mighty marchings of World-Force,\nl
Its acts were the comrades of God's infinite peace.\nl
An adjunct glory and a symbol self,\nl
The body was delivered to the soul,—\nl
An immortal point of power, a block of poise\nl
In a cosmicity's wide formless surge,\nl
A conscious edge of the Transcendent's might\nl
Carving perfection from a bright world-stuff,\nl
It figured in it a universe's sense.\nl
There consciousness was a close and single weft;\nl
The far and near were one in spirit-space,\nl
The moments there were pregnant with all time.\nl
The superconscient's screen was ripped by thought,\nl
Idea rotated symphonies of sight,\nl
Sight was a flame-throw from identity;\nl
Life was a marvellous journey of the spirit,\nl
Feeling a wave from the universal Bliss.\nl
In the kingdom of the Spirit's power and light,\nl
As if one who arrived out of infinity's womb\nl
He came new-born, infant and limitless\nl
And grew in the wisdom of the timeless Child;\nl
He was a vast that soon became a Sun.\nl
A great luminous silence whispered to his heart;\nl
His knowledge an inview caught unfathomable,\nl
An outview by no brief horizons cut:\nl
He thought and felt in all, his gaze had power.\nl
He communed with the Incommunicable;\nl
Beings of a wider consciousness were his friends,\nl
Forms of a larger subtler make drew near;\nl
The Gods conversed with him behind Life's veil.\nl
Neighbour his being grew to Nature's crests.\nl
The primal Energy took him in its arms;\nl
Page 301

His brain was wrapped in overwhelming light,\nl
An all-embracing knowledge seized his heart:\nl
Thoughts rose in him no earthly mind can hold,\nl
Mights played that never coursed through mortal nerves:\nl
He scanned the secrets of the Overmind,\nl
He bore the rapture of the Oversoul.\nl
A borderer of the empire of the Sun,\nl
Attuned to the supernal harmonies,\nl
He linked creation to the Eternal's sphere.\nl
His finite parts approached their absolutes,\nl
His actions framed the movements of the Gods,\nl
His will took up the reins of cosmic Force.\nl
\rl{\fsc End of Canto Fifteen}
\rl{\fsc End of Book Two}
Page 302
