Into the whiteness of its muse of Space\nl
A spate, a torrent of the speed of Life\nl
Broke like a wind-lashed driven mob of waves\nl
Racing on a pale floor of summer sand;\nl
It drowned its banks, a mountain of climbing waves.\nl
Page 491

Enormous was its vast and passionate voice.\nl
It cried to her listening spirit as it ran,\nl
Demanding God's submission to chainless Force.\nl
A deaf force calling to a status dumb,\nl
A thousand voices in a muted Vast,\nl
It claimed the heart's support for its clutch at joy,\nl
For its need to act the witness Soul's consent,\nl
For its lust of power her neutral being's seal.\nl
Into the wideness of her watching self\nl
It brought a grandiose gust of the Breath of Life;\nl
Its torrent carried the world's hopes and fears,\nl
All life's, all Nature's dissatisfied hungry cry,\nl
And the longing all eternity cannot fill.\nl
It called to the mountain secrecies of the soul\nl
And the miracle of the never-dying fire,\nl
It spoke to some first inexpressible ecstasy\nl
Hidden in the creative beat of Life;\nl
Out of the nether unseen deeps it tore\nl
Its lure and magic of disordered bliss,\nl
Into earth-light poured its maze of tangled charm\nl
And heady draught of Nature's primitive joy\nl
And the fire and mystery of forbidden delight\nl
Drunk from the world-libido's bottomless well,\nl
And the honey-sweet poison-wine of lust and death,\nl
But dreamed a vintage of glory of life's gods,\nl
And felt as celestial rapture's golden sting.\nl
The cycles of the infinity of desire\nl
And the mystique that made an unrealised world\nl
Wider than the known and closer than the unknown\nl
In which hunt for ever the hounds of mind and life,\nl
Tempted a deep dissatisfied urge within\nl
To long for the unfulfilled and ever far\nl
And make this life upon a limiting earth\nl
A climb towards summits vanishing in the void,\nl
A search for the glory of the impossible.\nl
It dreamed of that which never has been known,\nl
Page 492

It grasped at that which never has been won,\nl
It chased into an Elysian memory\nl
The charms that flee from the heart's soon lost delight;\nl
It dared the force that slays, the joys that hurt,\nl
The imaged shape of unaccomplished things\nl
And the summons to a Circean transmuting dance\nl
And passion's tenancy of the courts of love\nl
And the wild Beast's ramp and romp with Beauty and Life.\nl
It brought its cry and surge of opposite powers,\nl
Its moments of the touch of luminous planes,\nl
Its flame-ascensions and sky-pitched vast attempts,\nl
Its fiery towers of dream built on the winds,\nl
Its sinkings towards the darkness and the abyss,\nl
Its honey of tenderness, its sharp wine of hate,\nl
Its changes of sun and cloud, of laughter and tears,\nl
Its bottomless danger-pits and swallowing gulfs,\nl
Its fear and joy and ecstasy and despair,\nl
Its occult wizardries, its simple lines\nl
And great communions and uplifting moves,\nl
Its faith in heaven, its intercourse with hell.\nl
These powers were not blunt with the dead weight of earth,\nl
They gave ambrosia's taste and poison's sting.\nl
There was an ardour in the gaze of Life\nl
That saw heaven blue in the grey air of Night:\nl
The impulses godward soared on passion's wings.\nl
Mind's quick-paced thoughts floated from their high necks,\nl
A glowing splendour as of an irised mane,\nl
A parure of pure intuition's light;\nl
Its flame-foot gallop they could imitate:\nl
Mind's voices mimicked inspiration's stress,\nl
Its ictus of infallibility,\nl
Its speed and lightning heaven-leap of the Gods.\nl
A trenchant blade that shore the nets of doubt,\nl
Its sword of discernment seemed almost divine.\nl
Yet all that knowledge was a borrowed sun's;\nl
The forms that came were not heaven's native births:\nl
Page 493

An inner voice could speak the unreal's Word;\nl
Its puissance dangerous and absolute\nl
Could mingle poison with the wine of God.\nl
On these high shining backs falsehood could ride;\nl
Truth lay with delight in error's passionate arms\nl
Gliding downstream in a blithe gilded barge:\nl
She edged her ray with a magnificent lie.\nl
Here in Life's nether realms all contraries meet;\nl
Truth stares and does her works with bandaged eyes\nl
And Ignorance is Wisdom's patron here:\nl
Those galloping hooves in their enthusiast speed\nl
Could bear to a dangerous intermediate zone\nl
Where Death walks wearing a robe of deathless Life.\nl
Or they enter the valley of the wandering Gleam\nl
Whence, captives or victims of the specious Ray,\nl
Souls trapped in that region never can escape.\nl
Agents, not masters, they serve Life's desires\nl
Toiling for ever in the snare of Time.\nl
Their bodies born out of some Nihil's womb\nl
Ensnare the spirit in the moment's dreams,\nl
Then perish vomiting the immortal soul\nl
Out of Matter's belly into the sink of Nought.\nl
Yet some uncaught, unslain, can warily pass\nl
Carrying Truth's image in the sheltered heart,\nl
Pluck Knowledge out of error's screening grip,\nl
Break paths through the blind walls of little self,\nl
Then travel on to reach a greater life.\nl
All this streamed past her and seemed to her vision's sight\nl
As if around a high and voiceless isle\nl
A clamour of waters from far unknown hills\nl
Swallowed its narrow banks in crowding waves\nl
And made a hungry world of white wild foam:\nl
Hastening, a dragon with a million feet,\nl
Its foam and cry a drunken giant's din,\nl
Tossing a mane of Darkness into God's sky,\nl
It ebbed receding into a distant roar.\nl
Page 494

Then smiled again a large and tranquil air:\nl
Blue heaven, green earth, partners of Beauty's reign,\nl
Lived as of old, companions in happiness;\nl
And in the world's heart laughed the joy of life.\nl
All now was still, the soil shone dry and pure.\nl
Through it all she moved not, plunged not in the vain waves.\nl
Out of the vastness of the silent self\nl
Life's clamour fled; her spirit was mute and free.\nl

\spar Then journeying forward through the self's wide hush\nl
She came into a brilliant ordered Space.\nl
There Life dwelt parked in an armed tranquillity;\nl
A chain was on her strong insurgent heart.\nl
Tamed to the modesty of a measured pace,\nl
She kept no more her vehement stride and rush;\nl
She had lost the careless majesty of her muse\nl
And the ample grandeur of her regal force;\nl
Curbed were her mighty pomps, her splendid waste,\nl
Sobered the revels of her bacchant play,\nl
Cut down were her squanderings in desire's bazaar,\nl
Coerced her despot will, her fancy's dance,\nl
A cold stolidity bound the riot of sense.\nl
A royalty without freedom was her lot;\nl
The sovereign throned obeyed her ministers:\nl
Her servants mind and sense governed her house:\nl
Her spirit's bounds they cast in rigid lines\nl
And guarding with a phalanx of armoured rules\nl
The reason's balanced reign, kept order and peace.\nl
Her will lived closed in adamant walls of law,\nl
Coerced was her force by chains that feigned to adorn,\nl
Imagination was prisoned in a fort,\nl
Her wanton and licentious favourite;\nl
Reality's poise and reason's symmetry\nl
Were set in its place sentinelled by marshalled facts,\nl
They gave to the soul for throne a bench of Law,\nl
For kingdom a small world of rule and line:\nl
Page 495

The ages' wisdom, shrivelled to scholiast lines,\nl
Shrank patterned into a copy-book device.\nl
The Spirit's almighty freedom was not here:\nl
A schoolman mind had captured life's large space,\nl
But chose to live in bare and paltry rooms\nl
Parked off from the too vast dangerous universe,\nl
Fearing to lose its soul in the infinite.\nl
Even the Idea's ample sweep was cut\nl
Into a system, chained to fixed pillars of thought\nl
Or rivetted to Matter's solid ground:\nl
Or else the soul was lost in its own heights:\nl
Obeying the Ideal's high-browed law\nl
Thought based a throne on unsubstantial air\nl
Disdaining earth's flat triviality:\nl
It barred reality out to live in its dreams.\nl
Or all stepped into a systemed universe:\nl
Life's empire was a managed continent,\nl
Its thoughts an army ranked and disciplined;\nl
Uniformed they kept the logic of their fixed place\nl
At the bidding of the trained centurion mind.\nl
Or each stepped into its station like a star\nl
Or marched through fixed and constellated heavens\nl
Or kept its feudal rank among its peers\nl
In the sky's unchanging cosmic hierarchy.\nl
Or like a high-bred maiden with chaste eyes\nl
Forbidden to walk unveiled the public ways,\nl
She must in close secluded chambers move,\nl
Her feeling in cloisters live or gardened paths.\nl
Life was consigned to a safe level path,\nl
It dared not tempt the great and difficult heights\nl
Or climb to be neighbour to a lonely star\nl
Or skirt the danger of the precipice\nl
Or tempt the foam-curled breakers' perilous laugh,\nl
Adventure's lyrist, danger's amateur,\nl
Or into her chamber call some flaming god,\nl
Or leave the world's bounds and where no limits are\nl
Page 496

Meet with the heart's passion the Adorable\nl
Or set the world ablaze with the inner Fire.\nl
A chastened epithet in the prose of life,\nl
She must fill with colour just her sanctioned space,\nl
Not break out of the cabin of the idea\nl
Nor trespass into rhythms too high or vast.\nl
Even when it soared into ideal air,\nl
Thought's flight lost not itself in heaven's blue:\nl
It drew upon the skies a patterned flower\nl
Of disciplined beauty and harmonic light.\nl
A temperate vigilant spirit governed life:\nl
Its acts were tools of the considering thought,\nl
Too cold to take fire and set the world ablaze,\nl
Or the careful reason's diplomatic moves\nl
Testing the means to a prefigured end,\nl
Or at the highest pitch some calm Will's plan\nl
Or a strategy of some High Command within\nl
To conquer the secret treasures of the gods\nl
Or win for a masked king some glorious world,\nl
Not a reflex of the spontaneous self,\nl
An index of the being and its moods,\nl
A winging of conscious spirit, a sacrament\nl
Of life's communion with the still Supreme\nl
Or its pure movement on the Eternal's road.\nl
Or else for the body of some high Idea\nl
A house was built with too close-fitting bricks;\nl
Action and thought cemented made a wall\nl
Of small ideals limiting the soul.\nl
Even meditation mused on a narrow seat;\nl
And worship turned to an exclusive God,\nl
To the Universal in a chapel prayed\nl
Whose doors were shut against the universe;\nl
Or kneeled to the bodiless Impersonal\nl
A mind shut to the cry and fire of love:\nl
A rational religion dried the heart.\nl
It planned a smooth life's acts with ethics' rule\nl
Page 497

Or offered a cold and flameless sacrifice.\nl
The sacred Book lay on its sanctified desk\nl
Wrapped in interpretation's silken strings:\nl
A credo sealed up its spiritual sense.\nl

\spar Here was a quiet country of fixed mind,\nl
Here life no more was all nor passion's voice;\nl
The cry of sense had sunk into a hush.\nl
Soul was not there nor spirit but mind alone;\nl
Mind claimed to be the spirit and the soul.\nl
The spirit saw itself as form of mind,\nl
Lost itself in the glory of the thought,\nl
A light that made invisible the sun.\nl
Into a firm and settled space she came\nl
Where all was still and all things kept their place.\nl
Each found what it had sought and knew its aim.\nl
All had a final last stability.\nl
There one stood forth who bore authority\nl
On an important brow and held a rod;\nl
Command was incarnate in his gesture and tone;\nl
Tradition's petrified wisdom carved his speech,\nl
His sentences savoured the oracle.\nl
“Traveller or pilgrim of the inner world,\nl
Fortunate art thou to reach our brilliant air\nl
Flaming with thought's supreme finality.\nl
O aspirant to the perfect way of life,\nl
Here find it; rest from search and live at peace.\nl
Ours is the home of cosmic certainty.\nl
Here is the truth, God's harmony is here.\nl
Register thy name in the book of the elite,\nl
Admitted by the sanction of the few,\nl
Adopt thy station of knowledge, thy post in mind,\nl
Thy ticket of order draw in Life's bureau\nl
And praise thy fate that made thee one of ours.\nl
All here, docketed and tied, the mind can know,\nl
All schemed by law that God permits to life.\nl
Page 498

This is the end and there is no beyond.\nl
Here is the safety of the ultimate wall,\nl
Here is the clarity of the sword of Light,\nl
Here is the victory of a single Truth,\nl
Here burns the diamond of flawless bliss.\nl
A favourite of Heaven and Nature live.”\nl
But to the too satisfied and confident sage\nl
Savitri replied casting into his world\nl
Sight's deep release, the heart's questioning inner voice:\nl
For here the heart spoke not, only clear daylight\nl
Of intellect reigned here, limiting, cold, precise.\nl
“Happy are they who in this chaos of things,\nl
This coming and going of the feet of Time,\nl
Can find the single Truth, the eternal Law:\nl
Untouched they live by hope and doubt and fear.\nl
Happy are men anchored on fixed belief\nl
In this uncertain and ambiguous world,\nl
Or who have planted in the heart's rich soil\nl
One small grain of spiritual certitude.\nl
Happiest who stand on faith as on a rock.\nl
But I must pass leaving the ended search,\nl
Truth's rounded outcome firm, immutable\nl
And this harmonic building of world-fact,\nl
This ordered knowledge of apparent things.\nl
Here I can stay not, for I seek my soul.”\nl
None answered in that bright contented world,\nl
Or only turned on their accustomed way\nl
Astonished to hear questioning in that air\nl
Or thoughts that could still turn to the Beyond.\nl
But some murmured, passers-by from kindred spheres:\nl
Each by his credo judged the thought she spoke.\nl
“Who then is this who knows not that the soul\nl
Is a least gland or a secretion's fault\nl
Disquieting the sane government of the mind,\nl
Disordering the function of the brain,\nl
Or a yearning lodged in Nature's mortal house\nl
Page 499

Or dream whispered in man's cave of hollow thought\nl
Who would prolong his brief unhappy term\nl
Or cling to living in a sea of death?”\nl
But others, “Nay, it is her spirit she seeks.\nl
A splendid shadow of the name of God,\nl
A formless lustre from the Ideal's realm,\nl
The Spirit is the Holy Ghost of Mind;\nl
But none has touched its limbs or seen its face.\nl
Each soul is the great Father's crucified Son,\nl
Mind is that soul's one parent, its conscious cause,\nl
The ground on which trembles a brief passing light,\nl
Mind, sole creator of the apparent world.\nl
All that is here is part of our own self;\nl
Our minds have made the world in which we live.”\nl
Another with mystic and unsatisfied eyes\nl
Who loved his slain belief and mourned its death,\nl
“Is there one left who seeks for a Beyond?\nl
Can still the path be found, opened the gate?”\nl

\spar So she fared on across her silent self.\nl
To a road she came thronged with an ardent crowd\nl
Who sped brilliant, fire-footed, sunlight-eyed,\nl
Pressing to reach the world's mysterious wall,\nl
And pass through masked doorways into outer mind\nl
Where the Light comes not nor the mystic voice,\nl
Messengers from our subliminal greatnesses,\nl
Guests from the cavern of the secret soul.\nl
Into dim spiritual somnolence they break\nl
Or shed wide wonder on our waking self,\nl
Ideas that haunt us with their radiant tread,\nl
Dreams that are hints of unborn Reality,\nl
Strange goddesses with deep-pooled magical eyes,\nl
Strong wind-haired gods carrying the harps of hope,\nl
Great moon-hued visions gliding through gold air,\nl
Aspiration's sun-dream head and star-carved limbs,\nl
Emotions making common hearts sublime.\nl
Page 500

And Savitri mingling in that glorious crowd,\nl
Yearning to the spiritual light they bore,\nl
Longed once to hasten like them to save God's world;\nl
But she reined back the high passion in her heart;\nl
She knew that first she must discover her soul.\nl
Only who save themselves can others save.\nl
In contrary sense she faced life's riddling truth:\nl
They carrying the light to suffering men\nl
Hurried with eager feet to the outer world;\nl
Her eyes were turned towards the eternal source.\nl
Outstretching her hands to stay the throng she cried:\nl
“O happy company of luminous gods,\nl
Reveal, who know, the road that I must tread,—\nl
For surely that bright quarter is your home,—\nl
To find the birthplace of the occult Fire\nl
And the deep mansion of my secret soul.”\nl
One answered pointing to a silence dim\nl
On a remote extremity of sleep\nl
In some far background of the inner world.\nl
“O Savitri, from thy hidden soul we come.\nl
We are the messengers, the occult gods\nl
Who help men's drab and heavy ignorant lives\nl
To wake to beauty and the wonder of things\nl
Touching them with glory and divinity;\nl
In evil we light the deathless flame of good\nl
And hold the torch of knowledge on ignorant roads;\nl
We are thy will and all men's will towards Light.\nl
O human copy and disguise of God\nl
Who seekst the deity thou keepest hid\nl
And livest by the Truth thou hast not known,\nl
Follow the world's winding highway to its source.\nl
There in the silence few have ever reached,\nl
Thou shalt see the Fire burning on the bare stone\nl
And the deep cavern of thy secret soul.”\nl
Then Savitri following the great winding road\nl
Came where it dwindled into a narrow path\nl
Page 501

Trod only by rare wounded pilgrim feet.\nl
A few bright forms emerged from unknown depths\nl
And looked at her with calm immortal eyes.\nl
There was no sound to break the brooding hush;\nl
One felt the silent nearness of the soul.\nl
\rl{\fsc End of Canto Three}
Page 502

\par
\ht Canto Four: The Triple Soul-Forces
\par
\sbigcap Here from a low and prone and listless ground\nl
The passion of the first ascent began;\nl
A moon-bright face in a sombre cloud of hair,\nl
A Woman sat in a pale lustrous robe.\nl
A rugged and ragged soil was her bare seat,\nl
Beneath her feet a sharp and wounding stone.\nl
A divine pity on the peaks of the world,\nl
A spirit touched by the grief of all that lives,\nl
She looked out far and saw from inner mind\nl
This questionable world of outward things,\nl
Of false appearances and plausible shapes,\nl
This dubious cosmos stretched in the ignorant Void,\nl
The pangs of earth, the toil and speed of the stars\nl
And the difficult birth and dolorous end of life.\nl
Accepting the universe as her body of woe,\nl
The Mother of the seven sorrows bore\nl
The seven stabs that pierced her bleeding heart:\nl
The beauty of sadness lingered on her face,\nl
Her eyes were dim with the ancient stain of tears.\nl
Her heart was riven with the world's agony\nl
And burdened with the sorrow and struggle in Time,\nl
An anguished music trailed in her rapt voice.\nl
Absorbed in a deep compassion's ecstasy,\nl
Lifting the mild ray of her patient gaze,\nl
In soft sweet training words slowly she spoke:\nl
“O Savitri, I am thy secret soul.\nl
To share the suffering of the world I came,\nl
I draw my children's pangs into my breast.\nl
I am the nurse of the dolour beneath the stars;\nl
I am the soul of all who wailing writhe\nl
Under the ruthless harrow of the Gods.\nl
Page 503

I am woman, nurse and slave and beaten beast;\nl
I tend the hands that gave me cruel blows.\nl
The hearts that spurned my love and zeal I serve;\nl
I am the courted queen, the pampered doll,\nl
I am the giver of the bowl of rice,\nl
I am the worshipped Angel of the House.\nl
I am in all that suffers and that cries.\nl
Mine is the prayer that climbs in vain from earth,\nl
I am traversed by my creatures' agonies,\nl
I am the spirit in a world of pain.\nl
The scream of tortured flesh and tortured hearts\nl
Fall'n back on heart and flesh unheard by Heaven\nl
Has rent with helpless grief and wrath my soul.\nl
I have seen the peasant burning in his hut,\nl
I have seen the slashed corpse of the slaughtered child,\nl
Heard woman's cry ravished and stripped and haled\nl
Amid the bayings of the hell-hound mob,\nl
I have looked on, I had no power to save.\nl
I have brought no arm of strength to aid or slay;\nl
God gave me love, he gave me not his force.\nl
I have shared the toil of the yoked animal drudge\nl
Pushed by the goad, encouraged by the whip;\nl
I have shared the fear-filled life of bird and beast,\nl
Its long hunt for the day's precarious food,\nl
Its covert slink and crouch and hungry prowl,\nl
Its pain and terror seized by beak and claw.\nl
I have shared the daily life of common men,\nl
Its petty pleasures and its petty cares,\nl
Its press of troubles and haggard horde of ills,\nl
Earth's trail of sorrow hopeless of relief,\nl
The unwanted tedious labour without joy,\nl
And the burden of misery and the strokes of fate.\nl
I have been pity, leaning over pain\nl
And the tender smile that heals the wounded heart\nl
And sympathy making life less hard to bear.\nl
Man has felt near my unseen face and hands;\nl
Page 504

I have become the sufferer and his moan,\nl
I have lain down with the mangled and the slain,\nl
I have lived with the prisoner in his dungeon cell.\nl
Heavy on my shoulders weighs the yoke of Time:\nl
Nothing refusing of creation's load,\nl
I have borne all and know I still must bear:\nl
Perhaps when the world sinks into a last sleep,\nl
I too may sleep in dumb eternal peace.\nl
I have borne the calm indifference of Heaven,\nl
Watched Nature's cruelty to suffering things\nl
While God passed silent by nor turned to help.\nl
Yet have I cried not out against his will,\nl
Yet have I not accused his cosmic Law.\nl
Only to change this great hard world of pain\nl
A patient prayer has risen from my breast;\nl
A pallid resignation lights my brow,\nl
Within me a blind faith and mercy dwell;\nl
I carry the fire that never can be quenched\nl
And the compassion that supports the suns.\nl
I am the hope that looks towards my God,\nl
My God who never came to me till now;\nl
His voice I hear that ever says `I come':\nl
I know that one day he shall come at last.”\nl
She ceased, and like an echo from below\nl
Answering her pathos of divine complaint\nl
A voice of wrath took up the dire refrain,\nl
A growl of thunder or roar of angry beast,\nl
The beast that crouching growls within man's depths,—\nl
Voice of a tortured Titan once a God.\nl
“I am the Man of Sorrows, I am he\nl
Who is nailed on the wide cross of the universe;\nl
To enjoy my agony God built the earth,\nl
My passion he has made his drama's theme.\nl
He has sent me naked into his bitter world\nl
And beaten me with his rods of grief and pain\nl
That I might cry and grovel at his feet\nl
Page 505

And offer him worship with my blood and tears.\nl
I am Prometheus under the vulture's beak,\nl
Man the discoverer of the undying fire,\nl
In the flame he kindled burning like a moth;\nl
I am the seeker who can never find,\nl
I am the fighter who can never win,\nl
I am the runner who never touched his goal:\nl
Hell tortures me with the edges of my thought,\nl
Heaven tortures me with the splendour of my dreams.\nl
What profit have I of my animal birth;\nl
What profit have I of my human soul?\nl
I toil like the animal, like the animal die.\nl
I am man the rebel, man the helpless serf;\nl
Fate and my fellows cheat me of my wage.\nl
I loosen with my blood my servitude's seal\nl
And shake from my aching neck the oppressor's knees\nl
Only to seat new tyrants on my back:\nl
My teachers lesson me in slavery,\nl
I am shown God's stamp and my own signature\nl
Upon the sorry contract of my fate.\nl
I have loved, but none has loved me since my birth;\nl
My fruit of works is given to other hands.\nl
All that is left me is my evil thoughts,\nl
My sordid quarrel against God and man,\nl
Envy of the riches that I cannot share,\nl
Hate of a happiness that is not mine.\nl
I know my fate will ever be the same,\nl
It is my nature's work that cannot change:\nl
I have loved for mine, not for the beloved's sake,\nl
I have lived for myself and not for others' lives.\nl
Each in himself is sole by Nature's law.\nl
So God has made his harsh and dreadful world,\nl
So has he built the petty heart of man.\nl
Only by force and ruse can man survive:\nl
For pity is a weakness in his breast,\nl
His goodness is a laxity in the nerves,\nl
Page 506

His kindness an investment for return,\nl
His altruism is ego's other face:\nl
He serves the world that him the world may serve.\nl
If once the Titan's strength could wake in me,\nl
If Enceladus from Etna could arise,\nl
I then would reign the master of the world\nl
And like a god enjoy man's bliss and pain.\nl
But God has taken from me the ancient Force.\nl
There is a dull consent in my sluggish heart,\nl
A fierce satisfaction with my special pangs\nl
As if they made me taller than my kind;\nl
Only by suffering can I excel.\nl
I am the victim of titanic ills,\nl
I am the doer of demoniac deeds;\nl
I was made for evil, evil is my lot;\nl
Evil I must be and by evil live;\nl
Nought other can I do but be myself;\nl
What Nature made me, that I must remain.\nl
I suffer and toil and weep; I moan and hate.”\nl
And Savitri heard the voice, the echo heard\nl
And turning to her being of pity spoke:\nl
“Madonna of suffering, Mother of grief divine,\nl
Thou art a portion of my soul put forth\nl
To bear the unbearable sorrow of the world.\nl
Because thou art, men yield not to their doom,\nl
But ask for happiness and strive with fate;\nl
Because thou art, the wretched still can hope.\nl
But thine is the power to solace, not to save.\nl
One day I will return, a bringer of strength,\nl
And make thee drink from the Eternal's cup;\nl
His streams of force shall triumph in thy limbs\nl
And Wisdom's calm control thy passionate heart.\nl
Thy love shall be the bond of humankind,\nl
Compassion the bright key of Nature's acts:\nl
Misery shall pass abolished from the earth;\nl
The world shall be freed from the anger of the Beast,\nl
Page 507

From the cruelty of the Titan and his pain.\nl
There shall be peace and joy for ever more.”\nl

\spar On passed she in her spirit's upward route.\nl
An ardent grandeur climbed mid ferns and rocks,\nl
A quiet wind flattered the heart to warmth,\nl
A finer perfume breathed from slender trees.\nl
All beautiful grew, subtle and high and strange.\nl
Here on a boulder carved like a huge throne\nl
A Woman sat in gold and purple sheen,\nl
Armed with the trident and the thunderbolt,\nl
Her feet upon a couchant lion's back.\nl
A formidable smile curved round her lips,\nl
Heaven-fire laughed in the corners of her eyes;\nl
Her body a mass of courage and heavenly strength,\nl
She menaced the triumph of the nether gods.\nl
A halo of lightnings flamed around her head\nl
And sovereignty, a great cestus, zoned her robe\nl
And majesty and victory sat with her\nl
Guarding in the wide cosmic battlefield\nl
Against the flat equality of Death\nl
And the all-levelling insurgent Night\nl
The hierarchy of the ordered Powers,\nl
The high changeless values, the peaked eminences,\nl
The privileged aristocracy of Truth,\nl
And in the governing Ideal's sun\nl
The triumvirate of wisdom, love and bliss\nl
And the sole autocracy of the absolute Light.\nl
August on her seat in the inner world of Mind,\nl
The Mother of Might looked down on passing things,\nl
Listened to the advancing tread of Time,\nl
Saw the irresistible wheeling of the suns\nl
And heard the thunder of the march of God.\nl
Amid the swaying Forces in their strife\nl
Sovereign was her word of luminous command,\nl
Her speech like a war-cry rang or a pilgrim chant.\nl
Page 508

A charm restoring hope in failing hearts\nl
Aspired the harmony of her puissant voice:\nl
“O Savitri, I am thy secret soul.\nl
I have come down into the human world\nl
And the movement watched by an unsleeping Eye\nl
And the dark contrariety of earth's fate\nl
And the battle of the bright and sombre Powers.\nl
I stand upon earth's paths of danger and grief\nl
And help the unfortunate and save the doomed.\nl
To the strong I bring the guerdon of their strength,\nl
To the weak I bring the armour of my force;\nl
To men who long I carry their coveted joy:\nl
I am fortune justifying the great and wise\nl
By the sanction of the plaudits of the crowd,\nl
Then trampling them with the armed heel of fate.\nl
My ear is leaned to the cry of the oppressed,\nl
I topple down the thrones of tyrant kings:\nl
A cry comes from proscribed and hunted lives\nl
Appealing to me against a pitiless world,\nl
A voice of the forsaken and desolate\nl
And the lone prisoner in his dungeon cell.\nl
Men hail in my coming the Almighty's force\nl
Or praise with thankful tears his saviour Grace.\nl
I smite the Titan who bestrides the world\nl
And slay the ogre in his blood-stained den.\nl
I am Durga, goddess of the proud and strong,\nl
And Lakshmi, queen of the fair and fortunate;\nl
I wear the face of Kali when I kill,\nl
I trample the corpses of the demon hordes.\nl
I am charged by God to do his mighty work,\nl
Uncaring I serve his will who sent me forth,\nl
Reckless of peril and earthly consequence.\nl
I reason not of virtue and of sin\nl
But do the deed he has put into my heart.\nl
I fear not for the angry frown of Heaven,\nl
I flinch not from the red assault of Hell;\nl
Page 509

I crush the opposition of the gods,\nl
Tread down a million goblin obstacles.\nl
I guide man to the path of the Divine\nl
And guard him from the red Wolf and the Snake.\nl
I set in his mortal hand my heavenly sword\nl
And put on him the breastplate of the gods.\nl
I break the ignorant pride of human mind\nl
And lead the thought to the wideness of the Truth;\nl
I rend man's narrow and successful life\nl
And force his sorrowful eyes to gaze at the sun\nl
That he may die to earth and live in his soul.\nl
I know the goal, I know the secret route;\nl
I have studied the map of the invisible worlds;\nl
I am the battle's head, the journey's star.\nl
But the great obstinate world resists my Word,\nl
And the crookedness and evil in man's heart\nl
Is stronger than Reason, profounder than the Pit,\nl
And the malignancy of hostile Powers\nl
Puts craftily back the clock of destiny\nl
And mightier seems than the eternal Will.\nl
The cosmic evil is too deep to unroot,\nl
The cosmic suffering is too vast to heal.\nl
A few I guide who pass me towards the Light;\nl
A few I save, the mass falls back unsaved;\nl
A few I help, the many strive and fail.\nl
But my heart I have hardened and I do my work:\nl
Slowly the light grows greater in the East,\nl
Slowly the world progresses on God's road.\nl
His seal is on my task, it cannot fail:\nl
I shall hear the silver swing of heaven's gates\nl
When God comes out to meet the soul of the world.”\nl
She spoke and from the lower human world\nl
An answer, a warped echo met her speech;\nl
The voice came through the spaces of the mind\nl
Of the dwarf-Titan, the deformed chained god\nl
Who strives to master his nature's rebel stuff\nl
Page 510

And make the universe his instrument.\nl
The Ego of this great world of desire\nl
Claimed earth and the wide heavens for the use\nl
Of man, head of the life it shapes on earth,\nl
Its representative and conscious soul,\nl
And symbol of evolving light and force\nl
And vessel of the godhead that must be.\nl
A thinking animal, Nature's struggling lord,\nl
Has made of her his nurse and tool and slave\nl
And pays to her as wage and emolument\nl
Inescapably by a deep law in things\nl
His heart's grief and his body's death and pain:\nl
His pains are her means to grow, to see and feel;\nl
His death assists her immortality.\nl
A tool and slave of his own slave and tool,\nl
He praises his free will and his master mind\nl
And is pushed by her upon her chosen paths;\nl
Possessor he is possessed and, ruler, ruled,\nl
Her conscious automaton, her desire's dupe.\nl
His soul is her guest, a sovereign mute, inert,\nl
His body her robot, his life her way to live,\nl
His conscious mind her strong revolted serf.\nl
The voice rose up and smote some inner sun.\nl
“I am the heir of the forces of the earth,\nl
Slowly I make good my right to my estate;\nl
A growing godhead in her divinised mud,\nl
I climb, a claimant to the throne of heaven.\nl
The last-born of the earth I stand the first;\nl
Her slow millenniums waited for my birth.\nl
Although I live in Time besieged by Death,\nl
Precarious owner of my body and soul\nl
Housed on a little speck amid the stars,\nl
For me and my use the universe was made.\nl
Immortal spirit in the perishing clay,\nl
I am God still unevolved in human form;\nl
Even if he is not, he becomes in me.\nl
Page 511

The sun and moon are lights upon my path;\nl
Air was invented for my lungs to breathe,\nl
Conditioned as a wide and wall-less space\nl
For my winged chariot's wheels to cleave a road,\nl
The sea was made for me to swim and sail\nl
And bear my golden commerce on its back:\nl
It laughs cloven by my pleasure's gliding keel,\nl
I laugh at its black stare of fate and death.\nl
The earth is my floor, the sky my living's roof.\nl
All was prepared through many a silent age,\nl
God made experiments with animal shapes,\nl
Then only when all was ready I was born.\nl
I was born weak and small and ignorant,\nl
A helpless creature in a difficult world\nl
Travelling through my brief years with death at my side;\nl
I have grown greater than Nature, wiser than God.\nl
I have made real what she never dreamed,\nl
I have seized her powers and harnessed for my work,\nl
I have shaped her metals and new metals made;\nl
I will make glass and raiment out of milk,\nl
Make iron velvet, water unbreakable stone,\nl
Like God in his astuce of artist skill,\nl
Mould from one primal plasm protean forms,\nl
In single Nature multitudinous lives,\nl
All that imagination can conceive\nl
In mind intangible, remould anew\nl
In Matter's plastic solid and concrete.\nl
No magic can surpass my magic's skill.\nl
There is no miracle I shall not achieve.\nl
What God imperfect left, I will complete,\nl
Out of a tangled mind and half-made soul\nl
His sin and error I will eliminate;\nl
What he invented not, I shall invent:\nl
He was the first creator, I am the last.\nl
I have found the atoms from which he built the worlds:\nl
The first tremendous cosmic energy\nl
Page 512

Missioned shall leap to slay my enemy kin,\nl
Expunge a nation or abolish a race,\nl
Death's silence leave where there was laughter and joy.\nl
Or the fissured invisible shall spend God's force\nl
To extend my comforts and expand my wealth,\nl
To speed my car which now the lightnings drive\nl
And turn the engines of my miracles.\nl
I will take his means of sorcery from his hands\nl
And do with them greater wonders than his best.\nl
Yet through it all I have kept my balanced thought;\nl
I have studied my being, I have examined the world,\nl
I have grown a master of the arts of life.\nl
I have tamed the wild beast, trained to be my friend;\nl
He guards my house, looks up waiting my will.\nl
I have taught my kind to serve and to obey.\nl
I have used the mystery of the cosmic waves\nl
To see far distance and to hear far words;\nl
I have conquered Space and knitted close all earth.\nl
Soon I shall know the secrets of the Mind;\nl
I play with knowledge and with ignorance\nl
And sin and virtue my inventions are\nl
I can transcend or sovereignly use.\nl
I shall know mystic truths, seize occult powers.\nl
I shall slay my enemies with a look or thought,\nl
I shall sense the unspoken feelings of all hearts\nl
And see and hear the hidden thoughts of men.\nl
When earth is mastered, I shall conquer heaven;\nl
The gods shall be my aides or menial folk,\nl
No wish I harbour unfulfilled shall die:\nl
Omnipotence and omniscience shall be mine.”\nl
And Savitri heard the voice, the warped echo heard\nl
And turning to her being of power she spoke:\nl
“Madonna of might, Mother of works and force,\nl
Thou art a portion of my soul put forth\nl
To help mankind and help the travail of Time.\nl
Because thou art in him, man hopes and dares;\nl
Page 513

Because thou art, men's souls can climb the heavens\nl
And walk like gods in the presence of the Supreme.\nl
But without wisdom power is like a wind,\nl
It can breathe upon the heights and kiss the sky,\nl
It cannot build the extreme eternal things.\nl
Thou hast given men strength, wisdom thou couldst not give.\nl
One day I will return, a bringer of light;\nl
Then will I give to thee the mirror of God;\nl
Thou shalt see self and world as by him they are seen\nl
Reflected in the bright pool of thy soul.\nl
Thy wisdom shall be vast as vast thy power.\nl
Then hate shall dwell no more in human hearts,\nl
And fear and weakness shall desert men's lives,\nl
The cry of the ego shall be hushed within,\nl
Its lion roar that claims the world as food,\nl
All shall be might and bliss and happy force.”\nl

\spar Ascending still her spirit's upward route\nl
She came into a high and happy space,\nl
A wide tower of vision whence all could be seen\nl
And all was centred in a single view\nl
As when by distance separate scenes grow one\nl
And a harmony is made of hues at war.\nl
The wind was still and fragrance packed the air.\nl
There was a carol of birds and murmur of bees,\nl
And all that is common and natural and sweet,\nl
Yet intimately divine to heart and soul.\nl
A nearness thrilled of the spirit to its source\nl
And deepest things seemed obvious, close and true.\nl
Here, living centre of that vision of peace,\nl
A Woman sat in clear and crystal light:\nl
Heaven had unveiled its lustre in her eyes,\nl
Her feet were moonbeams, her face was a bright sun,\nl
Her smile could persuade a dead lacerated heart\nl
To live again and feel the hands of calm.\nl
A low music heard became her floating voice:\nl
Page 514

“O Savitri, I am thy secret soul.\nl
I have come down to the wounded desolate earth\nl
To heal her pangs and lull her heart to rest\nl
And lay her head upon the Mother's lap\nl
That she may dream of God and know his peace\nl
And draw the harmony of higher spheres\nl
Into the rhythm of earth's rude troubled days.\nl
I show to her the figures of bright gods\nl
And bring strength and solace to her struggling life;\nl
High things that now are only words and forms\nl
I reveal to her in the body of their power.\nl
I am peace that steals into man's war-worn breast,\nl
Amid the reign of Hell his acts create\nl
A hostel where Heaven's messengers can lodge;\nl
I am charity with the kindly hands that bless,\nl
I am silence mid the noisy tramp of life;\nl
I am Knowledge poring on her cosmic map.\nl
In the anomalies of the human heart\nl
Where Good and Evil are close bedfellows\nl
And Light is by Darkness dogged at every step,\nl
Where his largest knowledge is an ignorance,\nl
I am the Power that labours towards the best\nl
And works for God and looks up towards the heights.\nl
I make even sin and error stepping-stones\nl
And all experience a long march towards Light.\nl
Out of the Inconscient I build consciousness,\nl
And lead through death to reach immortal Life.\nl
Many are God's forms by which he grows in man;\nl
They stamp his thoughts and deeds with divinity,\nl
Uplift the stature of the human clay\nl
Or slowly transmute it into heaven's gold.\nl
He is the Good for which men fight and die,\nl
He is the war of Right with Titan wrong;\nl
He is Freedom rising deathless from her pyre;\nl
He is Valour guarding still the desperate pass\nl
Or lone and erect on the shattered barricade\nl
Page 515

Or a sentinel in the dangerous echoing Night.\nl
He is the crown of the martyr burned in flame\nl
And the glad resignation of the saint\nl
And courage indifferent to the wounds of Time\nl
And the hero's might wrestling with death and fate.\nl
He is Wisdom incarnate on a glorious throne\nl
And the calm autocracy of the sage's rule.\nl
He is the high and solitary Thought\nl
Aloof above the ignorant multitude:\nl
He is the prophet's voice, the sight of the seer.\nl
He is Beauty, nectar of the passionate soul,\nl
He is the Truth by which the spirit lives.\nl
He is the riches of the spiritual Vast\nl
Poured out in healing streams on indigent Life;\nl
He is Eternity lured from hour to hour,\nl
He is infinity in a little space:\nl
He is immortality in the arms of death.\nl
These powers I am and at my call they come.\nl
Thus slowly I lift man's soul nearer the Light.\nl
But human mind clings to its ignorance\nl
And to its littleness the human heart\nl
And to its right to grief the earthly life.\nl
Only when Eternity takes Time by the hand,\nl
Only when infinity weds the finite's thought,\nl
Can man be free from himself and live with God.\nl
I bring meanwhile the gods upon the earth;\nl
I bring back hope to the despairing heart;\nl
I give peace to the humble and the great,\nl
And shed my grace on the foolish and the wise.\nl
I shall save earth, if earth consents to be saved.\nl
Then Love shall at last unwounded tread earth's soil;\nl
Man's mind shall admit the sovereignty of Truth\nl
And body bear the immense descent of God.”\nl
She spoke and from the ignorant nether plane\nl
A cry, a warped echo naked and shuddering came.\nl
A voice of the sense-shackled human mind\nl
Page 516

Carried its proud complaint of godlike power\nl
Hedged by the limits of a mortal's thoughts,\nl
Bound in the chains of earthly ignorance.\nl
Imprisoned in his body and his brain\nl
The mortal cannot see God's mighty whole,\nl
Or share in his vast and deep identity\nl
Who stands unguessed within our ignorant hearts\nl
And knows all things because he is one with all.\nl
Man only sees the cosmic surfaces.\nl
Then wondering what may lie hid from the sense\nl
A little way he delves to depths below:\nl
But soon he stops, he cannot reach life's core\nl
Or commune with the throbbing heart of things.\nl
He sees the naked body of the Truth\nl
Though often baffled by her endless garbs,\nl
But cannot look upon her soul within.\nl
Then, furious for a knowledge absolute,\nl
He tears all details out and stabs and digs:\nl
Only the shape's contents he holds for use;\nl
The spirit escapes or dies beneath his knife.\nl
He sees as a blank stretch, a giant waste\nl
The crowding riches of infinity.\nl
The finite he has made his central field,\nl
Its plan dissects, masters its processes,\nl
That which moves all is hidden from his gaze,\nl
His poring eyes miss the unseen behind.\nl
He has the blind man's subtle unerring touch\nl
Or the slow traveller's sight of distant scenes;\nl
The soul's revealing contacts are not his.\nl
Yet is he visited by intuitive light\nl
And inspiration comes from the Unknown;\nl
But only reason and sense he feels as sure,\nl
They only are his trusted witnesses.\nl
Thus is he baulked, his splendid effort vain;\nl
His knowledge scans bright pebbles on the shore\nl
Of the huge ocean of his ignorance.\nl
Page 517

Yet grandiose were the accents of that cry,\nl
A cosmic pathos trembled in its tone.\nl
“I am the mind of God's great ignorant world\nl
Ascending to knowledge by the steps he made;\nl
I am the all-discovering Thought of man.\nl
I am a god fettered by Matter and sense,\nl
An animal prisoned in a fence of thorns,\nl
A beast of labour asking for his food,\nl
A smith tied to his anvil and his forge.\nl
Yet have I loosened the cord, enlarged my room.\nl
I have mapped the heavens and analysed the stars,\nl
Described their orbits through the grooves of Space,\nl
Measured the miles that separate the suns,\nl
Computed their longevity in Time.\nl
I have delved into earth's bowels and torn out\nl
The riches guarded by her dull brown soil.\nl
I have classed the changes of her stony crust\nl
And of her biography discovered the dates,\nl
Rescued the pages of all Nature's plan.\nl
The tree of evolution I have sketched,\nl
Each branch and twig and leaf in its own place,\nl
In the embryo tracked the history of forms,\nl
And the genealogy framed of all that lives.\nl
I have detected plasm and cell and gene,\nl
The protozoa traced, man's ancestors,\nl
The humble originals from whom he rose;\nl
I know how he was born and how he dies:\nl
Only what end he serves I know not yet\nl
Or if there is aim at all or any end\nl
Or push of rich creative purposeful joy\nl
In the wide works of the terrestrial power.\nl
I have caught her intricate processes, none is left:\nl
Her huge machinery is in my hands;\nl
I have seized the cosmic energies for my use.\nl
I have pored on her infinitesimal elements\nl
And her invisible atoms have unmasked:\nl
Page 518

All Matter is a book I have perused;\nl
Only some pages now are left to read.\nl
I have seen the ways of life, the paths of mind;\nl
I have studied the methods of the ant and ape\nl
And the behaviour learned of man and worm.\nl
If God is at work, his secrets I have found.\nl
But still the Cause of things is left in doubt,\nl
Their truth flees from pursuit into a void;\nl
When all has been explained nothing is known.\nl
What chose the process, whence the Power sprang\nl
I know not and perhaps shall never know.\nl
A mystery is this mighty Nature's birth;\nl
A mystery is the elusive stream of mind,\nl
A mystery the protean freak of life.\nl
What I have learned, Chance leaps to contradict;\nl
What I have built is seized and torn by Fate.\nl
I can foresee the acts of Matter's force,\nl
But not the march of the destiny of man:\nl
He is driven upon paths he did not choose,\nl
He falls trampled underneath the rolling wheels.\nl
My great philosophies are a reasoned guess;\nl
The mystic heavens that claim the human soul\nl
Are a charlatanism of the imagining brain:\nl
All is a speculation or a dream.\nl
In the end the world itself becomes a doubt:\nl
The infinitesimal's jest mocks mass and shape,\nl
A laugh peals from the infinite's finite mask.\nl
Perhaps the world is an error of our sight,\nl
A trick repeated in each flash of sense,\nl
An unreal mind hallucinates the soul\nl
With a stress-vision of false reality,\nl
Or a dance of Maya veils the void Unborn.\nl
Even if a greater consciousness I could reach,\nl
What profit is it then for Thought to win\nl
A Real which is for ever ineffable\nl
Or hunt to its lair the bodiless Self or make\nl
Page 519

The Unknowable the target of the soul?\nl
Nay, let me work within my mortal bounds,\nl
Not live beyond life nor think beyond the mind;\nl
Our smallness saves us from the Infinite.\nl
In a frozen grandeur lone and desolate\nl
Call me not to die the great eternal death,\nl
Left naked of my own humanity\nl
In the chill vast of the spirit's boundlessness.\nl
Each creature by its nature's limits lives,\nl
And how can one evade his native fate?\nl
Human I am, human let me remain\nl
Till in the Inconscient I fall dumb and sleep.\nl
A high insanity, a chimaera is this,\nl
To think that God lives hidden in the clay\nl
And that eternal Truth can dwell in Time,\nl
And call to her to save our self and world.\nl
How can man grow immortal and divine\nl
Transmuting the very stuff of which he is made?\nl
This wizard gods may dream, not thinking men.”\nl
\sparn And Savitri heard the voice, the warped answer heard\nl
And turning to her being of light she spoke:\nl
“Madonna of light, Mother of joy and peace,\nl
Thou art a portion of my self put forth\nl
To raise the spirit to its forgotten heights\nl
And wake the soul by touches of the heavens.\nl
Because thou art, the soul draws near to God;\nl
Because thou art, love grows in spite of hate\nl
And knowledge walks unslain in the pit of Night.\nl
But not by showering heaven's golden rain\nl
Upon the intellect's hard and rocky soil\nl
Can the tree of Paradise flower on earthly ground\nl
And the Bird of Paradise sit upon life's boughs\nl
And the winds of Paradise visit mortal air.\nl
Even if thou rain down intuition's rays,\nl
The mind of man will think it earth's own gleam,\nl
His spirit by spiritual ego sink,\nl
Page 520

Or his soul dream shut in sainthood's brilliant cell\nl
Where only a bright shadow of God can come.\nl
His hunger for the eternal thou must nurse\nl
And fill his yearning heart with heaven's fire\nl
And bring God down into his body and life.\nl
One day I will return, His hand in mine,\nl
And thou shalt see the face of the Absolute.\nl
Then shall the holy marriage be achieved,\nl
Then shall the divine family be born.\nl
There shall be light and peace in all the worlds.”\nl
\rl{\fsc End of Canto Four}
Page 521

\par
\ht Canto Five: The Finding of the Soul
\par
\sbigcap Onward she passed seeking the soul's mystic cave.\nl
At first she stepped into a night of God.\nl
The light was quenched that helps the labouring world,\nl
The power that struggles and stumbles in our life;\nl
This inefficient mind gave up its thoughts,\nl
The striving heart its unavailing hopes.\nl
All knowledge failed and the Idea's forms\nl
And Wisdom screened in awe her lowly head\nl
Feeling a Truth too great for thought or speech,\nl
Formless, ineffable, for ever the same.\nl
An innocent and holy Ignorance\nl
Adored like one who worships formless God\nl
The unseen Light she could not claim nor own.\nl
In a simple purity of emptiness\nl
Her mind knelt down before the unknowable.\nl
All was abolished save her naked self\nl
And the prostrate yearning of her surrendered heart:\nl
There was no strength in her, no pride of force;\nl
The lofty burning of desire had sunk\nl
Ashamed, a vanity of separate self,\nl
The hope of spiritual greatness fled,\nl
Salvation she asked not nor a heavenly crown:\nl
Humility seemed now too proud a state.\nl
Her self was nothing, God alone was all,\nl
Yet God she knew not but only knew he was.\nl
A sacred darkness brooded now within,\nl
The world was a deep darkness great and nude.\nl
This void held more than all the teeming worlds,\nl
This blank felt more than all that Time has borne,\nl
This dark knew dumbly, immensely the Unknown.\nl
But all was formless, voiceless, infinite.\nl
Page 522

As might a shadow walk in a shadowy scene,\nl
A small nought passing through a mightier Nought,\nl
A night of person in a bare outline\nl
Crossing a fathomless impersonal Night,\nl
Silent she moved, empty and absolute.\nl
In endless Time her soul reached a wide end,\nl
The spaceless Vast became her spirit's place.\nl
At last a change approached, the emptiness broke;\nl
A wave rippled within, the world had stirred;\nl
Once more her inner self became her space.\nl
There was felt a blissful nearness to the goal;\nl
Heaven leaned low to kiss the sacred hill,\nl
The air trembled with passion and delight.\nl
A rose of splendour on a tree of dreams,\nl
The face of Dawn out of mooned twilight grew.\nl
Day came, priest of a sacrifice of joy\nl
Into the worshipping silence of her world;\nl
He carried immortal lustre as his robe,\nl
Trailed heaven like a purple scarf and wore\nl
As his vermilion caste-mark a red sun.\nl
As if an old remembered dream come true,\nl
She recognised in her prophetic mind\nl
The imperishable lustre of that sky,\nl
The tremulous sweetness of that happy air\nl
And, covered from mind's view and life's approach,\nl
The mystic cavern in the sacred hill\nl
And knew the dwelling of her secret soul.\nl
As if in some Elysian occult depth,\nl
Truth's last retreat from thought's profaning touch,\nl
As if in a rock-temple's solitude hid,\nl
God's refuge from an ignorant worshipping world,\nl
It lay withdrawn even from life's inner sense,\nl
Receding from the entangled heart's desire.\nl
A marvellous brooding twilight met the eyes\nl
And a holy stillness held that voiceless space.\nl
An awful dimness wrapped the great rock-doors\nl
Page 523

Carved in the massive stone of Matter's trance.\nl
Two golden serpents round the lintel curled,\nl
Enveloping it with their pure and dreadful strength,\nl
Looked out with wisdom's deep and luminous eyes.\nl
An eagle covered it with wide conquering wings:\nl
Flames of self-lost immobile reverie,\nl
Doves crowded the grey musing cornices\nl
Like sculptured postures of white-bosomed peace.\nl
Across the threshold's sleep she entered in\nl
And found herself amid great figures of gods\nl
Conscious in stone and living without breath,\nl
Watching with fixed regard the soul of man,\nl
Executive figures of the cosmic self,\nl
World-symbols of immutable potency.\nl
On the walls covered with significant shapes\nl
Looked at her the life-scene of man and beast\nl
And the high meaning of the life of gods,\nl
The power and necessity of these numberless worlds,\nl
And faces of beings and stretches of world-space\nl
Spoke the succinct and inexhaustible\nl
Hieratic message of the climbing planes.\nl
In their immensitude signing infinity\nl
They were the extension of the self of God\nl
And housed, impassively receiving all,\nl
His figures and his small and mighty acts\nl
And his passion and his birth and life and death\nl
And his return to immortality.\nl
To the abiding and eternal is their climb,\nl
To the pure existence everywhere the same,\nl
To the sheer consciousness and the absolute force\nl
And the unimaginable and formless bliss,\nl
To the mirth in Time and the timeless mystery\nl
Of the triune being who is all and one\nl
And yet is no one but himself apart.\nl
There was no step of breathing men, no sound,\nl
Only the living nearness of the soul.\nl
Page 524

Yet all the worlds and God himself were there,\nl
For every symbol was a reality\nl
And brought the presence which had given it life.\nl
All this she saw and inly felt and knew\nl
Not by some thought of mind but by the self.\nl
A light not born of sun or moon or fire,\nl
A light that dwelt within and saw within\nl
Shedding an intimate visibility\nl
Made secrecy more revealing than the word:\nl
Our sight and sense are a fallible gaze and touch\nl
And only the spirit's vision is wholly true.\nl
As thus she passed in that mysterious place\nl
Through room and room, through door and rock-hewn door,\nl
She felt herself made one with all she saw.\nl
A sealed identity within her woke;\nl
She knew herself the Beloved of the Supreme:\nl
These Gods and Goddesses were he and she:\nl
The Mother was she of Beauty and Delight,\nl
The Word in Brahma's vast creating clasp,\nl
The World-Puissance on almighty Shiva's lap,—\nl
The Master and the Mother of all lives\nl
Watching the worlds their twin regard had made,\nl
And Krishna and Radha for ever entwined in bliss,\nl
The Adorer and Adored self-lost and one.\nl
In the last chamber on a golden seat\nl
One sat whose shape no vision could define;\nl
Only one felt the world's unattainable fount,\nl
A Power of which she was a straying Force,\nl
An invisible Beauty, goal of the world's desire,\nl
A Sun of which all knowledge is a beam,\nl
A Greatness without whom no life could be.\nl
Thence all departed into silent self,\nl
And all became formless and pure and bare.\nl
Then through a tunnel dug in the last rock\nl
She came out where there shone a deathless sun.\nl
A house was there all made of flame and light\nl
Page 525

And crossing a wall of doorless living fire\nl
There suddenly she met her secret soul.\nl

\spar A being stood immortal in transience,\nl
Deathless dallying with momentary things,\nl
In whose wide eyes of tranquil happiness\nl
Which pity and sorrow could not abrogate\nl
Infinity turned its gaze on finite shapes:\nl
Observer of the silent steps of the hours,\nl
Eternity upheld the minute's acts\nl
And the passing scenes of the Everlasting's play.\nl
In the mystery of its selecting will,\nl
In the Divine Comedy a participant,\nl
The Spirit's conscious representative,\nl
God's delegate in our humanity,\nl
Comrade of the universe, the Transcendent's ray,\nl
She had come into the mortal body's room\nl
To play at ball with Time and Circumstance.\nl
A joy in the world her master movement here,\nl
The passion of the game lighted her eyes:\nl
A smile on her lips welcomed earth's bliss and grief,\nl
A laugh was her return to pleasure and pain.\nl
All things she saw as a masquerade of Truth\nl
Disguised in the costumes of Ignorance,\nl
Crossing the years to immortality;\nl
All she could front with the strong spirit's peace.\nl
But since she knows the toil of mind and life\nl
As a mother feels and shares her children's lives,\nl
She puts forth a small portion of herself,\nl
A being no bigger than the thumb of man\nl
Into a hidden region of the heart\nl
To face the pang and to forget the bliss,\nl
To share the suffering and endure earth's wounds\nl
And labour mid the labour of the stars.\nl
This in us laughs and weeps, suffers the stroke,\nl
Exults in victory, struggles for the crown;\nl
Page 526

Identified with the mind and body and life,\nl
It takes on itself their anguish and defeat,\nl
Bleeds with Fate's whips and hangs upon the cross,\nl
Yet is the unwounded and immortal self\nl
Supporting the actor in the human scene.\nl
Through this she sends us her glory and her powers,\nl
Pushes to wisdom's heights, through misery's gulfs;\nl
She gives us strength to do our daily task\nl
And sympathy that partakes of others' grief\nl
And the little strength we have to help our race,\nl
We who must fill the role of the universe\nl
Acting itself out in a slight human shape\nl
And on our shoulders carry the struggling world.\nl
This is in us the godhead small and marred;\nl
In this human portion of divinity\nl
She seats the greatness of the Soul in Time\nl
To uplift from light to light, from power to power,\nl
Till on a heavenly peak it stands, a king.\nl
In body weak, in its heart an invincible might,\nl
It climbs stumbling, held up by an unseen hand,\nl
A toiling spirit in a mortal shape.\nl
Here in this chamber of flame and light they met;\nl
They looked upon each other, knew themselves,\nl
The secret deity and its human part,\nl
The calm immortal and the struggling soul.\nl
Then with a magic transformation's speed\nl
They rushed into each other and grew one.\nl

\spar Once more she was human upon earthly soil\nl
In the muttering night amid the rain-swept woods\nl
And the rude cottage where she sat in trance:\nl
That subtle world withdrew deeply within\nl
Behind the sun-veil of the inner sight.\nl
But now the half-opened lotus bud of her heart\nl
Had bloomed and stood disclosed to the earthly ray;\nl
In an image shone revealed her secret soul.\nl
Page 527

There was no wall severing the soul and mind,\nl
No mystic fence guarding from the claims of life.\nl
In its deep lotus home her being sat\nl
As if on concentration's marble seat,\nl
Calling the mighty Mother of the worlds\nl
To make this earthly tenement her house.\nl
As in a flash from a supernal light,\nl
A living image of the original Power,\nl
A face, a form came down into her heart\nl
And made of it its temple and pure abode.\nl
But when its feet had touched the quivering bloom,\nl
A mighty movement rocked the inner space\nl
As if a world were shaken and found its soul:\nl
Out of the Inconscient's soulless mindless night\nl
A flaming Serpent rose released from sleep.\nl
It rose billowing its coils and stood erect\nl
And climbing mightily, stormily on its way\nl
It touched her centres with its flaming mouth;\nl
As if a fiery kiss had broken their sleep,\nl
They bloomed and laughed surcharged with light and bliss.\nl
Then at the crown it joined the Eternal's space.\nl
In the flower of the head, in the flower of Matter's base,\nl
In each divine stronghold and Nature-knot\nl
It held together the mystic stream which joins\nl
The viewless summits with the unseen depths,\nl
The string of forts that make the frail defence\nl
Safeguarding us against the enormous world,\nl
Our lines of self-expression in its Vast.\nl
An image sat of the original Power\nl
Wearing the mighty Mother's form and face.\nl
Armed, bearer of the weapon and the sign\nl
Whose occult might no magic can imitate,\nl
Manifold yet one she sat, a guardian force:\nl
A saviour gesture stretched her lifted arm,\nl
And symbol of some native cosmic strength,\nl
A sacred beast lay prone below her feet,\nl
Page 528

A silent flame-eyed mass of living force.\nl
All underwent a high celestial change:\nl
Breaking the black Inconscient's blind mute wall,\nl
Effacing the circles of the Ignorance,\nl
Powers and divinities burst flaming forth;\nl
Each part of the being trembling with delight\nl
Lay overwhelmed with tides of happiness\nl
And saw her hand in every circumstance\nl
And felt her touch in every limb and cell.\nl
In the country of the lotus of the head\nl
Which thinking mind has made its busy space,\nl
In the castle of the lotus twixt the brows\nl
Whence it shoots the arrows of its sight and will,\nl
In the passage of the lotus of the throat\nl
Where speech must rise and the expressing mind\nl
And the heart's impulse run towards word and act,\nl
A glad uplift and a new working came.\nl
The immortal's thoughts displaced our bounded view,\nl
The immortal's thoughts earth's drab idea and sense;\nl
All things now bore a deeper heavenlier sense.\nl
A glad clear harmony marked their truth's outline,\nl
Reset the balance and measures of the world.\nl
Each shape showed its occult design, unveiled\nl
God's meaning in it for which it was made\nl
And the vivid splendour of his artist thought.\nl
A channel of the mighty Mother's choice,\nl
The immortal's will took into its calm control\nl
Our blind or erring government of life;\nl
A loose republic once of wants and needs,\nl
Then bowed to the uncertain sovereign mind,\nl
Life now obeyed to a diviner rule\nl
And every act became an act of God.\nl
In the kingdom of the lotus of the heart\nl
Love chanting its pure hymeneal hymn\nl
Made life and body mirrors of sacred joy\nl
And all the emotions gave themselves to God.\nl
Page 529

In the navel lotus' broad imperial range\nl
Its proud ambitions and its master lusts\nl
Were tamed into instruments of a great calm sway\nl
To do a work of God on earthly soil.\nl
In the narrow nether centre's petty parts\nl
Its childish game of daily dwarf desires\nl
Was changed into a sweet and boisterous play,\nl
A romp of little gods with life in Time.\nl
In the deep place where once the Serpent slept,\nl
There came a grip on Matter's giant powers\nl
For large utilities in life's little space;\nl
A firm ground was made for Heaven's descending might.\nl
Behind all reigned her sovereign deathless soul:\nl
Casting aside its veil of Ignorance,\nl
Allied to gods and cosmic beings and powers\nl
It built the harmony of its human state;\nl
Surrendered into the great World-Mother's hands\nl
Only she obeyed her sole supreme behest\nl
In the enigma of the Inconscient's world.\nl
A secret soul behind supporting all\nl
Is master and witness of our ignorant life,\nl
Admits the Person's look and Nature's role.\nl
But once the hidden doors are flung apart\nl
Then the veiled king steps out in Nature's front;\nl
A Light comes down into the Ignorance,\nl
Its heavy painful knot loosens its grasp:\nl
The mind becomes a mastered instrument\nl
And life a hue and figure of the soul.\nl
All happily grows towards knowledge and towards bliss.\nl
A divine Puissance then takes Nature's place\nl
And pushes the movements of our body and mind;\nl
Possessor of our passionate hopes and dreams,\nl
The beloved despot of our thoughts and acts,\nl
She streams into us with her unbound force,\nl
Into mortal limbs the Immortal's rapture and power.\nl
An inner law of beauty shapes our lives;\nl
Page 530

Our words become the natural speech of Truth,\nl
Each thought is a ripple on a sea of Light.\nl
Then sin and virtue leave the cosmic lists;\nl
They struggle no more in our delivered hearts:\nl
Our acts chime with God's simple natural good\nl
Or serve the rule of a supernal Right.\nl
All moods unlovely, evil and untrue\nl
Forsake their stations in fierce disarray\nl
And hide their shame in the subconscient's dusk.\nl
Then lifts the mind a cry of victory:\nl
“O soul, my soul, we have created Heaven,\nl
Within we have found the kingdom here of God,\nl
His fortress built in a loud ignorant world.\nl
Our life is entrenched between two rivers of Light,\nl
We have turned space into a gulf of peace\nl
And made the body a Capitol of bliss.\nl
What more, what more, if more must still be done?”\nl
In the slow process of the evolving spirit,\nl
In the brief stade between a death and birth\nl
A first perfection's stage is reached at last;\nl
Out of the wood and stone of our nature's stuff\nl
A temple is shaped where the high gods could live.\nl
Even if the struggling world is left outside\nl
One man's perfection still can save the world.\nl
There is won a new proximity to the skies,\nl
A first betrothal of the Earth to Heaven,\nl
A deep concordat between Truth and Life:\nl
A camp of God is pitched in human time.\nl
\rl{\fsc End of Canto Five}
Page 531

\par
\ht Canto Six: Nirvana and the Discovery of the All-Negating Absolute
\par
\sbigcap A calm slow sun looked down from tranquil heavens.\nl
A routed sullen rearguard of retreat,\nl
The last rains had fled murmuring across the woods\nl
Or failed, a sibilant whisper mid the leaves,\nl
And the great blue enchantment of the sky\nl
Recovered the deep rapture of its smile.\nl
Its mellow splendour unstressed by storm-licked heats\nl
Found room for a luxury of warm mild days,\nl
The night's gold treasure of autumnal moons\nl
Came floating shipped through ripples of faery air.\nl
And Savitri's life was glad, fulfilled like earth's;\nl
She had found herself, she knew her being's aim.\nl
Although her kingdom of marvellous change within\nl
Remained unspoken in her secret breast,\nl
All that lived round her felt its magic's charm:\nl
The trees' rustling voices told it to the winds,\nl
Flowers spoke in ardent hues an unknown joy,\nl
The birds' carolling became a canticle,\nl
The beasts forgot their strife and lived at ease.\nl
Absorbed in wide communion with the Unseen\nl
The mild ascetics of the wood received\nl
A sudden greatening of their lonely muse.\nl
This bright perfection of her inner state\nl
Poured overflowing into her outward scene,\nl
Made beautiful dull common natural things\nl
And action wonderful and time divine.\nl
Even the smallest meanest work became\nl
A sweet or glad and glorious sacrament,\nl
An offering to the self of the great world\nl
Or a service to the One in each and all.\nl
Page 532

A light invaded all from her being's light;\nl
Her heart-beats' dance communicated bliss:\nl
Happiness grew happier, shared with her, by her touch\nl
And grief some solace found when she drew near.\nl
Above the cherished head of Satyavan\nl
She saw not now Fate's dark and lethal orb;\nl
A golden circle round a mystic sun\nl
Disclosed to her new-born predicting sight\nl
The cyclic rondure of a sovereign life.\nl
In her visions and deep-etched veridical dreams,\nl
In brief shiftings of the future's heavy screen,\nl
He lay not by a dolorous decree\nl
A victim in the dismal antre of death\nl
Or borne to blissful regions far from her\nl
Forgetting the sweetness of earth's warm delight,\nl
Forgetting the passionate oneness of love's clasp,\nl
Absolved in the self-rapt immortal's bliss.\nl
Always he was with her, a living soul\nl
That met her eyes with close enamoured eyes,\nl
A living body near to her body's joy.\nl
But now no longer in these great wild woods\nl
In kinship with the days of bird and beast\nl
And levelled to the bareness of earth's brown breast,\nl
But mid the thinking high-built lives of men\nl
In tapestried chambers and on crystal floors,\nl
In armoured town or gardened pleasure-walks,\nl
Even in distance closer than her thoughts,\nl
Body to body near, soul near to soul,\nl
Moving as if by a common breath and will\nl
They were tied in the single circling of their days\nl
Together by love's unseen atmosphere,\nl
Inseparable like the earth and sky.\nl
Thus for a while she trod the Golden Path;\nl
This was the sun before abysmal Night.\nl
\sparn Once as she sat in deep felicitous muse,\nl
Still quivering from her lover's strong embrace,\nl
Page 533

And made her joy a bridge twixt earth and heaven,\nl
An abyss yawned suddenly beneath her heart.\nl
A vast and nameless fear dragged at her nerves\nl
As drags a wild beast its half-slaughtered prey;\nl
It seemed to have no den from which it sprang:\nl
It was not hers, but hid its unseen cause.\nl
Then rushing came its vast and fearful Fount.\nl
A formless Dread with shapeless endless wings\nl
Filling the universe with its dangerous breath,\nl
A denser darkness than the Night could bear,\nl
Enveloped the heavens and possessed the earth.\nl
A rolling surge of silent death, it came\nl
Curving round the far edge of the quaking globe;\nl
Effacing heaven with its enormous stride\nl
It willed to expunge the choked and anguished air\nl
And end the fable of the joy of life.\nl
It seemed her very being to forbid,\nl
Abolishing all by which her nature lived,\nl
And laboured to blot out her body and soul,\nl
A clutch of some half-seen Invisible,\nl
An ocean of terror and of sovereign might,\nl
A person and a black infinity.\nl
It seemed to cry to her without thought or word\nl
The message of its dark eternity\nl
And the awful meaning of its silences:\nl
Out of some sullen monstrous vast arisen,\nl
Out of an abysmal deep of grief and fear\nl
Imagined by some blind regardless self,\nl
A consciousness of being without its joy,\nl
Empty of thought, incapable of bliss,\nl
That felt life blank and nowhere found a soul,\nl
A voice to the dumb anguish of the heart\nl
Conveyed a stark sense of unspoken words;\nl
In her own depths she heard the unuttered thought\nl
That made unreal the world and all life meant.\nl
“Who art thou who claimst thy crown of separate birth,\nl
Page 534

The illusion of thy soul's reality\nl
And personal godhead on an ignorant globe\nl
In the animal body of imperfect man?\nl
Hope not to be happy in a world of pain\nl
And dream not, listening to the unspoken Word\nl
And dazzled by the inexpressible Ray,\nl
Transcending the mute Superconscient's realm,\nl
To give a body to the Unknowable,\nl
Or for a sanction to thy heart's delight\nl
To burden with bliss the silent still Supreme\nl
Profaning its bare and formless sanctity,\nl
Or call into thy chamber the Divine\nl
And sit with God tasting a human joy.\nl
I have created all, all I devour;\nl
I am Death and the dark terrible Mother of life,\nl
I am Kali black and naked in the world,\nl
I am Maya and the universe is my cheat.\nl
I lay waste human happiness with my breath\nl
And slay the will to live, the joy to be\nl
That all may pass back into nothingness\nl
And only abide the eternal and absolute.\nl
For only the blank Eternal can be true.\nl
All else is shadow and flash in Mind's bright glass,\nl
Mind, hollow mirror in which Ignorance sees\nl
A splendid figure of its own false self\nl
And dreams it sees a glorious solid world.\nl
O soul, inventor of man's thoughts and hopes,\nl
Thyself the invention of the moments' stream,\nl
Illusion's centre or subtle apex point,\nl
At last know thyself, from vain existence cease.”\nl
A shadow of the negating Absolute,\nl
The intolerant Darkness travelled surging past\nl
And ebbed in her the formidable Voice.\nl
It left behind her inner world laid waste:\nl
A barren silence weighed upon her heart,\nl
Her kingdom of delight was there no more;\nl
Page 535

Only her soul remained, its emptied stage,\nl
Awaiting the unknown eternal Will.\nl
Then from the heights a greater Voice came down,\nl
The Word that touches the heart and finds the soul,\nl
The voice of Light after the voice of Night:\nl
The cry of the Abyss drew Heaven's reply,\nl
A might of storm chased by the might of the Sun.\nl
“O soul, bare not thy kingdom to the foe;\nl
Consent to hide thy royalty of bliss\nl
Lest Time and Fate find out its avenues\nl
And beat with thunderous knock upon thy gates.\nl
Hide whilst thou canst thy treasure of separate self\nl
Behind the luminous rampart of thy depths\nl
Till of a vaster empire it grows part.\nl
But not for self alone the Self is won:\nl
Content abide not with one conquered realm;\nl
Adventure all to make the whole world thine,\nl
To break into greater kingdoms turn thy force.\nl
Fear not to be nothing that thou mayst be all;\nl
Assent to the emptiness of the Supreme\nl
That all in thee may reach its absolute.\nl
Accept to be small and human on the earth,\nl
Interrupting thy new-born divinity,\nl
That man may find his utter self in God.\nl
If for thy own sake only thou hast come,\nl
An immortal spirit into the mortal's world,\nl
To found thy luminous kingdom in God's dark,\nl
In the Inconscient's realm one shining star,\nl
One door in the Ignorance opened upon light,\nl
Why hadst thou any need to come at all?\nl
Thou hast come down into a struggling world\nl
To aid a blind and suffering mortal race,\nl
To open to Light the eyes that could not see,\nl
To bring down bliss into the heart of grief,\nl
To make thy life a bridge twixt earth and heaven;\nl
If thou wouldst save the toiling universe,\nl
Page 536

The vast universal suffering feel as thine:\nl
Thou must bear the sorrow that thou claimst to heal;\nl
The day-bringer must walk in darkest night.\nl
He who would save the world must share its pain.\nl
If he knows not grief, how shall he find grief's cure?\nl
If far he walks above mortality's head,\nl
How shall the mortal reach that too high path?\nl
If one of theirs they see scale heaven's peaks,\nl
Men then can hope to learn that titan climb.\nl
God must be born on earth and be as man\nl
That man being human may grow even as God.\nl
He who would save the world must be one with the world,\nl
All suffering things contain in his heart's space\nl
And bear the grief and joy of all that lives.\nl
His soul must be wider than the universe\nl
And feel eternity as its very stuff,\nl
Rejecting the moment's personality\nl
Know itself older than the birth of Time,\nl
Creation an incident in its consciousness,\nl
Arcturus and Belphegor grains of fire\nl
Circling in a corner of its boundless self,\nl
The world's destruction a small transient storm\nl
In the calm infinity it has become.\nl
If thou wouldst a little loosen the vast chain,\nl
Draw back from the world that the Idea has made,\nl
Thy mind's selection from the Infinite,\nl
Thy senses' gloss on the Infinitesimal's dance,\nl
Then shalt thou know how the great bondage came.\nl
Banish all thought from thee and be God's void.\nl
Then shalt thou uncover the Unknowable\nl
And the Superconscient conscious grow on thy tops;\nl
Infinity's vision through thy gaze shall pierce;\nl
Thou shalt look into the eyes of the Unknown,\nl
Find the hid Truth in things seen null and false,\nl
Behind things known discover Mystery's rear.\nl
Thou shalt be one with God's bare reality\nl
Page 537

And the miraculous world he has become\nl
And the diviner miracle still to be\nl
When Nature who is now unconscious God\nl
Translucent grows to the Eternal's light,\nl
Her seeing his sight, her walk his steps of power\nl
And life is filled with a spiritual joy\nl
And Matter is the Spirit's willing bride.\nl
Consent to be nothing and none, dissolve Time's work,\nl
Cast off thy mind, step back from form and name.\nl
Annul thyself that only God may be.”\nl

\spar Thus spoke the mighty and uplifting Voice,\nl
And Savitri heard; she bowed her head and mused\nl
Plunging her deep regard into herself\nl
In her soul's privacy in the silent Night.\nl
Aloof and standing back detached and calm,\nl
A witness of the drama of herself,\nl
A student of her own interior scene,\nl
She watched the passion and the toil of life\nl
And heard in the crowded thoroughfares of mind\nl
The unceasing tread and passage of her thoughts.\nl
All she allowed to rise that chose to stir;\nl
Calling, compelling nought, forbidding nought,\nl
She left all to the process formed in Time\nl
And the free initiative of Nature's will.\nl
Thus following the complex human play\nl
She heard the prompter's voice behind the scenes,\nl
Perceived the original libretto's set\nl
And the organ theme of the composer Force.\nl
All she beheld that surges from man's depths,\nl
The animal instincts prowling mid life's trees,\nl
The impulses that whisper to the heart\nl
And passion's thunder-chase sweeping the nerves;\nl
She saw the Powers that stare from the Abyss\nl
And the wordless Light that liberates the soul.\nl
But most her gaze pursued the birth of thought.\nl
Page 538

Affranchised from the look of surface mind\nl
She paused not to survey the official case,\nl
The issue of forms from the office of the brain,\nl
Its factory of thought-sounds and soundless words\nl
And voices stored within unheard by men,\nl
Its mint and treasury of shining coin.\nl
These were but counters in mind's symbol game,\nl
A gramophone's discs, a reproduction's film,\nl
A list of signs, a cipher and a code.\nl
In our unseen subtle body thought is born\nl
Or there it enters from the cosmic field.\nl
Oft from her soul stepped out a naked thought\nl
Luminous with mysteried lips and wonderful eyes;\nl
Or from her heart emerged some burning face\nl
And looked for life and love and passionate truth,\nl
Aspired to heaven or embraced the world\nl
Or led the fancy like a fleeting moon\nl
Across the dull sky of man's common days,\nl
Amidst the doubtful certitudes of earth's lore,\nl
To the celestial beauty of faith gave form,\nl
As if at flower-prints in a dingy room\nl
Laughed in a golden vase one living rose.\nl
A thaumaturgist sat in her heart's deep,\nl
Compelled the forward stride, the upward look,\nl
Till wonder leaped into the illumined breast\nl
And life grew marvellous with transfiguring hope.\nl
A seeing will pondered between the brows;\nl
Thoughts, glistening Angels, stood behind the brain\nl
In flashing armour, folding hands of prayer,\nl
And poured heaven's rays into the earthly form.\nl
Imaginations flamed up from her breast,\nl
Unearthly beauty, touches of surpassing joy\nl
And plans of miracle, dreams of delight:\nl
Around her navel lotus clustering close\nl
Her large sensations of the teeming worlds\nl
Streamed their dumb movements of the unformed Idea;\nl
Page 539

Invading the small sensitive flower of the throat\nl
They brought their mute unuttered resonances\nl
To kindle the figures of a heavenly speech.\nl
Below, desires formed their wordless wish,\nl
And longings of physical sweetness and ecstasy\nl
Translated into the accents of a cry\nl
Their grasp on objects and their clasp on souls.\nl
Her body's thoughts climbed from her conscious limbs\nl
And carried their yearnings to its mystic crown\nl
Where Nature's murmurs meet the Ineffable.\nl
But for the mortal prisoned in outward mind\nl
All must present their passports at its door;\nl
Disguised they must don the official cap and mask\nl
Or pass as manufactures of the brain,\nl
Unknown their secret truth and hidden source.\nl
Only to the inner mind they speak direct,\nl
Put on a body and assume a voice,\nl
Their passage seen, their message heard and known,\nl
Their birthplace and their natal mark revealed,\nl
And stand confessed to an immortal's sight,\nl
Our nature's messengers to the witness soul.\nl
Impenetrable, withheld from mortal sense,\nl
The inner chambers of the spirit's house\nl
Disclosed to her their happenings and their guests;\nl
Eyes looked through crevices in the invisible wall\nl
And through the secrecy of unseen doors\nl
There came into mind's little frontal room\nl
Thoughts that enlarged our limited human range,\nl
Lifted the ideal's half-quenched or sinking torch\nl
Or peered through the finite at the infinite.\nl
A sight opened upon the invisible\nl
And sensed the shapes that mortal eyes see not,\nl
The sounds that mortal listening cannot hear,\nl
The blissful sweetness of the intangible's touch;\nl
The objects that to us are empty air,\nl
Are there the stuff of daily experience\nl
Page 540

And the common pabulum of sense and thought.\nl
The beings of the subtle realms appeared\nl
And scenes concealed behind our earthly scene;\nl
She saw the life of remote continents\nl
And distance deafened not to voices far;\nl
She felt the movements crossing unknown minds;\nl
The past's events occurred before her eyes.\nl
The great world's thoughts were part of her own thought,\nl
The feelings dumb for ever and unshared,\nl
The ideas that never found an utterance.\nl
The dim subconscient's incoherent hints\nl
