Unworthy of Godhead in the original sleep.\nl
I claim from Time my will's eternity,\nl
God from his moments.” Death replied to her,\nl
“Why should the noble and immortal will\nl
Stoop to the petty works of transient earth,\nl
Freedom forgotten and the Eternal's path?\nl
Or is this the high use of strength and thought,\nl
To struggle with the bonds of death and time\nl
And spend the labour that might earn the gods\nl
And battle and bear agony of wounds\nl
To grasp the trivial joys that earth can guard\nl
In her small treasure-chest of passing things?\nl
Child, hast thou trodden the gods beneath thy feet\nl
Only to win poor shreds of earthly life\nl
For him thou lov'st cancelling the grand release,\nl
Keeping from early rapture of the heavens\nl
His soul the lenient deities have called?\nl
Are thy arms sweeter than the courts of God?”\nl
She answered, “Straight I trample on the road\nl
The strong hand hewed for me which planned our paths.\nl
Page 652

I run where his sweet dreadful voice commands\nl
And I am driven by the reins of God.\nl
Why drew he wide his scheme of mighty worlds\nl
Or filled infinity with his passionate breath?\nl
Or wherefore did he build my mortal form\nl
And sow in me his bright and proud desires,\nl
If not to achieve, to flower in me, to love,\nl
Carving his human image richly shaped\nl
In thoughts and largenesses and golden powers?\nl
Far Heaven can wait our coming in its calm.\nl
Easy the heavens were to build for God.\nl
Earth was his difficult matter, earth the glory\nl
Gave of the problem and the race and strife.\nl
There are the ominous masks, the terrible powers;\nl
There it is greatness to create the gods.\nl
Is not the spirit immortal and absolved\nl
Always, delivered from the grasp of Time?\nl
Why came it down into the mortal's Space?\nl
A charge he gave to his high spirit in man\nl
And wrote a hidden decree on Nature's tops.\nl
Freedom is this with ever seated soul,\nl
Large in life's limits, strong in Matter's knots,\nl
Building great stuff of action from the worlds\nl
To make fine wisdom from coarse, scattered strands\nl
And love and beauty out of war and night,\nl
The wager wonderful, the game divine.\nl
What liberty has the soul which feels not free\nl
Unless stripped bare and cannot kiss the bonds\nl
The Lover winds around his playmate's limbs,\nl
Choosing his tyranny, crushed in his embrace?\nl
To seize him better with her boundless heart\nl
She accepts the limiting circle of his arms,\nl
Bows full of bliss beneath his mastering hands\nl
And laughs in his rich constraints, most bound, most free.\nl
This is my answer to thy lures, O Death.”\nl
Page 653

\spar Immutable, Death's denial met her cry:\nl
“However mighty, whatever thy secret name\nl
Uttered in hidden conclaves of the gods,\nl
Thy heart's ephemeral passion cannot break\nl
The iron rampart of accomplished things\nl
With which the great Gods fence their camp in Space.\nl
Whoever thou art behind thy human mask,\nl
Even if thou art the Mother of the worlds\nl
And pegst thy claim upon the realms of Chance,\nl
The cosmic Law is greater than thy will.\nl
Even God himself obeys the Laws he made:\nl
The Law abides and never can it change,\nl
The Person is a bubble on Time's sea.\nl
A forerunner of a greater Truth to come,\nl
Thy soul creator of its freer Law,\nl
Vaunting a Force behind on which it leans,\nl
A Light above which none but thou hast seen,\nl
Thou claimst the first fruits of Truth's victory.\nl
But what is Truth and who can find her form\nl
Amid the specious images of sense,\nl
Amid the crowding guesses of the mind\nl
And the dark ambiguities of a world\nl
Peopled with the incertitudes of Thought?\nl
For where is Truth and when was her footfall heard\nl
Amid the endless clamour of Time's mart\nl
And which is her voice amid the thousand cries\nl
That cross the listening brain and cheat the soul?\nl
Or is Truth aught but a high starry name\nl
Or a vague and splendid word by which man's thought\nl
Sanctions and consecrates his nature's choice,\nl
The heart's wish donning knowledge as its robe,\nl
The cherished idea elect among the elect,\nl
Thought's favourite mid the children of half-light\nl
Who high-voiced crowd the playgrounds of the mind\nl
Or people its dormitories in infant sleep?\nl
All things hang here between God's yes and no,\nl
Page 654

Two Powers real but to each other untrue,\nl
Two consort stars in the mooned night of mind\nl
That towards two opposite horizons gaze,\nl
The white head and black tail of the mystic drake,\nl
The swift and the lame foot, wing strong, wing broken\nl
Sustaining the body of the uncertain world,\nl
A great surreal dragon in the skies.\nl
Too dangerously thy high proud truth must live\nl
Entangled in Matter's mortal littleness.\nl
All in this world is true, yet all is false:\nl
Its thoughts into an eternal cipher run,\nl
Its deeds swell to Time's rounded zero sum.\nl
Thus man at once is animal and god,\nl
A disparate enigma of God's make\nl
Unable to free the Godhead's form within,\nl
A being less than himself, yet something more,\nl
The aspiring animal, the frustrate god\nl
Yet neither beast nor deity but man,\nl
But man tied to the kind earth's labour strives to exceed\nl
Climbing the stairs of God to higher things.\nl
Objects are seemings and none knows their truth,\nl
Ideas are guesses of an ignorant god.\nl
Truth has no home in earth's irrational breast:\nl
Yet without reason life is a tangle of dreams,\nl
But reason is poised above a dim abyss\nl
And stands at last upon a plank of doubt.\nl
Eternal truth lives not with mortal men.\nl
Or if she dwells within thy mortal heart,\nl
Show me the body of the living Truth\nl
Or draw for me the outline of her face\nl
That I too may obey and worship her.\nl
Then will I give thee back thy Satyavan.\nl
But here are only facts and steel-bound Law.\nl
This truth I know that Satyavan is dead\nl
And even thy sweetness cannot lure him back.\nl
No magic Truth can bring the dead to life,\nl
Page 655

No power of earth cancel the thing once done,\nl
No joy of the heart can last surviving death,\nl
No bliss persuade the past to live again.\nl
But Life alone can solace the mute Void\nl
And fill with thought the emptiness of Time.\nl
Leave then thy dead, O Savitri, and live.”\nl
The Woman answered to the mighty Shade,\nl
And as she spoke, mortality disappeared;\nl
Her Goddess self grew visible in her eyes,\nl
Light came, a dream of heaven, into her face.\nl
“O Death, thou too art God and yet not He,\nl
But only his own black shadow on his path\nl
As leaving the Night he takes the upward Way\nl
And drags with him its clinging inconscient Force.\nl
Of God unconscious thou art the dark head,\nl
Of his Ignorance thou art the impenitent sign,\nl
Of its vast tenebrous womb the natural child,\nl
On his immortality the sinister bar.\nl
All contraries are aspects of God's face.\nl
The Many are the innumerable One,\nl
The One carries the multitude in his breast;\nl
He is the Impersonal, inscrutable, sole,\nl
He is the one infinite Person seeing his world;\nl
The Silence bears the Eternal's great dumb seal,\nl
His light inspires the eternal Word;\nl
He is the Immobile's deep and deathless hush,\nl
Its white and signless blank negating calm,\nl
Yet stands the creator Self, the almighty Lord\nl
And watches his will done by the forms of Gods\nl
And the desire that goads half-conscious man\nl
And the reluctant and unseeing Night.\nl
These wide divine extremes, these inverse powers\nl
Are the right and left side of the body of God;\nl
Existence balanced twixt two mighty arms\nl
Confronts the mind with unsolved abysms of Thought.\nl
Darkness below, a fathomless Light above,\nl
Page 656

In Light are joined, but sundered by severing Mind\nl
Stand face to face, opposite, inseparable,\nl
Two contraries needed for his great World-task,\nl
Two poles whose currents wake the immense World-Force.\nl
In the stupendous secrecy of his Self,\nl
Above the world brooding with equal wings,\nl
He is both in one, beginningless, without end:\nl
Transcending both, he enters the Absolute.\nl
His being is a mystery beyond mind,\nl
His ways bewilder mortal ignorance;\nl
The finite in its little sections parked,\nl
Amazed, credits not God's audacity\nl
Who dares to be the unimagined All\nl
And see and act as might one Infinite.\nl
Against human reason this is his offence,\nl
Being known to be for ever unknowable,\nl
To be all and yet transcend the mystic whole,\nl
Absolute, to lodge in a relative world of Time,\nl
Eternal and all-knowing, to suffer birth,\nl
Omnipotent, to sport with Chance and Fate,\nl
Spirit, yet to be Matter and the Void,\nl
Illimitable, beyond form or name,\nl
To dwell within a body, one and supreme\nl
To be animal and human and divine:\nl
A still deep sea, he laughs in rolling waves;\nl
Universal, he is all,—transcendent, none.\nl
To man's righteousness this is his cosmic crime,\nl
Almighty beyond good and evil to dwell\nl
Leaving the good to their fate in a wicked world\nl
And evil to reign in this enormous scene.\nl
All opposition seems and strife and chance,\nl
An aimless labour with but scanty sense,\nl
To eyes that see a part and miss the whole;\nl
The surface men scan, the depths refuse their search:\nl
A hybrid mystery challenges the view,\nl
Or a discouraging sordid miracle.\nl
Page 657

Yet in the exact Inconscient's stark conceit,\nl
In the casual error of the world's ignorance\nl
A plan, a hidden Intelligence is glimpsed.\nl
There is a purpose in each stumble and fall;\nl
Nature's most careless lolling is a pose\nl
Preparing some forward step, some deep result.\nl
Ingenious notes plugged into a motived score,\nl
These million discords dot the harmonious theme\nl
Of the evolution's huge orchestral dance.\nl
A Truth supreme has forced the world to be;\nl
It has wrapped itself in Matter as in a shroud,\nl
A shroud of Death, a shroud of Ignorance.\nl
It compelled the suns to burn through silent Space,\nl
Flame-signs of its uncomprehended Thought\nl
In a wide brooding ether's formless muse:\nl
It made of Knowledge a veiled and struggling light,\nl
Of Being a substance nescient, dense and dumb,\nl
Of Bliss the beauty of an insentient world.\nl
In finite things the conscious Infinite dwells:\nl
Involved it sleeps in Matter's helpless trance,\nl
It rules the world from its sleeping senseless Void;\nl
Dreaming it throws out mind and heart and soul\nl
To labour crippled, bound, on the hard earth;\nl
A broken whole it works through scattered points;\nl
Its gleaming shards are Wisdom's diamond thoughts,\nl
Its shadowy reflex our ignorance.\nl
It starts from the mute mass in countless jets,\nl
It fashions a being out of brain and nerve,\nl
A sentient creature from its pleasures and pangs.\nl
A pack of feelings obscure, a dot of sense\nl
Survives awhile answering the shocks of life,\nl
Then, crushed or its force spent, leaves the dead form,\nl
Leaves the huge universe in which it lived\nl
An insignificant unconsidered guest.\nl
But the soul grows concealed within its house;\nl
It gives to the body its strength and magnificence;\nl
Page 658

It follows aims in an ignorant aimless world,\nl
It lends significance to earth's meaningless life.\nl
A demigod animal, came thinking man;\nl
He wallows in mud, yet heavenward soars in thought;\nl
He plays and ponders, laughs and weeps and dreams,\nl
Satisfies his little longings like the beast;\nl
He pores upon life's book with student eyes.\nl
Out of this tangle of intellect and sense,\nl
Out of the narrow scope of finite thought\nl
At last he wakes into spiritual mind;\nl
A high liberty begins and luminous room:\nl
He glimpses eternity, touches the infinite,\nl
He meets the gods in great and sudden hours,\nl
He feels the universe as his larger self,\nl
Makes Space and Time his opportunity\nl
To join the heights and depths of being in light,\nl
In the heart's cave speaks secretly with God.\nl
But these are touches and high moments lived;\nl
Fragments of Truth supreme have lit his soul,\nl
Reflections of the sun in waters still.\nl
A few have dared the last supreme ascent\nl
And break through borders of blinding light above,\nl
And feel a breath around of mightier air,\nl
Receive a vaster being's messages\nl
And bathe in its immense intuitive Ray.\nl
On summit Mind are radiant altitudes\nl
Exposed to the lustre of Infinity,\nl
Outskirts and dependencies of the house of Truth,\nl
Upraised estates of Mind and measureless.\nl
There man can visit but there he cannot live.\nl
A cosmic Thought spreads out its vastitudes;\nl
Its smallest parts are here philosophies\nl
Challenging with their detailed immensity,\nl
Each figuring an omniscient scheme of things.\nl
But higher still can climb the ascending light;\nl
There are vasts of vision and eternal suns,\nl
Page 659

Oceans of an immortal luminousness,\nl
Flame-hills assaulting heaven with their peaks,\nl
There dwelling all becomes a blaze of sight;\nl
A burning head of vision leads the mind,\nl
Thought trails behind it its long comet tail;\nl
The heart glows, an illuminate and seer,\nl
And sense is kindled into identity.\nl
A highest flight climbs to a deepest view:\nl
In a wide opening of its native sky\nl
Intuition's lightnings range in a bright pack\nl
Hunting all hidden truths out of their lairs,\nl
Its fiery edge of seeing absolute\nl
Cleaves into locked unknown retreats of self,\nl
Rummages the sky-recesses of the brain,\nl
Lights up the occult chambers of the heart;\nl
Its spear-point ictus of discovery\nl
Pressed on the cover of name, the screen of form,\nl
Strips bare the secret soul of all that is.\nl
Thought there has revelation's sun-bright eyes;\nl
The Word, a mighty and inspiring Voice,\nl
Enters Truth's inmost cabin of privacy\nl
And tears away the veil from God and life.\nl
Then stretches the boundless finite's last expanse,\nl
The cosmic empire of the Overmind,\nl
Time's buffer state bordering Eternity,\nl
Too vast for the experience of man's soul:\nl
All here gathers beneath one golden sky:\nl
The Powers that build the cosmos station take\nl
In its house of infinite possibility;\nl
Each god from there builds his own nature's world;\nl
Ideas are phalanxed like a group of suns,\nl
Each marshalling his company of rays.\nl
Thought crowds in masses seized by one regard;\nl
All Time is one body, Space a single look:\nl
There is the Godhead's universal gaze\nl
And there the boundaries of immortal Mind:\nl
Page 660

The line that parts and joins the hemispheres\nl
Closes in on the labour of the Gods\nl
Fencing eternity from the toil of Time.\nl
In her glorious kingdom of eternal light\nl
All-ruler, ruled by none, the Truth supreme,\nl
Omnipotent, omniscient and alone,\nl
In a golden country keeps her measureless house;\nl
In its corridor she hears the tread that comes\nl
Out of the Unmanifest never to return\nl
Till the Unknown is known and seen by men.\nl
Above the stretch and blaze of cosmic Sight,\nl
Above the silence of the wordless Thought,\nl
Formless creator of immortal forms,\nl
Nameless, investitured with the name divine,\nl
Transcending Time's hours, transcending Timelessness,\nl
The Mighty Mother sits in lucent calm\nl
And holds the eternal Child upon her knees\nl
Attending the day when he shall speak to Fate.\nl
There is the image of our future's hope;\nl
There is the sun for which all darkness waits,\nl
There is the imperishable harmony;\nl
The world's contradictions climb to her and are one:\nl
There is the Truth of which the world's truths are shreds,\nl
The Light of which the world's ignorance is the shade\nl
Till Truth draws back the shade that it has cast,\nl
The Love our hearts call down to heal all strife,\nl
The Bliss for which the world's derelict sorrows yearn:\nl
Thence comes the glory sometimes seen on earth,\nl
The visits of Godhead to the human soul,\nl
The Beauty and the dream on Nature's face.\nl
There the perfection born from eternity\nl
Calls to it the perfection born in Time,\nl
The truth of God surprising human life,\nl
The image of God overtaking finite shapes.\nl
There in a world of everlasting Light,\nl
In the realms of the immortal Supermind\nl
Page 661

Truth who hides here her head in mystery,\nl
Her riddle deemed by reason impossible\nl
In the stark structure of material form,\nl
Unenigmaed lives, unmasked her face and there\nl
Is Nature and the common law of things.\nl
There in a body made of spirit stuff,\nl
The hearth-stone of the everliving Fire,\nl
Action translates the movements of the soul,\nl
Thought steps infallible and absolute\nl
And life is a continual worship's rite,\nl
A sacrifice of rapture to the One.\nl
A cosmic vision, a spiritual sense\nl
Feels all the Infinite lodged in finite form\nl
And seen through a quivering ecstasy of light\nl
Discovers the bright face of the Bodiless,\nl
In the truth of a moment, in the moment's soul\nl
Can sip the honey-wine of Eternity.\nl
A Spirit who is no one and innumerable,\nl
The one mystic infinite Person of his world\nl
Multiplies his myriad personality,\nl
On all his bodies seals his divinity's stamp\nl
And sits in each immortal and unique.\nl
The Immobile stands behind each daily act,\nl
A background of the movement and the scene,\nl
Upholding creation on its might and calm\nl
And change on the Immutable's deathless poise.\nl
The Timeless looks out from the travelling hours;\nl
The Ineffable puts on a robe of speech\nl
Where all its words are woven like magic threads\nl
Moving with beauty, inspiring with their gleam,\nl
And every thought takes up its destined place\nl
Recorded in the memory of the world.\nl
The Truth supreme, vast and impersonal\nl
Fits faultlessly the hour and circumstance,\nl
Its substance a pure gold ever the same\nl
But shaped into vessels for the spirit's use,\nl
Page 662

Its gold becomes the wine jar and the vase.\nl
All there is a supreme epiphany:\nl
The All-Wonderful makes a marvel of each event,\nl
The All-Beautiful is a miracle in each shape;\nl
The All-Blissful smites with rapture the heart's throbs,\nl
A pure celestial joy is the use of sense.\nl
Each being there is a member of the Self,\nl
A portion of the million-thoughted All,\nl
A claimant to the timeless Unity,\nl
The many's sweetness, the joy of difference\nl
Edged with the intimacy of the One.\nl
\sparn “But who can show to thee Truth's glorious face?\nl
Our human words can only shadow her.\nl
To thought she is an unthinkable rapture of light,\nl
To speech a marvel inexpressible.\nl
O Death, if thou couldst touch the Truth supreme\nl
Thou wouldst grow suddenly wise and cease to be.\nl
If our souls could see and love and clasp God's Truth,\nl
Its infinite radiance would seize our hearts,\nl
Our being in God's image be remade\nl
And earthly life become the life divine.”\nl
Then Death the last time answered Savitri:\nl
“If Truth supreme transcends her shadow here\nl
Severed by Knowledge and the climbing vasts,\nl
What bridge can cross the gulf that she has left\nl
Between her and the dream-world she has made?\nl
Or who could hope to bring her down to men\nl
And persuade to tread the harsh globe with wounded feet\nl
Leaving her unapproachable glory and bliss,\nl
Wasting her splendour on pale earthly air?\nl
Is thine that strength, O beauty of mortal limbs,\nl
O soul who flutterest to escape my net?\nl
Who then art thou hiding in human guise?\nl
Thy voice carries the sound of infinity,\nl
Knowledge is with thee, Truth speaks through thy words;\nl
The light of things beyond shines in thy eyes.\nl
Page 663

But where is thy strength to conquer Time and Death?\nl
Hast thou God's force to build heaven's values here?\nl
For truth and knowledge are an idle gleam\nl
If Knowledge brings not power to change the world,\nl
If Might comes not to give to Truth her right.\nl
A blind Force, not Truth has made this ignorant world,\nl
A blind Force, not Truth orders the lives of men:\nl
By Power, not Light, the great Gods rule the world;\nl
Power is the arm of God, the seal of Fate.\nl
O human claimant to immortality,\nl
Reveal thy power, lay bare thy spirit's force,\nl
Then will I give back to thee Satyavan.\nl
Or if the Mighty Mother is with thee,\nl
Show me her face that I may worship her;\nl
Let deathless eyes look into the eyes of Death,\nl
An imperishable Force touching brute things\nl
Transform earth's death into immortal life.\nl
Then can thy dead return to thee and live.\nl
The prostrate earth perhaps shall lift her gaze\nl
And feel near her the secret body of God\nl
And love and joy overtake fleeing Time.”\nl

\spar And Savitri looked on Death and answered not.\nl
Almost it seemed as if in his symbol shape\nl
The world's darkness had consented to Heaven-light\nl
And God needed no more the Inconscient's screen.\nl
A mighty transformation came on her.\nl
A halo of the indwelling Deity,\nl
The Immortal's lustre that had lit her face\nl
And tented its radiance in her body's house,\nl
Overflowing made the air a luminous sea.\nl
In a flaming moment of apocalypse\nl
The Incarnation thrust aside its veil.\nl
A little figure in infinity\nl
Yet stood and seemed the Eternal's very house,\nl
As if the world's centre was her very soul\nl
Page 664

And all wide space was but its outer robe.\nl
A curve of the calm hauteur of far heaven\nl
Descending into earth's humility,\nl
Her forehead's span vaulted the Omniscient's gaze,\nl
Her eyes were two stars that watched the universe.\nl
The Power that from her being's summit reigned,\nl
The Presence chambered in lotus secrecy,\nl
Came down and held the centre in her brow\nl
Where the mind's Lord in his control-room sits;\nl
There throned on concentration's native seat\nl
He opens that third mysterious eye in man,\nl
The Unseen's eye that looks at the unseen,\nl
When Light with a golden ecstasy fills his brain\nl
And the Eternal's wisdom drives his choice\nl
And eternal Will seizes the mortal's will.\nl
It stirred in the lotus of her throat of song,\nl
And in her speech throbbed the immortal Word,\nl
Her life sounded with the steps of the world-soul\nl
Moving in harmony with the cosmic Thought.\nl
As glides God's sun into the mystic cave\nl
Where hides his light from the pursuing gods,\nl
It glided into the lotus of her heart\nl
And woke in it the Force that alters Fate.\nl
It poured into her navel's lotus depth,\nl
Lodged in the little life-nature's narrow home,\nl
On the body's longings grew heaven-rapture's flower\nl
And made desire a pure celestial flame,\nl
Broke into the cave where coiled World-Energy sleeps\nl
And smote the thousand-hooded serpent Force\nl
That blazing towered and clasped the World-Self above,\nl
Joined Matter's dumbness to the Spirit's hush\nl
And filled earth's acts with the Spirit's silent power.\nl
Thus changed she waited for the Word to speak.\nl
Eternity looked into the eyes of Death\nl
And Darkness saw God's living Reality.\nl
Then a Voice was heard that seemed the stillness' self\nl
Page 665

Or the low calm utterance of infinity\nl
When it speaks to the silence in the heart of sleep.\nl
“I hail thee, almighty and victorious Death,\nl
Thou grandiose Darkness of the Infinite.\nl
O Void that makest room for all to be,\nl
Hunger that gnawest at the universe\nl
Consuming the cold remnants of the suns\nl
And eatst the whole world with thy jaws of fire,\nl
Waster of the energy that has made the stars,\nl
Inconscience, carrier of the seeds of thought,\nl
Nescience in which All-Knowledge sleeps entombed\nl
And slowly emerges in its hollow breast\nl
Wearing the mind's mask of bright Ignorance.\nl
Thou art my shadow and my instrument.\nl
I have given thee thy awful shape of dread\nl
And thy sharp sword of terror and grief and pain\nl
To force the soul of man to struggle for light\nl
On the brevity of his half-conscious days.\nl
Thou art his spur to greatness in his works,\nl
The whip to his yearning for eternal bliss,\nl
His poignant need of immortality.\nl
Live, Death, awhile, be still my instrument.\nl
One day man too shall know thy fathomless heart\nl
Of silence and the brooding peace of Night\nl
And grave obedience to eternal Law\nl
And the calm inflexible pity in thy gaze.\nl
But now, O timeless Mightiness, stand aside\nl
And leave the path of my incarnate Force.\nl
Relieve the radiant God from thy black mask:\nl
Release the soul of the world called Satyavan\nl
Freed from thy clutch of pain and ignorance\nl
That he may stand master of life and fate,\nl
Man's representative in the house of God,\nl
The mate of Wisdom and the spouse of Light,\nl
The eternal bridegroom of the eternal bride.”\nl
She spoke; Death unconvinced resisted still,\nl
Page 666

Although he knew refusing still to know,\nl
Although he saw refusing still to see.\nl
Unshakable he stood claiming his right.\nl
His spirit bowed; his will obeyed the law\nl
Of its own nature binding even on Gods.\nl
The Two opposed each other face to face.\nl
His being like a huge fort of darkness towered;\nl
Around it her light grew, an ocean's siege.\nl
Awhile the Shade survived defying heaven:\nl
Assailing in front, oppressing from above,\nl
A concrete mass of conscious power, he bore\nl
The tyranny of her divine desire.\nl
A pressure of intolerable force\nl
Weighed on his unbowed head and stubborn breast;\nl
Light like a burning tongue licked up his thoughts,\nl
Light was a luminous torture in his heart,\nl
Light coursed, a splendid agony, through his nerves;\nl
His darkness muttered perishing in her blaze.\nl
Her mastering Word commanded every limb\nl
And left no room for his enormous will\nl
That seemed pushed out into some helpless space\nl
And could no more re-enter but left him void.\nl
He called to Night but she fell shuddering back,\nl
He called to Hell but sullenly it retired:\nl
He turned to the Inconscient for support,\nl
From which he was born, his vast sustaining self;\nl
It drew him back towards boundless vacancy\nl
As if by himself to swallow up himself:\nl
He called to his strength, but it refused his call.\nl
His body was eaten by light, his spirit devoured.\nl
At last he knew defeat inevitable\nl
And left crumbling the shape that he had worn,\nl
Abandoning hope to make man's soul his prey\nl
And force to be mortal the immortal spirit.\nl
Afar he fled shunning her dreaded touch\nl
And refuge took in the retreating Night.\nl
Page 667

In the dream twilight of that symbol world\nl
The dire universal Shadow disappeared\nl
Vanishing into the Void from which it came.\nl
As if deprived of its original cause,\nl
The twilight realm passed fading from their souls,\nl
And Satyavan and Savitri were alone.\nl
But neither stirred: between those figures rose\nl
A mute invisible and translucent wall.\nl
In the long blank moment's pause nothing could move:\nl
All waited on the unknown inscrutable Will.\nl
\rl{\fsc End of Canto Four}
\rl{\fsc End of Book Ten}
Page 668
